name: Light Hunters: Battalion of Darkness – Rise of the East & Dawn of Amazonia
description:
New Heroes find themselves exiled in the dark forest. Coming from other lands, with different fighting styles, these unfortunates will have to arm themselves with courage and intelligence to regain their past glory.

Light Hunters: Rise of the East & Dawn of Amazonia is the first expansion for Light Hunters

When playing with Rise of the East & Dawn of Amazonia expansion, the base game rules don't change, although new gameplay are added for each of new Heroes.

Light Hunters: Rise of the East & Dawn of Amazonia adds 8 new Heroes + 1 familiar to the base game. At the beginning of the game, players may draft their battalion among the new Heroes and the standard one.

Each Hero brings new gameplay within their skills, such as reducing the Ether level, giving a Spirit of Light card to an ally or setting traps.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Drink Drank Drunk
description:
Drink Drank Drunk the Game of mis-beer-having!

Simple, hilarious and addictive fun : The party in a box with a laughter guarantee. Play with your friends or bring it to a bar to make new ones!

200 unique cards of 5 categories make up the deck each card can interact with one another making for hundreds of unique combinations and hysterical, surprising and unique situations designed to have you and your friends giggling like children in no time!

Just shuffle the deck and take turns drawing a card! There are 6 different kinds of cards!


ACTION (Green) cards take action as soon as they are picked up and include many different Mini-games & challenges.
RULE (Red) set new rules for everyone playing (Max 2 at a time)
POWER (Pink) cards give you hilarious abilities!
WEAKNESS (Blue) cards give you personal rules to follow
SPECIAL (Yellow) kept secret and used once at any time!
WILD CARDS for alternate ways to play


ALTERNATIVE GAME MODES :
After getting to grips with the core mechanics and failing at completing the entire deck in one sitting (Still never been done!) the cards come with a multitude of ways to play and win too from team games, collection games to solo games and skill based game modes; all of which are outlined in the rulebook or our website.

The handy portable Drink Drank Drunk box comes with 200 high quality individually illustrated cards along with a glorious 8 paged rules pamphlet.

—description from the publisher

name: The Catholic Card Game: Generations Expansion Pack
description: This expansion for the Catholic Card Game includes 12 yellow prompt cards and 42 white answer cards in their own tuck box. Half of the cards revolve around Baby Boomers (printed in LARGER FONT) and the other half are all about Millennials.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Religious

name: Dungeon Party: Dice Tower Coasters
description:
A set of four new tiles for the upcoming Dungeon Party game from Forbidden Games!

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

The four tiles are Game Room, Gem Dice Tower, Vasel Paladin, and Zee-Ogre.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Flicking, Move Through Deck, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Set-up

name: Parma 1734
description:
"Parma 1734" (War of Polish Succession – Italy) is a two-player wargame simulation of XVIII century warfare at tactical battalion level.

The system is called "Discipline & Command" and it's based on two concepts:

every unit has only a Discipline value that is used to fire and shock
the army is organized in Wings with its own leaders; each Wing will activate in an order decided by the player


It's a not complex wargame with a battle scenario and a little introductory scenario for the vanguards’ fight near La Crocetta.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Wald der Lichter
description:
It's become very dark in the forest of lights because the dwarven treasure was stolen by the evil Griswald. This treasure is not just any treasure, but something very special because it's the only things that can make the forest shine. On the run, Griswald has hidden the treasures in the forest and cast a spell on them: Only if the treasures are returned in the correct order will the magic break and the forest shine again.

In Wald der Lichter ("Forest of Lights"), Ethelred the Seventh, King of the Dwarves, has sent you to find the individual treasures, so make careful note of where they're hidden so that you can bring them back to the king.

—description from the publisher

name: Space Dinos
description:
Boldly going where no Dinos had gone before...

During their mission to explore strange new worlds, the Space
Dinos found a new home after the fall of their kind on earth. They continued their pursuit of exploration, tracking Stardust and building constellations that grace the night sky. Space has become their final adventure. Join them in their continuing voyage to build constellations as they explore through space.

Earn the most star points while placing constellation tiles in the galaxy. Constellation tiles may not be placed directly next to tiles of similar design (color or number of stars).

Constellations are available in 6 colors with 1 of each tile containing 1-6 stars. Tiles must be placed making a grid that is 6x6 tiles. Dinos exploring constellations and creating pleasing constellation sets earn star points allowing them to travel through the galaxy. Several game play missions are available and dictate new player objectives and are detailed in those missions.

—description from the designer
categories: Children's Game, Math, Prehistoric, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Heja Sverige
description:
Heja Sverige is a strategic level 2-player wargame set in the latter half of the 30 Years War when Sweden re-ignited the war in Germany.

Then France got involved as well and it would take 18 more years for the hostilities to end, leaving a shattered Germany in its wake when the war finally ended in 1648.

One player is the Union Player and he'll control the Factions of Sweden, France and the Protestants.

The other player is the League Player and he'll control the Factions of Spain, Bavaria and the Holy Roman Empire (HRE)

The game is played for a maximum of 9 two-year turns on a map divided into Areas controlled by the various Factions and Neutrals.

Armies consisting of Infantry, Cavalry and Artillery combat units are moved around by Generals, engage in combat and take control of Areas looking to fulfil their objectives.

—description from the designer
categories: Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Wargame

name: King's Castle
description:
After the King's death two rival fractions compete for the Throne which is situated at the center of a 13-cell Castle.

The board is hexagonal with a Castle at its centre. There's a sufficient amount of checkers. There are two players, Black and White, who each direct an army of men that grows by placement, while the men also move as singles or in line, and may capture conditionally.

Play starts on an empty board and men are entered one by one outside the Castle and must organise themselves to enter it. Inside the Castle the fight goes on as both try to capture the Throne by occupying and holding two cells that are adjacent to it on opposite sides.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, King of the Hill

name: Squarcles
description:
squarcle*, (skwair-cul), n, a graphic symbol consisting of three elements, where each element is either a square or a circle and is either black or white.

Squarcles is a symbol recognition game in which players try to be the quickest to spot the correct squarcle among all the squarcles on the card.

The game uses just 1 card!
You'll also need 4 dice and some tokens for scoring (or a pen and paper).

* I coined this word :)

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Sheriff of Nottingham: 2nd Edition – Festival of Nottingham
description:
Originally available as part of Promo Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter Campaign. A deck of cards added to the game that modify certain rules from round to round.

—user summary
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based, Party Game
mechanics: Bribery, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Set Collection

name: Postcard Tobruk
description:
A very fast and simple (but subtle) minimalist rendition of the 5 (possible) major battles around Tobruk during World War 2, Jan 41-Nov 42.
Basically brigade to division to (Italian) corps level.
Indeterminant time periods but 4-7 turns.
Unique rules regarding armored/panzer vs. (Disrupted) infantry units, and Rommel (with a desert/fennec fox) is on the scene to chase the desert rats.
Pressed Attack/Desperate Defense combat options.

Anyone - including schools and libraries - is free to print this off in A6/4"x6" or A5/5"x8" format in as many copies as you like and send them to family and friends who might be interested ... as long as you keep my copyright statement, its Dedication, and my history quotes. All other publication rights, including/especially for large, conventional boxed format are reserved to me for licensing.

It is advisable to photocopy/enlarge the front to A4/11"x17" for an optimal piece size and to A3/11"x17" for optimal map size. You can enlarge the rules as much as you need to.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Zone of Control

name: Expediente Anunnaki: Brujería
description:
When the archaeologist Nicole Harper decides to go hiking in the Catskill Mountains, north of New York, she is totally unaware of what she is about to uncover in the depths of the forest...
Alone, isolated and being chased by formidable enemies, she will not find it easy to survive. Her escape will become ever-more difficult and uncertain as she soon finds things to be even worse than she had imagined.
But her nightmare does not end there! In the midst of all the confusion, she will come across a great and ancient evil that threatens the future of all humankind.
Immerse yourself in this frightening adventure and take on the role of Nicole as she comes face to face with a myriad of challenges...

Main Characteristics

Relive the classics of old. Make your own adventure and decide how the story develops.
You will look forward to each and every engagement due to the intense and exciting combat system that allows for various outcomes and possibilities.
Adult-themed illustrations and story content. You will genuinely be surprised by the plot as well as the complex decision-making system.
The narrative and background of the story is so well-developed that you will be hooked from the very beginning. As you progress through the adventure, the secrets of the Anunnaki will reveal themselves.
Solve enigmas, puzzles, and riddles to get equipment, increase your skills, gain access to hidden areas, and much more!
Expediente Anunnaki. Brujería - Libro 1 ("Anunnaki Files: Witchraft - Book 1") forms part of the universe created by David Velasco, a renown author of novels, books, and roleplaying games in Spain.


—description from the publisher (translated)


Cuando la arqueóloga Nicole Harper decide practicar senderismo en las Montañas de Catskill, al norte de Nueva York, no puede ni imaginar lo que está a punto de descubrir en lo más profundo del bosque…
Sola y aislada, se enfrentará a una peligrosa carrera para tratar de sobrevivir, perseguida por unos implacables enemigos. Su huida será trepidante y cada vez más arriesgada, pues comprobará que todo es aún peor de lo que había imaginado.
¡Pero su pesadilla no acabará ahí! En plena vorágine de acontecimientos se topará con un mal aún más grotesco, una amenaza forjada en el albor de los tiempos, capaz de poner en jaque el futuro de toda la humanidad. Prepárate para ponerte en la piel de Nicole en esta aventura temática y altamente inmersiva repleta de horrores y desafíos.Principales características

Revive las clásicas lecturas de antaño. Vive tu propia aventura y decide cómo se desarrolla la historia.
Sistema de combate tenso y trepidante, que hará que disfrutes cada enfrentamiento gracias a la riqueza de posibilidades que ofrece.
Temática y estética adulta. La dureza de su argumento y la complejidad de las decisiones y sistema de juego te sorprenderán.
Su cuidado trasfondo y narrativa te atraparán desde el principio. A medida que avances en tu aventura, los misterios de los Anunnaki empezarán a ser revelados.
Resuelve enigmas, puzles y acertijos para conseguir equipo adicional, mejora de tus habilidades, acceder a áreas ocultas y mucho más.
Expediente Anunnaki. Brujería - Libro 1 forma parte del universo creado por David Velasco, un reputado escritor de novelas, libros y juegos de rol en España.


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Dice, Exploration, Novel-based, Puzzle, Zombies

name: Ratapolis
description:
You and your family of rats have been living happily in Ratapolis for some time now. Unfortunately, Balthus and his cats are now coming after you. You will strive to survive and, why not, end up on top of the other families in town.

In Ratapolis, players try to save as many of their own rats as they can and leave them in the best cheese-awarding building tiles at the end of the game.

On a turn, players program two moves, which can be any combination of attacks and/or displacements. They simultaneously reveal their moves and resolve them before the cats randomly invade a building tile, removing said tile and all rats standing there from the game. Some buildings award special powers to the family who controls them.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Programmed Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Carolingian Twilight: Decline of an Empire AD814
description:
Carolingian Twilight: Decline of an Empire AD814 is a two to six-player game covering the decline of the Carolingian Empire following the death of Charlemagne (Charles the Great) in AD 814. The Salic Law of the Franks required that at a man’s death, his property was divided among all his sons, which led to civil wars among Charlemagne’s descendants when the inheritance in question was the Empire itself. From the various wills, wars and treaties dividing and redistributing the Empire during the 800s, emerged the nuclei of the modern states of France, Germany, and Italy.

Each of the 10 scenarios depicts the period following a particular division of the empire, with each player taking on the role of one of the heirs. The object of the game is to reunite the Empire under a single ruler, while fending off not only fraternal Frankish rivals, but also the hostile surrounding foreign powers. Each game turn represents 1 year. The map scale is one inch to 75 miles. Each area is an historical region. Each unit represents 100-5000 soldiers (plus camp followers, etc.).

Components: One 22 x 34-inch game map 280 1/2-inch counters.

Published in S&T #342 Sept-Oct 2023.

name: Gemeinsame Sache
description:
Gemeinsame Sache is a party game for up to eight players.
Each round, a pretty easy question is being shown (for example "A board game?". Now everybody has to secretly write down an answer which fits the most to the current question. You bet on your guess if you think many other players have written it down, too.

Everybody shows its answer the ones who have the same answer as the majority wins and gets point.

name: Get That Pirate's Booty
description:
Get That Pirate's Booty is a game of theft, trickery, and sabotage + some pirate ships!

Be the first player to collect 3 sets of 4 treasures or collect all four pirates ships to win.

Battle other pirates for their Booty using challenge cards or use action cards to sabotage other players strategies. Players draw and discard cards to collect sets of cards or steal them from other players using challenge cards.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Black Stories: Leichen, Pech & Pannen Edition
description:
Deadly football goals, human stew in the Jacuzzi, exotic delicacies that bite back without further ado: incomprehensible accidents, catastrophic coincidences and dramatic passing ...
The Grim Reaper is never at a loss for ideas when it comes to decimating his flock. And reality still invents the darkest stories!

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Trivia

name: Okko: Legendary Journey – Oni Court
description:
This expansion for Okko - oni Hunters greatly complicates the task of Okko and his companions. Can they accept the new challenge and save Pajan's empire from falling into the hands of the dark forces that covet it?
This expansion makes the final battle against the Oni richer and at times more difficult by introducing a variety of demonic creatures, each one different from the other.

name: Battle of Midway
description:
In Battle for Midway players will have the opportunity to take on the role of an American or Japanese air force commander and become a participant in the famous Battle of Midway of 1942, which decided the fate of the war in the Pacific. The game is for two players and its duration depends on the adopted Game Mode.

The war game with COBI bricks combines strategy requiring planning with random elements. The pawns are mini models of block planes on special bases. Every player will easily master extremely simple game rules based on clear icons. The set includes a box, a game board consisting of seven large and two small pieces, 12 airplanes on special stands, action cards, tokens and markers. The included sticker sheet lets players personalize their planes!

Perfectly balanced tactical and random elements make the gameplay exciting every time. Players of all ages can easily duel with each other! Devise clever strategies or let your luck run wild! Feel the atmosphere of the Second World War clash thanks to the amazing graphics. Lead your air fleet to victory!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Market, Modular Board, Programmed Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer: The Horus Heresy – Age of Darkness Rulebook
description:
An Age of Darkness has descended upon the galaxy. Horus Lupercal, Warmaster of the Emperor's armies, has turned against his gene-father and sent the Imperium spiralling into bloody civil war. Of the eighteen great Space Marine Legions, finest of all humanity's soldiers, fully half have sided with the traitorous Warmaster, while the remainder stand staunchly loyal to the Emperor. It is a war of brother against brother, Space Marine against Space Marine, which has seen the might of the Imperium's vast armies turned upon itself in a cataclysm of fire and blood.

In Warhammer: The Horus Heresy you will pit mighty armies of superhuman warriors against each other in apocalyptic tabletop battles. Choose your favoured Legion, from the knightly Dark Angels to the duplicitous Alpha Legion, build your own army from a range of spectacular Citadel and Forge World miniatures, and clash with fellow players in wargames of staggering tactical depth. The tale of the Horus Heresy is the bedrock of Warhammer 40,000's rich history, and this boxed game is the perfect first step to joining the epic conflicts that reshaped the galaxy.

This 336-page hardback Rulebook contains:


Extensive background on the Emperor, the Great Crusade, the Imperium, the 18 Legiones Astartes, and the galaxy-spanning conflict that became known as the Horus Heresy
Core rules for playing Warhammer: The Horus Heresy, including general principles, shooting and fighting, unit types, special rules, and more
Rules for the five modes of play: Narrative Play, Campaign Play, Open Play, Team Play, and Matched Play
A miniatures showcase containing eight armies created by members of the Warhammer: The Horus Heresy Studio and beyond


—description from the publisher
categories: Civil War, Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Novel-based, Religious, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Bias, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Force Commitment, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Order Counters, Physical Removal, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Skulls of Sedlec: Ultimate Champions
description:
Ultimate Champions is a 1-card additional champion for Skulls of Sedlec, complementing those from Skulls of Sedlec: Champions.

Ultimate Champions want to be next to other Champions.

name: Ride Chip Trick
description:
Ride Chip Trick is a trick-taking game which uses wooden discs instead of playing cards. The black discs have positive ranks and are dealt to the players. The red discs have negative ranks and start out of the game.

Players may play 1 or 2 chips to each trick, and the person who plays the highest sum will win the trick. They take all chips from the trick into a score pile in front of them and a red chip into their hand.

The game is played over a number of rounds equal to the number of players, and a round is over when the red chips have all been taken.

Players earn points equal to the sum of the chips left in their hand and those collected from tricks. However, only point totals from 1 to 25 will be scored; all over scores result in 0 points.

The player with the most points wins.

name: 49 shades of grey
description:
49 shades of grey is a catching card game for two people. It requests to have a good eye, brains and tactical skills. The 49 cards are printed in different shades of grey on both sides and on the front side they are numbered from 1 (light grey) to 49 (dark grey). Can you guess the hidden number by assessing the shade of grey?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Predictive Bid, Set Collection

name: Tempête sur Belfort 1870-1871
description:
The war of 1870 was marked by major sieges such as those of Metz, Strasbourg and Paris. The one of Belfort, from November 3, 1870 to February 18, 1871, is one of the last episodes of the war and the garrison will be the last French army to lay down its arms.

To simulate the siege, the Storm over Diksmuide (VaeVictis 133) system was copied and modified. The soggy plains of Flanders are replaced here by rugged, wooded terrain dominated by the citadel of Belfort.

Storm over Belfort tries to show the difficult conditions of an ultimately dynamic siege where bitter fighting is fought in the snow and under the shells for more political than strategic gains.

A game by Jean-Philippe Gury

Complexity: 4/10
Solo playability: 2/10
Duration: 2 to 3 hours
One turn = two weeks
A battalion = a few hundred men

Published in VaeVictis #164.

name: Gift ved første blik
description:
Gift ved første blik ("Married at First Sight") is a reality tv show of Danish origin.
This game casts two players as newlyweds, and the other players are friendly advisors who draw cards with marital dilemmas. Each advisor gets to vote yes or no to each dilemma, and then the newlyweds has to agree on whether to say yes or no to the dilemma.

After four dilemmas, the cards are flipped, and the consequences on four parameters are tallied up: communication, sex life, social life, and economy. If any parameter goes too far out of balance, the marriage fails and the game ends. Otherwise, play goes on to next round, again of four dilemmas. The game ends at latest after three rounds.

Points:
The newlyweds get 1 point for each dilemma they say 'yes' to, and 1 point for 'surviving' the first round, 2 points for the second round, and 3 points for the third round.
The advisors each get a point for each time the newlyweds follow their advice.
However, should the game end because the marriage fails, the advisors who gave the advice that was the final straw of the marriage, each lose 2 points.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Pokémon TCG: Pokémon GO
description:
The [Pokémon GO] TCG expansion draws its inspiration from Pokémon GO with artwork that captures Pokémon in a real-world setting.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Micro Mars
description:
Micro Mars is a roll-and-write game of open space adventure and exploration. Each player is the starship's captain and requires a single printed game sheet, a pencil, and two dice.

In order to move about the map, roll 2 dice. In the route, the field finds the figures for the dropped values. Since you have two figures, you are able to combine them into one in the planning field. Then, you can put it on the map as a completed figure, so that will be your move.

During your move, you must avoid meteorites and asteroids. The game's main aim is to collect 5 repair parts for your spaceship. If you are lucky, you can stumble upon an oxygen balloon, which may help you along the way. Remember that you have only 13 moves.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Print & Play, Space Exploration

name: Robot Roll & Write
description:
Robot roll and write is a game for 1 to 99 players lasting approximately 15 minutes.

Each player must roll his dice and choose the appropriate shape drawn on cards arranged on a common game board. He draws the chosen shape or track on his game sheet trying to connect the various parts as best as possible, which give victory points. In the end the player with the best score is the winner.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Drag Racing: The Dice Game  Top Fuel / Funny Car
description:
Welcome race fans and gaming enthusiasts to the world’s fastest and exciting sport in history-Top Fuel-Funny Car Drag Racing. Have you ever wondered what it would be like to sit in one of the most technically sophisticated 10,000 hp racing
machines and punch it full throttle on the green light exceeding over 300 mph in less than three seconds, wowzah..that’s extremely fast. The closest most of us can feel this thrill is to ride on the Top Fuel Dragster ride at Cedar Point Amusement Park, which exceeds 300mph in three seconds, front seat car is great to get that Need for Speed thrill. Drag Racing: The Dice Game is an exciting and thrilling alternative game that captures the competitive racing of professional top fuel and funny cars right on your tabletop.

—description from the designer

name: Flower Market
description:
In Flower Market (フラワーマーケット), the player becomes a flower wholesaler, buys flowers from the market, and sells them to the flower shop manager. Make a lot of profit and increase the trust of the flower shop manager. The player with the most trust wins.

There are two ways to earn trust in this game. One is to sell flowers to many flower shops. By doing so, you can earn the trust of the shop owner.

The other is to get a lot of profit. You can earn the trust of the market by earning big profits.

A characteristic of this game is that the player does not have any money, and borrows money to purchase flowers. Grab more trust while thinking about advertising, managing inventory, and more.

プレイヤーは花の卸問屋になり、花を市場から買い入れて花屋の店長さんに売っていきます。
多くの利益をあげ、花屋の店長からの信頼を上げてください。もっとも多くの信頼を集めたプレイヤーの勝利です。

このゲームで信頼を得る方法は2つあります。
１つは多くの花屋さんに花を売ること。そうすることで店主からの信頼を得ることができます。
もう一つは多くの利益を得る事。大きな利益を得ることで、市場から信頼を得ることができます。

このゲームで特徴的なのは、プレイヤーは所持金を持っておらず、借金をして花を仕入れていくことです。宣伝や在庫の管理などを考えながら、より多くの信頼をつかみ取ってください。
publisher's summary
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: Angry Raccoons
description:
Angry Raccoons is an exciting board game designed for 2-5 players, aged 10 and above. In this game, players take on the role of Hillbillies, with the objective of becoming the king of their beloved trailer par k by defeating their neighbors. To battle raccoons and other Hillbillies, players roll dice, aiming to win 2 out of 3 rounds.

Each Hillbilly has special powers that can modify the outcome of their rolls, and all players have access to liquor cards that can alter the outcome of a round. With its simple mechanics and sudden twists, Angry Raccoons is easy to learn and provides a fun and engaging experience for players of all levels. Whether you're having a family game night or hosting a friendly gathering, Angry Raccoons is a perfect choice for hours of entertainment.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Hot Potato, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Council at Daybreak
description:
Council at Daybreak is a social deduction game of mystery and discovery. Each game is only 15 minutes but you'll find yourselves playing for hours!

There is a heretic among you! In each game, players have a role to play in finding the heretic in the council. Behold, the heretic will do anything to not be accused...
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Religious
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Sprout
description:
Sprout is a cooperative adventure strategy game about restoration and landscape creation. Instead of saving a world from the threat of impending destruction, players take on the role of four characters who find an already destroyed world and bring it back to life through peaceful actions such as walking, planting, and clearing away ash. (Well…. there’s also a threat of impending destruction. More on that in a bit.)

Players take on the roles of four “lifelings”, elemental sprites with the power to create life wherever they walk. When a lifeling pawn moves across the board, they trace their path by placing hexagon tiles that match their element. (Grass, water, soil, or ice) The tiles interact and stack, creating a unique, colorful map on every playthrough. Players must hurry to cover the entire map, called “the Barren”, with these “life tiles” before the end of twelve rounds, or else they lose the game by the volcano at the center of the Barren erupting.

Complicating the strategy, four enemy characters called the “flamelings” move around the board with randomized paths determined by dice rolls. Flamelings remove (“burn away”) life tiles wherever their tokens move and can also knock out lifelings, cause explosions, and spread ash tiles (which must be removed for the players to win). Players must work together, using their actions, unique special abilities, and tile interactions to avoid, trap, and distract the flamelings, who can respawn even after being knocked out.

The randomness of the enemy’s movements, as well as the unique landscapes created by players, necessitates new strategies every playthrough. For experienced players, difficulty can be adjusted by lowering the number of rounds the players have to accomplish their goal.

This game is appropriate for players who enjoy whimsical storytelling, light role playing, ticking-clock challenges, and the satisfaction of placing the last piece of a puzzle.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Role Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Hack & Slash 2: Whack & Stash
description:
In this expansion for Hack & Slash, you'll find 11 new quests and a new kind of reward – Treasures! They can add to your fame – or bend a rule for a future quest. Also comes with an additional always-available card, Shop at Wiz-Mart.

Contents
11 Quest cards
20 Treasure cards
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: UNO Ultimate: Add-on Pack – Rocket & Groot
description:
Rocket & Groot
Two best buddies looking out for each other. Rocket and Groot are in it for the goodies. Rocket and Groot really strive when they have Item Cards attached, so try to stay equipped. Always be on the lookout for Item Cards that each player has, as you may never know if someone has something you want, or you want destroyed. When using your Character Power, sometimes it's better to leave an Enemy attacking you to ensure you take out another players Item Cards or getting one from the Danger Discard Pile.

Included in this add-on pack:


One Uno Ultimate Rocket & Groot Deck!
Character specific Wild Cards!
Danger Deck Cards with Villains and more!
2 Chase Foil Cards
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Number

name: Имаджинариум: Юбилейный (Imaginarium: Anniversary)
description: An additional set of 98 cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Feud
description:
Feud is a two-player strategy game set in a kingdom at war. Players take turns to occupy counties and seas, conquer towers, walls, castles, and cathedrals, and strive to earn the highest amount of nobility points to conquest the fatherland throne.

During the game, players roll three dice and drive them on the kingdom map with a flick of their fingers, aiming to occupy regions and seas with their troops. After the invasion, they create counties within the regions and place troops according to the dice values.

The game unfolds as players conquer towers, walls, castles, and cathedrals, earning points for each of these conquests. Additionally, players can use the special powers to earn points for having the majority of regions crowns and conquering the lordships of the Sea,North, South, West, and East.

The game ends when all the towers have been assigned or when both players have exhausted their Grim Reaper icons. At the end, players calculate their final scores based on their achievements.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Flicking, Line Drawing

name: Clash of Magic Schools
description:
In the two-player game Clash of Magic Schools, each player is the headmaster of one of the magic schools facing each other in the finals of the Tournament of Sorcerers. Be prepared to do anything it takes to help your school win this prestigious challenge.

During the game, send your students to face danger in a series of perilous trials across different arenas, while knowing that the rival school will try to steal victory from you at any cost, even by using forbidden magic. Tensions are high...

Who will win the Tournament of Sorcerers this year?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Zone of Control

name: Majolica: Revised Edition
description:
The rise of industrialization during the Victorian Era enabled both the mass production of a type of glazed pottery known as majolica as well as its spread to the Far East, including Japan, China, Taiwan, and Southeast Asia. The name “Majolica” comes from the Spanish name for the island of Maio (Cape Verde), which became renowned for (and later synonymous with) its export of high quality colorful glazed pottery tiles.

In the game of Majolica, players take turns to collect majolica tiles from the outlying sides of a 4 x 4 grid and place them in one of their four workshops. When the ratio of the tile colors matches the requirement of the workshop, you may deliver the tiles to your design card and "carry-over" the remaining tiles to the next workshop.

Choose the tiles wisely, arrange your design cards in the right place, and "recycle" your remaining tiles efficiently are the keys to score the most points and win the game.

Majolica: Revised Edition is the new edition of Majolica@2018. Its mechanism was improved and all new art is inside it now!

name: Self Careless: Deluxe Edition
description:
The Cat Deck lets you play Self Careless in a whole new way! One player is “The Human”, and the other player is “The Cat”. The cat is trying to knock over the human’s coffee and prevent them from having a productive day.

On the cat's turn, they draw two cards from the cat deck and choose which one to play. They are a mix of movement cards to move the cat token and "Anti-Coffee" powers that let you cause various hi-jinks.

If the cat token touches the coffee token it "knocks over the coffee" and it is removed from play until the next successful Task is set by the main player. If the main player loses, the cat wins!

-description from publisher's website

name: Dominance
description:
It will be the control of the most important provinces that establishes the final victory. You will have to bring as many territories to your side as possible by planning a careful strategy or trying to outwit your opponents. But if things get bad, you can always change sides! Set in the Roman provinces, among the Celtic tribes, in the dominions of medieval Italy, in the territories of the Inca Empire, in the Ottoman court, or in pre-industrial England, Dominance is a game of majorities with the outcome always hanging in the balance until the end.

There are three factions that claim dominion over a given territory. Each faction is represented by a metal coin, which, when placed on a territory, indicates its assignment. The game is developed on a variable board, built from hexagons. During setup, each territory is assigned to a faction. Each player represents a Roman Consul, a Celtic chieftain, a medieval lord, an Inca general, an Ottoman noble, or the head of an English noble family. The objective of the game is ultimately to be on the side of the winning faction.

On their turn, a player can carry out two actions of their choice: open a contest, strengthen, move, gain power, or place. Opening a dispute ends the turn in any case, and it works like this: each player secretly bets a certain number of coins, even zero. The coins are revealed, and the faction with the most, both on the territory and in the bets, wins. The territory is permanently assigned to that faction. The leader who led the faction to victory and the player who bet the most coins of that color get loot: new coins and the possibility of building in the territory or adjacent ones. Constructions (villages, cities, bridges, and the capital) increase the value of the territory. Strengthening allows you to add a coin from the game reserve to a territory that already has one (of the same color). Moving allows you to move coins from one territory to an adjacent one. Gaining power allows you to draw the first coin from the coin display. Placing allows you to put your own coin in a territory.

Each player's coin stock is kept secret. When all territories have been awarded (except one), the game ends. Each territory gives 1-5 points depending on the buildings present. The faction with the most points wins. The player with the most coins from that faction wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Hexagon Grid, Voting, Zone of Control

name: Mirror of Truth
description:
The players are guests at a dinner party in one of the most respected mansions in the town. All of a sudden, they discover that the owner of the mansion is killed and the players become involved in the investigation of this dreadful murder. An unknown force stops time and takes the souls of all the innocent guests into the Afterlife. They become shadows – foggy and silent. Now, the players should explain to everyone who they are, thus proving their innocence. For this purpose, they use "clues" scattered around to hint at their personality. The players should also identify the murderer as quickly as possible. The quicker and smarter you are, the more chances to win you have!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Targeted Clues, Voting

name: Shifting Seasons
description:
Shifting Seasons is an abstract tile-shifting game in which players move season tiles and strategically place them on their player board.

Every person has one player board that is divided into 4 qudrants, that are numbered from 1-4.
On a turn, you take 1 of the 3 tiles from the display. You then push the choosen tile into the main sliding game board starting from 1 of the 4 arrows. This ejects a tile at the opposite side onto a number (1-4). Place this ejected tile in the matching quadrant on your player board.
With bonus markers you can move a tile on your player board or push two tiles into the sliding game board.
Keep taking turns until everyone has claimed 24 tiles, then count your points based on how well you matched the scoring cards. You gain points for matching tiles and gain bonus points if the tiles match your player board or are precious tiles.
mechanics: Map Deformation, Slide/Push, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Superstar Chess
description:
Superstar Chess was invented by László Polgár, Hungarian chess master coach. It is a hexagonal chess variant, created mainly for educational purposes.
The board consists of 37 hexes and each player has 1 king, queen, rook, knight, bishop and 5 pawns.
The rules can be found on the author's homepage (http://www.polgar-superstar-chess.net) or in the 'files' section of this page.

"It is quick and interesting and a lot of creative, brilliant games will be played with it." - Leon Pliester Ph.D., International Master of Chess

name: Patrician: The Delegates (part 2)
description:
Download-only expansion for Patrician.

Once in a year the patrician families send delegates to the big gathering. By that they can achieve additional prestige points.

name: World of Motor Racing
description: Replay system covering the various types of motor sport - each volume/add on covers a different fields: Formula One, INDY CARS, NASCAR, Le Mans, Rallying etc.

name: Earthshine
description:
In the land of Earthshine, a game of luck has been passed down from generation to generation, evolving as the years went on. Today, we pass that game to you, allowing you to make it your own.

Players use polyhedral dice (d4 through d20, which they must provide), and a coin (or d2), starting with the d20, to attempt to roll successfully under the next die type (under a 12 on a d20 for example) to gain the new dice type. They continue rolling each die type, attempting to add the next lower die until they decide to stop, at which point they can try to get a gem by rolling all of their accumulated dice.

A player wins if they collect the moon token (which they get if they earn the d2/coin and successfully flip heads) and keep it until the start of their next turn, or if they earn 4 gems.


Released in the February 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Burn the Festival
description:
In Burn The Festival you will have to be the rabbit that most mess up a music festival without dying in the attempt. Or rather, without getting killed trying!

It is a card game, where you will have to get the cards with the highest scores and prevent your rivals from getting the cards with the highest scores.

Shuffle the cards and start by drawing 6 cards. The player in his turn must draw a card from the center deck and decide which card from his hand he is going to play. The opponents may, in turn, use the cards in their hands to prevent the card played from coming into play.

—description from the publisher

name: Golem Arcana: Zikia – The Khan's Pyre
description:
Description from the publisher:

Grown from the trees of Eretsu's living forests, the golems of Arcanum Zikia are the masters of ambush warfare. In Golem Arcana: Zikia – The Khan's Pyre, you'll find three new Zikia Golems: the Bramblehorn, the Woodguard, and the Wildwood Dryad with its fearsome thorn eruption attack! Also included are four Relic Cards representing ancient magical artifacts with which you can equip your Golems with to wreak further havoc.
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: New Dawn: Bonus Game Material
description:
Stretch Rewards for the New Dawn Kickstarter Campaign of July 2014:

A First Player Resin Miniature Marker
A new race, The Ludons consisting of a player board and 8 Technology cards

Pack of 34 Cards (See Note 1)
- 1 Spiel 2014 Card
- 2 Phase A Economic Facilities
- 2 Phase A Scientific Facilities
- 2 Phase A Military Facilities
- 2 Phase A Hostile Facilities
- 2 Phase B Economic Facilities
- 2 Phase B Scientific Facilities
- 2 Phase B Military Facilities
- 2 Phase B Hostile Facilities
- 2 Green Base Benefits (See Note 2)
- 3 Stations
- 3 Alliance Aid Cards
- 9 Events Cards

Note 1 - The cards have the same expansion code (ND) as the New Dawn Base Game.

Note 2 - The Base Benefit Cards have the code for Station (ST) instead of the correct (BB).
categories: Dice, Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Card Baseball
description: Appearing in A Gamut of Games, Card Baseball is an abstract baseball simulator that uses a single standard deck of cards.

name: Shanghaien: Extrakarte 2
description:
This is a small expansion for the base-game Shanghaien. It is based in an extra "dirty tricks" card called "Send to the sharks / Exchange".

Every player gets one at the beginning of the game. He can use it one time during the game like every other "dirty tricks" card.

Using it he can choose between two actions:

- “Send to the sharks”: The player flips the card of the tavern onto which he has added a die in the same
turn onto its back side. When the cards are distributed, cards of the tavern which are flipped over are
removed from the game regardless of dice added onto them. Nevertheless dice added to a flipped card still
count as tie-breakers for adjacent cards which are not turned over. The “dirty tricks”-card is removed from
the game after usage.

- “Exchange”: The player takes one of his own dice he has added to a card of the tavern in a previous turn
back to his supply. Then he adds both dice he has rolled in that turn onto the corresponding cards of
the tavern. This action can only be performed if the player has added at least one die to the tavern in a
previous turn. The “dirty tricks”-card is removed from the game after usage.

You can download the cards here:

http://www.michaelschacht.net/p/shangXPUS2.pdf (english, letter)
http://www.michaelschacht.net/p/shangXP2.pdf (german, DINA4)
http://www.michaelschacht.net/p/shangXPE2.pdf (spanish)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates

name: Fairy
description:
Every round, reveal a new card. Simultaneously, all players choose a hand gesture to guess how the card relates to the previous one (? for higher value, ? for lower value, ? for same suit, or ✊ to guess a fairy).

Guess the correct value relation and get two points. Guess same suit correctly and get four points. Call one of the three fairies in the deck? That's seven points!

Any wrong guess loses you a point. First player to fifteen wins!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: RuneSword: Bith – Female Cleric
description:
A thematic series in the Lost Worlds series (these books are even compatible with the others). Players each take a character represented with a game book and a stat sheet. By giving the book to the opposite player, the pages give a first person view to the combatants. As various moves direct the players to turn to this page or that, combat damage, restrictions, and other special events are relayed to the players via the pages of the book.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.

name: Clash of Empires
description:
This is a miniatures wargames(using cardboard cut ups as miniatures) set in the Austro Prussian war of 1866.

Published by Total Fighting Power Games

Expanded by:

Clash of Empires: Fire on the Iser

name: BattleTech: ClanTroops
description: From the publisher: "ClanTroops is a supplement to the BattleTech: Battletroops game, providing 16 scenarios set during the Clan invasion. ClanTroops features rules expansions dealing with new terrain, weapons, equipment, an both Inner Sphere and Elemental battle armor. ClanTroops also contains five new mapsheets and a variety of counters, including stand-up counters for both types of battle armor."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Atmosfear: The Harbingers – Booster Game Tape
description:
This is an expansion VHS tape set for Atmosfear: The Harbingers game consisting of two 45 min. VHS tapes in a protective sleeve. Change the number of players by altering the number of keystones. The new tapes help increase re-playability of the game by providing fresh videos.

Expands:

Atmosfear: The Harbingers

name: 18MM
description:
The design has a blank 7x7 map that is randomly covered by 49 tiles which have numbered cities or terrain on them. Players start with the same capital regardless of the number of players. The game adds extra trains and more private companies based on the number of players (similar to 1846). Train availability, tile
availability, and game end work on a fixed schedule, similar to 18CZ except the round also determines train/tile as well as when stock/operating rounds/end game occur.

For the first 3 rounds there is one city available per player to start a company in. It works a lot like the minor companies in 1822 where you can see that cities 4, 8, 12 are available in the first round (for a 3 player game), 1, 11, 20 are available in round 2, and 9, 14, 18 are available in round 3. The starting locations are auctioned by highest bid with the bid being discarded to the bank and then the player chooses the starting share price after winning the bid. Players can only start one company each in each of the first 3 rounds, so once you win a bid for a starting location you cannot compete in the other auctions this round. Thus the last player gets the final starting location for $0 without an auction. After the first 3 stock rounds, new companies can be started in any city with an open station circle (after winning the auction for the starting location) and players can start more than one company in a given stock round.

There is also one randomly picked private company available per player for the first 3 rounds. The private companies are auctioned and count as capital toward starting a company like in 1817. Unlike the starting city locations, players can win more than one bid for the private companies. Some of the private companies produce revenue each round (unlike 1817) so it sometimes make sense to hold a private company for a few rounds before using it to start a company.

The game has multiple train types each in limited supply. You can buy hex trains (which are good for running to multiple cities right by each other), freight trains (which pick up coal and can run to the off map areas), passenger trains (+10 revenue into the company per city), plus trains (get to run one extra time before rusting), or advanced trains (run the turn they are purchased). The price of the older trains drop each round (you can buy a 2 freight train for $120 in the first operating round, $90 in round 2, or $60 in round 3).

You have the 2/5/10 share system similar to 1817, including mergers. Companies can take loans similar to 1817 except the loan market is not shared, instead the loan interest rate is driven based on which operating round it is. You have the option when doing 5 share mergers to add share values together instead of averaging as in 1817 (receiving 3 shares instead of 6) to recapitalize a company.

President shares can be sold to the market and companies then liquidate at the end of the stock round if no other player buys the president share. Trains can only be purchased between companies for full price for a current phase train of 1/2 price for a non current train. The shorting features from 1817 were not included in 1888 for obvious reasons as well as to simply the game.

The game takes in the 4 to 5 hour range and is intended to be a fun & easy game to play. The goal is simply to maximize your net worth at the end by running trains for as much as possible, driving up their share price, and then dumping the companies right before their trains rust. Players can't go bankrupt because they can just dump companies in bad financial health and companies which cannot buy a train will just die (no presidential liability).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Apocalypse au Zoo de Carson City: Les Extensions de Linda
description: Apocalypse au Zoo de Carson City: Les Extensions de Linda, an expansion for Apocalypse au Zoo de Carson City, allows for gameplay with up to six players, while also including an adventure mode for both solitaire and multiplayer experience and a "Linda mode" for expert players. Curious...

name: Fog of Love: Love on Lockdown
description:
Is your relationship too comfortable or are you just unable to go anywhere else?

Love on Lockdown is an expansion to the critically acclaimed, Fog of Love board game. Love on Lockdown tells the story of a couple who find themselves locked inside together for months on end with nothing to do. (How did we ever come up with this idea!?)

While on lockdown, you'll have more to manage than most couples - like your boredom and how reckless you're acting about the Threat. Coping with cabin fever will make or break the relationship - if you can even keep it up that long to begin with!

Navigate a branching storyline that switches paths based on your choices.
Choose the fate of your relationship from 8 new destinies
Explore 45 fun, new Scene cards all concerned with life, love, and happiness on the (literal) inside.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Role Playing, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Battle Mages
description:
Choose your Battle Mage, ready yourself as you enter the Selek Arena for a fight to the death against some of the most powerful champions of Thargos! Each Mage has an edge in their own magic art. Pit your wits against others as you add to the power of incoming spells and redirect them to your opponents but beware of rare magic that can change the outcome in the blink of an eye. This is a place of dangerous and volatile magic where only the strongest survive.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management

name: Get the Gem
description:
Get the Gem is a hide-and-seek game that comes to life with your child's imagination. One player creates a trail of arrows past make-believe obstacles like rushing rivers, fallen logs, and boiling mud. The other players follow that path and act out an adventure on their way to hidden treasure.

Includes an alternative, counting-game version.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Cold Case: Murder with Interest
description:
The Cold Case game line summons players to investigate the unsolved cases of victims murdered decades ago by piecing together the details that the police could never find. Inside the box, you will find realistic materials pertaining to the crime, and a complex story containing everything you need to crack the case. Follow the clues and submit your answers online to finally bring the killers to justice.

In Murder with Interest, players investigate a double murder that takes place at an office party in a small town in Ireland.

name: Werewolf: A Party Game for Devious People
description:
Werewolf is a party game of lies, deceit, & accusations.
Are you devious enough?
20 Villager Cards, 10 Werewolf Cards, 8 Wild Cards, 2 Seer Cards, 2 Doctor Cards, 2 Moderator Cards, 2 Village Drunk Cards, 2 Witch Cards, 2 Alpha Werewolf Cards
Play with up to 35 people (or two 20 person games!)
Most well-designed Werewolf game that exists.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Combat Arena: Clash of Champions
description:
Combat Arena is back, in a whole new incarnation that pits four mighty warriors of the 41st Millennium against each other in brutal combat. Trapped in an inescapable vault by the mad Necron Overlord, Trazyn the Infinite, two to four players must duke it out to earn their chance at freedom.

This sequel to Combat Arena brings back fast-paced, replayable combat with accessible rules, tactical depth, and beautiful miniatures, each with their own unique actions and attacks. Will you emerge victorious?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: 1st & Goal: Essen Eagles
description:
Essen Eagles is an expansion for the American football game 1st & Goal that, unlike the half-dozen expansions released with the base game, consists of only a single team.
This limited edition team contains 7 specialty dice for the Essen Eagles. Requires 1st & Goal® game to play.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Town Center: Expansion n°2
description:
Town Center: Expansion n°2 consists of four additional player boards for Town Center and twelve wooden cubes in a seventh color, with two different starting configurations.

This player board simulates the construction of New York City as a city with such an incredibly high density has to have its own version of Town Center. The board is topologically completely different from the original, which should alter the deepest-rooted habits of even the most experienced players. The twelve new dark green cubes represent the citizens of the city, adding new situations and new opportunities for construction to the basic game. After all, it would be a shame to build The Big Apple as a ghost town!
categories: Abstract Strategy, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Quark's Treasure Expansion Pack
description:
Quark’s Treasure is a Ferengi Shuttle. This vessel was given to Quark by his cousin as repayment for a debt. Quark decided to take it on a test journey and, joined by his brother, Rom, traveled to Earth to deliver his nephew, Nog, to Starfleet Academy. Of course, he also planned to make profit on the trip by smuggling a shipment of kemocite in the cargo hold.
Star Trek - Attack Wing: Quark's Treasure Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 18 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Platoon Commander: Korea 1950
description:
The first historical Platoon Commander module delves into the dynamic early days of the Korean War. The North Korean People's Army (NKPA) is relentlessly marching south, and the United States Army, vastly outnumbered, finds itself fighting a series of desperate battles in an attempt to buy enough time for the Pusan Perimeter to be finished. Chaffees and T-34s, Skyraiders and guerilla attacks; it's all here.

Platoon Commander: Korea 1950 features four tense scenarios:

Task Force Smith: The NKPA armor shrug off everything the Americans threw at them. Can they survive?

Taejon: The 21st Infantry Regiment & 78th Heavy Tank are all that stands between the NKPA and the unfinished Pusan Perimeter.

Chochiwon: The 21st Infantry Regiment faces ten-to-one odds. But US airpower might even the score.

Task Force Lynch: The daring Pusan Perimeter Breakout.

name: Master of Orion: The Board Game – Fuska Advisor Promo Card
description:
From the publisher...

The Klackon are a hive minded insectoid race from the cavernous world of Kholdan, and Fuska is the advisor to their Queen. In ``Master of Orion: The Board Game`` any race can recruit him to impose a level of calm among your entire society that can only be
found in the shared thoughts of a collective consciousness. This International Tabletop Day 2017 exclusive may allow you to build structures generally unavailable to you with the constantly fluctuating popular opinion of lesser, and more individual, societies.

"Always

While this advisor is yours, it is considered that your reputation is equal to 6. Mark your real reputation level. Discard this adviser before scoring points"

name: Wendepunkte
description:
With Wendepunkte you can play through a potential life in east Germany (at the time of the German Democratic Republic) and after the German reunification. You experience the pressure of the system, discrepancies in your potential biography and you need to make decisions living with its consequences.
While playing you learn about the political turning point in 1989 which changed the life for millions of people completely.

Wendepunkte is a simple, fast-paced and compelling card game. It's fun and different every time being played and it illustrates a part of German history.

The game takes place over three rounds with three turns each. During a turn, all players choose one card from their hand to play, then handing the remainder to an adjacent player.
After each player has revealed their cards simultaneously, the next turn starts with each player then selecting another card from the deck they were passed.
All cards have different symbols on them which either allow you to play certain other cards or they forbid playing them because you're missing the right symbols on the cards you've already played.

After round two and three, all players sum up the points on their played cards and the player with the most points wins the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: 5.15: A Rock Climbing Card Game
description:
You begin 5.15 as a 5.7 climber, a long way from being able to complete a 5.15 -- one of the hardest climbs in the world.

Start by picking your Style: sport, boulder, trad, or alpine. Then build up your strength by sending easier climbs alone and with partners. Along the way you will build up your stash of personal Gear, adding to your climbing strength and protecting you from bad Weather and Setbacks (from your so-called friends).

The first player to send a 5.15 wins the game!

5.15 comes with forty rock climbs and eight 5.15 climbs so you can explore and adventure all over the world. There are also 102 Booty cards: Actions, Setbacks, Weather, and Gear (shoes, harnesses, clothing, everything you need to get outside!). Four styles let you explore different playstyles every game.

5.15 was funded on Kickstarter in fall 2020 and is available for pre-order on five15game.com

name: Wonder Tales: Magic & Mayhem
description: Here's the magical items expansion. At just two cards, it'll give players a variety of items to use, but there's a catch - any item that you use in round 1 is available to your opponent in the next round.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Set Collection, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Spearmen – Unit Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

Stand your ground against the enemies of Daqan! Runewars Miniatures Game: Spearmen – Unit Expansion features eight Spearmen plastic figures and two plastic infantry movement trays to expand your Daqan army. Five additional upgrade cards for any army will give you the tools you need to push back any force.

name: Insecta: Trilobite
description:
Trilobite is a supplement for Insecta Second Edition that changes the game's focus to undersea evolution. It includes rules for underwater movement and combat, with new mutant design cards adapted to the watery environment. Sea creatures from across Earth's history populate a new Hive deck, and a system of catastrophe cards controls the passage of time. New rules and design cards cover grasping tentacles, camouflage, electric batteries, water jet siphons, pistol claws, proboscis, rear-attack spines, echo locating organs, suction feet, ink sacs, swim bladders, and more.

Contents:
4-page rules expansion with pull-out design card reference sheet
48 Hive bug cards
18 counters
58 bug design cards
16 catastrophe cards
6 rubber sea monsters
1 rubber pixie
categories: Animals, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Prehistoric, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Simulation, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Fat Messiah Games, Sierra Madre Games

name: Zaraba Twenty-Two (ザラバ22)
description:
Zaraba Twenty-Two is one of the finalists for the 2020 Trick Taking Party Awards. It is a three-player only trick-taking game using a subset of a standard deck of cards.

In the game, the lead player will play 2 cards to each trick, and the first one that is "followed" becomes the lead suit; the other card is moved to a stock chart area.

At the end of a hand, suits without any cards are worth 0 points; suits with cards in the area whose ranks sum to 22 or more are worth -1; and suits whose ranks sum 1 to 21 will be worth positive points.

Players score points for the cards won in tricks and the player with the most points after a number of rounds wins.

name: Island Siege: Rampart Expansion
description: Rampart Expansion add 24 new cards to Island Siege! It includes 12 new forts, 6 new buildings, and 6 new ships.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical

name: Unlock! Epic Adventures: Die sieben Prüfungen des Drachen
description:
Unlock! is a co-operative card game inspired by escape rooms that uses a simple system which allows you to search scenes, combine objects, and solve riddles. Play Unlock! to embark on great adventures, while seated at a table using only cards and a companion app that can provide clues, check codes, monitor time remaining, etc.

The Gold Dragons temple welcomes every seven years new disciples. Be worthy of Mater Li's teachings.

Alle sieben Jahre empfängt Meister Li im Tempel des goldenen Drachen neue Schüler. Geht auf eine Reise, um euch seinen Lehren als würdig zu erweisen.

name: DragonRaid
description:
"The exciting new RPG adventure for courageous Christians."

"DragonRaid is an exciting experience in adventure simulation. More than just a game, it offers hours of enjoyment while teaching participants to resist sin, counter deceptive arguments, memorize Scripture, and build moral and spiritual character."

The boxed set includes the following items:

Rules & Instructions Cassette Tape
New Player Briefing
DragonRaid Rule Book
LightRaider Handbook
Adventure Master Manual
Character Sheets
2 Battle Grids
Character Cut-outs
Dark Creature Cut-outs
NPC Cut-outs
Dice Set (Two StarLots, One Shadow Stone)
Adventure #1 ("The LightRaider Test")
Adventure #2 ("Rescue of the Sacred Scrolls")
Adventure #3 ("MoonBridge Raid Trilogy," Part 1)


Ages 12 and up.

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Wood Elf Druid Expansion Pack
description: The Wood Elf Druid Dragonfly the Grey is one of five blind boosters that players may purchase as an entrance fee to participate in Months 2-6 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The booster includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Munchkin Alphabet Coloring Book
description:
Description from the publisher:

It may be possible to learn the alphabet without the dungeon-delving excitement of Munchkin...but why would you want to? With The Munchkin Alphabet Coloring Book, you'll delight in reading aloud the 26 alphabet verses written by Steve Jackson. Then your little munchkins (or you!) can color the 26 all-new illustrations by Munchkin fan-favorite John Kovalic.

The book also includes ten new Munchkin cards, so you can surprise your friends more easily than jumping out of a closet and shouting, "Abcdef!" From now on, ABC stands for Attack, Backstab, and Color!

name: Cutterland: Cartridge Pack – Mashroom
description:
Mashroom Spawn!

In this box, you'll find a set of 80 Landscape cards for the game of Cutterland with a new monster — Mashroom! Play the familiar game and explore new combinations!

Mashroom
If there is at least 1 mashroom in an area, the area scores 2 VPs for each creature within it (including devoured creatures and the mashroom itself). Each area is scored only once.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Puzzle, Territory Building, Video Game Theme
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Caporetto, 1917: Catastrophe for Italy
description:
Caporetto, 1917
Catastrophe for Italy

By the standards of the Great War, Caporetto was a remarkable battle. Within a month, the Austro-Germans inflicted over 300,000 Italian casualties at a loss to themselves of only 100,000, and had shifted the front over 100 miles. But they fell short of a decisive victory.

Caporetto recreates this spectacular offensive. Modifications to the Great War in the East Standard Rules account for infiltration, naval fire support, changes of command, heroic "last ditch" leadership, and much more. The game poses different problems for each Player, with the Austro-German player impelled to push his advance as fast and as far as possible and the Italian Player forced to retreat, often in the face of certain losses to his rear-guard units, in order to rebuild his shattered line. But despite the inherent imbalance of forces, the game is tensely balanced.

Included in the The Great War in the East: Four World War 1 Battles Quadrigame.
Folio edition contains Standard rules, Special rules, 17" x 21" map and 200 counters.

name: HEXano
description:
Using hexagonal tiles, race against your opponents to score points and be the first to finish their pattern.
Boasting fast paced, strategic gameplay and stunning artwork, HEXano is the latest game from the creator of the Unoriginal Card Game.

Tessellation and pattern recognition are key aspects of the game making it not just a easy game to learn, but also a fun way to educate children in these subjects!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Matching, Score-and-Reset Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Speed Matching, Tile Placement

name: Muse: Factory Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for the game Muse. It has some gold foil on parts of the card, unlike all the cards in the base game.

This card is added to the deck of other masterpiece cards for added variety.

The promo was included separately from the base game for free by some FLGS's.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Mines of Ōlnäk
description:
Under the command of the dwarf king, the biggest clans from all over the world meet around the old mountain of Ōlnäk. Their objective is to rediscover and rebuild their lost and ancient city.

Over eight semesters in Mines of Ōlnäk, players have to turn their clan into the most powerful and richest one to claim the right to rule the city. As the chief of your clan, you have to coordinate your workers and choose wisely where to use them, between exploiting the city resources, participating in joint projects, selling resources, and claiming political rights.

Will you be able to become the next King of Ōlnäk?
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Empires of the Void: Pirates of Cidran
description:
Pirates of Cidran is an expansion to Empires of The Void consisting of an additional race with the same name.

This expansion was offered as a backer reward to those backing Empires of The Void on Kickstarter.

name: Speed Circuit: British Grand Prix
description:
British Grand Prix: Brands Hatch (Dartford, Kent, England, U.K.). This expansion map is an official map for Speed Circuit from Avalon Hill. Printed on the map is the following: "This Course was prepared especially for ORIGINS IV by Mark Maticek and The Avalon Hill Game Company for distribution to participants in the SPEED CIRCUIT tournament. Not for sale or reproduction."

This is an expansion for Speed Circuit.

name: Tannenburg
description:
Sub-title:"The East Prussian Campaign 1914". The Imperial German Army's successful opening battles of encirclement and destruction of the Imperial Russian 2nd Army at the opening of World War 1.

Contents include a Ziploc baggie, a 17"x22" paper map sheet, 2-page rules folder, die-cut thin paper counters, and a paper sheet with the Combat Results Table/Terrain Effects Chart/Turn Record Track/Reinforcements Schedule. Players must provide their own die.

The map sheet is mostly tan with blue national territory lettering, forest and water features and brown for all other terrain including single & double rail lines, towns/cities, borders, fieldworks, detached and ring forts, and place names. Counters are white with green print (Russians) and green with white print (Germans) and represent Brigade/Divisional level Combat units.

The rules folder has a listing of abbreviations. On the back page are the victory conditions, addenda, design notes and scenarios including some optional set-ups. Additional options include:

A.Stronger German 8th Army;
B.Stronger Russian 2nd Army;
C.Better Russian Mobilization;
D.Better Russian Cavalry.

The game runs from August 17th, 1914 through September 15th, 1914 and each turn represents 1 day while each hex is considered to be 3 miles across from side to side. The playing area covers East Prussian Germany down to north Russian Poland.

The Russian moves first and the Sequence of Play is as follows:

1.Supply Judgement phase;
2.Movement phase;
3.Combat phase,

followed by the German Player's turn. There are Special Rules for Cavalry, Landsturm, Fortifications & Fieldworks, and Hidden (inverted) units.

This is a very concise and easy to learn game as is most of the company's products while being one of the first produced by them to have die-cut counters.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Skispringen
description: Roll the dice and move the spaces. Decide if you want to buy this space. Perhaps you have to draw an action card. You have money in the beginning of the game. And you should have more money in the end of the game.

name: Sportiv, Football édition 2006
description:
How to play football... even on a small table.

Each player has 4 sets of cards: Players cards, Actions / counter-actions cards, Goal cards and and Goalkeeper cards.

During his turn, a player can add players, remove adverse players by matching the totals (his player(s) numbers total = adverse player(s) numbers total), or play a special action (can be countered).

And finally, he may try to score a goal using his goal card set, while the opponent will try to block it with his goalkeeper set, hoping to guess the parts of the goal that need to be protected and doing so.

name: Escape the Blob
description:
In a colorful fantasy setting, players try to escape from the Schmunzelmonster (a tentacled alien monster). Each player has 4 Schlammhüpfers ('mud hoppers', the pawns), who try to escape from getting eaten by the Schmunzelmonster by throwing 2 dice. The first die determines if players get to move their Schlammhüpfers or the Schmunzelmonster (⅔ chance). The second die determines how far they must move.
On a player's turn, if they still have a Schlammhüpfer in the safety of their burrow, they need to move it out before they may move another one on the board. Schlammhüpfer can cover quite a lot of distance because they skip occupied spots. That is needed, however, to get away from the ravenous monster.

The player with the last Schlammhüpfer remaining wins the game. Schmunzelmonster is a beautiful and colorful game for ages 6 and up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: King for a Day
description:
Players take the part of competing nobles trying to become king.

Players bid for special abilities, collect resource cards and gold and also build structures to generate gold and more power.

At the end, the player with the most Power wins.

Home Page: http://www.fairplaygames.com/newworldgames/bnw/3%204%205.htm...

name: Naval Wargames World War 1 and World War 2
description:
Synopsis from the book:
"They are only models and the sea may be any surface which is conveniently at hand, but when the grey warships slip out of port at the start of a game they become something different. They are German cruisers heading for the Atlantic to prey upon enemy shipping; they are the battleships, carriers and escorts of Force H leaving Gibraltar for another desperate voyage...or an American carrier force off on a long probe towards the Japanese-held islands of the Pacific."--Barry J. Carter

The book covers building or acquiring naval miniatures for table top gaming; also has a set of rules and information for designing your own rules, as well as data for warships from WW1 and WW2.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Larger Than Life: The Game of Pulp Adventures
description:
SO WHAT ARE THE PULPS?

It’s spaceships, jungle lords, and Nazis. Lost cities, underwater adventure, and maybe even a hard-boiled detective or two.

It’s about heroes moving from scene to scene at breakneck speed. Hot on the trail or maybe a step in front of the bad guys.

It’s clever cliffhangers that leave you wanting more.

But mostly it’s all about the story.

And that’s what drives Larger Than Life. In LTL you step into the story and become a Larger Than Life Hero. LTL moves you from scene to scene each with a different challenge. Complete your challenge and move to the next scene. Fail and you’re whisked down another road that leads to who knows where. But if you stick to it and if you’re lucky you’ll complete all the challenges and that will get you what you wanted from the beginning, a shot at the “Big Bad”.
