Szczekociny 1794 is an independent and complete game and knowledge of the game "Raclawice 1794" is not required.

name: Giza: Fast Sleds
description:
This official Mayfair promo expansion was included as a convention and retail give-away on a tile sheet titled: Game Variants & Mini Expansions Set #1. It was also included in the Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #18.

This gives players the opportunity to potentially push two sleds on their turn.

"He sled, she sled"

Setup:
Take a Fast Sled token and place it behind your screen.

Nominate Another Sled:
On your turn, after a sled is pushed or pyramid stone is lifted, you may use and discard your fast sled token to nominate and push an additional sled. This token may only be used to push a sled, it may not be used to lift. If another player has used his/her sled token this round, then you can not use your token until the next round.

Game End:
If the game ends without the completion of the pyramid and you still have your Fast Sled token, you are eliminated from the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement

name: Stawvs
description:
Stawvs is a pure abstract strategy game for 2-4 players. The 8x8 square board begins full of 4 stashes of randomly distributed Components: Looney Pyramid Games. In turn, players move their own pieces and claim pyramids to score.

It is similar to Amazons, with Volcano scoring: each turn, a player moves one of their own pieces in an unblocked straight line, then removes a chosen pyramid somewhere in an unblocked straight line from that piece's new location. At the end, each monochrome trio is 7 points, each other trio is 5 points, and each other piece is 1 point.

name: Malifaux: Mercenaries
description: This box set expands the number of units available for Malifaux by adding the Mercenaries crew. The set contains Viktoria (X2), Taelor, Bishop and Johan.

name: Scoralet
description:
In Scoralet, each player receives a small tray with a 5x5 grid of felted spaces. Between the players on the table are placed square wooden tiles with letters on them. Each player in turn calls out a letter and the other players pick this letter from the central pile and place it in one of the spaces on their tray. Their goal is to spell out as many 3, 4, or 5 letter words as possible, left-to-right or top-to-bottom.

Play continues until all 25 spaces are filled. 5 letter words score 15 points, 4 letter words score 10, and three letter words score 5. 2 letter words do not score. Smaller words within larger words also may score their own points, so long as the larger word is not simply a plural of the smaller. In that case, only the larger plural word scores. Proper names of people or places do not count unless agreed upon prior to the game's start. Highest score wins.

The distribution of the letter tiles breaks down for each player in the following manner:

a-3, b-2, c-1, d-2, e-3, f-1, g-1, h-1, i-2, j-1, k-1, l-2, m-1, n-2, o-3, p-2, q-1, r-2, s-2, t-2, u-2, v-1, w-1, x-1, y-1, z-1.

This totals 42 tiles for each player. Prior to start, the pile must be made of this many tiles for each player, and no more. 84 tiles for two, 126 tiles for three, 168 tiles for four players.

Print ads from 1936 referred to this game as the "successor to Anagrams." Two editions were sold, a two-player edition for 50 cents and a four-player edition for 1 dollar.

name: Kyro 5
description:
Defeat your Pharaoh foe by being the first to place five pyramids in a row.

Game includes 24 plastic pyramids - 12 green and 12 blue. Players take turns placing a pyramid on the table. Pyramids must touch when they are placed. First player to get 5 in a row wins!

name: Ultrium Sphere: Tëra-nëva Sphere
description:
In a distant future, man has conquered space and the ultimate entertainment is an extremely violent sport called ULTRIUM SPHERE.

In these matches, anything goes. At least two teams oppose each other, competing to score the 3 decisive goals that lead to victory. The teams usually belong to powerful corporations or mere independents, and the players come from the entire Galaxy (human beings, androids, genetic experiments or aliens). ULTRIUM SPHERE has become the most popular game throughout the universe and is watched by hundreds of billions of entities. The players who manage to survive the game and perform outstandingly well are virtually elevated to the rank of Divinities and are named the ULTRAs.
In ULTRIUM SPHERE, each player is the leader of an Ultrium Sphere team, which he/she tries to lead to victory.
Each team consists of two decks: 25 Ultra Cards and 25 Interaction Cards. The Ultra Cards represent the team members and describe their race and various characteristics, offensive (tackling, attack, shot) and defensive (resistance, save, pass). The Interaction cards are the different strategies that the team can apply.
At the beginning of the game, each player draws 4 Interaction Cards and 6 Ultra Cards. The 6 Ultras are to be laid out in two lines, the attack line and the defense line (3 Ultras in each line). The Interaction cards stay in hand.
The Ultras can be used either for their special ability or to carry out various actions according to their place on the field. The strikers can undermine the opponent’s defense (tackling, attack) or try to shoot a goal. The defenders can make passes to strikers (a pass must take place prior to every shot at goal) or stop the opponent’s shots. The player must activate the Ultras (i.e. turn them at a 90-degree angle) when he/she uses them. Once activated, the Ultras can no longer be used. Therefore, the player must not activate all his/her Ultras during his/her turn, since the activated Ultras will not be able to defend during the opponent’s turn. When the player chooses to play an action, he/she must cast a 12-sided die and add the Ultra’s personal bonus for the action chosen. To know whether the action succeeds or not, the player compares the total to a success threshold, which must be exceeded or not depending on the type of action.
The Interaction card may be used at any time to strengthen one’s own Ultras or weaken the opponent’s Ultras.
When the turn begins, the player draws 1 Interaction card and set all his/her Ultras upright. First, he/she can replace Ultras and have 2 Ultras swap place. He/she can then use the Ultras and Interaction cards.
When the player can no longer or does no longer want to carry out any action, or when he/she scores a goal, his/her turn ends and the opponent can begin his/her turn.
The game goes on until one of the players scores 3 goals.

name: Touchy Feely
description:
Touchy Feely is a game in which players have to find objects using only their sense of touch.

Twenty-six Touchy Feely trinkets (miniatures of real objects) are placed in a nylon container, the "Tube of Touch". Cards showing each object indicate what items should be found.

Three games can be played:

Memory Match: Four cards are drawn. The players get five seconds to memorise them. They are then placed face-down. Now, both players simultaneous go searching for the items shown, and get sixty seconds to retrieve three items and place them on top of the cards. Whomever has the most matches wins the game.
Speedy Feely: One card is drawn. Both players go searching for the object. When someone finds it, he takes the card, and the next card is drawn. Whomever has collected the most cards after sixty seconds wins the game.
Hand Solo: A solo version of Speedy Feely, with one player trying to find as many objects as he can.


A fourth game, Kitchen Sink is played with custom items rather than the supplied trinkets.

name: Wheel of Fortune Electronic Game
description:
FROM THE BOX:

The celebrated television game show comes to life in your own living room with this tabletop game! Over 1000 puzzles in your favorite game categories. Tons of fun for friends, families or the ultimate Wheel of Fortune fan!

Just like the show and all other previous version before it you spin the wheel, choose a letter, buy a vowel and solve the puzzle. When the wheel is spun, the seasons 24-26 template scrolls upwards on the LCD screen (and with the gradual movements on the wheel can stop anywhere the player wishes). The game has four rounds including the Jackpot round in round three and the bonus round where you have to spin a smaller-sized 24 wedge wheel and solve one puzzle in order to claim you prize. It follows the rules from season 26 and wedges like Jackpot, Mystery Wedge, Wild Card, Prize Wedge Million Dollar Wedge, gift tag and free spin (shown as "Free Spin + $300" if the wheel stops) are there. It also has QWERTY Keyboard that can only be used with the included stylus pen. and it featured the voice of the late Charlie O'Donnell as host.

A Platinum Edition of the game was released in 2009.
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Word Game
publishers: Irwin Toy Ltd., iToy, TF1 Games

name: Samurai Robots Battle Royale
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Samurai Robots Battle Royale is a standalone set of miniatures rules for mecha battles. Based on the award-winning "Song of Blades" engine, it allows players to refight the wild, imaginative battles seen in the classic Japanese anime series. It also includes rules and guidelines for more realistic science-fiction military games, or even battles with steam-powered engines of destruction. You can play quick mecha vs mecha duels, or larger battles in which each player controls 3-6 giant robots for a two-hour game.

Build your mecha from the ground up with a point system, choosing quality/combat scores, armor, weapons and special rules for each part of its body. Samurai Robots Battle Royale can be played on an average dinner table using any models you already own, including toy robots and paper figures, in any scale.

Samurai Robots Battle Royale and our kaiju game Mighty Monsters are compatible, so you can run mechas vs giant monsters battles.
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Lacrosse Blast Pro Indoor Lacrosse Game
description:
Lacrosse Blast is an "old-school" card-chart-and-dice simulation of pro lacrosse. Primarily designed as a solitaire game for sports board game hobbyists, it can also be played head-to-head, with each player making decisions for his team.

From the publisher:

We've taken our original lacrosse game, Crash and Scramble, and made it even better by adapting it to the same game engine that powers our popular hockey game, Hockey Blast. The result is a fast-playing, fun board game simulation of this cutting-edge pro sport that captures everything fans love about it: bone-jarring hits, acrobatic passes, rocket-fast shots, and amazing saves. YOU can re-create all the thrilling action of this "ahead-of the curve" sport, right in your own home, with Lacrosse Blast Pro Indoor Lacrosse Game!

Lacrosse Blast uses a possession-by-possession system of play that keeps things moving fast. The game uses the same easily-memorized chart structure and no-nonsense method of rating players as our hockey game. Players perform based on the presence--or absence--of various qualities like speed, power and skill. Each player is also rated for his ability in creating and/or taking away scoring opportunities, as well as for shots and assists, penalties, face-offs and injury. That means you'll get table-top performances which echo each player's real-life abilities without a bunch of calculations or math gymnastics. You'll see the great assist guys dishing it off for goals and the powerhouse shooters firing the ball into the net, while the less-talented players defer to someone else. You'll be caught up in the action as you "watch" players use their power, skill and savvy to make plays. Goalies have their own special ratings, designed to make the real-life star net-minders shine on your table top the just way they do on the pro league floor! Easy-to-play, but amazingly detailed--THAT'S Lacrosse Blast Pro Indoor Lacrosse simulation board game!

name: HeroClix: Kick-Ass 2 – Fast Forces
description: Bring all of the knuckle-dusting, explosive action of the Kick-Ass 2 movie to your tabletop with HeroClix! This Kick-Ass 2 HeroClix Fast Forces Mini-Figure 6-Pack allows you to expand your HeroClix universe by adding playable figures to your collection from the Kick-Ass 2 movie. Featuring 6 figures with advanced dial designs along with 2 exclusive maps, this great Fast Forces Pack would be a great addition to any HeroClix collection, for new and established players alike!
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Tooth: Kickstarter Exclusive Cards
description: This is a five card Super Tooth expansion exclusive to those who backed the Super Tooth Kickstarter. This expansion includes the cards: Stampede, Cave, Oviraptor, Lost, and T-Rex. Two additional cards, the Kickstarter Exclusive Cards reference card and the T-Rex reference card, provide an explanation and rules for each card in the expansion.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric

name: Super Tooth: Titanic Tree Eaters Expansion
description: This expansion to Super Tooth consists of nine cards: 1 Foliage Event Card, 2 awesome Meat-Eating Ceratosaurus Cards, and 6 Plant-Eating Diplodocus Cards. The explanation and rules for each card in this expansion can be found on the Expansion Events reference card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric

name: Super Tooth: End of Days Expansion
description: This expansion to Super Tooth is comprised of nine cards: 1 Asteroid Event Card, 2 fearsome Meat-Eating Gigantosaurus cards, and 6 Plant-Eating Plateosaurus cards. The explanation and rules for each card may be found on the Expansion Events reference card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Ogre Mage Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Ogre Mage Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Credo!: The Game of the Early Church
description:
As in the original Credo, in Credo!: The Game of the Early Church players compete to get their versions of the articles of the Nicene Creed voted in. There are numerous event cards which affect the proceedings.

This edition makes some significant changes, among which are:

The game can be played with up to eight players, although play mats for just six are provided.
The alternate winning conditions (11 million flock or 117 council votes) have been eliminated.
The game ends when the creed is complete or when the event deck is exhausted.
The creed is divided into 13 articles instead of 10, and there are furthermore additional optional articles (designated X, Y, and Z) which the Emperor can choose to vote on at any time. (Consequently, players can have up to 12 articles on their mats instead of 9.)
All flock cards have the same value.

name: Moscow Embattled, 1941: the Minigame
description: This mini - even micro - game has just the 6 German armies/panzergruppen and 9 Russian army and front units, plus 2 air units for each side. 3 hexes from Smolensk to Moscow. Uses Dark Crusade's, Tiger Attack's, and Darkest Crusade's simple firing point/hit system. 20-day turns as in Moscow Defended! Blitzkrieg. Siberians. A half-hour-lunch game, FREE to print off and play from CoatneyHistory (where the rules are).
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: DOLMEN
description:
The night of the summer solstice, all the goblins are on the moor to designate their king. Enter the round and build the most beautiful dolmen to win the title.

Dolmen is a beautiful wooden play on the Celtic theme published in limited series. You play the Goblins, these small Breton goblins, who will build their dolmen picking up the slabs arranged in a circle around the stone table.

GOAL OF THE GAME

The goal is to have the most points in its own construction at the end of the game. It stops when a player has 7 tiles in its dolmen.

In a turn, players will either move their korrigan AND watch a slab OR try to add a tile to their dolmen AND watch a slab

A korrigan moves from 0 to 3 (without rolling the dice) on the light points around the circle in any direction.

Each tile has a colored light on two of its sides. Arranged on the circle early in the game, the face of each slab has points (2 to 6). These will serve as the final countdown to determine the winner.

To add a stone to the dolmen, the korrigan must be in front of it and one of the colored sides of the stone must be the same color as the ends of the dolmen.

The player rolls the dice and if the result is more than the score of the slab, it can be placed by matching lights.
If the dice score is not enough, you need to consume power points symbolized by colored gems and give the difference on the stone table of the fairy.

To recover its power points, the player must go see the fairy. This will also take the opportunity to replace the stones around the circle.

As soon as a dolmen is finished, each player counts his points (even those with incomplete dolmen) and adds the unused points of powers. The winner is the one with the highest score.

Warning, this is not necessarily the fastest who is the winner ...

name: Hellweg westfalicus: Christmas Sale Mini-Expansion
description:
Postcard mini-expansion (available for download from the designer's website in German or English)

Christmas Sale is a new merchandise card.

The owner can sell once in the game more than one Merchandise token in one town on the trading card.

If used carriages have to be removed don't do it before the complete sale.

A bonus for the last trading card in the game will only be counted once for that sale

name: Outsider
description:
Outsider is a card game that combines cooperative and hidden traitor mechanics with set collection and hand management, in an immersive science fiction setting.

Players are each assigned or choose a character, each with unique abilities and a different combination of the four skill icons. Each player is also given a random Loyalty card, which is kept secret from the other players. Most players will be Crew and will work together to complete repairs, represented by Goal cards. Crew members win the game when they have completed more goals than there are players, all Crew have at least one completed Goal, and any Crew member correctly declares victory on their turn.

One or two players will be Outsiders. Outsiders win the game if they declare victory on their turn and all Crew members are Doomed. All players lose if the deck runs out or if everyone becomes Doomed from a single source, which adds a cooperative element. An addendum provides alternate rules for groups that find this too harsh or would prefer a more narrative ending.

The setting is gritty sci-fi with art by James Zark lending a cyberpunk flavor to the characters. The basic concept deals with a future where vessels move between universes to save time on space travel, with the occasional side-effect of crew members becoming murderous and paranoid, called "Outsiders".

Outsiders are literally castaways from other dimensions. Having shifted between universes too many times, they suddenly find that they no longer recognized things that should be familiar. Torn from a discarded reality, their only option is to seize control of the ship and reverse the shifts in reality, dooming the rest of the crew in the process.

The game lends itself to a wide variety of strategies, and despite a small learning curve the basics come into focus pretty quickly. Multiple playthroughs reveal increasingly complex possibilities, and each game is distinctly different as new combinations of Loyalties and characters are explored.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Каркассон: тайл Избушка
description:
Каркассон: Богатырь на распутье & Избушка (Carcassonne: Hero at the Crossroads & Baba Yaga) is a two-tile semi-unofficial expansion for Carcassonne made by Russian publisher Hobby World and presented to participants of the Russian national Carcassonne league in 2013. One tile represents Bogatyr, a Russian hero from folktales, at a crossroads, while the other tile represents Izbushka, the small hut of Baba Yaga the witch, also from Russian folktales.

Bogatyr's tile has no special rules, but it does feature text on a stone that might be translated as follows:

If you go to the left - you'll find death.
If you go to the right - you'll lose your horse.
If you go straight - you'll live, but will forget who you are.

The Izbushka tile scores somewhat like an anti-cloister as it's worth 1 point for the tile itself and 1 additional point for each empty space around the tile, for a maximum of 8 points.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Bomarzo: The Crooked House
description:
Kickstarter and Giochistarter exclusive development card for the Bomarzo boardgame.

This card represents one of the most iconic structures inside the Sacred Woods of Bomarzo and can be shuffled in the Development deck to be drawn by players during the game.

It provides 1 Architecture point when deployed and 3 architecture points when evolved on its b-side.

Also, the evolved side of the card provides 1 silver resource in every Production phase.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Gem Rush: Skill Cards
description: From the nimble mind of Gem Rush designer Jeremy Lennert, this set of eleven Skill cards gives each player a unique mining ability as their edge. In addition, there are several gameplay variants to choose from.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Naruto Shippuden Deck-building Game: Mecha-Naruto Promo
description:
Oversized hero card for the Naruto Shippuden Deck-building game from Cryptozoic.

Card text:
"+1 Chakra for each filled Chakra Point.
Chakra (3): +2 Power"

Features 1 "Equipment", 1 "Starter", and 2 "Enemy" Chakra Points.

name: Confrontation: Lahnars Army Book
description: The Army Book: Lahnars is a supplement for Confrontation: The Age of the Rag’narok. It contains everything you need to play with or battle against the Lahnars (Lions).
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: 5Crests
description:
5Crests is a hybrid card game set in an alternate history, where the discovery of a magically imbued mineral called Villium gives rise to a stronger, more centralized criminal enterprise, the First Family. The family, in their quest to control this new power, created 5 different guilds, honoring the ways of their members to provide muscle and protection against any who oppose it.

You play the role of a fast rising street lieutenant in one of these guilds trying to carve out your own slice of the American Dream. Each player constructs a deck of various allies, weapons, trade fronts, and actions. Players can build and expand their arsenal by collecting more cards and trading with their friends to get more powerful allies and tools of the trade. Then you take to the streets and fight other street lieutenants for supremacy. Each lieutenant starts with a set amount of health based on their abilities, but winning requires that you bring the opposing lieutenants health to 0. Players expand their Villium trade by playing and controlling trade fronts. As these fronts bring in Villium, players are able to bring their allies and resources into the fray to battle with their enemies. Fights can be 1 on 1 street brawls, or all out mob wars between multiple players. Those left standing will continue their quest to gain control of the first family.

The family is calling, will you answer?
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: O Ataque dos Tubarões-Vampiros
description:
From the publisher:

A Eron Dal Molin's board game, launched by Lends and developed by Foka Games.
In this fun journey, you're a pirate or a vampire shark alternately. As a pirate, mark points by surviving the attacks from the monster; as shark-vampire, gain victory points biting and turning pirates into new sharks. In both roles, just outsmart your opponents to win. It is a strategy game the escape tension is a constant and "backstabbing" among participants ensure laugh. Of course, a little luck can help in difficult situations.

Every turn the pirates can move 1-3 sea spaces swimming away from vampire shark and block the path of another pirates. Blocked pirates are easy to be bitten by vampire sharks that need to move 3 sea spaces straight to the closest pirate. Strategy cards can be played to help pirates avoid bites or by vampire sharks to move freely. At same time a treasure hunt is happening and as a pirate you need to take the treasure map and go to the right island to gain more victory points.

Being the last pirate alive you'll gain victory points so every turn you need to choose run away or block your friends.

name: Pocket Odyssey: Collector's Edition
description:
From the publisher:
In Pocket Odyssey players assume the roles of legendary heroes embarking on epic quests, defeating monsters, finding loot and pretty much anything the players mind can imagine. One of the players is chosen at the beginning of the game to be “the storyteller”, they use innovative quest building cards to help them create a quest for the other players on the fly. Each of the other players assume the role of a single hero, they get to create who that hero is and then how that hero interacts in the storytellers world.

Pocket Odyssey is designed to be portable, the first micro RPG ever, measuring 1in. thick, 3.5in. tall and 5.5in. wide, this game will quite literally fit in your pocket (the Collector's Edition is in a larger box). Pocket Odyssey has been designed for board game players of all backgrounds to pick up and play. Ever been curious about what a role playing game is, but were too intimidated by all the rules? Maybe you have played role playing games before, but don’t have the time to commit to a huge campaign anymore. Just want an engaging and fun fantasy game? Pocket Odyssey is what you have been waiting for.

Gameplay Features


2-4 players (5-6 w/ expansion)
90-120 minutes play time
A tabletop RPG hybrid! No pen or paper needed!
Innovative "on the spot" quest creation method allows for anyone to play as the Game Master. No prep needed!
Focused rules keep the game moving quickly and bring the most fun parts of traditional RPG's into the limelight!


Core game components:
Rule Book
3 Stat Cards
6 Background Cards
16 Personal Goal Cards
20 Item Shards
9 Power Cards
11 Potion Cards
20 Flaw Cards
12 Wooden Pawns
1d6
9 Baddie Stat Cards
40 Counters Shards
10 Action Shards
24 Map Tiles (double sided)
18 Quest Cards
12 Baddy Cards

PLUS:

Large "Box of Holding"
Rule Book
2 Stat Cards
6 Background Cards
9 Power Cards
20 Item Shards
8 Wooden Pawns
6 Baddy Cards
40 Counters Shards
24 Magic Items Cards
25 Hidden Power Cards
24 Baddy Cards
10 Tide of Battle Cards
mechanics: Acting, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Beast of Balka
description:
It is time to hunt the Beast of Balka! The Sun Clan and Moon Clan are competing to be the first to slay the Beast and earn the favor of their god, and they must navigate a jungle full of monsters — and enemy hunting parties — to do so. Will you be able to use your superior tactics to claim your quarry, or will the other clan get the best of you?

Beast of Balka is a fast-paced abstract strategy game that challenges each player to outwit their opponent, taking into account positioning as well as probability to emerge victorious. However, destroying your enemy is not your goal: simply an obstacle to it.

Each player takes turns traversing the forest, honing in on their prey and trying to hinder one another. The more each hunting party encounters danger, the more bloodthirsty they become; but they must face ambushes, misdirection, and — worst of all — stampeding beasts!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck

name: City of Outcasts
description:
In City of Outcasts players take a darker path and travel to Rym, the infamous City of Outcasts, a city outside the control of the Empire. Once a peaceful settlement of hopeful pilgrims looking to green the desert, the city was disastrously buried by the desert sands and eventually became a destination for all sorts of neer-do-wells looking to escape the eyes of the authorities - and to set up a little empire of their own. In City of Outcasts players are looking to secure the support of the various characters and factions in the city and build up enough support to reclaim Rym for its down-trodden people. In the micro game tradition of games like Love Letter, but with a little more going on, City of Outcasts looks to provide players with a quick, but in-depth micro game experience.

OVERALL GAMEPLAY: Each player is attempting to play the various powers off each other to assemble allies in a cunning bid to take control of Rym, the City of Outcasts. There are 13 ally cards in the game as well as an Eyes of the People card. One card is dealt to each player face down at the beginning of the game and an equal number of cards are dealt face up on the table as there are players plus one. Each ally cards has an influence number, special ability and a point value. Each player will draw one card from the table clockwise until each player has 2 cards in hand with 1 card remaining. The ally card on the table is the character players are trying to influence. Each player will then simultaneously choose a card from their hand and place it on the table face down. Going clockwise, cards are revealed and if there is an ability with a choice, it must be made upon the reveal. Whoever has the highest revealed influence number after all cards are revealed wins the face up card for the points on the card and takes the Eye of the People card. The Eyes of the People is for the start player of the next round as well as a bonus point at the end of the game. The game ends when there are not enough cards to place on the table and the player with the most points wins and more importantly, usher in a period of justice, peace and prosperity for its down-trodden people.

There is also included in the game 9 Location Cards and 16 Identity Tokens that can be used for a more epic version of the game. Players assign allies that they have influenced to locations for dominance in Rym. These cards have location points which are used to determine who has the most control within the city. Three location cards are used for each game and the winner is determined after 3 games.

name: Apokalypsis
description:
Apokalypsis takes the players back to the Ancient Greece. As the wrath of the Gods fall upon you, you must interpret the omens and foresee which parts of the island that will remain safe and which parts that are doomed.

The wrath of the Gods causes the island of Thera to sink tile by tile. The players now struggle to interpret the omens and move onto safe land. The player or players with the most survivors at the end of the game wins.

The game is played with three basic components:


The meeples that the players try to save.
The land tiles that form the island of Thera and that are flipped to their sea side when land turns into sea.
The omen cards that tell the players which land will sink sooner and which will sink later.


The players take turn to do the following:


Omen: Draw 2 secret omens.
Action: Move own meeples, push others’ meeples or build bridges to cross the sea.
Event: Choose 1 omen to keep and 1 to return to the bottom of the pile. Add it to the omens kept so far and check if at least 2 omens hit the same land tile. If so, resolve an apocalypse.
Apocalypse: Flip land tiles to sea tiles and discard meeples on them.


The game ends when a player has lost all his or her meeples. Most survivors wins!

Apokalypsis combines deduction and take that mechanisms. Which tiles that turn into sea are determined by the secret and collective decisions of the players. By choosing the right omens and deducing which omens the other players have seen, you may move your meeples onto safe land and push the others onto unsafe land. The game is tense and interactive, yet quick and simple.
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Take That

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Guardians of the Galaxy Starter Set
description:
From the publisher:

This game is a small scale skirmish level game where Superheroes and Villains face off against each other in a 3D tabletop set up. It could be a city, the Wakandan desert, the Savage Lands, the blue area of the moon or anything you like. In Marvel they fight anywhere.
It is played on a 36" x 36" board so will fit on most tables without a problem.

In a game you will usually have between 4-7 characters on your team. Each of these characters act individually using their own Power to carry out different attacks and use Special Powers.
Many can help or hinder each others though with boosts and actions like a Fastball Special.

The aim of the game is to win set scenarios by completing different tasks and scoring Victory Points. These could be anything from take down / save the highest Level model in the team or rescue and keep a Cosmic Relic.

Each character comes with their own Stat Card which shows everything they can do. Attacks, Defence, Skills, Power, Damage and such.
These are then used in a 2 D8 mechanic during the game. For example, 2D8 plus Attack Stat vs Defence Stat or 2D8 against your own Agility.

A group of cosmic adventurers led by Star-Lord, the Guardians of the Galaxy protect the universe from threats all across space. The team also includes Drax, Gamora, Groot and Rocket Raccoon!maybe required.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: District-Z: The Cult
description:
You never thought it would come to this. When the dead rose, you thought that they would be the biggest threat. You were wrong. Your supplies are running low. Medicine and food are nearly gone. The group decided that you will make the next run. You thought that you had prepared for this. You weren’t ready for them but they were ready for you.

District-Z: The Cult is a stand-alone game and does not require the original District-Z to play. This is a Choose Your Own Adventure-style game that will take you from your first steps outside of your small compound and into a harried run from a mysterious Cult that is always on your trail. You will choose your own path. Will you take down the Cult or will you be converted?

The CULT GAME BOOK: This is the story that you must encounter. You will read a page and attempt to overcome the challenges presented. You may be presented with a choice of which test to perform on the card. The choices will be separated by the keyword “OR” and this allows you to choose one of the tests to
complete while ignoring the other test (unless the page states otherwise). Once the test has been performed, perform the appropriate SUCCESS or FAILURE result.

DICE
The dice in District-Z: The Cult are customized with symbols representing each of a SURVIVOR’S ATTRIBUTES as well as the dreaded AUTO-FAIL result. If you roll an AUTO-FAIL result you may not reroll that die during your reroll attempts.

CULT Cards represent the constant threat of the Cult and are used to change the game causing difficulties for the Player via increased challenges, reduction in stats, and even causing you to perform all tasks on a page.

Items and Companion cards represent the Items and Companions that you may come across during the game. These cards are attached to your character mat and you may use their special abilities to assist you in defeating the challenges.

The Survivor mats are where you will track the changes that your Survivor goes through. You will, through the course of the game, be able to increase the basic stats of your character, gain experience, and earn special abilities which are all tracked on this mat.

The game involves the player reading a scenario in the Cult book and then performing one of the tests on the page by rolling the number of dice equal to the abilities in the test. For example: Let's say that you are on a page that has you testing AGILITY and PERCEPTION. You would look at your mat and see that you have 2 PERCEPTION and 3 AGILITY. You would roll 5 dice and try to gain enough of each symbol to match the test's requirement. Let us assume that the test says AGILITY:2 and PERCEPTION:1. With your 5 dice, you would have to roll 2 AGILITY symbols and 1 PERCEPTION symbol. You do get to reroll your dice twice for a total of 3 rolls (unless an ability or card states otherwise) but you may not reroll the AUTO-FAIL dice.

The game ends when the players reach one of the different endings. Will you escape the Cult or will you fall into the cold embrace of death?
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Magmeda Monsters
description:
Magmeda Monsters is a strategic card game for two players. The game is set in the mysterious galaxy Magmeda where war is brewing — and it's up to you to decide its fate. Play the evil Oppression Deck to divide and conquer, or play the Liberation Deck to free Magmeda from the spreading darkness.

The game is played best of three rounds. The goal in each round is to knock out all six of your opponent's monster cards before they knock out yours. Use your monsters' magic and abilities wisely, along with your powerful skill cards, to crush your opponent's forces.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Math, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: FN BS: The Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

FN BS is a micro card game based on the seven deadly sins and Truth, also known as Veritas. It's a game filled with deception, perseverance, and strategy. Sin players compete to survive by collecting resources, using their sin powers, and eliminating other players. But Sin players must watch out for the Veritas player, who will try to convert them into fellow allies. The twist: players can lie about what sins they possess. A player literally calls "FN BS" when he or she thinks someone is lying.

It takes 5 minutes to learn, 20 minutes to play, and made for 2-6 players.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Religious
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Memory, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Zebulon: Galactic Control
description: Zebulon: Galactic Control is a space themed strategic board game that allows you to create a new layout every time you play using 40 planets on 20 tiles. Complete missions, lay traps and confront other players in battle. Players race around the map by purchasing fuel en route to completing missions. When you finish a mission pick up rewards and upgrade your ship. Use reward cards to attack your foe or help you win the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Ember: Light and Dark – Spectral Pack
description:
LIGHT AND DARK is a pair of expansions that supercharge your game with twenty new cards across two exciting packs - each packed with game-changing mechanics. There's a lot to deal with in Light and Dark!

The Spectral Pack introduces ten creature cards that curse and hinder your enemies with dark magic. Conjure these creatures and steal the Victory Points for yourself, while the cards curse your enemies with powers that range from stripping the cards in their hand to making their creatures weaker. Beware, for what you reap so may you sew, for the owner can choose to Conjure the creature in their turn and send it right back at you!

Spectral cards are creatures of shadow and gloom. They are cursed and bring only darkness to whoever controls them...

The Spectral cards are the powers of evil, of darkness and malevolence. These ten cards will give you the power to strip your opponents of their abilities, to force players to discard valuable cards, and to reduce the VP of their own creatures.

And then you have Sinistra, the Elemental Dragon God of Shadow. Her trio of powers are alone formidable, but when combined, she can affect all opponents with her powers every turn. Now that's nasty! Sinistra is definitely a game changer...

Contains:
6 Creature cards
1 Artifact card
1 Three-part Dragon
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Hostile Takeover
description:
Hostile Takeover is a strategic game for two players. You are a shareholder of a company and you can move executives, managers and workers. The aim of the game is to make the workers of your opponent yours.

The game is played on a 7x7 tile grid. Each player begins with eleven workers (large sized disks), seven managers (medium sized disks) and four executives (small sized disks). Pieces can move independently but managers must always be place on top of a worker and executives must always be placed on top of a manager. The color of the disk on top determines which player owns the piece; the size of the lowest disk moved determines the possible move. Workers move one space orthogonally, managers move one space diagonally, and executives can move one space in any direction.

The first player to control six of the opponent's workers, while still controlling six of their own, controls more than half of the workers on the board and has pulled off a "hostile takeover".

The game comes with some extra or specially marked components allowing for more different games to be played with the same set.

name: Dragon and Rider
description:
Description from the publisher:

Dragon and Rider is a team-based fighting game where you and a partner will take on the rolls of a dragon and rider and must work together to counter your opponent's moves and take back the skies.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Prisoner's Dilemma, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Ninja Scroll
description:
Let's have a Ninja duel!
To complete your secret mission, you have to use Japanese concealed weapons and clash with the enemy.

Game Play
1. Choose a Throwing Star or a Kunai Knife token in front of yours secretly.
2. Play the token as if you are a ninja throwing a throwing star, and reveal your token on the Scroll at the same time.
3. Succeeds according to the following principles:
(a) The one with the bigger number wins.
(b) 1 surpasses 5.
(c) If both numbers are the same, the aggressor wins.
4. Deal damage and change the aggressor to whom took damage.

You can take back the tokens you have played before to make yourself more choices.
Also you can keep the tokens aside to empower your ultimate attack!

Don’t forget there are some school advantages like Iga, Koga, Nokizaru and Fuma you can learn.
Defeat the rival ninja and win the Ninja Scroll !

name: Baroque: Europe at War 1550-1700
description:
Baroque is a set of wargames rules, based on the Impetus system.

The rules allow you to play with miniatures the wars that ravaged Europe from the mid XVI Cent to the end of the XVII Cent.

The book includes game rules for field battles (with examples and diagrams) and
7 army lists to start play immediately:


German Catholics (1618-32)
Swedish (1630-34)
ECW Royalist (1642-43)
ECW Parlamentarian (1642-44)
Ottoman Turks (1645-1700)
Later Imperialist (1648-1700)
Later Polish (1632-1700)


Description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Biome Builder
description:
In Biome Builder, your mission as an ecologist in training is to build a food chain from plants to apex predators- think algae to great white shark in the ocean. A biome is a community of plants and animals unique to a habitat. In this game you have 4 different habitats in which you start building a biome: the Amazon Rainforest, the Sahara Desert, the Pacific Ocean, and the American Prairie. Each player creates food chains (biomes) in four different environments and banks their biomes for points.

Cards come in four suits (biomes). Each suit has multiple cards numbered one through five. The players manage hands of five cards and have access to a central market of five face-up cards. Players may build two biomes at one time in their play area by playing cards of each biome on top of one another, with each succeeding card greater in value than the prior one, as in Lost Cities. Players also may trade with the market and discard action cards, taking as many actions on their turns as they have cards for. Hands are replenished at turn’s end. A biome of at least three cards may be “banked” at any time, making room in the player’s play area for a new biome to begin. Play continues until the deck runs out. Players then add up the values of the cards in their banked biomes and collect a 10-point bonus for each biome that used all numbers 1 through 5.

After going through the entire deck the player with the highest set of banked biomes wins.

Winner of Gold Medal from International Serious Play 2018
2018 Seal of Approval from the National Parenting Center
Best Family Game at 2017 Boston Festival of Independent Games

name: Shadow Tactics: The Board Game
description:
The new Shogun seized power over Japan, bringing peace to the land. However, harmony is a fragile concept, so to silence the voices of conspiracy and capture the dreaded warlord Kage-Sama, the Shogun recruits a few remarkable individuals, who specialize in deception, assassination and sabotage.

Take control of 5 unique characters with vastly different skill sets and fight your way through the forces of the Daimyo, who relies on superior numbers of soldiers and samurai. Hide in bushes and sneak in the shadows as you try to infiltrate enemy camps and castles. Utilize your special skills, lure your enemies into traps and deceive the guards so your friends can swiftly penetrate defenses and deal with the leaders of the rebellion.

But on the other side of the table sits the Daimyo, who is prepared for all your moves and gets new abilities gradually as you move toward your target. Every mission comes with different maps and objectives, so you have to adapt your tactics according to the situation.

Highlights


5 unique ninja characters, plus several Daimyos(villains) and guards, each with their own plastic miniatures
Engaging story-based episodes: play through multiple missions, complete achievements and collect bonuses. Your actions will have consequences in future missions!
Tactical stealth gameplay and character abilities based on the acclaimed Shadow Tactics video game.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Modular Board, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Fantasy Battle Rules (Second Edition)
description:
This is the second edition of very popular Warhammer Fantasy Battles wargame, released shortly after the first edition.

Warhammer Fantasy Battles is a tabletop game for two or more players where you command several armies from a huge range that goes from Humans, Dwarves, Elves, Undead, Orcs, Lizardmen, and other fantasy races. This starter set provides you with all the rules you need to play, a core for two armies, and guides you through collecting and painting your own army of Citadel miniatures.

This edition consists of three books: Combat, Magic, and Battle Bestiary.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Ravening Hordes
description:
Ravening Hordes is a complete set of 15 army lists for the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles, that allows to use existing armies (from the 4th, and 5th edition) in the new version of the game.

Armies in the 32-page booklet: Orcs & Goblins, Empire, Daemon Hosts, Chaos Warriors, Beastmen, Skaven, Tomb Kings of Khemri, Vampire Counts, Dwarfs, Lizardmen, High Elves, Wood Elves, Dark Elves, Bretonnians, Chaos Dwarfs.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Storm Over Dublin
description:
On Easter Monday, 24th April 1916, the Irish Volunteer Force, Cumann na mBan, Fianna na hÉireann and Irish Citizen Army gathered at their mustering points across Dublin. 1,200 men, women and boy scouts seized control of the city centre, and at noon Patrick Pearce stood on the steps of the GPO and proclaimed the Irish Republic to a stunned crowd. Hopes that the British would be too preoccupied on the Western Front to deal with Ireland were soon dashed. Troops flooded in from Athlone, Belfast, the Curragh and Liverpool. The Rebels were outnumbered by ten to one, but held out for a week as Dublin was reduced to rubble.

The Irish War of Independence (1919-21) ended with the partition of Ireland into North and South. This was accepted by the Provisional Government led by Mike Collins, but rejected by the IRA who wanted to unite all of Ireland in a Republic. Collins was given artillery by the British Army, surrounded the IRA HQ at the Four Courts and fired the first shots of the Irish Civil War on 28th June 1922. The Four Courts fell two days later, but it took another week to drive the IRA out of Dublin.

Storm Over Dublin is an Area/Impulse game of the 1916 Easter Rising and 1922 Battle of Dublin. The Rebel Player must seize strategic buildings across Dublin and hold them against the odds. The Government Player must take back control of the city block by block, using cavalry, infantry, artillery, gunboats, bombers, tanks, and armoured cars, even if the city is reduced to ruins. Each side earns victory points for controlling areas and capturing enemy Leaders and Units. The Government Player needs a substantive lead as the rebels are court-martialled at the end of the game, and their martyrdom may sway the public opinion and give them victory.

—description from the designer
categories: Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Codenames: Malaysia Edition
description:
This Malaysia Edition is a new localised edition of the game with all the base cards plus 2 Bonus Packs which contain 20 double-sided cards with 40 unique words based on Malaysian culture and lingo.

Bonus Pack - Malaysia #1:

Nasi Lemak / Wayang Kulit
Angpau / Durian
Congkak / Mosque
Mamak / Baju Kurung
Batik / Bukit Bintang
Borneo / Pewter
Orangutan / Pasar Malam
Wau / Roti Canai
Malaysia / Badminton
Nyonya / Rafflesia


Bonus Pack - Malaysia #2:

Laksa / Rainforest
Coconut / Kek Lok Si
Kuala Lumpur / Teh Tarik
Indian / Twin Towers
Kinabalu / Chinese
Silat / Batu Cave
Satay / Bomoh
Warung / Cheongsam
Malay / Char Keow Teow
Sari / Kopitiam
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Table Battles: C3i #32 Scenarios
description: Two new scenarios for Table Battles: Battle of Gaines Mill (one of the Seven Days Battles from the American Civil War) and Battle of the Bouvines (a decisive victory for France's Philip Augustus against the Holy Roman Empire in the early thirteenth century). Includes 9 (two-sided) cards representing the units for each battle.
categories: American Civil War, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Wargame

name: MacArthur's Defeat: The Battle For Luzon
description:
MacArthur's defeat is a simulation of the Japanese invasion of the Philippines from December 1941 to May 1942. Designed for two player but easily played solo, the game covers land and air operations, abstracting naval operations.

Units are primarily regiments with some battalions. Artillery battalions are represented in a semi-abstract manner. Air units are at group (for the Japanese) and squadron (United States and Commonwealth of the Philippines) level. Tank units can be massed together or broken down in company sized units and assigned to support infantry divisions.

Japanese surprise, B-17s, Bataan, Corregidor, and other key elements of the campaign are all included.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Pictomania (Second Edition): Bonus Cards – Pop Culture / Geek
description:
18 thematical cards of various difficulty from movies, TV shows, gaming, music and more.

The cards are different from those found in Pictomania: Geek Edition
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: Battle of the Bards: Taverns Pack
description: A fixed (non-random) foil pack of Taverns with rules on how to add them to your Battle of the Bards game. Contains 15 Tavern cards and 1 rules card.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Music
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Epic PVP: JRPG promo
description:
This set of 3 cards was sent to previous supporters of 'Fun to 11' games. The cards are for use in the Epic PVP series of games but feature art from the company's new game, "The JRPG Tabletop Adventure Game."
—user summary

To use your free promo cards in an Epic PvP game, have each player shuffles (sic) 1 random promo card into their deck before set-up.

The cards are:

JRPG: TAG Heroes
JRPG: TAG Slime
Fun to 11


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Trivial Pursuit: Dragon Ball Z
description:
Remove the packaging from the cards. Place the cards in the holder with the question side facing forward. Choose a player to go first. Play then continues clockwise.
Roll the die to decide a category color.
Another player takes the front card and reads you the question from that category.
If you answer correctly the card goes to the back of the deck. Roll the die again to go for a "Wedge" question.
This time if you answer the question correctly keep the card in front of you.
To win another card you must correctly answer a question on a new card, then correctly answer a "Wedge" question on the next card.
Keep going until you get an answer wrong. This ends your turn.

The first player to collect six cards wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Jogakbo
description:
In Jogakbo, a.k.a. 조각보 (Korean for "patchwork"), you are a member of the Seolbo Artisan Group — "설" (seol) referring to both harmony and a piece of silk — and your group has been challenged to assemble a beautiful quilt from whatever silk pieces they have available in their shops. Who will create the most harmonious quilt that satisfies the client's demands?

To set up, each player receives their own 8x8 game board, playing on either the easy or normal side of the board. The board features a 2x2 central space as well as a number of holes and spots for ornamentation. You lay out two main order cards and one secondary order card at random, along with 5-9 pieces of silk cloth in the four colors, adjusting the quantity based on the player count. Additionally, you have high-quality silk patches that cover either a 1x1 or 2x1 space, with these pieces being of a fifth and sixth color. Place one piece of silk of the main four colors on the matching spaces on the market board. Give each player three coins, with the start player taking an additional coin.

On a turn, you can either move the token on the market board to a different color and take the silk piece and any coins from this space, or pay 2 coins to choose any silk piece from the main four colors, whether from the market board or in the reserves. (The start player can place the token on any of the four colors on the first turn.) You then place the silk on your board. Your first piece must cover at least one square in the center of your game board; each subsequent piece must lie orthogonally adjacent to a piece already on your board, and pieces of the same color cannot be adjacent to one another!

If you cover an ornament space on your board, you can pay a coin to take a high-quality silk piece and place it on your board. If you cover another ornament space, you can do this again. To end your turn, (if needed) choose a silk piece from the reserve of the same color that you took and place it on the market board, then place a coin from the bank on any market space that doesn't have the token in it.

Whenever you achieve a secondary order during play, such as covering a hole with high-quality silk or placing a second piece of the same shape, you receive a bonus immediately.

After eight rounds, the game ends. You receive a bonus based on how well you completed the main orders, such as creating a silk-filled square or filling the diagonals of your board. Additionally, each filled vertical or horizontal line is worth 3 points, each uncovered ornament 1 point, each hole -1 point, and each coin 1 point as long as you have at least three coins. Whoever has the highest score wins.

name: Houses Of Knowledge
description:
In Houses Of Knowledge, players take the roles of curators trying to build the most diverse and impressive museum possible. But beware, as museum curation is a cut throat world, and your competitors will not hesitate to steal items from your museum to place it in theirs, disrupt the market to get better prices, or use talented PRs to raise their revenue.

Houses Of Knowledge is a collection game tasking players with placing items in thematic rooms in their museums. The first player to reach eight or more items on display will trigger the end game condition, as long as items or action cards are still available. Items on display bring more revenue which is used to buy rooms, more items, but also action cards.
Action cards take the shape of different characters.Each of them offer different perks, such as protecting your museum, reorganising the market or stealing cards from your opponents' hand.

Houses Of Knowledge relies on the capacity of the players to use the different actions efficiently in potentially huge combinations of cards synergies during their turn, while trying to prevent other players to do the same.

—description from the publisher

name: Solitaire WW2 Wargames: Three Strategy Card Games
description:
Solitaire WW2 Wargames: Three Strategy Card Games is vol. 3 in the Minden Classics series.

It is a 48-page illustrated book containing three strategy card games originally appearing in issues of Panzer Digest magazine.
Stringbag lets you fly Fairey Swordfish torpedo bombers against axis warships.
Sniper Attack puts you in the role of a sniper, trying to pick off high value targets while remaining undiscovered.
Penal Battalion is a quick abstract game on an off-beat topic: mine clearing.

All three are solitaire games on World War Two topics, and are highly playable with excellent reply value.
All you supply is a standard deck of playing cards, and you will be ready to go.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Card Game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Adeptus Astartes – Space Marines
description:
Codex: Space Marines is an expansion book for the Adeptus Astartes army in the 8th Edition of Warhammer 40,000.

This book contains everything needed to get a Space Marines army ready for war! A huge collection of rules content is within:

85 datasheets covering the entire Space Marines range – including the Primaris Space Marines

Points values for all miniatures, weapons and wargear for use in Matched Play games

Army abilities and wargear lists, alongside a brief explanation of their use and the use of keywords

Rules profiles for every piece of wargear and every weapon in the Space Marines’ arsenal

Rules for Battle-forged armies, including abilities for Space Marines armies and specific Chapter Tactics for Ultramarines, White Scars, Imperial Fists, Black Templars, Salamanders, Raven Guard and Iron Hands Chapters, reflecting their unique fighting styles

26 Stratagems for Battle-forged armies, reflecting the varied tactics used by Space Marines commanders on the battlefield

6 Warlord Traits, for use with any Space Marine Warlord, with Chapter-specific Warlord traits for Ultramarines, White Scars, Imperial Fists, Crimson Fists, Black Templars, Salamanders, Raven Guard and Iron Hands

Chapter Relics: special weapons and wargear wielded in battle by Space Marines characters

the Librarius psychic discipline: 6 psychic abilities for use by Space Marines Librarians

6 Tactical Objectives for use by Space Marines armies.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Sideshow Swap!: Shenanigans
description:
Add even MORE chaos to the 'Show! New performers with unique abilities have been hired that will keep the surprises coming even after the 'Show ends! If that wasn't enough, Shenanigans tickets spice things up by giving players new options to disrupt the game - like making other player's perform for free, looking at other player's hands, swapping with out of play performers and a whole lot more! Get your hot little hands on this expansion or your friends will make fun of you!

Sideshow Shenanigans includes:
• 2 Shenanigans Performers
• 20 Shenanigans Tickets
• 4 Now Playing! Shenanigans Tickets
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Poule Poule: Are you Easter?
description: The motion picture is going on with new actors: the Easter Egg, Chocotte the chocolate hen, Bunny Pinpin, the Easter Bunny.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Party Game

name: Caribbean Storm: Honduras 2009
description:
Caribbean Storm: Honduras 2009 is a simulation of a hypothetical conflict based on the constitutional crisis in Honduras in 2009. The Honduran army has removed President Manuel Zelaya by coup d’état and Venezuela, with Cuban and Nicaraguan political and military support, has decided to restore him by force. Signs of an impending attack have alerted the Honduran military. A grand tactical game of modern-era conflict, Caribbean Storm is played by two players or it can be played solitaire.

Game components consist of the following items. Note that Honduran units have a blue background and Venezuelan units have a yellow background.

—description from the publisher

name: Monkeelaus: En la búsqueda del Piojo Dorado
description:
In the Jadu Jungle live The Monkeelaus, a gang of Pipiopos monkeys who are fans of adventures, fruits and parties. Paala is one of them and she will be having a birthday soon. Her friends want her to have an unforgettable birthday party.

The best gift in the whole jungle is a tasty golden louse, but the only way to get one is to venture deep into the jungle and get to where a grumpy Giant Gorilla lives.

Fortunately, the jungle is full of friendly animals that will help the Monkeelaus on their tasty jungle adventure.

Monkeelaus – En la búsqueda del Piojo Dorado ("Monkeelaus in the quest of the golden louse") is a collaborative game that is played in two chapters: Paala's birthday and The best gift in the world.

Paala's birthday is a group challenge game. Players must overcome entertaining and crazy jungle challenges to get 5 pieces of cake, before 4 banana peels come out.
The best gift in the world is a strategy game. Players must get fruits in the jungle to exchange the Gorilla for one of its coveted golden lice and take it to Paala before time or fruit runs out.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Resource to Move, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bar Fight the Card Game
description:
In Bar Fight, you represent a bar competing in the world's most prestigious bartending competition. Each bar has it's own unique bonus ability, and signature and classic cocktails that can boost your score.

Each round you'll make a drink by combining Spirit, Mixer, and Flair cards in order to impress the specific Judge for the round. Different ingredients have various effects on each other, and the Judges have their own preferences, so there are countless ways to make a great drink. Judge cards are revealed three rounds in advance, so players must both impress the current Judge but also plan ahead for future rounds.

The highest scoring drink of the round wins that round's Judge Card, worth a number of Prize Ribbons, and the first player to get enough Ribbons wins the title of Bar Fight Champion!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Role Playing, Score-and-Reset Game, Trick-taking

name: Great War at Sea: Jutland – Viribus Unitis
description:
Our 35th issue features Austro-Hungarian battleships, the proud fleet flagship Viribus Unitis and her sisters, the projected Ersatz Monarch class-dreadnoughts that would have followed them, and the Radetzky-class semi-dreadnoughts that came before them.

Golden Journal No. 35: Viribus Unitis has 20 new die-cut and silky-smooth playing pieces, with all of those variant dreadnoughts and semi-dreadnoughts for your gaming pleasure, plus additional scenarios for Jutland and Wine-Dark Sea so you can play with them.

-description from publisher's website

name: Card Tactics
description:
One day, a Dragon from a faraway place made nest in our land. Chaos soon followed. Danger everywhere. A trio of heroes fought their way through unspeakable dangers to face the creature atop its mountain in a selfless effort to free the land from this menace.

Card Tactics is a pocket-sized tactical combat solo card game taking place in a gritty fantasy setting inspired by Tabletop RPGs, Fighting Fantasy books and unforgiving video games.

Win five increasingly-difficult combats using chosen heroes. Items and events will add options and unexpected challenges.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Critical Hits and Failures, Events, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Slide/Push, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Parole in Mente
description:
Draw a category and compose a themed word ... but be careful: you only win if you form the longest word and use the least used letters.

Players draw 5 letter tiles per color from the dealer (5 blue, 5 green and 5 red, in total 15). The current player draws a category map. All the players at this point must form, with the available letters, a word that belongs to the extracted category.
When one of the contestants thinks he has formed a correct word, he counts up to 15 and at that point the game stops and points are calculated. It then continues with a new heat.

At each new round each competitor can decide to draw a new letter, but he must discard one of the same color (putting it back in the middle). The game always continues in the same way: the winner is whoever reaches 50 points (or more, or less, at the choice of the players).
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Código Ergo Sum
description:
Código Ergo Sum is a game in which strategy and chance complement each other throughout the game. Each face on the side represents a reference to write on the game sheet, with the aim of establishing a code consisting only of 0 and 1 and thus help Oliver Cazz, the greatest hacker in history.


Players roll dice to generate a code consisting of 1's and 0's that matches the master code chosen at the beginning of the game.

You may choose freely where to start and continue freely across the grid, always respecting the indicated reference and using only empty spaces.

The grid must be completed turn after turn with 0 and 1, until you cannot fulfill the referenced shape indicated by the dice.

Players who match the code exactly win; otherwise points are given for the closest matching code.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters – Isabel's Story
description:
Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters is a story about two time travelers - Isabel and Kira - partners who have explored the farthest reaches of time, from ancient dynasties to the birth of the dinosaurs, and even the distant future. But disaster struck on their latest adventure, splitting their time machine in two and marooning them each in a different place and time!

In Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters - Isabel's Story, you take the role of Isabel as she works to repair her half of the time machine and hopefully reconnect with Kira before she is lost forever.

Just like all of the Escape Room in a Box games, the puzzles in Isabel's Story are non-linear, meaning there is always something for everyone to do - just like a real life escape room.

Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters - Isabel's Story can be combined with Escape Room in a Box: Time Drifters - Kira's Story to unlock a special bonus game, designed to be played remotely via video chat, that allows you to experience the final chapter in their story. Players from both groups will have to work together, share notes, collaborate on puzzles, and hopefully to reunite the two wayward time travelers.

name: Buscadores de Dino
description:
Dinosaur fans: Attention! In this game, a group of adventurous friends go out in search of dinos. Armed with fantasy and much joy, they immerse themselves in a world of colors.

Both dice are rolled and all players must look for the card that meets the conditions shown on the dice. Whoever finds the correct card first keeps it. Whoever has the most cards at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Matching, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Race

name: Widderkopf
description:
A Sheepshead-like game for 2 players.

Seventeen tricks are played each hand; certain cards are worth certain points; the main object of the hand is to capture 61+ points.

With Cracking, Recracking, Schneidering, and Schwartzing, the game value can progress from as low as a single measly point for an entire hand of play, or as much as 64(!) points for the same hand (if both players are doubling fools).

name: SHASN: Kickstarter Add-On Pack
description:
Includes:

1 2-piece resource box
1 Edge of Chaos board
1 punch board for Home Turf, movable Volatile Zone, and IOU tokens
1 scenario book
1 SHASN comic book
13 Elite cards
12 Cost of Victory cards
5 drawstring bags for voter pegs

These items were not included with the retail version of the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Resource Queue, Trading, Voting

name: Tether
description:
Astronauts love floating in space, but not all by themselves. Tether them together so they don't drift through the galaxy alone.

Each card in Tether has a two-digit number in the top corner, and when you rotate the card 180 degrees, the number in the opposite corner has the same two digits, but the positions are swapped. For instance the card with a 68 in one corner has 86 in the opposite corner. Opponents sit across the table from each other, which means that when you play a card each player sees a different number.

You can connect astronauts together if they have consecutive numbers. One player (or team) connects astronauts together horizontally on the table and the other connects them vertically. Since each side sees a different number and connects in a different direction, but is playing with the same astronauts, you have an asymmetric puzzle with a lot of interaction between players.

—description from the designer

name: Hunt A Killer: Mallory Rock
description:
When Beth Ferris-Hendricks’s death is declared an accident in the small town of Mallory Rock, Maine, her sister Gwen sets out to prove Beth was murdered. Gwen, having grown up on the New England island, must investigate the residents she has known all of her life.

To catch the killer, Gwen will need your help to expose her hometown and uncover the secrets that exist on Mallory Rock.

Difficulty: 3/5
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Star Wars: The Mandalorian – La busqueda
description: Grogu has been kidnapped and hidden in a secret location within the town of Nevarro. Players will use Mando, Moff Gideon, Ahsoka, Bo Katan, IG-11, or a Dark Trooper to find Grogu. Throughout the board they will find objects that will help them fulfill their mission. However, during the search, players must fight each other, so strategy will be essential to find Grogu while fighting to survive. The player who manages to take Grogu with him and flee from the town of Nevarro will be the winner.

name: Outrageous
description:
Creativity Wins!: Outrageous is a hot new party game, where players use their creativity to come up with witty, unique, & hilarious answers to modern-day prompts. Laugh all night long with witty answer prompts. Ex: "I'd hide if ___ showed up at my door." "They should sell ____ in vending machines."
How to Play: Designated judge picks a card & reads aloud. Players write their answers on a sheet & place into box. Answers are read by judge & points are awarded based on best answers. Most points wins!

Adaptable: Outrageous is great for any groups, parties, or birthdays. Depending on participants, games can be family friendly, wild, or "adults only". Inspiration play make the perfect card games for families on game night. Everyone can be OUTRAGEOUS!

Fun for the Family: Recommended for 4-8 players, 13 Years and up. More players can play with additional pencils. You will have the best games with your friends and family.
Game Play: Takes just 5 mins to learn. Each game lasts approximately 30 mins. Play a short round or all night long!

COMES WITH: 220 prompt cards, answer pad, 8 pencils, and instruction booklet

name: Fruits
description:
Fruits is no ordinary card game. This juicy twist on fast-paced favorites like Uno and Gin Rummy is chock-full of cheerful claymation art and surprising disruptors to keep you on your toes.

Players will encounter ten types of personality-packed Fruits cards of varying point values and must harvest “bunches” of three or more fruits to earn points. Along the way, action cards will come into play, either multiplying players’ successes or thwarting their efforts to gather the most fruit; for example: a pie card can double the total value of a bunch, but a grabber card gives an opponent the chance to steal a card—and all of its potential points—from another player’s hand.

Gameplay continues until one lucky fruit collector accumulates a thousand points and wins the game! Hope you’ve been eating your fruits, because Fruits requires a dash of luck, a little strategy, and a whole lot of zest.

—description from the publisher

name: MAUGA
description:
A lo largo de la historia son muchas las expediciones arqueológicas que se han adentrado en lo más profundo de Mauga, la montaña que, según la leyenda, salvaguarda el mayor tesoro jamás encontrado. Tras mucho tiempo sin intentarlo, 4 grupos de especialistas en arqueología están dispuestos a hallar el paradero del tesoro, algo que acabaría con la leyenda y los convertiría en responsables de uno de los mayores descubrimientos de la historia de la arqueología. ¿Será vuestra expedición la que lo consiga? Pues estad muy atentos porque el espíritu de Mauga no os lo pondrá nada fácil...

Throughout history, many archaeological expeditions have ventured into the deepest depths of Mauga, the mountain which, according to the legend, guards the biggest treasure ever found. After a long time with no attempts, 4 archaeologists are ready to seek the whereabouts of the treasure, something that would put an end to the legend and give them the credit for one of the greatest discoveries in the history of archaeology. Will yours be the expedition that achieves it? Well, be very careful, because the spirit of Mauga won’t make it easy for you...
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hidden Movement, Memory, Point to Point Movement

name: Noodlin'
description:
Noodling is a form of hand fishing for catfish that requires a person to stick their hand into a submerged hole, a place where catfish often lie, and wiggle their fingers in hopes that a fish bites onto their hand.

This card game captures that theme with rounds of hidden bids that each player can opt to try push luck on their own in a fishing hole or potentially team up with a partner just in case they land a huge one that they need help with! There is always the risk that you find a monster catfish that you are unable to bring in on your own and causes you to lose some of your previous catch.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Zen Battle
description:
Survival of the Chilliest

You don't need to know your Chakra from your Barista to have a blast in this quick-to-learn card game. Try to keep your calm and this chill race to become a Zen Master!

Players compete to transcend first by aligning their chakra cards from #1 to #7 with a Mastery card on top. The first player to transcend 4 times wins the game! Want to prove you're the most chill? Be the first to transcend all seven levels and become the ultimate master of Zen Battle.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game

name: Grow Up!
description:
In this family strategy game by Londji you must tend your vegetable garden, making the right decisions to ensure the best harvest.

Test your strategy, decision-making and cooperation skills as you plant seeds and raise herbs and veggies.

Whoever harvests the most fruits and veggies wins.

Game in brief:

Move the weather forecast: slide the weather cards & change the weather
Work in the garden: plant seeds, make the plants grow, make the fruits sprout
Harvest the vegetable garden: collect fruit tokens converting to money & points; store harvested vegetables
Open the farm shop: buy new vegetables or improvements
Deal with ongoing calamities/pests: play pest control cards
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, End Game Bonuses, Events, Resource Queue, Turn Order: Progressive, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Something Wild! Jurassic Park
description:
Something Wild is a line of card games featuring beloved characters and collectible Pop! pocket figures. Play numbered and colored character cards to make sets and runs. The first player to score three powers wins the game.

With Something Wild: Jurassic Park, you can score a set to snag the special power of a tiny T. Rex. Combine Character Cards in sets and runs to score points, just like in Rummy. Use Power Cards to add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay.

Combine multiple Something Wild! games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to your game!
