categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: Carcassonne: 3D Starting Landscape
description:
With this starting landscape and its 15 tile holders you can store your tiles from the Carcassonne mini expansions in an orderly manner. You can use the 15 tile holders individually as dividers and remove each tile holder with its tiles individually.

The 3D starting landscape replaces the starting tile or the starting tableau.

—description from the publisher

Place the landscape on the edge of the Table. So you don‘t place tiles behind the starting landscape during the game and everyone can see all the land tiles without restrictions.
Place the empty box with the open side down on the table.
Now you see a small gap on each of the long sides of the box. Put the castle panorama into one of these gaps. Make sure that the panorama is between two layers of paper and that the illustration is facing the bottom of the box.

—user summary

name: Monsterhunger!
description:
Desperate creatures are lurking around the village. Can you feed them before they tear down the gate and wreak havoc?

Monsterhunger! is a co-operative game in which you must manage your resources and use them cleverly. The game includes different levels of difficulty and variants for the whole family.

name: Hidden Ark: Extinct in the Wild Expansion
description:
A expansion punchboard for Hidden Ark that adds a few extinct fish species and some extra tokens and the rules for the expansion in English, French, and German.

Place them faceup next to the game board during setup. During the game, players may spend a rescue action to bring the species back into the wild. You don't need to use your rescue vessel, but you need to meet the requirement on the tile of having previously saved a fish of the depicted color. The extinct in the wild fish tiles will give you 9 victory points at the end of the game and instead of a permanent bonus you immediately receive a facedown opportunity taken from the opportunity pool.

Shuffle the opportunity tokens with the rest. The opportunity tokens in this expansion introduces permanent upgrades. When installing them, you will get a permanent advantage no matter which action row you use. The effects do not stack.

name: Sangonera
description:
Sangonera is a card game that collects the most Valencian expressions from the hand of the most representative characters of each town and Mediterranean gastronomy.

Fill your bar with customers before your opponents to win the game. Cook them the best menus and attack the competition with the action cards full of the best known expressions.

name: もしも勇者がいるのなら (If You Have A Brave)
description:
Explore the exhilarating realms of the 2nd edition SATSUGAI card game, where the woes of unfortunate royalty are a distant memory. This edition has undergone a transformative evolution, refining the essence conceived in the inaugural release.

In this riveting game, the simplicity of choosing a card belies the urge to play repeatedly. The game introduces the formidable Arrored Royalty card, capable of disrupting everything in its path, countered only by the strategic "Another World Brave in Another World" card, creating a delicate balance in the SATUGAI universe. With the core of the gameplay centered around these two captivating cards, SATSUGAI becomes an engaging and unpredictable experience.

Dive into a diverse array of cards, each offering a blend of fun and, at times, chilling effects. The game invites players to immerse themselves in the joy of exploring "Another World," a dimension that unfolds with every card played. The excitement reaches new heights with the addition of the expansion card set, "Tilt Sitters," expanding the possibilities for thrilling gameplay.

Whether reveling in the basic set of cards or delving into the boundless combinations offered by the "Tilt Sitters" expansion, SATSUGAI beckons players to embark on an unlimited deployment of strategic prowess. Get ready to rewrite the rules of engagement and experience the sheer delight of the 2nd edition SATSUGAI card game.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management

name: Senedong
description:
The title of the game comes from the Korean words "Semo," "Nemo," and "Donggeurami": they mean triangles, squares, and circles.
Players must quickly determine if the symbol cards in their hand match the top card on the central pile, following the rule card. Playing a card correctly earns 1 point, while an incorrect card results in a deduction of 1 point. Success in this game relies on speed and concentration.

—description from the publisher

name: Rauf und runter
description:
In Rauf & Runter, the results of the dice determine the momentum with which a chicken climbs higher on the ladder. Too little momentum causes a standstill, and too much momentum causes a fall.

Glucki wants to get to the top of the chicken ladder, but so do other chickens. Soon there is a lot of cackling. To prevent all the hens from acting like the cock of the walk, the chicken yard staff determines the chicken with the best chance of climbing the ladder every day, and Glucki's mates don't spend a lot of time bickering about it either. They take their flight to the top – in the form of five dice – in their own claws. High speed during the run-up provides momentum, but if you flap your wings too much, you will stumble down more rungs than up. It's much better for prudent hens, who sometimes also let off a few feathers, to achieve true top positions.

—description from the publisher

name: Scream or Die
description:
Cursed by a witch on Halloween Night, Scream or Die lets you and your friends take on the roles of up to 8 mischievous monsters as they compete for candy to lift the witch's curse.

Scream or Die is a dice game where you control the roll even when you aren't rolling! Each turn, one player randomly draws dice from a bag and rolls them, but all players can use Screams, the monster's currency, to affect the roll.

If you don't like the dice, add more. If you don't like the roll, shake it up!

At the end of the turn, collect your candy, collect your screams and pass the bag of dice to the next monster at the table. Scream or Die is for 2-8 players and last 15-25 minutes.

name: Tuo La Ji
description:
This game is known in Chinese as tuo la ji (拖拉机) (meaning 'tractor') or bashi fen (八十分) (meaning '80 points'). It is an expanded version of sishi fen ('40 points') using two or more decks, and is related to zhao pengyou ('looking for friends'). All these games are collectively known as Sheng1 Ji2 (升级), which means "raise level" or "promote". Tractor is widely popular in China, especially in Shanghai and south of the Yellow River where it has practically displaced the older single deck game.

The scores of the teams are expressed as card ranks. At the start of the game, each partnership has the lowest possible score, which is two. By winning games, a partnership can increase its score to a higher rank: three, four, five and so on. Above ten come jack, queen, king and ace. The objective is to achieve a score higher than ace - the partnership that achieves this wins the game.

In each hand, one team forms the declarers, sometimes known in Chinese as dang1 zhuang1 (当庄), and the other team forms the opponents. In the first hand, either team can be the declarers, depending on who makes trumps. In subsequent hands, the team that won the previous hand is the declarers, and the other team is the opponents.

One member of the declarers' team is the starter, who has the advantage of taking the last cards in the deal, discarding some cards, and leading the first trick. While the declarers try to increase their score, the opponents' objective is to take at least 80 card points, in which case they become the declarers for the next deal.

Source: edited from Pagat, http://www.pagat.com/kt5/tractor.html

name: BaristaCat
description:
BaristaCat is a fun, simple competitive family card game for 2-6 players.

Players assume the role of barista and compete against other players to claim feline customers by fulfilling coffee orders. Each round players collect ingredient cards that can be combined to create different drink orders. There is a ‘lobby’ of 8 customers waiting for their order, and each customer card displays the type and number of each ingredient needed to craft their drink. Each customer is worth a given dollar amount based on that customers’ order, which can vary in complexity and size, and this amount counts towards a player’s point total at game end. If a player has the required ingredients to fulfill a customer card on their turn they claim that customer towards their total score!

In addition to ingredient cards, players have the chance to draw special cards that may help them, or may disrupt the plans of their opponents. The game ends when any player has claimed a total of 10 customers, and the player with the highest customer points wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Kaiser's War in the East
description:
S&T 301, Sept-Oct 2016

Kaiser’s War in the East is a strategic level simulation of World War I on the Eastern Front, 1914-17. This is a two-player game; One player controls the Central Powers, the other player controls the Allies. The concept of “victory points” (VP) is central to play of game. Players begin each scenario with a designated number of VP. They gain new VP as a result of achieving objectives; they lose VP when they lose units in combat. They may expend them to gain reinforcements and carry out certain actions. To win the game you must have more VP than your opponent, so play is a balancing act between expending VP and attaining objectives.

name: Crozzit
description:
Similar to Hex, the players race to connect two opposite sides of the board. Each player has 30 small pieces, 1 long piece and 1 extralong piece.

Pieces can be stacked creating bridges, but cannot cross over an opponent piece.
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., Lúdilo, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Skipp
description:
The abstract strategy game Skipp is easy to learn, challenging to play. Each player has 7 tops and 14 bases.

The player who is the first to get a ‘top’ to the other side has won. But beware: tops may not touch the game board; they can only jump over bases of both players. Tops and bases each move in their own way. For example, tops may only move diagonally and empty bases may only go straight ahead. Tops may also capture each other (like checkers).

You may hinder your opponent by preventing movement. But be carefull your opponent will try to do the same.

Will you outsmart your opponent?

Choose the ‘Original’ game board (A) for a quick & intense game session or the ‘Extended’ game board (B) for a broad & strategic game session.

user summary

name: Tiers-Mondopoly
description:
Tiers-Mondopoly is an educational game about farming in the Third World. The players represent farmers from Peru. The goal of the game is to survive on the income of your own farm and, if possible, gain more prosperity.

Each game round represents one year in the life of the farmers. At the beginning of each year, every player chooses which crops he wants to grow on his fields. Then the climate is determined by a dice roll. Each climate has different effects on the yield of the crops.

On his turn, a player rolls a die and moves that number of spaces around the board. The players encounter different events that affect their farming business positively or negatively. Some events affect all players.

At the end of each year, each player calculates his profit or loss and the next round begins. After six rounds, the most profitable farmer wins.
publishers: Déclaration de Berne, Mastro Geppetto, Oxfam Wereldwinkels v.z.w.

name: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Kartenspiel – Sonderkarte 2006 – Emi'Ly, Bewahrerin der Harmonie
description:
This is a special card for the Siedler von Catan card game distributed in special fairs usually by mr. Klaus Teuber itself.
The card name is "Emi'Ly, Bewahrerin der Harmonie" what means "Emi'Ly, Keeper of Harmony".
The card text says: "You can re-roll once every of your income rolls. If you roll than one odd result you must pay one gold or take Emi'Ly back to your hand."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Stax
description:
Each player has thirteen hexagonal tiles, each of which has a unique arrangement of pointers to various edges. Tiles may be added to the playing area or moved in the direction of any of their pointers, possibly to stack on pieces of either colour which are then pinned. A player wins when the opponent's king (0-pointer) is captured.

Full rules: http://www.cameronius.com/games/stax

Several changes to the original rules have been applied during Nestorgames production process:

- 'Holed' tiles: So now it's allowed to pick up tiles with just 1 free side as you can insert one finger into the tile's hole. Moreover, you can see through the hole what's underneath (so you know which the hidden tiles are).

- New king: Now the king is the tile with no pointers. You cannot move your tiles unless your king is on the board. The king can move 1 space in any direction. The king is captured by removing it, so this prevents it from escaping by 'climbing'.

- The queen: The 6-pointer tile is the queen. The most powerful tile for attacking, but the weakest for defending!

- 3 player expansion: A 3rd set of tiles (blue) allows a 3rd player to play Stax.

name: Napoleon in Italy
description:
Napoleon in Italy is a simple two-player strategy game of maneuver and combat that simulates a portion of the campaign in November 1796 between the Austrians and the French in northern Italy. Players move their forces and have combat across the map in an effort to occupy key areas at the end of the game.

The game, published in Issue #3 (Spring 2008) of Panzer Digest, comes with a mapsheet, set of unit counters and markers, and rules (printed within the magazine). The map represents a portion of northern Italy where the original campaign was conducted. Movement on the map is regulated via a series of areas, usually representing towns. Areas that are connected by a line are adjacent to one another. There are no terrain effects in the game, and any one area is the same as any other, though some areas are designated with a star to represent victory areas.

French and Austrian units represent divisions, and each combat strength point represents approximately 1000 men. Units take losses in combat by marking off lost strength points from a unit roster. The overall commanders, Napoleon for the French and Alvinczy for the Austrians, are also represented by counters. Napoleon has a number of special benefits, to help balance the massive numerical advantage of the Austrian army.

Before the game begins, players bid the number of victory points they claim they can earn playing the Austrians, and the player with the highest bid must earn at least that many to win. Each turn represents three days of campaigning, and the game lasts six turns. Playing time is about 20 minutes solitaire, about 45-90 minutes against an opponant.

name: Deus Ex Machina: Mini Expansion
description:
This expansion for Deus Ex Machina includes:
The Olympian god Poseidon full set and Bellerofon hero card.

The Olympian god Ares full set and Penthesilea hero card.

1 new DI Card Deus Ex Machina and 3 new Objective Tiles.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Zoo Goal!
description:
Choose your team and challenge your opponent.
You will have 5 animal teams and lots of special cards for animated games that keep you on the edge of your seat!

Contents:
132 cards that include:

5 animal teams made up of 25 cards each. Most of the cards fall within the numerical range of 1 and 11, plus a possible special action. Some cards show a referee.
1 football pitch made up of 7 cards.


1 ball
12 goal counters

Choose your team and take your pack of 25 cards, then draw 3 cards.
Each player will have a covered card in front of them which must be turned over at exactly the same time that the opponent turns over theirs. The player with the highest card wins the tackle and moves the ball across to the next pitch card. Draw another card from your pile of cards and play again.

If the ball ends up on the pitch card with the penalty box and you win the tackle, the ball goes into the opponent’s goal and you score! Move the ball into a midfield position and start playing again.

On some cards there is a special action. Some examples: move the ball 3 cards forwards, stop the ball, beats 10 and 11.

When all the cards have run out, the first half of the match is over. The match finishes once the second half is over. The player with most goal wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time, Sports

name: The Big Fight
description:
A game for two players - bouts can be staged from 3 to 15 rounds. The Boxer with initiative plays a Punch Card which lands and scores unless the opponent can play an appropriate Defensive Card.

Points wins, Knock-Downs, Knockouts, Cuts, Referee Stops Fight are all possible and players can adjust their hands by changing cards to suit their round-by-round strategy. All cards have an Initiative Rating which determines who makes the next attack.

Card-playing skill required - quick playing and fun. Ideal for the corner of the pub, or bus or train journey!

name: ヴァルハラスカウト (Valhalla Scout)
description:
User summary
ヴァルハラスカウト (Valhalla Scout) (Baruhara Sukauto) is a Japanese card game, for 2 or 3 players, published in English and Japanese.

In the game of Valhalla Scout, players, as Gods in Heaven, scout for warriors for Ragnarok the final battle.

To win the game, players try to predict which faction is dominant in the winning force. There are two forces of warriors: those chosen by Gods and those forsaken. Normally the most powerful faction in the chosen force is dominant. However, the forsaken force prevails if they outnumber the chosen force in headcount, in which case the most powerful faction in the forsaken force is dominant.

Each player initially has four warrior cards, each of which has a color and strength value printed in its face. During your turn, you place one warrior card face-down on either force. One of the other players has two options: accept your decision, or refuse your decision and send the card to the opposite force face-up.

Each card has partial information about its identity printed on its back, and some cards have a special ability when refused. You should speculate about what card your opponent placed, and whether the opponent wants you to refuse.

The game ends when each player has one card in hand. Determine the dominating faction in the manner described above. The player who has the strongest card of the dominating faction wins the game.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは天界の神々となり、最終決戦《ラグナロク》に備えて屈強な戦士たちをスカウトしていくゲームです。最終的に合計値の大きい陣営（色）が勝つという単純明快なルールですが、相手の許可を尋ねる必要があるためそうは思い通りに行きません。
部分的に得られる情報から推理して詰めていく戦略的なゲームです。

name: I'd Eat That
description:
I'd Eat That is a story telling game that centers around everyone’s favorite cultural topic of food!

In this "game", you will use ingredient cards that have a wide range of foods and even preparation methods, which must be combined into a three course meal. You will then present one course at a time as a story, as wild or unique as you would like to make it, and all other participants will decide if they would eat it or not!

Originally designed for an interactive art exhibit in Tokyo that questioned what a game is, I’d Eat That was developed in Japan and later toured as a story collecting art project across Eastern Europe before being produced as a final product.

—description from the publisher's website

Every day we eat food. We have to consider creative combinations of ingredients, and what we feel like eating. Food is an adventure. It can mark rituals, and signify special gatherings. It can disgust us, intrigue us, taunt us, or bring us together. Can you craft a food adventure using only nine simple ingredients?

I'd Eat That is a new story telling game that will broaden your imagination, break the ice, and lead you on a wild culinary trip! Plus it comes in the shiniest box ever made.

—description from the designer

name: Dive: Goodies
description:
Three new companions to go diving with you!
The Axolotl, the Pufferfish and the Narwhal have their own abilities. Choose the right one to win the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Programmed Movement, Push Your Luck, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Give Me The Treasure
description:
After all the work is done, it's time for the bandits to split the treasures!
What do you say, "Let's get along and split the money"?
No, the bandit group's split is not a simple matter!
The bandits who want to get a little something for themselves will start splitting the money!

name: You Bet-Cha!
description:
You Bet-Cha! combines poker, trivia, chance and a race against the clock into an exciting game night! Lively categories will have you competing to name everything from members of the Detroit Bad Boys to Hotels on the Las Vegas Strip.

Don't bet off more than you can chew, or you'll be adding to your opponents' chip stack. An amusing mix of knowledge, quick thinking and betting strategy, You Bet-Cha!, is the perfect game for tabletop lovers, trivia enthusiasts and high rollers!

OBJECTIVE:

Be the player with the most chips after seven rounds

HOW TO PLAY:

-Ante up
-Roll the dice to determine category and type of game (live bet, silent bet or all play)
-Place your bets
-High bidder has one minute to give answers to subject
-Collect or surrender your chips
-Repeat!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Wreck Raiders: The Giant Clam
description: A Kickstarter exclusive mini-expansion for the game Wreck Raiders where you can collect pearls to add to your score.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: My First Escape Game: The Magical Forest
description: In the children's game My First Escape Game: The Magic Forest even the youngest children can become master puzzlers. Under the guidance of adult game masters, their task is to solve all the puzzles to help the little dragon Athi. They have 45 minutes to guide him back to his family and pass the test of the forest.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Black Day of the German Army 1918
description:
Division-Regiment level combat in World War I. The Allies must blast their way through the thinly-held German trench lines. Strafing airplanes, artillery barrages, and advancing tanks all help. The Germans must hold out, counterattacking only where necessary, and moving their regiments and divisions so as to block the Allies' advance until reinforcements arrive.

140 counters, 20 x 24 map, 12 pages of rules, chart.

Includes FULLER OFFENSIVE 1919.

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Hieracosphinx Expansion Pack
description: The Hieracosphinx Seti-Ram is the competitive prize for Month 4 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 七つの予言 (Seven Prophecies)
description:
Publisher's summary
七つの予言 (Nanatsu no Yogen) (Seven Prophecies) is a betting trick-taking card game.

Story
You can predict the future, the order whereby the cards are played. You thought that you'd never lose the game with such a skill, but it seems that all the players can predict the future likewise. Will you manage to make your prediction come true and win the future?

Overview
The players, using the cards dealt to them as their hands, play 7 to 10 units of mini-games, called tricks. Before starting the game, predict how many times you will come 1st, 2nd, and other places. The first player to make their prediction come true will score points.

More Detailed Overview
While in many betting trick-taking games, the players announce how many tricks they will win, in Seven Prophecies, the players must announce how many times they will come 1st, 2nd, and other places, like coming 1st twice, 2nd once, 3rd once, and 4th three times.

Does it sound too difficult? Not at all!
Because you "know the future!"
Before you start the game, you know the lead suits of all the tricks (what color cards to be played), so compare them with your hand and announce with which cards you're likely to win.

However, note that other players can also predict the future and thus have acquired the same information. Try to also read other players' thoughts and predict which places you will come.

name: Orcs on the Horizon
description:
Orcs on the Horizon pits you against an onrush of Orc hordes. Mine silver to pay for upgrades to your archers, knights, and fortress while the hordes march towards you. Build up your archers to take out the orcs before they make it to your fortress. Or, build up the defenses of your fortress to deal with the orcs that do get there. Or, build up your knights to battle the orcs that make it into your fortress. Do a little of each, or all of one, or some other combination to defeat the orc horde.

Orcs on the Horizon is a solo, one card, adventurous, dice based combat game played in two phases. In phase 1, as Orc hordes march towards your fortress, mine silver to purchase upgrades to your Archers, Knights, or Fortress. Archers can attack Orcs around the midpoint of their march towards your fortress. Once the Orcs reach your fortress, flip the card and begin phase 2. In phase 2, Archers aren't used, only Knights and the defenses of your fortress. Battle the Orcs to the death to win the game.

The game was created for the 2020 1 Card Print and Play Design Contest.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Print & Play

name: ژاندارمری (Gendarmery)
description:
A new criminal case has complicated everything, and the Chief has ordered you and your fellow police officers to solve it ASAP and arrest the main culprit. You must collect evidence in order to make arrests, whether you intend to capture the leader or another suspect.

To set up ژاندارمری (Gendarmery), create a "wall" of suspect cards in a 3x3 grid that leaves the center empty. Each suspect card features an illustration as well as that individual's characteristics. Underneath each suspect card is a face-down interrogation card that features an arrow pointing in one of the eight compass points or (near the bottom of the deck) a medal. Place one interrogation card face up in the center of the grid; the arrow on this card identifies the main suspect. Additionally, you lay out two face-up decks of evidence cards and a face-down "door" deck of action cards; the "janitor", for example, lets you take a card from a player's hand and put it in someone else's hand.

On a turn, you take one of four actions:


Take an evidence card from the top of a deck and add it to your hand.
Archive 1-2 cards from your hand, removing them from play.
Reveal the top door card from the deck and carry out its action to hinder someone else or help yourself.
Report evidence to capture a suspect.


To report, you reveal all of the evidence card in your hand. If the combination of symbols that you reveal are present on exactly one suspect card on the wall, you catalog those evidence cards and that suspect. (If your symbols match two or more suspects, you've wasted the Chief's time and your turn ends.) If that suspect was not the main suspect, place that suspect's interrogation card under the central card, then place a new face-down interrogation card and a new suspect card in the empty space.

If that suspect was the main suspect, then you collect that suspect card and all of the interrogation cards in the center of the grid; you then reveal the interrogation card that was under that suspect. If the card is a medal or an arrow that points to an empty space in the grid, the game ends. Whoever has collected the most cards wins.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Italia '44
description:
"Italia '44" is a two player wargame simulation (solitaire play is also possible, but without a specific integrated Solitaire rules system) of the Italian Campaign from the Anzio landing to the first assaults against the Gothic Line (January-October 1944).

90 counters, division-brigade scale, 20 km/hex. The map shows central Italy, from the Berhardt Line to Bologna and the Gothic Line.

The game uses a simplified version of the Hungary 44-45 rules system published in Vae Victis #78.

name: Star Realms: Frontier Hawk Promo Card
description:
Frontier Hawk is a Star Empire Ship to be used with the Star Realms series of games. This promo card is an alternate art version of a card from Star Realms: Frontiers and was originally released as part of the 2019 Promo Paradise Kickstarter.

Star Empire Ship
Cost: 1
Attack: 3
Primary Ability: Draw a card, then discard a card.

Flavor Text: These stealthy fighters are often the leading edge of an imperial armada.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: AirWar: C21 Lite
description:
From the freely downloadable PDF:

AirWar: C21 Lite is a cut down version of the second edition of AirWar: C21, our popular fast play, “entry level” set of rules for dogfights set in the years after WW2, and for near future SF games. The rules use a quasi 3D manoeuvre system, whereby the action is fought out in 2D, but with some representation of 3D air combat manoeuvres.

The Lite version is intended to give you the basics of the game and allow you the opportunity to try out some dogfights using the AirWar: C21 system between US F-14 D Tomcats and Russian Su-27 Flanker B’s.

Player notes:

A hexless tabletop miniatures game with each miniature representing a single aircraft. The system breaks game turns into two phases, with each aircraft moving & attempting a manoeuvre in each phase. Turn summary (edited from PDF):

Phase 1
• Select and apply engine power speed changes (unless stalled)
• Roll for initiative, conduct radar/visual spotting
• Move (if turning, move half the aircraft Speed, turn, and move the second half)
• Test for and execute all movement or manoeuvres in order of initiative
• Resolve effects of any missiles launched last phase
• Launch new missiles
• Resolve air-to-air gun or rocket attacks
• Resolve speed changes due to manoeuvre or stall recovery
Phase 2
• identical to Phase 1

Tests for manoeuvres vary in difficulty, making a Barrel Roll easier than an Immelman, etc.

The system uses multiple D6 & D10, single die rolls for tests, detection, etc, multiple for damage. Speed, damage & currently carried weapons are the only variables during play, but each aircraft & weapon has many values to record before starting. Although simplified from the full rules, the system includes a large variety of factors to simulate air warfare, with only the lack of altitude tracking being a notable abstraction.

Only statistics for the F14 Tomcat & Su27 Flanker and their weapons are included in the Lite rules.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Don't Dump The Daisy
description:
This game is another in a line of square-box molded-plastic board releases favored by Ideal Toy Corp. during this period. It incorporates several elements seen either alone or in combination in other action/dexterity games produced around this time - marbles, gravity, a spring.

Players start the game with ten marbles. Marbles must be placed on a large, plastic centrally-located daisy, which has vague depressions on each 'petal' for the marbles to rest in. The stem of the daisy is a strong spring.

There are 16 cards, all of which direct the holder to either 'put' or 'take' a given number of marbles from the daisy each turn. Four are dealt to each player; a turn consists of playing a card & following the directions. If either the placing or removal of marbles causes the daisy to tip over, the player causing the incident must take all the marbles that fall from the daisy.

When all four cards are used (i.e. when each player has had four turns) the pack is reshuffled and a fresh set of four cards is dealt to each player. Play continues in this manner until a player is able to place their final marble on one of the daisy's petals without causing any to fall.

The player who achieves this is the winner of the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Harpoon II
description:
This is the second edition of the original Harpoon Modern Naval Miniatures Rules.


The Harpoon Series

name: Frogger
description:
This is a racing game for the Decktet. Each player controls a group of 6 frogs which will try to reach their home safely through a dangerous path.

This game is an attempt to freely mimic the famous 80's arcade video game where you have to guide a small frog to its home across a traffic filled road and a dangerous river. Mechanically, it was inspired by Cartagena, from Leo Colovini.

A version appeared in the Revised&Expanded Decktet Book under the title Xing.

Game Rules:

* Frogger at the Decktet wiki

name: Proxy Wars
description:
Proxy Wars is an expandable two-player game in a contemporary but slightly fictional setting. Players represent a battle-ready faction and use their agents to fight for control of a customizable board, which is set up individually each game. To win, agents must occupy valuable tiles worth victory points (VPs) or wipe out enemy agents or do both.

Proxy Wars is a full-fledged strategy card-based board game, and the game mechanisms include tile-placing (the cards form the board) and deck-building elements. You are to decide how to best deploy your faction's power and agents to outwit your opponent with ingenious cutting, positioning and attacking strategies. Each player starts with ten agents (playing pieces) in his headquarters and a set of faction cards. Players alternate turns, choosing one of the following actions:


Play a new card
Recruit an agent
Move an agent
Attack enemy agents
Take card actions


At the end of the game, players total the number of agents they control, along with any VPs that they have accumulated on their cards. Whoever has the most points wins.

To play Proxy Wars, you need at least the two basic sets: GreenEngage and MegaCorp; Proxy Wars: Oath Bound, which contains additional cards for both factions, is recommended.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Fighting Eagles: Air Battles of 1918
description:
Fighting Eagles uses a simple game system to simulate the air battles of 1918 fought between the American and German air forces. Based on Rohrbaugh's Showtime Hanoi design, players will play head-to-head matches pitting several Allied aircraft vs. their German counterparts.

Allied player wins the game if their German target is destroyed and more German aircraft are destroyed than Allied. Any other result is a German win. If Red Baron (Fokker Dr1) is shot down or leaves the map the best the German can do is tie.

In addition the game will include two historical scenarios: Red Baron's Last Flight and Frank Luke's Last Flight and several variants including additional missions of bombing & balloon busting.

Players will need a standard deck of cards and one six-sided die (D6) to play the game.

Each copy of Fighting Eagles is composed of the following:


One set of 40 die cut counters
One 8.5 by 11 map with the Turn Record Track
A set of rules
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I

name: I Signori dei Draghi: I Segreti di Mysthras
description:
The first expansion for "I Signori dei Draghi":
Hordes of angry Dragons crowd Mysthras again after a long exile.
Countless creatures, new powers and new magical artifacts make your challenges even more exciting.
In addition to a new role strongly related to dragons, make their appearance on Mysthras creatures of "Lx" level and "allies" that will shape and make each game more strategic.
The Dragons are back in Mysthras. You will be able to control their powers?

The game box includes:
- 52 cards
- 2 instruction cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: The Thunder – Misaki Box Set
description:
If you wanted a ninja Master, here she is. Misaki is a melee assassin that moves around by attacking. And I do mean assassin, her damage is a bit low, but she has easy triggers that will simply remove models. And then she'll push away. You can't lock Misaki down, she is the wind and fire. Or some other vaguely wise-sounding saying. Come on: NINJAS! Dual Faction with Outcasts.

Outcast/Ten Thunders Box Set, containing six 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality Plastic, Stat Cards and six Upgrade Cards. Will require some preparation and assembly.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Dorasure Blades of the Empire
description:
An expansion for Dorasure that contains three new characters: Archer, Bishop and Jester.

Archer: can sacrifice movement dice for resources; co-operate on quests from long range; and utilise two dice in Team Combos. Her treasure item allows her to change an ally’s Climactic Battle result to a Team Combo.

Bishop: has the same resource as the base game’s Paladin. She can heal allies as an action; gain extra XP when completing quests with “magical” affinity; and add her Knowledge roll to an ally’s Combat quest attempt. Her treasure item allows her to use her Knowledge roll instead of a Combat roll in the Climactic Battle (effectively forfeiting the use of the Anti-Dragon Weapons).

Jester: can gain resources through Peak Roll fumbles and criticals. The Jester can also use two dice when determining the outcome of a Roaming Dragon action and select the preferred result; and uncover a single quest/reward tile pairing upon reaching level one. Once per game, the Jester’s treasure item lets you flip the results of a Peak Roll in the Climactic Battle phase (potentially converting a disaster into a sure hit against the dragon).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Deepwood Archers – Unit Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

Nock your arrows and prepare for battle with the Deepwood Archers – Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game!

The Deepwood Archers – Unit Expansion includes eight Deepwood Archer figures and two plastic infantry movement trays, enough to field a unit of Deepwood Archers or add on to the units found in the Latari Elves – Army Expansion, as well as five upgrade cards.

name: 派遣戦隊マモルンジャー (Haken sentai Mamorunja-)
description:
User summary
派遣戦隊マモルンジャー (Haken sentai Mamorunja-) in English would be "Dispatch Squad Mamorangers".

In this kind of trick-taking game, players will become managers of a Ranger Hero employment agency. Each agency will dispatch one Ranger Hero to fight and defeat mysterious enemies.

The game's graphic design hints at the Rangers having some Power. Therefore, each player will have to dispatch a different colour Ranger Hero to defeat those enemies.

Also, on the back of the fight for justice, they will also bet on how many monsters they can defeat.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーはヒーロー派遣会社の経営者となり、怪人を倒すために各社1人ずつヒーローを派遣して戦うトリテライクなゲームです。
怪人を倒すためには全員が違う色のヒーローを派遣しなければなりません。
また正義の戦いの裏で、怪人を何体倒すことができるかの賭け事もしています。
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Trick-taking
publishers: 758 Board Game Circle (758ボードゲーム会)

name: El Incidente (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
Lleváis un tiempo sin realizar los saltos temporales.
Tenéis unas "Vacaciones obligadas".
Pero desde hace unos días notáis un exceso de...

You have a time without making the temporary jumps.
You have a "Holiday obliged".
But for a few days you noticed an excess of ...

It's a fan expansion.
It runs in an orphanage and adds different alternative game systems, more puzzles and new characters.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Puzzle
mechanics: Memory, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Food Facts
description:
Description from the publisher:

Which nutrients do we consume daily in our food? Food Facts offers a playful and entertaining introduction into this topic, and also sparks an interest among people who may normally not care about the subject.

In the game the players have to guess and compare nutritional values ​​of different kinds of food. For example the following questions have to be answered:

Do hazelnuts or chocolate have a higher fat content? Are there more carbohydrates in rice or potatoes? Does a trout or a pork tenderloin contain more protein? Are cherries or ketchup more sugary? Is there a higher amount of fiber in peas or bananas? Do almonds or honey contain more calories? Is the water content higher in mushrooms or apples?

name: 六次化農村 (Sixth Rural Village)
description:
In 六次化農村 (Sixth Rural Village), the player runs a farming village, aiming to develop and contribute to the village the most as a farmer over the course of six years (six rounds). To do this, players must earn money by making crops and livestock products, then selling them. Additionally, players need to demonstrate great leadership in the village parliament in order to make processing buildings that create more valuable products to sell. Also, the parliament will decide who receives subsidies, so you need to keep this in mind. Furthermore, you will be forced to make a very difficult choice between how much you will focus on parliament and focus on the village.

This is a heavyweight game that asks you to consider various elements such as product trends, field and building positions, and voting in parliament, but each element is well intertwined, making it an enjoyable game.

name: Les Trois Portails
description:
LES TROIS PORTAILS is a game of medium complexity, a wargame in which you are the hero! It allows you to relive the epic of the Land of Alhandra, more exactly, the invasion of the chaos it undergoes by opening 3 magic portals.

With a 16-page booklet of illustrated rules and scenario add-ons, a system inspired by that of ARS BELLUM, but introducing characters, magic, objects, flyers and monsters, it is fully immersed in the Heroic-Fantasy world.

The Land of Alhandra is made up of ancient races (men, greenhorns, dwarves, elves) who are experiencing the rebirth of the forces of Darkness, embodied by the Lich King Alach Zhur, and the invasion of chaos.

The player delivers the battles of the scenarios on A4 cards (A3 later) that make up "The Great Campaign" (the story of the invasion of chaos).

The game is played in pairs, one game lasts about 1 to 2 hours. You can choose to embody one side or the other (Darkness or Empire), or alternate roles. Each scenario is independent and constitutes a small battle, but it is also a stage in the story that is told to you.

The units (leaders or combat units) have a movement and combat capability (possibly including firepower) and represent 500 to 1000 or 2000 men, a dozen or twenty monsters, an illustrious character or hero.

The system is based on the initiative conquered by players following a die roll and the impact of leaders and/or other modifiers in the scenario. Scenario speed and ease of understanding are favored. The player starts with basic units, he enriches his pool as the scenario progresses with other units, additional spells and characters.

In THE THREE PORTALS, the system is based on the skills of the units that bring the player's character or armies, and on the development of his main character or armies.

The basic module of the game gives the essential rules and the scenarios are the preamble of the story; the extensions are groupings of scenarios around one or more new features (new race, new characters, additions of objects or various attributes).
A general map in the basic module will be completed as the game progresses.

Usually, extensions include 4 additional battles, a counter board, additional maps, items, spells, the author works on additional locations.

The rulebook
16 pages of illustrated rules, simple concepts and fun play system effectively allowing the simulation of historical dimension of battles.
—description from the publisher (translated)

Participez à une épopée fantastique sur la terre d'Alhandra ! Accomplissez les desseins des forces des ténèbres, ou prenez en main le destin de l'Empire et des races anciennes... Un wargame dont VOUS êtes le héros !

Le livret de règles
16 pages de règles illustrées, des concepts simples et la possibilité de jouer avec plaisir tout en simulant avec efficacité la dimension historique des batailles

—description from the publisher

name: Dossiers Criminels: Le Maestro Assassiné
description:
A collaborative game made in France!
Play as a detective: On September 24, 2021, the famous maestro Ernst Ejna was found dead in his dressing room. Re-establish the chronology of events, study the various testimonies and unmask the murderer.
A complete criminal file: Contains testimonies, forensic analysis, press articles, crime scene photos, audio content...
Escape game mechanics: Solve puzzles to unlock 3 envelopes containing additional evidence.
Detective 2.0 : Internet access is required to hack a computer, unlock a phone and open a safe. Also, several levels of clues are available on the site so you don't get stuck

Qui A Tué Ernst Ejna ? Jeu de Société Escape Game - Jeu d’Enquête Immersif et Collaboratif :
? INCARNEZ UN DETECTIVE : Le 24 septembre 2021, le célèbre maestro Ernst Ejna est retrouvé mort dans sa loge. Rétablissez la chronologie des évènements, étudiez les différents témoignages et démasquez le meurtrier.
? UN DOSSIER CRIMINEL COMPLET : Contient des témoignages, des analyses de la police scientifique, des articles de presse, des photos de la scène de crime, des contenus audio…
? DES MÉCANIQUES D’ESCAPE GAME : Résolvez des énigmes pour déverrouiller 3 enveloppes contenant des preuves supplémentaires.
? DETECTIVE 2.0 : Un accès à internet est nécessaire afin de pirater un ordinateur, débloquer un téléphone et ouvrir un coffre-fort. Aussi, plusieurs niveaux d’indices sont disponibles sur le site afin que vous ne restiez pas bloqué.
?? UN JEU COLLABORATIF MADE IN FRANCE : 1-6 joueurs, à partir de 14 ans, 1h30 - 2 heures de jeu

name: Terraria: The Board Game
description:
Terraria: The Board Game is a co-operative adventure game for 1-4 players. Whether you’re a novice Terrarian or a long-time fan, you can now experience Re-Logic’s magnum opus on your tabletop, solo or with friends. With simple deckbuilding at its heart and a flexible action point system, choose your own playstyle and create memorable moments as you dig, fight, explore and build in a thrilling sandbox world!

-Explore ever-changing biomes, creating a unique world every time you play
-Dig to mine ores and gems as you spelunk below the surface
-Fight enemies to collect loot and obtain new cards
-Complete objective chains and trigger epic boss showdowns
-Build a base to unlock new crafting opportunities and NPC bonuses
-Craft powerful new accessories, tools and weapons
-Upgrade your character with tougher armor sets and useful buffs

Be vigilant; time marches on and the world is dangerous. To win, complete your chosen objectives before the days run out or your respawns are depleted.

Terraria: The Board Game feels like Terraria, distilling the fun of the digital gameplay loop while adding the satisfying tactility and in-person excitement of modern tabletop games. So, whether you’ve played the videogame or not, clear your table, invite your friends and bring the fun of Terraria to game night!
categories: Adventure, City Building, Exploration, Fighting, Territory Building, Video Game Theme

name: Beyond Solitaire
description:
Contains six paper-and-pencil games meant to be played by a single player, including Four Color, Pinball, Profit & Loss, Mountains & Valleys, No Way, and Buried Treasure (which is not to be confused with the later Sackson game of the same title that is a re-theming of Das Super-Blatt).

Part of a series of five paper-and-pencil game books by Sid Sackson, including Beyond Competition, Beyond Solitaire, Games of Art, Beyond Words, and Calculate!.
publishers: Hugendubel Verlag, Pantheon Books, Penguin Books

name: Vegas Slot Machine 1973
description:
Slot machine theme card game. Solo, competitive, co-operative or in teams.

Content: 72 symbol cards, 4 prize/score cards, 4 Spin Again cards (expansion 1), 3 Cumber cards (expansion 2) and the rules.

Rules in one minute:


All players draw 3 cards in their hand
Lay down 9 cards (3x3 grid) to make the slotmachine
On your turn: put down 1 card from your hand and try to make 3 of the same symbols on a winning line
3 of the same symbols on a winning line is a prize
Collect your prizes and keep them untill the end of the game
At the end of the game all players count their prizes and write down their credit points
You can play up to four games (10 minutes per game)
The player with the most credit points wins the game


A few things you can't do:


Don't put a symbol card on top of a card with the same symbol
Don't put a symbol card on top of a symbol that is already a part of a combination of two of the same symbols in a winning line
Never put a symbol card on top of the ANY symbol


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Memory, Video Game Theme

name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – N.I.N.E. Promo Card
description:
N.I.N.E is the November 2013 promo card for Ascension.

Mechana Hero
Gain 2 Rune
When you play a Mechana Construct, you may return this from your discard pile to your hand. (Cards played during your turn do not go to your discard pile until the end of the turn)

Cost: 4 Rune
VP: 2 points
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game: Al Gusto – Promotableau NR. 1
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 14.

4 cardboard tokens:

INSTANT-KAFFEE "Sweetener Scandal"
ABER BITTE MIT SAHNE! "Creamer"
MUCKEFUCK! "Lukewarm"
HÜTCHENSPIELER "Ability Swap"


Tokens are in German.

These tokens are also contained in "VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game - Game of the Year Expansion" but in English.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Why You Lying!
description:
Why You Lying! is a party game based on the classic Liar's Dice gameplay with some hilarious twists: legs and wings!

In this game, each player has a deck of 30 Animal cards consisting of 5 each of Cricket, Spider, Fish, Chicken, Rabbit, and the almighty Mascot Worker!
Players shuffle their deck and draw 5 hand cards at the beginning of each round. The start player will announce whether they will play with legs or wings in the current round by saying "I bet there are X (number of) Y (animals) with Z (amount of) legs (or wings) among all animals in all players' hand cards."
And players take turns to raise the bet by increasing X, Y (animals' hierarchy), or Z, OR they can call the previous player BLUFF!

Play smart with the information in your hand, and play cunning when you raise the bet. But beware, don't let the Mascot Workers fool you!

—description from the publisher

name: Disgrace & Favours
description:
In the set-making card game Disgrace & Favours you play the role of a socialite who is trying to gather influential people to your cause by "persuading" them to promote you. You do this by sending your servant to snoop on them, find out an embarrassing secret, then ask them nicely to help you out...or else.

Each card in the game appears twice, and if a player has her secret revealed by an opponent she becomes disgraced and the other identical card is forfeit, even if it is in a set.

Disgrace & Favours includes an element of luck as players have to try to guess what each other are up to during the snooping phase. Set disruption is also part of the game, and ruining someone's plans will bring you a large chunk of satisfaction. Naturally you can try to defend against this by getting hold of both cards or taking the disgrace token for yourself.

name: Munchkin Fatine e Folletti
description: Contains the Italian edition of Munchkin Fairy Dust and Munchkin Waiting for Santa plus three exclusive promos for a total of 33 foil cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows Upon Lassadar: Revenge of the Raven Consort
description:
Revenge of the Raven Consort is the 3rd game in the Lassadar Trilogy (Shadows Upon Lassadar and Sorrow of Salilth are the other 2).

This is a solitaire 'Choose Your Own Adventure' style card game lasting about 20 minutes

Needed to play:
• the 81 cards split into five separate game decks (Quest, Event, Combat, Spell and Win/Loss) each with their own icon and color
• 2d10 - used for combat and d100 percentage rolls (it is suggested that each d10 is a different color)
• 36 wooden cubes (used to mark spells (17), books (8), spirit/mana/fate (3) and combat strength (4) and special bonuses (4) some Event cards give you)

Play:
You are trying to find 9 lost books before the Raven Consort and the servants of the Grayking do. Cards are drawn from one of 5 decks (Quest, Combat, Spell, Event and Win/Loss), with each deck forming the basis of the choices you make in the game.

Each of the Quest, Spell and Event cards has a title at the top, text in the middle which must be resolved first, and a series of icons at the bottom.

Once you resolve the text in the middle, you can choose one of the bottom listed actions and draw your next card from that corresponding color deck, discarding the current ‘in play’ card.

Game end:
The game ends in one of 2 ways:
1. Once 9 books have been recovered by you and/or by the Raven
Consort, the game ends. If you have found the majority of the books you win the game, thwart the Raven Consort and save Lassadar. If the Raven Consort has the majority of the books, she wins and Lassadar is plunged back into misery and darkness.
2. If your spirit falls below 1 on the spirit track you have lost the game and become one of the Raven Consort’s Thralls and you are forever damned.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – The Looking Glass Promo Card
description:
Enlightened Construct
Cost = 3
Victory Points = 2
Card Text: you may acquire cards under this as if they were in the center row. If there is no card under this, reveal the top card of the center deck and put it under this. If this leaves play, banish all cards under this.

name: I Obey: The Campaign of Bezzecca 1866
description:
I Obey – the Campaign of Bezzecca 1866
This one is an operational game on Garibaldi campaign over the Alps during the initial and central phases of the Third Italian War of Independence. It was a strange, fascinating campaign by one of the most famous generals of his time, not only in Italy. Garibaldi’s red shirts fought and won against a superior, but very dispersed Austrian army, that tried to force Garibaldi to a slow and depressing struggle over mountain passes and cliffs, but was surprised in the decisive battle of Bezzecca that opened the road to victory for the Italian general that was stopped by a direct order of his king (to which he responded simply “I obey”, giving up a sure victory on the field for a political one for his country).

With a very peculiar chit drawing activation method and a combat system that stresses fatigue over real casualties, I obey is a fascinating study of this neglected campaign, with a see-saw motion of the counters over the splendid map and the chance for both sides to gain an unexpected victory.

Medium complexity, 2/3 hours playing time, both for competitive and solitaire play.

Released as Print-n-Play in June 2007

name: Donkey Kong Card Game
description:
Players place ladder and girder cards in a particular pattern on the playing field starting from a girder strip to build a high-rise structure up to Donkey Kong who sits on his cardboard throne. Each time a card is played, the player moves their respective Mario pawn by die count up the card structure.

In addition to the plain ladder and girder cards are obstacle and remedy cards that are self-explanatory. If you're the first player to move your pawn up, above the highest girder where Donkey Kong sits, then you'll capture Donkey Kong and win the game. Oh joy!

name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Totentanz auf der Titanic
description:
The Setting: North Atlantic, April 14 1912. The Titanic, the largest and most luxurious ocean liner of the world makes headway through icy waters. Lord Wellington, favourite of the ladies, is on board. He has just recently bought a mysterious jewel at auction: "The Eye of Shiva" which allegedly is cursed. One night the Lord is found dead in his cabin. Did the Indian god's revenge strike him down, or was it one of his illustrious fellow travellers from 1st class?

Das Thema: Nordatlantik, 14. April 1912. Die Titanic, der größte und luxuriöseste Passagierdampfer der Welt, bahnt sich seinen Weg durch das eiskalte Wasser. An Bord ist auch Lord Wellington, Liebling der Damenwelt. Erst vor kurzem hat er ein sagenumwobenes Juwel ersteigert “ Das Auge Shivas“, auf dem angeblich ein Fluch lastet. Nun hat man den Lord tot in seiner Kabine gefunden. Hat die Rache des indischen Gottes ihn niedergestreckt? Oder war doch einer seiner illusteren Mitreisenden aus der 1. Klasse der Täter?

name: Semiramis
description:
From the publisher:
You are a court gardener of the mythical Queen Semiramis. All plants have gotten mixed up and your task is to put them in such an order that neither plants of the same shape nor plants of the same color are standing next to one another. There is only one unoccupied space - and after solving the task, this space should be in the center of the board.

The fronts of the 24 cards show different starting positions. The first tasks can be solved within a relatively short time, but then they become increasingly more difficult.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – S'Gorn Expansion Pack
description:
A Gorn starship is a type of vessel utilized by the Gorn Hegemony during the mid-23rd century for conducting raids. The Gorn ship is designed with four nacelles, and its class configuration is unfamiliar to the Federation prior to the late 2260s.

In 2267, a Gorn starship approached the Earth outpost on Cestus III at space-normal speed using the outpost's regular approach route. Before the outpost knew what hit them, the Gorn ship knocked out the outpost's phaser batteries with its first salvo, leaving the outpost defenseless. The weapon used was described by a survivor as being "like phasers, only worse". The Gorn ship continued to assault the outpost, until it was obliterated.

The Gorn starship later attacked the USS Enterprise, which had been lured to the colony by false signals. The Enterprise's counterattack with full phaser and photon torpedo banks proved ineffective against the deflector screen of the Gorn ship, which was located just outside visual range.

The Star Trek: Attack Wing – S'Gorn Expansion Pack is the competitive prize for the "Arena" episode during Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: The Ancient World: The Frog God Statue Promo
description:
The Ancient World: The Frog God Statue Promo is placed on The Ancient World board when you set up. It is an extra action space. At the end of the round when all players have passed, players with a citizen on the Frog God Statue may pay one coin to place that citizen on any action space on the board. These citizens ignore all previously-placed citizens on any action space. Citizens are placed in numerical order (highest to lowest).

This was a (First Edition) Kickstarter promo for the European backers only (See Update #12).

Although technically compatible with The Ancient World (Second Edition), this tile and two others like it are not included in the latter edition because other new elements in the game cover the same ground in better ways.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Set Collection, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Abenteuer Tierwelt
description:
Find the right animals! What are those with hairs? Which can swim? Listen carefully! To which animal belongs every cry: was it a wild boar or a seal? Become trackers purposes! Which animal has left these footprints? Categorize the animals by various characteristics. Is a frog heavier than a mouse? What maximum speed can reach the elephant?
With tiptoi, young zoo visitors develop their knowledge of domestic and wild animals!

Retrouve les bons animaux ! Quels sont ceux qui ont des poils, lesquels savent nager ? Tendez bien l’oreille ! À quel animal appartient chaque cri : était-ce un sanglier ou un phoque ? Devenez de fins pisteurs ! Quel animal a laissé ces empreintes ? Classez les animaux selon diverses caractéristiques. Une grenouille est-elle plus lourde qu’une souris ? Quelle vitesse maximale peut atteindre l’éléphant ?
Avec tiptoi®, les jeunes visiteurs du zoo développent leurs connaissances sur les animaux domestiques et sauvages !

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Compulsive Gambler's Grog
description:
The Red Dragon Inn: Organized Play Season 1 (2015) participation promotional card. This card was given away if you won an RDI organized play.

Begin a Round of Gambling as though you just played "Gambling? I'm in!"

The winter of that Round of Gambling gains 2 alcohol Content.

Players may Ignore this Event to avoid the Round of Gambling. (However, players may no longer do this once the Round has begun.)

The best gamblers know when to stop!

The Organized Play Kits each contained 4 Tournament Prize Packs, consisting of twenty participation cards to be handed out to anyone who attends (this one and Deirdre's Detoxifying Draught) and three premium cards to be handed out as prizes.

The 2023 re-release of the Organized Play Kit contains only 1 Tournament Prize Pack.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Phase Order

name: Universal Rule: Edge of War
description:
The Pocket Universe is entering an era of tension as power surges throughout the galaxy.

Universal Rule: Edge of War introduces 3 new planet cards that integrate with the 4th X, exterminate. The Roza System is a protective pacifist planet, while Vianov has a very destructive Eater of Worlds ability. And in-between is Wovis, a sacrifice of a planet that destroys your own planets for great control over the battlefield. These three cards are shuffled in and three random cards are removed to mix up the Universal Rule game play.


Planets:

Roza System
Wovis
Vianov



The expansion was born from stretch goals during the Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Chrononauts: Really Fast Time Machine Promo Card
description:
This Gadget works in either type of Chrononauts deck.

Text says:
"If you have this Gadget on the table, you may play an extra Inverter or Patch, and draw to replace it, after your normal turn action. You may only use one Time Machine action per turn."

It debuted as a promo card at Origins 2004, and was added to the original game during the 3rd printing.
It was also available for purchase by itself from the Looney Labs webstore
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Sea Shanties
description:
Sea Shanties is a pirate-themed strategy game for 3-5 players. Players will compete to be the most renowned captain to ever sail the Kanvus Sea. In doing so, players will plunder islands for valuable loot, pillage loot from other captains using a unique sea battle mechanic, and complete objectives to write shanties that will become their legacy once Davy Jones takes his toll.

Sea Shanties' environmentally friendly design utilizes dynamic board tiles printed on canvas. There are over a duodecillion different configurations of the board, meaning you will never play on the same board twice!

Players start with 15 crew and a ship token on a starting island, selected by a draft. Players have 5 additional crew tokens in Hunter's Tavern.

Every captain's turn has three phases - Actions, then Bury, then Collect (ABC). During the action phase, captains may take up to 5 actions. The five available actions are Sail (Move their ship token to an adjacent square on the board, utilizing wind arrows), Plunder (place crew tokens from your player board onto an island that your ship token occupies), Abandon (remove all of your tokens from an island that your ship token does not occupy and place them in Hunter's Tavern), Recruit (place one crew token from Hunters Tavern onto your player board), and Sea Battle (initiate a battle with another captain's if their ship is in an adjacent square).

After the action phase, captains may Bury their loot that they had on their ship. Buried loot cannot be pillaged in sea battles. Once that phase is done, players may then Collect 1 loot per loot-producing island they control, collect any Ballads if they have buried the most of a particular type of loot, and collect one verse if they completed the specified objective on it.

Sea Battles are an augmented Prisoner's Dilemmah. Captains will secretly select a number on the battle dial between 0 and the number of crew tokens they have on their captain's placards (not on in the tavern or on islands). They will simultaneously reveal their selected numbers. The highest number wins and may pillage loot tokens from the loser equal to the difference of the two selected numbers. The winner will also have to surrender crew to the tavern equal to the difference. Lastly, the winner gets a Fear loot chit. Do you send all of your crew to battle, knowing that the opposer might select a low number and you lose most of your crew?

Once all of the shanties have been sung, the player with the most Renown Points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Prisoner's Dilemma, Worker Placement, Zone of Control

name: Mandala Stones: Dice Tower 2021 Objective Cards
description:
A set of 4 extra end of game objective cards labeled #X0 through #X04, giving players new ways to score points!

Part of Pack E from the 2021 Dice Tower Kickstarter.

name: King of Tokyo: Gift Promo Cards
description:
Three cards given by the Devir staff to every participant of the King of Tokyo tournament during the Mega XP 2022 event held in Mexico. Shuffle them with the base game cards to add variety to the game.


Secret Fan: upon obtaining this card, secretly choose another player's name. If that player wins the game, so do you!
Personal Tutor: anytime another player gains [heart], you may make that player earn one additional [heart]. If you do, you earn one [star] or one [heart].
Generous Spirit: Once during each one of your turns, you and another player you choose each gain one [star].


These cards were also given out to participants of the "King of Tokyo Tournament - Hug Season" at the 2022 UK Games Expo
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: T8
description:
T8 is a trick-taking card game for four players. The game is based around having eight suits, and eight cards per suit. The twist is that players can't follow suits previously played, and they play two cards per per turn into the trick. There is a new scoring mechanic built around the two-card-per-trick mechanic: the lower of the two cards played scores positive points, but any cards lower than that (from the other players) score negative points.

There is also a solo mode, in which players seek to give three automated opponents negative scores while earning a positive score themselves.

The game was designed to be given to attendees at the convention T8 in January 2023. 50 copies were printed.

—description from the designer

name: Yin Yang
description:
Yin Yang is a majority control game for 2 people. A pocket abstract with a constant tugof-war for the control of the five elements and the balance of the Three Pures.

Release Your Yin and Control Your Yang to Reach the Equilibrium
An abstract strategy duel in which we will fight to unbalance the balance through the favor of Yin or Yang. Master the elements, anticipate your opponent's moves and expand your energy to its maximum potential. Find the perfect balance and pick your bets wisely to achieve victory in this battle like no other

How to Play Yin Yang?

Choose yin or yang and place the playing area according to the initial placement rules.
Each turn we will activate a tile under our control, choosing between its element or its pure (number) and trigger its effect.
At the end of our turn we can take a tile under our control of an element we control


(have the majority) and place it in our betting area. These tiles will give us a bonus score at the end of the game if the majority of its element is still under our control.

We will play for 6 turns and we will check the final score based on the control of each element and adding the scores of our bets if they were successful.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Tug of War

name: Giganten
description:
Giganten could be briefly described as "Dinosaur Stratego." Each player has a set of 23 saurians (dinosaurs of various kinds, pterodactyls, pleisosaurs, etc.) which are stand-up cardboard pieces with plain backs, so the opponent cannot tell which piece is which. Pieces move and attack each other Stratego-fashion, with the goal being to find your opponent's eggs.

There were two versions of the game produced. The original 1981 version came in a small box, with a larger box coming out in 1982, and had numbers on the pieces to indicate their strength on land and in water (air being a special case). The larger version won the "Essener Feder"-prize (prize for the best rules) in 1983. The later (1992) version again came in a much smaller box and did not have numbers on the pieces, instead having a booklet that shows which pieces defeat which others in each kind of terrain (functionally it appears to be similar). This version also has fewer types of creatures than the first - no crocodile, diplodocus, etc.

In the included booklet of the small edition "How came the idea to Giganten", Hubert Pinthus talks from an old, well known game with opponents of unknown strength. It's clear that he meant "Stratego" and he admitted that Giganten was heavily inspired by Stratego. The change from military units to dinosaurs is a minor change, but there were more important changes: 1 - small edition: added variable terrain (land, swamp, lakes); the lakes in Stratego were not terrain, but mere obstacles. 2 - large edition: added variable board consisting of 4 parts and added 2 more dinosaurs.

The French version of the game was called "Dinosaures."

name: Mahola
description:
The four most respected members of the tribe, the Chief, Hunter, Maiden and Shaman, have come together, each seeking the favor of the Great Spirit. To win that favor, each must perform a ritual dance, with the best dance earning the desired divine favor.

Mahola is a card game for 3 to 4 players themed around the beautiful dances of the Native American culture. Players will draw, play, and pass cards in order to create the highest scoring dance and win a favor token. The first to win 3 tokens wins the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Loaded Questions: Pop Culture
description:
In this hilarious game where everyone's a critic, laugh, chat, and play away with 200 NEW creative questions on movies, music, television, celebrities, and all things pop culture.

Loaded Questions Pop Culture, just like the original and various versions, tests how well players know one another. It is the perfect game for anyone who loves movies, books or television. Questions include "If you ran a celebrity zoo, who would be your star attraction?" and "Which millionaire would you like to get a Christmas check from?" Matching people with their answers will score points for you. Loaded Questions Pop Culture comes with 200 new and hilarious questions that your family will love. You can play with enclosed components or the original game (original game sold separately)

name: Regime
description:
You are diplomats sent to the turbulent nation of REGIME to form an alliance with their leadership. Popular uprisings are a common occurrence, so be careful with whom you form an alliance!

To win, you must manage your allegiances, oust unpopular factions, and keep your constituency happy!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Number, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: El Tesorero
description:
A satirical card game about the political corruption in Spain. In this second edition has some new cards added with the latest hits in the spanish political news.

The game is a simple card game about buying and selling properties, manipulating the press and earn as much money as posible. There is 3 things you can do in your turn: draw a card, use a action card or playing a property to the table paying the the envelopes cards there is in the table or using your own propierties but never with cards in your hand.

To win the game you have the collect sets of those propierties and the player with the most points is the winner of the game.

name: Dicevania: Quintet of Rolls
description:
Dicevania: Quintet or Rolls is a double-faced print at home roll & write game, loosely inspired by a famous videogame. Roll your dice, conquer the map, and save the Countess girl!

SIDE A
Use 5d6 trying to score the needed combination in order to clear a room, then move to the nex one. Freely explore the castle, finding and managing your items to modify the rolls, recover HP and score points. Fill the rewards bars with scored points to get more items. Will you explore the whole map?

SIDE B
Roll 5d6 to determine which tetraminoes you'll have to put in the map. Try to cover it completely.

-description from designer
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Puzzle, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Yakitori
description:
Yakitori, the famed Japanese street food on skewers, is now a game in which players are skewering tiles, placing dice, and manipulating a fickle market to vie for the most Yen from hungry customers.

In the game, players roll dice, select from actions such as Cooking, Market, and Influence. Food tiles are bought, skewered, and sold at just the right time to net a healthy profit. Clever planning can pay off in this family-friendly game that will also intrigue seasoned gamers looking for a thinky game that integrates theme with mechanisms.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: La Pirámide del Faraón
description:
In The Pyramid of the Pharaoh, players compete to build a pyramid and find the symbols of building stones in search tiles that are in the center of the table. The requirement increases with the progress of the pyramid.

The player who completes their pyramid and gets the approval of the gods is the winner.
________________________________________________________________

La Pirámide del Faraón es un juego de mesa divertido y con reglas sencillas que pone al límite la memoria, el intelecto y la imaginación de chicos y grandes.

Los jugadores compiten por construir una pirámide y para hacerlo deben encontrar los símbolos de las piedras de construcción en las losetas de búsqueda que se hallan en el centro de la mesa. La exigencia se incrementa con el progreso de la pirámide.

El jugador que culmine su pirámide y consiga la aprobación de los dioses será el ganador.

name: Kaosball: Ringer – Gangsta Z
description:
"You know what they say: Kaosball ain't easy"

Gangsta Z brings his unique brand of high living to our beloved sport! His amazing ability can bend the game's very rules, and allow his team to stay on the offense all game if needed!

Remember, the uncanny resemblance to a certain games designer is completely coincidental....
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: War of the Buttons: The Flower Meadow & Little Sister
description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo for Day 2.

In this promo are:
1. The Flower Meadow
2. Little Sister Marker

Using:
1. Get your "Little Sister" marker at the Flower Meadow.
2. Decide if you want to use it at the beginning of each following round.
3. Influence a location by playing the marker.

Just one active "Little Sister" marker per player.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
publishers: ADC Blackfire Entertainment GmbH, Frosted Games

name: Queries 'n Theories
description: This game is a simulation of scientific method and generative grammars. One player invents a language consisting of basic sentences and replacement rules. The other players attempt to reconstruct the language by astute questioning.

name: Queen's Blade: The Duel
description:
The Queen's Blade series of combat books are reincarnated as a TCG in Queen's Blade: The Duel. In addition to art in the style of the Queen's Blade series, there are rare cards illustrated by famous artists. For the foreseeable future, this is a Japan-only release.

Unlike the books, Queen's Blade: The Duel is not licensed from the Lost Worlds system.

Official site:
http://www.megahobby.jp/qbtd/index/

How to play:
http://www.megahobby.jp/qbtd/index/rules/index.html
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Mature / Adult

name: Comme des Sardines...
description:
Crazy party game in which players fight laws of sardines. They are kept in so small tins that somebody has to change it!

Every round fop common pool players choose slogans which they will shout during the round. Then they take cards with those slogans, shuffle than and remove one.

Every player in turn takes one card from the pile and shouts the slogan which is written on it, then next one, etc.

One of the player starts to disturb other players by acting as a policeman, reporter, businessman or and old lady.

After pile is exhausted players vote on which slogan was missing scoring points for correct guesses. The disturber scores points according to number of players who did not vote on a right slogan.
