Recruit an adept to help you with the summoning.
Borrow his power and claim your victory!

At the beginning of the game, choose which of the two Adepts you want to play with. Their abilities will allow you to have an extra card in your hands or place a card ignoring placement rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle

name: Gate Ruler
description:
Gate Ruler is a Japanese trading card game designed by the designer of Future Card Buddyfight.
Each player in this game plays a ruler, and each ruler has his/her own rules, so that each player can fight in the same game with different rules. Like most tcgs, each player use creatures to fight with the opponent, and the player makes the opponent's life to 0 will win the game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Elekt: Minstrel
description:
The expansion introduces a new Minstrel Basic Unit and 4 Melody sets (Melody cards are marked with a note in the upper left corner). The rules of the expansion pack come into play if one of the Basic Units in your game is the Minstrel. Then give each player a set of Melodies (the set contains 1 copy of each type of Melody).

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Escape Room: The Game – Nuclear Countdown
description:
The beeping of the fax machine catches you off guard. It's a bomb threat, it says a bomb will go off tonight somewhere downtown. The fax was easy to trace, you and your team head out and 23 minutes later you knock on the door of one William Teller. No answer. The lock on the door is as poor as the building you're standing in and within seconds you're in the apartment. You see a table that is filled with all kinds of materials that send shivers down your spine. At that moment, your phone rings and your worst nightmare becomes reality, the bomb threat is real! William Teller has been arrested and was making a big scene, saying he wanted a window seat to watch the explosion at 8:00pm sharp. You realize that's in exactly one hour ...

Expansion puzzle to any Escape Room: The Game base game that contains the Chrono Decoder. This expansion was originally included in the 2016 Escape Room: The Game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: Lock
description:
Lock is a two-player strategy game inspired by classics such as 'Go' which takes about 15 minutes to play. It follows the Spooky Tower Games hallmark format of being in a cloth bag, which is also used as the board for the game.

In Lock the players take it in turn to place one of their tokens on the board. When a triangle of pieces is created, one of them is replaced with a wooden block and another is removed.

When a triangle of wooden blocks is created, a 'lock' move has been made. One of the opponent's pieces is permanently locked away within this triangle. It's possible to play a 'double lock' or even 'triple lock' move.

The game is won either when you fully surround one or more of your opponent's pieces, or when your opponent has run out of pieces to place.

name: OMAIGOD 'Hazme El Humor'
description:
SUPER FUNNY, a new board game to laugh out loud!

⚡️ Simple to play: Answer to daily talks and messages how you would never dare to!
Win points by combining the funniest question-answer cards. The one who earns more points by finding the best combinations wins the game!


Play in 15-45min with 3-15 players, you will have millions of possible combinations to answer.
Created by the greatest Toño & Pablo, authors of Guatafac.
FREAKING FUNNY: 480 cards with hot questions, answers and pictures!


♻️ Cards printed in the European Union with paper from sustainably managed forests. 1% of the profits are donated to charities. (ERDF in 2021)

—description from the pubisher

name: Oh My Ring!
description:
In Oh My Ring!, you need to be quick and agile to slide your rings from one finger to the next while trying to match the combinations on the cards.

Each player starts with eight colored rings: two of each color, with four on each hand. Each turn, a card is revealed that shows one or two hands and a combination of colored rings. As quickly as you can, move the rings from finger to finger to recreate that pattern before anyone else. The fastest player to do so wins the card, and whoever first collects five cards wins.

Some constraints will make the task harder, such as treating one color as another or forcing you to switch rings without looking at your fingers.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: World of Tanks: Battlegrounds
description:
World of Tanks: Battlegrounds - All the elements of the board game have been designed and produced with utmost precision, reflecting the computer game's world in an extremely realistic manner. This makes all the battles on the table nothing short of those that rage in the virtual reality. In both cases, the game is based on three common elements: locations, tanks and tactical battle. The board gameplay is made even more realistic thanks to the pictures of tanks and locations being identical to those in the “World of Tanks” computer game.

The game offers four gameplay options:

basic (battle) – uncovered memory type – on their way to victory, players conquer locations and fight tank battles between each other;
team – for pairs (this option can be played by two or four players);
family – covered memory type – players move through the board with their tanks, looking for location pairs;
solo – a race between the game and the player to conquer more locations.

name: Alieninjas
description:
Some creatures have escaped from the S.O.L.A.R. Laboratory. They had been captured in space and were dubbed Alieninjas due to their capacity to camouflage, turning into other creatures.
However, these little monsters cannot camouflage completely, and they end up leaving important parts of their anatomy exposed, making their identification and capture easier.
You are agents of S.B.F. - Special Biosecurity Force - assigned to retrieve all those creatures while keeping a low profile.
Alieninjas are 5 unique mission-based games, which will put your agility, memory, and reasoning to the test, promoting the winner to the rank of institution commander.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Action Drafting, Memory, Push Your Luck, Real-Time

name: Al-Khazneh
description:
Al-Khazneh is an Arabic word for treasury. Become an adventurer exploring the natural treasury, collect map pieces, discover the treasure first, and get your hands on its power. You have to reach out to other adventurers, who are colleagues and competitors, sometimes with a negotiating hand, sometimes with a sharp sword. The goal of the game is to get the most treasures.

The game has card drafting and set collection mechanism.

Each player has five cards (a piece of map) in their hands. In your turn, you trade cards in your hands with cards in caravans or with other players. When you place your cards in the caravan, you can stack them up to prevent other players from taking them. Or you can play the 'Duel' card to rob other players, but you should always be prepared for counterattacks.

Collect three pieces and complete a map set, and you excavate hidden treasures and jewelry from the game board. Treasures have different effects, which makes interesting changes in the game. When all the treasures are excavated, the player with the most jewels wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Magic: The Gathering – Theros Beyond Death Planeswalker Deck: Elspeth, Undaunted Hero
description:
This Magic: The Gathering starter deck is ready to go with a 60 card ready deck, storage box and strategy guide. Battle a few times to understand how to play your deck, then open the 2 included booster packs to customize it.

Elspeth is a renowned warrior of surpassing skill and unshakable willpower, who has defeated everything from gods to death itself. Build up a battalion of devoted soldiers and lead them fearlessly to a glorious victory.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Ghost Snap
description:
Kathy and James have heard rumors there are ghosts around town. They locate a "ghost camera" to capture the proof and when they conquer their anxiety fearfully hold up the camera in a misty cemetery, they discover that the ghosts are really there!

Ghost Snap is a co-operative game for 2 players. Players share cards and play cards. If you don't think about your partner's invisible anxiety, it will be difficult to continue snapping pictures of the ghosts. Keep your courage in mind and take a picture of the ghosts! Your score will be based on the number of successful snaps and difficulty is determined by the number of anxiety cards in the deck.

name: Faux Raccords
description:
In Faux Raccords, players try to cooperate editing a movie without being able to communicate. Several modes of play are available, in which you will edit a Feature Film, Two Short Films, a Series, a Multi-Arcs Movie or found your own Production Company.

On your turn, you will play a card from your hand in one of three different ways:

placing a card face down in the Film
placing a card face up in the Cut in order to use its power
discarding a card in order to peek at a face down card in the Film.


Then you draw a new card and add it to your hand.

The game ends either when a player has no card to play on their turn, or when a player decides the movie is ready. The winning condition depends on the mode. For example, for the Feature Film, players need to obtain a row of 16 cards in ascending order.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kraken Skulls!
description:
Kraken Skulls is a swashbuckling game full of dice and danger!

You play as a pirate captain who sets sail determined to become the most dreadful pirate of the high seas. Navigate treacherous waters as you do what pirates do: hoard treasure to improve your ship’s strength and win battles to gain the fear and respect of your opponents.

Move secretly and simultaneously to determine encounters. Will you clash with rival pirates, try to escape the infamous Navy, or team up to defeat the deadly Kraken?

If you manage to avoid conflict, then pillage, bury, or dig to add cards to your hand. Spend treasure to upgrade your ship and add more dice to aid you throughout the game.

With over 20 different dice minigames, each playthrough will be a unique experience.

The first to achieve six Dread is crowned Ruler of the Seas! Do you have what it takes? Gather your crew, roll your dice, and set sail for adventure in the hectic world of Kraken Skulls!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Number, Pirates
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Starship Commander Solitaire
description:
Starship Commander is a solitaire bookgame that places you in command of a star fleet responsible for exploring, colonizing and defending the galaxy. Many forms of resistance must be faced to achieve your missions. Events will occur that may jeopardize you and crew. Careful use of resources and acquiring advanced technologies will help you achieve your goals.

—description from the rulebook

This is a re-implementation of the popular PnP Micro Space Empire by the same designer.
categories: Book, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kaikoro Kingdoms
description:
Euro-style roll and write game where you'll build your own kingdom, and defend it from fearsome Kaijus.

In this new adventure, players will spend their turns building their kingdom according to their style of play: build villages to gain more points, recruit leaders to create an engine of abilities and extra score, or build shields to improve your defenses.

Each time you play a game of Kaikoro Kingdoms you can choose a different Kaiju to be the current threat for all players. Each Kaiju will attack and punish players differently, so take advantage of that to create your strategy!

Up to 100 players can play Kaikoro Kingdoms at the same time, but if that's not your thing, each Kaiju comes with its own unique rules if you decide to play solo.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, City Building, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Oathsworn: Into the Deepwood – Sir Tom Vasel Promo Ally
description:
Originally available in Pack Archer from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Sir Tom Vasel
Of House Dice Tower

Might: 2 yellow dice
Ability: The Seal of Excellence - Once per encounter, after another friendly character criticals during an attack that hits, they may draw 6 white dice instead of 1.

name: Under Our Sun
description:
Under our Sun is a semi-cooperative exploration board game set in a post-apocalyptic world where life is at the mercy of the sun. One to four (six with Expansions) players embark on an adventure, assume the role of survivor, and join forces to reach a common goal. Players beware... everyone might not have the same goal in mind.

Explore
Head into the wasteland and uncover a new world, tile by tile.

Craft
Scavenge for crucial resources, craft unique items, weapons, and gear to prepare for the upcoming challenges.

Survive
Navigate an unforgiving landscape and adapt to the extreme conditions.
Be it nature, human or something unknown, danger comes in many forms. Use your character's individual skills and collaborate to reach your goal and survive.

Detailed description

Under our Sun is a semi-cooperative, exploration board game set in a post-apocalyptic world.
When a giant asteroid hits the sun, life on earth is suddenly at its mercy. Modern technology is no longer available, and the entirety of the northern hemisphere becomes a desolate hellscape as a result of the ensuing solar storms.
Society’s rules and regulations are replaced by anarchy, and every day becomes a struggle for survival.

As gameplay commences, you will become an integral member of one of the few remaining honorable and socially-minded communities. Players will choose between four unique characters (six with expansions), each with their own strengths and weaknesses, and will head into the wastelands to ensure the survival of the group and fulfill crucial tasks. The game can be played with a fully-cooperative approach, or to make things extra interesting, there could also be a traitor within the group.
Choose one of the four missions included in the core box, which are varied according to difficulty, play-time, and strategic approach.
Under our Sun has a turn-based gameplay where each round represents a single day divided into different phases (morning, noon, evening, and night). Explore the area, tile by tile, to trigger events scattered throughout the map. Find precious loot and scavenge for resources to craft unique items in an effort to upgrade both your character and shelter. Engage in life or death fights against humans, animals, or something completely unknown. Adapt to ever changing weather conditions where even the most elementary of tasks results in a fight for survival.

To succeed in this harsh land, players must manage resources, maintain their health, and ensure adequate water supply. Only through collaboration and the use of individual skills, will players be able to achieve survival and reach their ultimate goal (whatever that may be).
Dive into the thrilling and complex world of “Under our Sun,” and become one of earth’s final survivors!

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Traitor Game

name: Metropolis
description:
From the publisher's website:

Metropolis: Battle-force Conflicts
The war in Iskandria is escalating and the initial skirmishing is developing into full-blown military conflict. In response, all the warring factions are throwing in ever-increasing numbers of fresh troops, including heavier armoured elements and specialists.

With your Urban War strike-team as the core, Metropolis enables you to build much larger battle-forces to pit against your enemies in full-scale warfare.

Game Intro
Metropolis moves the action up a level from the small-scale skirmishes played out in Urban War. It shifts the focus from the individual to the squad. Your armies, or ‘Battle-forces’, will largely consist of several squads that vary in size, but normally contain around five to ten troopers. Accompanying them will be various individual models that represent important officers and characters, and larger more powerful war machines and vehicles.

Each faction has a different battle-force structure. Various basic squads form the foundation of their battle-forces, with the mix of support, assault, and elite squads, and the accompanying individuals and war machines, giving each their own unique flavour.

name: The War At Sea
description:
From "The Object of the Game":
To control the seas as much as possible during the period of the war. The winner is the player with the most "Points of Control" after 8 turns.

The game represents surface action between capital ships in WWII.

The mapboard is an abstract rendering of Europe/Eastern USA/Brazil and surrounding sea zones, divided into large movement zones. Individual counters represent single capital ships, U-boats, convoys and airstikes. Capital ship fire is simulated with dice rolls directed from and to individual ships, with damage being accrued and marked with counters until the target ship is sunk.

117 counters
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Kandahar: Special Forces in Afghanistan
description:
Kandahar: Special Forces in Afghanistan (Solitaire) gives you command of a Special Forces team in Afghanistan from 2003 to 2013. Your lead your men on a variety of randomly generated missions; you choose your weapons and equipment, decide on how to posture your team, and plan your approach and method of extraction.

You must choose weapons and equipment that don’t run the risk of quickly exposing your team, and don’t cause unintended escalation. (If the US military must divert regular combat units to your area to quell enemy activity, the value of the Green Berets will be called into question by the traditionalists at the Pentagon.) Your goal is to disrupt the enemy’s freedom of action in your area of operations while creating only a minimal footprint at minimal cost.

Kandahar is a solitaire game in which you assume the role of a Special Forces colonel. The system will generate missions and enemy responses to your unit’s activities.

Each team counter represents about five men, while each commander and officer counter represent one man each. Each enemy combat unit represents various sizes of units, typically platoons.

Each hex on the map represents 200 meters from side to opposite side. Each turn represents anything from hours to days, depending on the tempo of your activities.

Modern War, Issue #21 JAN-FEB 2016

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Wraiths – Unit Expansion
description:
Fear is made flesh with the Wraiths Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! With the ability to pass through walls and unleash a shriek to terrify even the most stalwart Daqan warriors, these phantoms torment the armies of the living with an unnatural fury. Unleash the ancient specters and make the living cower before you!

—description from the publisher

name: Courtier: Power Promo Cards
description:
Text says:

Flexible
Discard your private petition. Draw a new petition from the deck.

Play an influence card

2 copies of this card were included inside AEG's version of Patronize
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombie Kittens: Not the Full Game. Just the 22 Expansion Cards
description:
This version of "Zombie Kittens" cannot be played as a standalone game and MUST be added to another version of Exploding Kittens to play. Add this 22-card expansion to your Exploding Kittens game to explode and then come back to life and then maybe explode again.
This is not a standalone game - it requires a copy of Exploding Kittens to play.
Brand new illustrations from the creator of the Oatmeal.
Compatible with all English language Exploding Kittens decks.
This pack has all of the NEW cards from the standalone game Zombie Kittens, including 5 Zombie Kitten cards. Use these cards when you draw an Exploding Kitten to avoid exploding. If you use a Zombie Kitten, you must ALSO resurrect a Dead player, bringing them back into the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Zombies

name: Thornwatch: The Dark of the Wood
description:
Thornwatch is a graphic novel adventure game for 3-6 players that bridges the gap between narrative-driven RPGs and pick-up-and-play board games. A group of heroes fights their way through the comic panels of a world created by Penny Arcade's Mike Krahulik and Jerry Holkins. Each branching storyline plays in about an hour using easy-to-learn character decks and custom dice mechanisms. Gorgeous map tiles and pawns provide a sense of tactile immersion that is unique to each adventure.

Thornwatch: The Dark of the Wood includes two hundred new cards and nine storyboards for play with the Thornwatch base game. This includes five new hero decks (The Briarlock, The Dark Courier, The Unsundered, The Weave-Weald, The Woldsen), five hero trackers, and one new Judge tracker (two Judges).
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Modular Board, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: One World Dominion
description:
One World Dominion is an expansion for Risk. It's a set of 44 new territory cards that replace the standard territory cards. Players may collect sets of cards and trade them for armies or they may play cards individually to take the action stated on the card.

There are 44 different actions; one for each card. Some examples are: "Black Helicopters", "Mind Control", "United Nations", and "Ebola".

Expands:

Risk
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Stratagems of the Warring States: Thirty-six Stratagems
description:
English Name: Stratagems of the Warring States - Thirty-six Stratagems
Chinese Name: 战国策三十六计
Publisher: 上海善见城文化传播有限公司
Offical Web: http://www.sj-city.com/
Game Web: http://blog.sina.com.cn/zhanguoce36ji
Publish: 1.8.2010 virsion 2 "ICE BLUE"
18.4.2011 virsion 2 "FIRE RED"

Awards:
2010 WZY Best Game (China)
2010 WZY Best Strategy Game (China)
(report link<English>: http://www.wanzhuoyou.com/2011/01/19/shanghai-bg-carnival-an... )

Profile:
The Spring and Autumn Period and Warring States Period began after the Royal of Zhou dynasty moved their capital to Luoyi in 770 B.C.,
When battles frequently broke out between vassal states for larger nations to absorb smaller ones. In this game, you, as an omnipotent king, will contend for hegemony against the players just like you.
Why not to try to take advantage of a Bad situation to loot, or the taste of being corrupted by seductive women? Welcome to enjoy the Thirty-Six Stratagems of China.
(This is a card type game designing for 2-6 players older than 15 years.)

A:
Production Characteristics:

The game's background is dynasty of The Spring and Autumn of China ( 770 BC ), game design fully respects the history, description and profile all compiled abstract from the official history: and (historical records ), card skills and special design also respects the Spring and Autumn States history and the historical life of celebrity. Stratagem card described come from the book, and processing of the Thirty-Six Stratagem card of the game, as the story completely designed from the . Building and Arms cards from the same historical data set, be pointed out that the use of cavalry element of a violation of historical facts.
The design of the game full consideration to the needs of different players ,so we support two kinds of game modes:
1: Build model-based benevolent
2: Conquest-based force and power
which is also fully reflects the Warring States period, the founding of two very different way.

B:
Simple Rules:

1: Build model-based benevolent game modes:
Recommend to strategic players,only one can win the game

3 people: (about 30-45 minutes) ,first one who build 3 golden building + 2 other building to win (Recommend)
4 people: (about 40-60 minutes), first one who build 3 golden building + 1 other building to win (Recommend)
5, 6 people (about 60-120 minutes) first one who build 3 golden building to win

Game preparation:
Beginning of the players rolls the decision, according to counter-clockwise, one after one, each one take 1 Countries Cards, 2 Prime Minister cards but should choose only 1, then, each one take 4 Stratagem cards , 8 Army cards. Game begin.

Action steps:
1) Take card: Round began, the first turn pick 2 Stratagem cards , 3 Army Cards
2) Use blue stratagem cards or build: at this time can build a building, can use the blue Stratagem card (non-war Stratagem card)
3) Attack: You can attack other players. Note: if you attack other players, you can't build or use blue stratagem cards again at this turn. Attack by the following process: select the target building ->Declaration of war and asked whether the defence side retreat(need retreat stratagem cards ) -> If the defence side cant retreat then both sides into the battle.
Battle: Use building features (offensive and defensive order) -> Battle and use orange Stratagem cards (attack, defend, third party order) -> victories Assessment -> clean up the battlefield ( Please note the use of time for stratagem, country characteristics and Prime Minister skills )
4) Discard cards: end of turn. Building and stratagem cards limited 4, need to discard the excess, Army card unlimited. Then turn to the next player action

Brief rules:
1) No building player can not attack, except other player use the together attack stratagem cards
2) the number of the Army cards should tell to others
3) 1 player 1 turn can only attack or use together attack stratagem cards 1 time,
4) a player can only be attacked 1 time, unless attacked by the attack stratagem cards,

2: Conquest-based force and power
Recommend to whom love PK players , more cruel and intense. Team war or solo all ok.

3 people: (about 30-45 minutes) lost all golden building, out! (Recommend)
4 people: (about 40-60 minutes), 2V2 or solo lost all golden building, out! (Recommend)
6 people (about 40-90 minutes), only for 3v3, lost all golden building, out!

same as the Build model-based benevolent game mode, but , every one need put 1 set (3 Pieces) golden buildings first before game began.

Brief rules:
Except the golden building, player need at least 1 other color building then can attack, except other player use the together attack stratagem cards.
other rules all same as the first mode.
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Shanjiancheng Culture Communication Co., Ltd. Shanghai.China

name: Canadian Checkers
description:
This game, played mainly in Quebec, is different enough from Checkers to be called a distinct game. It is played on a 12 x 12 board of 144 squares with 30 pieces on a side.

Un-promoted pieces can capture forward or backward. A promoted piece (queen) moves like a chess bishop, and can capture a piece anywhere along its line of movement.

One of the rules that set it apart from Draughts and Checkers is Compulsory Capturing. Once begun, you must take all the pieces you are able without stopping short. To do so means the forfeiture of your piece. This can be a strategic move but trying it more than once during a tournament is not advisable.

This game is part of the Checkers Family

name: Castle of Magic: The Castle Cursed
description:
The Castle Cursed expands Cloud Kingdom's original Castle of Magic game by adding Wild Magic cards to the game. It also offers a replacement set of wizards suited to using the Wild Magic.

A limited edition reprint (30 copies) of The Castle Cursed, containing only 15 wizard cards, was made available in 1998.

Expands:

Castle of Magic
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Templar Queenie 2: The Secret Letters, The Tapestries & The Lamps
description:
Templar Queenie 2: The Secret Letters, The Tapestries & The Lamps, a mini-expansion for Templar: The Secret Treasures, consists of three modules that can be used individually, together, or in combination with any other modules for the game.


The Secret Letters: Each player has one secret letter tile that he can discard to replay a (valid) character that's already in his discard stack. If unused, the secret letter tile is worth 3 VP at game's end.



The Tapestries: Each player has one tapestry tile that he can place in a room. When Remigius awards points in a room, anyone with a tapestry in the room scores twice as many points as normal, then all tapestries in the room are discarded. If unused, the tapestry tile is worth 3 VP at game's end.



The Lamps: Each player has one lamp tile that he can place in a room. When Remigius or Severus ends movement in a room with a lamp, the lamp's owner scores 2 VP, then reclaims his lamp, which can be placed again on a future turn.

name: Catan Scenarios: #WeStayHome
description:
This is a PnP scenario for CATAN and can be used with other expansions as well.

Instead of placing the desert tile in the middle, replace it with a home hex. Place the other home hex where the number 2 token lies. The robber starts in the center.When placing your starting settlements, only 1 may be adjacent to a home hex.

If the robber is moved, either by throwing '7' or by playing a 'knight' card, place it on any terrain as normal. But it can't return to a home tile. The robber doesn't steal a card. Instead every player adjacent to a home hex receives 1 resource card of the type produced by the hex the robber was moved to. No matter how many settlements or cities you have adjacent to the home hexes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Income, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Race, Random Production, Trading

name: Det dårlige selskab: udvidelse #1 – Ekstra upassende!
description: An expansion for Det dårlige selskab. New cards, a few new optional rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game

name: 4 1/2 Minuten
description:
This turbulent card game for the whole family is, so to speak, Mau Mau, only cooperative and on time: All players try together in as little as 4 ½ minutes as many of the total of 95 cards to play. Unusual, because you have to play so that the following players can possibly create as well. And the time is running - either via a conventional timer (kitchen timer or smartphone) or via the Music.

Here's how it works: The cards are face-up and the players have to take down cards in turn - as with Mau Mau you can put the same numbers or colors on top of each other. But you have to rethink: Since all have the same goal - namely, that as many as possible cards are stored within 4 ½ minutes - you play as possible so that the other players can also serve. But there are two discard piles - this increases the chances. But the time is running - it means keep your nerves and overview.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Monster Derby Expansion I
description:
This Expansion pack doubles the fun by adding 25 more monsters.

basilisk, boogeyman, chimera, ettin, ghost, snake, hell hound, hydra, leprechaun, mammoth, manticore, minotaur, pixie, roc, sea serpent, skeleton, sphinx, spider, stegosaurus, troll, werewolf, wraith, wyvern, yeti, make-your-own, and, of course, the gorilla.

You must have Monster Derby to play. Players move monsters to try to engineer a finish by the monsters picked most highly on their secret agenda cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: The Second Most Perfect Moment
description:
Suddenly, a portal opens up and someone walks through it - not just anyone, but you. Again.

Before you can say anything, the other you says, “Shut up and listen. This is a time machine. You know what you have to do.” As you are handed the machine, your mind immediately goes back to that one event that you always wished that you could have changed.

This is your chance to change it. You see on the readout that the machine is already primed to go to the exact date and time that you were thinking of. As you press the activate button, the other you says, “Don’t screw it up like I did.”

The Second Most Perfect Moment is a standalone (and combinable) expansion to The Perfect Moment. It's made up of 3 small expansions that were released in 2019.

Players race to rewrite history in their favor using a deck of only 18 cards. Players use equipment, exploit paradoxes in the time-space continuum, and author their own revision of the past. Featuring a clever multi-sided card system, every card is used by both players based on what they can see. Equipping that card for yourself may just give your opponent the ability they were looking for. Every turn, players activate up to two revealed cards, which each have special effects. After the effects are resolved, the player can optionally score a card to earn up to 3 points depending on how closely they match it. The first player to 16 points wins. It takes careful planning and a bit of luck to avoid failing like you have so many times before. This time will be different.

This time...


This can be played on its own or combined with The Perfect Moment and expansions.

Includes 3 previously released expansion sets of the series, and the solo mode rule set:

1979: A Job Interview Gone Wrong
1987: A Little Espionage Gone Wrong
2010: An Escape Plan Gone Wrong
The Perfect Moment: Echoes (2nd version)
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Jenga: Godzilla – Extreme Edition
description: Classic Jenga reskinned and rethemed with a Godzilla mechanic that forces players to draw increasingly higher numbers of blocks on their turns.

name: Cake of Doom
description:
Take over the world... with cakes!

Players compete to rule Earth by offering delicious bribes of cakes to its inhabitants. They must also watch out for any baking disasters from devious opponents. The first player to control enough regions will win.

A casual, light-hearted card game of cakes and aliens, Cake of Doom is perfect for non-gamers, casual groups, families, or as a palate cleanser for games night.

Let the bribery and sabotage begin!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: KaijuDice!
description:
A game of rampage, you take control of a Kaiju Monster and score points by rampaging the city.
This game is a print and play game for 2 to 4 players from 4 to 104 years old.
All you need are some D6. The first player of the turn throw some D6, and picks one to move his kaiju monster, if the monster ends in a square with a building, it's a rampage ! The building is destroyed. The next player picks one of the remaining D6 and so on... The next turn, the player to the left becomes the first player.
When all the building are destroyed, each player scores one point for one building destroyed by his monster. Players with the higher scores are the winners.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Funky Fungi
description:
See if you have what it takes to be the mushroom master in Funky Fungi from Ridley's Games! In this card-collecting game that will definitely grow on you, forage for the best fungi to be the first player to reach ten points and win the game.

The starting player chooses a mushroom card from their hand to start the round, and the other players must play a card matching the color of this card with a higher or lower value. The card with the highest value of the lead color wins the round, with the winning player getting first pick of one of the cards played that round, the second player then choosing one, and so on. As the game goes on, the aim is to try to collect clusters, or combinations of 2 to 4 different fungi. Each completed cluster has a points value, and the player who reaches ten points first will be crowned champignon!

Be sure to pick your fungi wisely, as some can be toxic and played against other foragers!

A magical mushroom game for fun-gis and fun-girls alike, it's suitable for ages 8+, 2 to 4 players and has an average 30 minute gameplay. Packaged in a travel-friendly, mushroom-style box, this game is super portabella! Printed on FSC paper and with vegetable inks.

—description from the publisher

name: Susan
description:
RulesAn abstract game played on a hexagonal board of 61 spaces.


9 . . . . .

Reminiscent of Go, but the rules are essentially:

Gameplay alternates between the two players, who each have their own color. A player's turn consists of either


placing an off-board stone of their color on an empty space on board, or
sliding an on-board stone of their color onto an adjacent empty space.


You cannot pass. If each player performs three slides in a row (meaning six consecutive plies or game actions being slides in total) then the game ends immediately in a tie.

You win as soon as any of the opponent's stones is surrounded on all liberties. Surrounding this stone is valid by any combination of own stones, opponent's stones, and even the board edges. But if your move causes one of your stones to be surrounded, you lose (even if you simultaneously surround an enemy stone!

6 . . . . . . . .
5 . . . O O X . . .
4 . . O . O X . . i
3 . . . X X . . h
2 . . . . . . g
1 . . . . . f
a b c d e


The diagram shows a situation where setting the next stone onto d4 would result in an immediate win of player X since stone on e4 would completely be surrounded. It does not matter if the surrounding stones are stones of player X or player O.

Suppose it is player X's turn: In the diagram shown above setting stone X on d4 is a win for player X since stone O on e4 gets completely surrounded.

Suppose it is player O's turn: In the diagram shown above setting stone O on d4 is a win for player X, too, since stone O on e4 gets completely surrounded.

Suppose it is player O's turn: Setting a stone onto c3 will continue the game. Player X cannot win any longer by setting his stone onto d4 since then he would lose immediately since this newly set stone is completely surrounded then. He loses even if stone O on e4 gets surrounded simultaneously.

Instead of placing a stone, you can instead slide one of your stones on your turn.


9 . . . . .

a b c d e


Note that in the diagram above stone X on b2 is perfectly safe. Neither player can set onto a1 without losing the game, since the stone set onto a1 would be completely and directly surrounded. The result would be the active player's loss of the game.



References
Original rules text: http://www.stephen.com/sue/sue_man.txt
Note that Stephen Linhart's page uses a different game notation

About the game: http://www.stephen.com/sue/sueabout.html
Java version of the game Susan: http://sourceforge.net/projects/susan/
Note: the Lawa Susan does not seem to include the rule on draw situations on six consecutive set of stones

Play by email server: http://gamerz.net/pbmserv/susan.html
There is a computer version available for the Macintosh as well: http://www.stephen.com/sue/suemac.html

name: War of the Austrian Succession
description:
War of the Austrian Succession is a wargame of Frederick the Great’s first military campaign, the First Silesian War of 1740-42. This was the opening War of the Austrian Succession which eventually involved the major powers of Europe. The intent of the game is to show operational level warfare in the 18th century Age of Kings. There are two sides in the game, Prussia and its allies (the Coalition), and Austria and its allies (Habsburgs).
The map portrays the area in Central Europe where the original campaign took place; each hex on the map represents about 7.5 miles across. Each unit repre­sents a brigade or wing of an army (approximately 4,000 - 12,000 men and their equipment), and each turn represents one or two months of operations, depending on the season.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 280 counters.

name: Aeroplanes: PWS-24
description:
Aeroplanes: PWS-24 is a plane card expansion for Aeroplanes: Aviation Ascendant boardgame.

The PWS-24 was a Polish single-engine passenger aircraft for 4 passengers, built in PWS (Podlaska Wytwórnia Samolotów) factory, used from 1933 to 1936 by LOT Polish Airlines. It was the only series-built airliner of domestic design ever used by LOT.

Aeroplanes: PWS-24 is a free expansion, created by Phalanx Games Polska to celebrate the release of the Polish edition of the Aeroplanes: Aviation Ascendant boardgame.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Transportation
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Andrana Project
description:
THE STORY

Year 2067: global warming is no longer a prophecy but a reality.
The world, as we know it, has changed. Cities, governments, and nationalities got diluted giving way to a single world power, the World Federation. This new order represents few privileged, citizens of former first powers who today live protected from the chaos and misery that invades the planet. The rest of humanity migrates aimlessly on the run from war, hunger, and destruction left behind by climate change.

Meanwhile, the new world, driven by state-of-the-art technology, raises its walls seeking isolation from chaos. Set in the form of Smart Cities and defended by machines, the new world order is forced to find a solution to uncover illegal immigrants who manage to cross its borders and disguise among its citizens. Andrana Project, a Nano chip implanted in the nape of its inhabitants is the new identity document. From this moment on, everything involving a person is linked to their nanochip: their identity, bank and medical details, properties, titles... everything.

Project Andrana is well received by the majority of the population, although many are opposed to its potential risks. In this context, an old ideological movement begins to acquire strength and prominence: The Neoluddites.

Convinced that technology has a negative impact on people, their communities and the environment, Neoluddites believe that social and ecological collapse condemns most of the world's population to live in misery. Although this ideology has been alive for years, its followers had just passively abandoned technology until the arrival of Project Andrana, after which they started to get organized to act as a group. Neoluddites are dispersed all over the world and they know no frontiers. There are different factions, some more pacifist, and other more radical ones, determined to end the hegemony of the World Federation, which has taken technological evolution to the extreme. In time, some citizens of the World Federation will join this movement, tearing their nanochip off, becoming exiles and preparing to fight the system.
Constant confrontations between the World Federation and the Neoluddites will shape the fate of humanity.

THE GAME

This is the plot of Andrana Project, an independent game that will be able to test your strategic ability, emotional intelligence, teamwork capacity and leadership skills.

Andrana Project is a phygital social game, this means that it is a group game, played face to face, supported on your smart phone or tablet.

To play Andrana Project you need a minimum of 4 players with smartphone/tablet and Internet connection. Every player needs to download the game, one of them will start the game and each of them will be assigned a team and a character.

In Andrana Project there are two opposing teams: the Neoluddites and the World Federation. Players from both teams have to discover their opponents to shut them down. The game has different missions that will get upgraded depending on how much it’s played.

Each player will be assigned a different character from each team, which means also different abilities and power inside the game.

These are the main powers of each of them (among many others):

The Neoluddites leader: As the Leader, he can recruit citizens. If he recruits a citizen he/she will become a Neoluddite and will fight for his team.

Neoluddites Doctor: As a Doctor, she can heal herself or any player she wants, so she can prevent that person of dying.

Neoluddites Citizen: As a citizen, they can save someone’ life, giving theirs instead. If they save someone from their team will result in a lot of points.

All Neoluddites have to be careful when stealing the access. If they steal the wrong person their identity will be revealed to that player.

Cybersecurity: As Cybersecurity, they can spy on one player to know his/her identity. They have the module, the Andrana server’s access. The Neoluddites want to steal them. The Agent knows who this person is and he will try to protect him.

DCS Agent: A DCS Agent can arrest other players to disable them in the next round. They are the only one who can recharge their weapon and attack more than once.
They must protect Cybersecurity, being aware of shooting him, if they kill him their team loses the game.

CITIZEN: As a citizen, they can save someone’s life, giving theirs instead. If they save someone from their team will result in a lot of points.

Each player needs to hide its identity from the rest, and at the same time observe their opponents to uncover theirs.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Deduction, Environmental, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Acting, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Simulation, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Blitzkrieg Unleashed: The Battle of Sedan – May 13-14, 1940
description:
Blitzkrieg Unleashed: The Battle of Sedan: May 13-14, 1940, is an introductory level game of the battle between the French Armed forces and Germany's Wehrmacht on May 13th and 14th, 1940. The Germans launched Operation Yellow, the invasion of France and the Low Countries, on May 10, 1940. The main German offensive, dubbed the Sichelschnitt (razor cut), struck through the lightly defended Ardennes Forest and emerged at Sedan. General Heinz Guderian led the German vanguard, the XIX Panzer Corps. The defenders, under the command of General Charles Huntzinger, were determined that the humiliation visited upon France at this battlefield in 1870 would not be repeated in 1940.

This is the second game in the Blitzkrieg in the West Series from High Flying Dice Games

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1.5 hours
Hex: 1 miles / 1.61 kilometer
Units: Battalion to Regiments

Game Inventory:
One 11x17" full color map
One single-side printed un-mounted countersheet (224 1/2" counters)(mounted counters are optional)
One 6-page rulebook
Two Player aid Charts (TEC/CRT)

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 1.5 to 2 hours
publishers: High Flying Dice Games, Schutze Games

name: Panic High School
description: A card game set in recent/modern day Japan. Enlist the use of various school clubs (such as the Chemistry Club and Bunny-Girl Club) to help you in your quest to command the school via taking over the most territory in it.

name: Oxford
description:
Contents:
12 pieces per side; each with O on one side, X on the other.

The board starts with each player having 6 pieces in play; 3 with each symbol.

Each turn, a player brings a new piece into play, or moves a piece a distance exactly equal to the number of pieces they own matching that symbol. At the end of a move the piece is flipped to show the opposite symbol. Movement is orthogonal; forwards or sideways, but never backwards.

An opponent's piece may be captured by replacement, and lost pieces may be regained by moving to the opponent's starting row.

To win, put the opponent in a position where they only have pieces with one symbol in play - it doesn't matter which one!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Square Grid

name: Alphatian Roulette
description:
Aim of the game is to massacre your opponent inflicting him ten (dice) damages!

Players swap each turn between attacker and defender.
During his turn the first player is “attacking”; his opponent is “defending”. The attack is done as follows: the player rolls the five d6, after which he can re-roll the dice he wants (however, each time he must keep at least one die, so that the attack will be composed at most of five rolls).

The goal is to try to damage the opponent, with each “6” being a possible damage.

When the attacker has completed his throws, the defender must try to parry: he chooses one of the numbers shown by the dice and throws all the dice that show that number. But beware!: with a single roll now he has to obtain at least one die with a higher number, and he has only one possibility.

If he fails, he suffers one damage for each “6” that the attacker has rolled, plus an additional damage. If he succeeds, instead, the attacker suffers as many damages as the difference between the thrown number and the lower among the attack dice.

The Roulette is very simple and each game lasts from two to three minutes. Even though, attacker and defender have often strategy doubts.

Also a more-than-two player version exists.

name: Poison Ivy
description: Object of the game is to pick the highest number of green stem leaves from the Ivy Patch and to avoid catching POISON IVY (red stem leaves). You put a bandage on each finger as you select a red stemmed leaf. I guess there is a mild amount of deduction as you should know how many leaves are red stemmed. Otherwise it is a pure luck fest.

name: Clean Sweep
description:
The board is fenced except at the corners, where each corner has a square collection tray (with sides) of a distinct color. There are 4 brooms (look more like paint brushes) - one of each color. There is a garbage can in the center of the board filled with trash.

To begin, 'pop' the garbage can to send the trash flying and landing all over the board. Simultaneously, each player then tries to sweep the 'good' garbage into their own tray and the 'bad' garbage into opponents' trays. Score points for the good trash - a single piece of one kind of trash scores 5 points, two of a kind scores 15 points and three of a kind scores 25 points. Each piece of bad trash scores a negative point.

Highest point total wins.

It appears two versions of Clean Sweep were released. The original(?) version has obstacles you attach on the board, additional colors of trash and brooms of different colors. A second version has a different board, even though the picture on the box is the older version of the board, fewer colors of trash pieces and brooms are all the same color.

name: Shanghaien: Extrakarte 1
description:
This is a small expansion for the base-game Shanghaien. It is based in an extra card called "Shanghai forbidden / Re-roll all dice".

You can download the cards here:

http://www.michaelschacht.net/p/shangXPUS1.pdf (english, letter)
http://www.michaelschacht.net/p/shangXP1.pdf (german, DINA4)
http://www.michaelschacht.net/p/shangXPE1.pdf (spanish)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates

name: Namibia Uranium Expansion
description:
The Uranium Expansion adds a new commodity to the game, which can be prospected by the last player in a round. Uranium can only be shipped via train, however from any port connected.

The set contains of a new player summary card, 12 commodity cubes and 1 commodity disc. The expansion also has a new game turn track which allows for a longer play of 9 rounds.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building

name: BattleTech: Invading Clans
description:
From the back of the book:

They came from the Periphery in devastating war machines piloted by genetically engineered warriors. They are the Clans, descendants of the great Aleksandr Kerensky, the legendary general who led the remnants of the Star League army out of the Inner Sphere and away from the rising tide of war. Their very names strike fear in the hearts of their foes.

Ghost Bear. Diamond Shark. Nova Cat. Smoke Jaguar. Steel Viper. Jade Falcon. Wolf.

But who are these mysterious invaders? How have they changed from their cousins who remained behind in the Inner Sphere? In the tradition of the Clan Wolf and Jade Falcon sourcebooks, Invading Clans details the history, culture and military might of the remaining invading Clans.

User comment:

This book is a companion volume to the two more specific Clan volumes produced for the Wolf and Jade Falcon Clans, and details the other five Clans that invaded the Inner Sphere, to varying degrees of detail. Expanding on the background detail are details and in-game stats for 10 new BattleMechs, two for each of the Clans. These were later reproduced in the BattleTech: Technical Readout 3058, so if you own that sourcebook already you won't get any new equipment out of this one, but the background is useful when constructing games that feature the Clans, as protagonists or antagonists.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Texas Nukem
description:
In Texas Nukem you get a set of countries (hidden for other players) that you need to invade and investigate. If you conquer all of those countries – you don't need to hold them, just investigate them one at a time – then you win the game.

The battle system is ripped from the card game Texas Hold'em. For each battle, cards are revealed one at a time, and players raise each others by throwing in more armies from neighboring countries.

A trashy game of strategy and bluffing on large as well as small scale, with a dash of Euroish balancing mechanisms.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Spargo
description:
Spargo is 3D Go that can be played with a Series: Shibumi set. It uses a 4x4 holes board and balls in 2 colours.

Two players, White and Black, take turns placing a piece of their colour on an empty board hole or stacked on four pieces.

Any group with no freedom (adjacent empty board hole) is captured and removed, except that balls that support other balls are not removed. Other Go rules apply, except that passing is not allowed.

The game ends when a player has no legal moves. The player with the most marbles in play wins.

HAIKU for SPARGO (Cameron Browne):

The roots seek freedom,
but the soil is hard and scarce.
Not enough for both.

name: Clash in the South Pacific
description:
"Clash in the South Pacific" is an operational level board wargame for Battle of the Santa Cruz Island. Players control either the aircraft carrier fleet of Imperial Japanese Navy or United States Navy. Players manage fleet movement, search for the enemy, and aircraft operation. The basic design is similar to Task Force: Carrier Battles in the Pacific.

Winner is determined by victory points based on damage given to only opponent aircraft carrier.

This game was designed for wargame beginners.

Game scale: 75 km per hex, 90 minutes　per turn, 1 ship, 2 Destroyers or 9 Planes per unit.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation
publishers: Epoch, Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: Battle This!
description: BATTLE THIS! is the ultimate two players (Ages 12 to Adult) strategic board game for those who are looking for a challenge. The game consists of two military forces; Green and Brown. Each force has a total of 16 playing pieces: 8 Soldiers, 4 Tanks and 4 Fighter Planes. Each playing pieces move and capture a certain way and each playing pieces are worth a certain amount of points. The objective of the game is to try to outwit your opponent; eliminate all of his / her playing pieces while trying to score as many points as you can.

name: Shingle: The Anzio Beachhead 22 Jan. - 3 Mar. 1944
description:
From the editor's website:

To reinvigorate their stalled Italian campaign, the Allies landed a reinforced corps at the small coastal town of Anzio, just 30 miles from Rome and the German supply arteries. A hesitant advance and a rapid German reaction set the stage for a nip-and-tuck battle for the beachhead.
This classic campaign is covered using the Fire & Movement system at one kilometer per hex and one day per turn. The standard unit is the infantry battalion, which can be strengthened by a multitude of tanks and other heavy weapons, plus fire support markers rated for different weapon types up to and including a massive heavy bomber strike.
Each player has several strategic options, kept secret from his opponent, to use the fight for the beachhead to further the larger campaign. All strategies and operations are constrained by limited logistics; players must balance carefully his expenditures for reinforcements, replacements, and fire support. The player who strikes the best balance, and who best utilizes the various weapons at his disposal, has the chance to achieve a war-changing victory.

Components: One 22 x 34" map & 280 counters

name: Trig
description:
Trig is the root form of a suite of three games collectively entitled The Summer-House Floor.

It's a centrifugal connection game played on the Colour A and Colour B pathways of a regular, 127-cell hex-hex board coloured non-contiguously in Colour A, Colour B and Colour C (Colour C at the corners), with a single black cell - known as the Pillar - at its centre. The board is empty at start of play.

Two players, Black and White, take turns occupying with pieces of their own colour exactly one vacant cell which must be adjacent to the Pillar and/or to at least one occupied cell. If a placement completes an equilateral triangle of any size whose other two vertices are friendly pieces already in place AND whose centre is occupied by an enemy piece, the latter is removed from the board and replaced with one of the mover's own colour. (Where a placement enables multiple captures just one of these must be chosen, and 'cascade' capture is never permitted.) Victory is achieved by completing a continuous string of one's own pieces which, however circuitously, links the Pillar to the edge of the board or forms a loop enclosing the Pillar somewhere within it.

Although demonstrably not undrawable, Trig has never produced a draw in actual play.

name: Famous Divisions: Guards Armoured Division
description:
Guards Armoured Division: Part of The Famous Divisions series by Decision Games, started with Gross Deutschland Panzer (World at War magazine #20) and continuing with British Guards Armour, uses a system that represents a new evolution in design that brings tactical elements to an otherwise operational simulation. Recreating four battles of the British Guards Armour Division in 1944 and 1945, this game includes four battles: Operation Goodwood, Operation Veritable, Bonninghardt Ridge, and Joe’s Bridge. It was designed by John Schettler and developed by Eric Harvey and Ty Bomba.

The Famous Divisions Series offers a new concept: game play is governed by the drawing of "Event Chits" during combat. Combat is not simply resolved by comparing the attack strengths and defense strengths of units, but is modified by a random chit-draw of over 140 possible "events" that introduce the elements of chaos and unpredictability to combat resolution. Event Chits can be nullified by other Event Chits; so players never know how an attack may be resolved based solely on odds ratios.

Each hex represents approximately 500 meters from side to opposite side. Each game turn represents approximately six hours; however, the game turns aren't divided into separate friendly and enemy turns. Rather, each is comprised of numerous individual HQ activations. All of the HQ activation chits are placed into a cup, and each is drawn one at a time to initiate the activation (movement and combat) of a particular headquarters and its associated companies. When that HQ’s activation is finished, a new HQ is drawn from the cup, and then its activation begins.

Famous Divisions: Guards Armour is a special edition game that includes two counter sheets (560 counters) and four maps (on two 22 x 34 inch sheets) of the various battlefields where the division fought. Combat units are individual companies featuring distinct vehicles and weapons, shown as icons along with the unique capabilities of the vehicle or weapon portrayed. At company level the game play is tactical in many respects: units have individual range values, different movement capabilities depending on type (wheeled, tracked and leg), and the rules cover such things as demolishing bridges, pontoon bridges, weather, overrun, supply, infantry riding tanks, direct ranged fire, artillery barrages, opportunity fire, night, fortifications (bunkers, trenches, mines, dragon’s teeth), engineers, armor recovery vehicles, airpower and anti-aircraft.

While not a purpose-designed solitaire system, the Event Chit mechanism makes the series easily adapted to such play, since the player won't know what chits may be drawn that could alter combat, or what order the HQ activations will take place. Some examples of the 140 Event Chits are: Sniper, Good Commander, Ambush, Experienced NCO, Caught in Crossfire, Fanatic, Radio Out, Critical Hit, Frontal Assault, Elite Troops, Outflanked, Hand-to-Hand Combat, and Friendly Fire.

The game includes two maps (22x34”) and two counter sheets containing 560 counters.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 6 hours
Hex: 601 yards / 550 meters
Units: Company

Game Inventory:
Two 22 x 34" full color mapsheets
Two dual-side printed countersheets (560 1/2" counters)
One 32-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15

name: Disc Duelers: Promo Pack
description:
This is a set of five cards for Disc Duelers originally available to backers of the 2013 Kickstarter campaign. The cards are:


Giant Bag of Gold
Firebright
Magic Amulet
Roller Skates
Worldbook
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Racing, Sports

name: Machinas: Death Races in the Wasteland
description:
Machinas: Death Races in the Wasteland is a post apocalypse racing game that features a unique set of mechanics where the players are involved at all times. Unlike other race games where players can drift far to the rear and out of the action, Machinas uses a "pack" mechanic where players are always in the action. Instead of tracking your position on the track we track your position in the "pack".

Machinas is our first card driven game that can be played by itself or added to any existing miniatures or RPG. Machinas is a stand alone game that can be used with any Post Apocalyptic rules, such as our own After the Horsemen.

All you need to play Machinas comes in one deck of cards and the rules. No track is needed and all you need to know to play the game is on the cards! You will have to provide a couple of everyday six-sided dice, but that's it.

Players customize their drivers and cars then race around the track. If you want you can race along highways and roadways in your favorite post apocalyptic setting, it's up to you.

Each driver has three Attributes - Savvy, Tech, and Speed and there's a wide variety of ways to customize your car. When the race starts each player keeps his cards out of sight until needed. Once played the cards are laid out for all to see. This keeps the customization of your car a secret until it is revealed.

But customizing your car and driver is just the beginning.

During the race you have to plan your strategy and tactics. When do you sit back and when do you make your move? Do you try and shoot up your opponents or make dramatic two car passes? Machinas is much more than rolling dice and the drivers with the the right strategy and good tactics will win.

Machinas is a perfect one-off pickup game, easy to learn and fun to play. For the serious gamers you can choose to play the Campaign Game where your cars and drivers get better as you gain experience.
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: Stratagem
description:
Light and fun, Stratagem is an abstract strategy board game strikes a perfect balance of luck and strategy that casual gamers will really enjoy.

This turn-based game can be played with 2 to 6 players. Players take turns rolling a die for movement and claiming spaces on a hexagonal board. When claimed spaced are converted to controlled spaces players score points. The first player to reach a target score wins.

Action cards can be played to support or hinder any player's progress. On each player's turns all players have an opportunity to play one card if they want to.

Not to be confused with:

Stratagem (1998)
StrataGem (2004)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Warhammer: The End of Times – Khaine
description:
From the publisher's website:

Ulthuan teeters on the brink of ruin as Daemons run rampant across its Ten Kingdoms. Meanwhile, in the grim north of Naggaroth, Malekith the Witch King prepares to face his destiny once and for all. Everything you think you know about the Elves of Warhammer is changing.

Warhammer: Khaine continues the epic saga of The End Times. The fate of Ulthuan is described over two softback books.

Warhammer: Khaine Book 1 is a 144-page book which details the third chapter of the End Times,the final reckoning between the Elven races.

Warhammer: Khaine Book 2 is a 48-page rules book that contains six new scenarios and orders of battle based on the events in Warhammer: Khaine Book 1. It includes Magic of the End Times, a new spell lore available to all armies, and new army lists, allowing customers to field a unified Elven army drawn from Wood Elves, High Elves and Dark Elves to match different parts of the narrative. It also includes newly updated special character rules for Malekith the Eternity King; Tyrion Avatar of Khaine; Imrik Crown Prince of Caledor; and Alarielle Incarnate of Life.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Binh Dinh '69
description:
Operational level game of the counterinsurgency campaign in 1969 in Binh Dinh province, central coast of Vietnam.

The Government player, commanding South Vietnamese, South Korean and American units, must protect and improve the security of the civilian populations and major highways while seeking and destroying the insurgent forces. The Insurgent player, commanding elements of the National Liberation Front and North Vietnamese army, must undermine the government's power and replace his governing structures with his own.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment

name: RiaCon Window Pattern Card (fan expansion for Sagrada)
description:
This window pattern card is a fan made expansion for the Sagrada boardgame, featuring level 5 and 6 patterns.
We are listening to you asking why this card has the name "RiaCon"... Allright, allright, you win. We will tell you the story!

In Portugal - similar to other countries - we have annual conventions to play boardgames with people from everywhere.
We belong to the boardgamers group of Aveiro, a city that is known as Portugal's Venice :)
This city is well known for it's river named "Ria de Aveiro", an arm from the sea that passes through the city.
That's the reason why this convention is named RiaCon and the card received the name by inheritance.

As volunteers in RiaCon we had the crazy ideia of designing one card to Sagrada to mark the difference in this event.
In this way, we could encourage the participants that didn't knew Sagrada to try it out and the ones that already knew the game to play it once again.

Now we are sharing it with you and we hope that you enjoy playing with this expansion as much as we do!
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Nemesis: TL;DR Version
description:
This is an asymmetric deck game that was published as a promotion for backers of Nemesis by Awaken Realms.

In this game you wander in a spaceship (10 cards). On your turn you take a card and apply its rules. After that, the next player does the same.

While grabbing eggs or becoming the soldier, you must bluff your way through the spaceship. In this game there are a number of different win conditions.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Agents of Mayhem: Bombshells Team
description:
The expansion adds 3 new characters to play as for the Mayhem player.

Joule, aka Cosima Bellini, is the daughter of the fashion world titan Bellini family. Cosima is one of the most brilliant engineering minds in Europe and worked hard to live up to both her parents' legacies. But her parents had to go into hiding after LEGION targeted her father's work, which drove Cosima to join MAYHEM.
Joule can deplay a Turret which attacks LEGION to draw their fire away from her. Her main Beam Weapon can either damage LEGION troopers or heal her Turret.

Red Card, aka Ingo Rotkapp, made it his job to be the #1 Ultra-Fan for German soccer club FC Rüdesheim. By the time LEGION had started targeting sporting events, Ingo had earned his notoriety as a brutal hooligan. After inciting a riot against LEGION during a championship game, MAYHEM decided that even a loose cannon like him could be the perfect weapon at the right time.
Red Card is a tank on legs, that just charges into battle. He has a harness that releases an explosion damaging nearby enemies. The longer he waits, the more powerful the explosion, but the more susceptible he becomes to enemy attacks!

Rama, aka Pranati Malhotra, is a distinguished immunologist that fought to contain a Dark Matter Plague that spread like wildfire across her country. Now she pursues a cure for the disease and vengeance upon those who unleashed it.
Rama fires an Energy BOW. The longer she charges a shot, the more damage the strike inflicts. Rama also has a special Mayhem ability that allows her to fire a shot that is tainted with a modified dark matter plague. A hit enemy is infected, suffering Damage over Time. When they die, a cloud of poisonous gas spreads the infection to other enemies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Video Game Theme

name: Chain Mail: The Sacred Mask – Adventure Kit
description:
Whispers in the corners of taverns and great libraries alike speak of an ancient mask of great power.

Many an old master look for the artifact and evil powers would kill to control it. Wear it at your own risk, for it is dangerous.

The Sacred Mask is an Adventure Kit for Chain Mail: Adventures of Earthshine.

Goal: Return the Sacred Mask to the Master.

This expansion includes:

Quest: The Sacred Mask
Map: Dragon's Mouth
Monsters: Necro Lich / Skeletons
Treasure: Winterthorn



Released in the January 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Flamme Rouge: Styrkeprøven
description: A promotional track card for Flamme Rouge. The card depicts the setup for a new track that can be played in Flamme Rouge.

name: City of Gears: Gear-Driven Puppeteer Promo Tile
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Promo tile for City of Gears.

Gain 1 point for each adjacent tile containing an opponent's robot.

—user summary
categories: City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Deathwager
description:
Deathwager is a bluffing and strategy game, containing 38 tarot size cards and a steel token. Players collect red "Eye" Cards, looking for Hearts or Skulls symbols. The orientation of the King card determines the fate of the players: a living King upwards means the winning player will be the one with the most Hearts on her cards, whereas a dead King favors the Skulls.

—description from the publisher

name: Käpt'n Kuller
description:
The pirate gang has collect huge piles of loot, and to distribute the treasures, they've decided to play the legendary pirate skittles game.

Who will manage to make the ball roll skillfully down the launch tube in Käpt'n Kuller to hit the desired diamonds and in the end collect the most gold coins?

name: Détective Charlie: part en vacances
description: Four new adventures for Charlie.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Expansion for Base-game

name: DeliCats
description:
We're going on vacation for a few days, and our lovely neighbors have offered to look after our cat. What we haven't mentioned is that our cat has specific eating habits, preferring only a certain type of food and a particular place to eat, but I'm sure they'll manage just fine...

DeliCats is a cooperative logic and deduction game designed for cat enthusiasts. Each player takes on the role of a neighbor tasked with feeding their neighbor's cats without prior knowledge of their culinary preferences. Throughout each round, players will feed other cats, attempting to discern their favorite food or preferred eating spot. By the game's end, players will present food to all the neighbors' cats, aiming to match their individual preferences. The success or failure of the game hinges on your deduction skills.

You'll find a calendar of missions ordered from easiest to most difficult, with variations from the standard 'A Quiet Weekend' mission.

—description from the designer

name: Nemesis: Retaliation – Untold Stories #4
description: Untold Stories #4 provides a cooperative campaign for Nemesis: Retaliation. These new scenarios are presented in a colored graphic-novel/comic-book style.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Ofrendados, the road to Mictlán
description:
Ofrendados is a roll-and-write game where we seek to create the most beautiful "ofrenda" (altar) for our beloved ones and guide them from Mictlán (Land of the Dead) to celebrate with us in "Día de Muertos"

The game takes place over 5 rounds, where players draft dice in order to draw "ofrendas" (altars), build the flower path (and trigger bonuses), collect money, and buy "calaveritas" (little skull) cards to improve your altars.

The winner of the game is the player with the highest points, accumulated via the flower path, the "ofrendas", the cards, and coins. In order to win the player will also need to reach the land of the living in the flower path.

name: 18BL: Bergisches Land
description:
This game is largely based on the rules of 1830, but has a number of new elements that make it a standalone game.

First, the 6 private companies, all of which have a specific function, will be auctioned among the 3 to 6 players. Then the 8 railway companies can be opened. The special feature of 18BL are the rail buses, which are available as an alternative to the normal locomotives. The rail busses reflect passenger transport by rail in rural areas of the Bergisch Land, which was not attractive enough for the use of normal passenger trains. The challenge for 18BL is to find the right mix of locomotives and rail busses according to the available rail network and the connected cities and towns.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Salmon Run: The Grizzly Bear
description: Part of the 2012 Salmon Run Kickstarter campaign, The Grizzly Bear Expansion limited edition card that allows you to move a bear up to 2 hexes. Each salmon in the same hex must discard 2 cards at random.

name: Legacy
description:
In Legacy you will strive to become the new leader of the people of Ilyenashae – a continent upon which the people have risen up and overthrown their previous governments in fear for their safe future. You will campaign to become the leader of the continent’s territories and then create a new infrastructure by building developments in the territories, like citadels and universities.

In your turn you have two actions which can be any combination of: campaign for a territory by playing campaign cards or your hard won influence so the people side with you rather than any other player; progress, where you develop your territories so they produce more or help to defend them from other players; support, where you call on your followers and patrons to provide you with more influence and cards to play; and enlighten where you can play ideology cards like liberalism, utilitarianism and pioneering or even nihilism.

The combination of the ideologies you play shows what form your new government style takes they also give you advantages which will help you to win over the people. Territories and ideologies both give you points which represent the support of the peoples of Ilyenashae. The winner is the one who reaches the tipping point of territories held and ideologies played that convinces the whole continent to follow them.

Legacy gameplay is a mix of strategy, resource management and civilisation building driven by area control and card play.

- - -

"This was already our second chance. We do not dare hope for a third but we must try, or else accept the end of everything. In our desperation we have rid ourselves of all self-serving princes, casting them down the mountain. We now look to those men and women who rise from the flame and ash still flying banners of hope, still urging us on despite the pain and devastation. We now turn to these heroes for new leadership and new ideas on how we should live and rule ourselves for the betterment of all. One of them will forge a new society that will unite all the peoples of Ilyenashae to stand and face our trials together. Our future will be their... Legacy."
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Fighting, Political, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: D-Day Dice: Heroes
description: This 63-card expansion brings 8 new Legendary Units to the game (like the ones included in War Stories).
