These Units (and the new Awards included) represent the lesser known (and often forgotten) countries and cultures that helped the Allied cause: Australia, New Zealand, Poland, Belgium, Norway, Brazil, along with the Maori and the African-Americans. Included are the famous "Buffalo Soldiers" of the US 92nd Infantry Division, the Brazilian Expeditionary Force, the No.10 (Inter-Allied) Commando, and more.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Intervention
description:
Intervention is a party game for everyone's worst habits. Each round, a card reader reads off a question card and everyone anonymously votes for the person they believe best fits the card. Then everyone attempts to guess how many votes they received.

Each round is hilariously revealing as the question cards are often taboo, inappropriate, and all around ridiculous.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Terra on Tour
description:
Terra on Tour takes players on an adventurous journey of knowledge around the world — but if the players don't know what's being asked about, they can still score by being close to the correct answer. What's more, players also assess the answers given by others, allowing you to score from the knowledge (or lack thereof) of opponents.

Terra on Tour is a standalone game, but the cards included can also function as an expansion for Terra.

name: Guderian's War: The German Advance on Moscow, 1941
description:
Guderian's War: The German Advance on Moscow, 1941 is a two-player, low-to-intermediate complexity, strategic simulation (with operational undertones) of the German drive on Moscow during Operation Barbarossa, a crucial part of their attempt to overrun the western Soviet Union in 1941. The German player is mainly on the offensive, attempting to win by seizing key areas on map faster than was done historically. The Soviet player is primarily on the defensive, but the situation also requires he prosecute almost continuous counteroffensives throughout the game.

Game play encompasses the period that began with the Germans launching their invasion on 22 June and ends on 1 September of the same year. The main thrust of the design is to test Guderian's oft-repeated claim he could've led Army Group Center into Moscow during that time, had he only been allowed by Hitler to run a true blitzkrieg.

The game may end sooner than the historic termination time, if the German player is able to do significantly better than his historic counterpart by advancing so quickly he causes the overall political, social, economic and military collapse of the Soviet Union. Alternatively, if the German player doesn't do well enough soon enough, he may lose the game in that it's then assumed Hitler loses faith in the idea of taking Moscow and instead turns AGC's panzers south to Kiev, just as occurred historically.

Each hexagon on the map represents 16 miles (26 km) from side to opposite side. The units of maneuver for both sides are primarily divisions, along with a few units of other sizes. Most German divisions have four steps, while most Soviet units are one-step with unknown strengths upon entry. The effects of the general air superiority enjoyed by the Germans throughout this campaign are built into the movement and combat rules. Each of the nine turns represents one week. The game is easily adaptable for solitaire play.

Product Information
- Complexity: 6 out of 10
- Solitaire Suitability: 8 out of 10
- Time Scale: nine one-week turns
- Map Scale: 16 (26 km) miles per hex
- Unit of Maneuver: primarily divisions for both sides
- Players: one or two
- Playing Time: two to four hours

Projected Contents
- One 34x22" large-hex mounted map board
- Two countersheets of 5/8" size units (352 total), mounted and die-cut
- One rule-book
- Charts & Tables
- Dice
- Game Box
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Honey Scouts
description:
It's the annual spring moon, and the hive is abuzz with excitement. The Honeyscout Tournament is open, and every bee is preparing to battle it out for the top prize. As the Chief Honeyscout of your team, uncover locations of fields of flowers and get worker bees to swarm to treasure troves of nectar you have discovered. Get ready for the buzz of your life!

In HoneyScouts, you place hex tiles to match colors (essentially building the hive), and every time you match a color, you draft a card that gives the location of a flower, with the number indicating the distance between you (the bee) and the flower. When you match colors on the hive to create a complete hexagon of one color, you attract a bee to your swarm.

Why do the numbers on the cards matter? Because the game contains a trick-taking mechanism in which you can win bee battles and attract all the bees from an opponent, poaching them to your side. Special tiles and event cards can throw you off balance or be used to your advantage.

In the end, the player who attracts the most bees wins.

name: Oh Crud
description:
Oh Crud is the fun and exciting new card game that's like 6 games in 1. There are 6 rounds of game play and each round is played slightly different.

Before each round, you roll the appropriate dice which can drastically affect your game play strategy. It's different every time you play!

The object of the game is to avoid getting any CRUD and get the lowest score. When you get CRUD, you get points and you don't want any points because the person with the lowest score at the end of the game wins! Strategize which card you're going to play next so you don't get stuck with the CRUD!

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hot Potato, Trick-taking

name: Slava
description:
Get ready for a strategic showdown in the world of Slava! This captivating war game will test your wits and cunning as you battle for victory in a high stakes war of military prowess. Do you possess the tactical vision to outsmart your adversaries? The battle is on, and the fate of the war is in your hands.

In Slava, your objective is clear: be the first to win five campaigns and claim ultimate victory. Each campaign will have you engaged in intense battles and cunning strategies, and you'll need to make every move count. The main deck contains 40 military cards, with 7 types of units that all have different strengths.To add an extra layer of intrigue, there is a changing weather condition that will influence the dynamics of your battles,
and you have some commanders at your disposal that rank first among their type of unit.

Whether you're dueling it out in a 2-player game or engaging in epic 4 or 5-player showdowns, your choices of when to play what card matter and are critical to success. When to play the bomb and to sabotage your enemies? If I cannot win this battle, how can I influence who will win to maintain a balance of power? The fate of your campaigns hinges on your choices. Now that your troops are ready, you'll dive into the world of Slava.

The game starts with determining the weather conditions for the upcoming campaign, which will significantly impact your strategies. From clear skies to stormy conditions and heavy fog, you'll need to adapt to the elements to secure victory. Each campaign consists of 8 battles, and after every confrontation, the cards are collected by the victor. The player with the most points at the end of a campaign earns a victory point.
The battles are fierce, and the outcome is determined by the weather related strength of your cards. Last man standing rules apply, and the player who wins a battle must start the next one. Special rules come into play, such as a bonus for winning the last battle or the strategic use of the bomb to nullify all points.

Remember, there's no obligation to win confrontations, and you can play any card from your hand. You have full control over how to play!

Can you outsmart your opponents, adapt to changing weather conditions, and emerge as the ultimate commander in chief? The battlefield awaits your strategy and skill!

—description from the publisher

name: Prefect
description:
Prefect is a print and play game and a spin-off of the anticipated 2023 board game, Age of Rome.

The motivation for its creation is best drawn from the official announcement: “Is it just me, or does anyone else get tired of waiting for a KS game to arrive? Well, we are sure a lot of you might be feeling impatient (in a good way, we hope) about Age of Rome's delivery, so here is a little gift to ease your waiting. We thought it would be cool to design a small spinoff pnp game while Age of Rome is moving into production. And we present to you, Prefect.”

—description from the publisher

In the game, one or more players take the role of Prefect, an administrator of a Roman province managing religion, politics, farming, trade, and military. During each round, players roll three dice and select one to grow the province and two to apply as waste. Players balance growth and waste as well as carefully prioritize their choices to earn the most glory points.

—user summary
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kaosball: Ringer – Kongbad
description:
"It's just a game man... Chill out!"

Kongbad is one of the most memorable ringers in the game today, and not simply because he's a huge ape. His laidback and easygoing approach to life, love and Kaosball make him a fan favorite!

He's made a long career manipulating play to cost opponents points in unusual ways, and he's very good at it.

Kickstarter and convention exclusive Ringer.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Kaosball: Ringer – The Warrior
description:
"Wanna know how many times Ive been crossed? Count the kills on the scoreboard."

She's a unique brand of fighter, with a powerfully vengeful spirit. They say on the field, if she's got her eye on you, nothing else matters. Make peace with your gods, and say good night.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Angola
description:
"Angola" is a wargame on the Angolan Civil War, 1975-1976. Focused mostly on the conventional side of the war and little on politics.

Components
One 29”x22” map in three colors
One sheet of 120 die-cut counters
One eight-page half-size rulebook

name: Mr. President
description:
This is the original 3M release of Mr. President, and is an entirely different game from the 1967/1971 release, which can be found at Mr. President.

This version of Mr. President, which can be identified by the tan (rather than maroon) box and 1965 Copyright date, is a much simpler game. States are awarded using a Hols der Geier/Raj-like system, wherein players choose a card from their hand and the high card wins, with tied states carried over to the next turn. Play with 3 or 4 is individual, rather than partnership, with the player carrying the largest number of electoral votes winning.

Even within this edition, there are two versions, with one using a chalkboard and the other a dial scoreboard for tracking electoral votes. These versions also have somewhat different rules:


The 1965 edition has rules for a short game, a long game, and a nominee game. In the latter two games are played. In the first the players of each party compete against each other to determine which is the presidential candidate. In the second the parties compete in the general election, with the cards played summed by party.



The 1966 edition keeps the short and long game but removes the nominee game. Instead it offers the option of scoring by popular votes instead of electoral votes.

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Outland Scouts – Unit Expansion
description:
At the farthest reaches of Terrinoth, remote villages find their protectors in the Outland Scouts Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! These inspirational soldiers use their knowledge of the land to outwit invaders and rally the greater Daqan forces with their indomitable faith. Call your banners and defend Terrinoth at all costs!

—description from the publisher

name: Sports Spectacular
description:
This set contains simple games for six sports. They appear to all be modified versions of the six games in RGI's Play the Pros series, published a few years earlier. The games are:


Baseball, presumably based on Major League Baseball Game by Yogi Berra (no BGG entry)



Football, presumably based on Pro Football Game by Paul Warfield (no BGG entry)



Hockey, presumably based on Pro Hockey Game by Rod Gilbert (no BGG entry - this is not the same as Rod Gilbert's Violent World of Pro Hockey)



Basketball, presumably based on Pro Basketball Game by Oscar Robertson (no BGG entry - this is not the same as Oscar Robertson's Pro Basketball Strategy)



Auto Racing, based on Grand Prix Auto Race Game by Jackie Stewart. This version removes the apex lines, changes the car construction system in several ways, adds pit stops, etc.



Tennis, based on Pro Tennis Game by Rod Laver. This version adds shot cards and makes other changes.
publishers: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC

name: How to Host a Murder: The Hollywood Premiere of Powar and Greede
description:
You and the other guests are gathered -- in the glare of the spotlights at Powars Oriental Gardens Theater for the premiere of Powar Film Studios' newest release, "Powar and Greede." A small, private party for the cast is being held in the Banquet Room adjoining the theatre, while outside, Hollywood's elite mills about, breathlessly anticipating the 8:30 curtain.

Earlier today, W. Anton Powar appeared in the private garden of the theatre where, as a publicity stunt for the new film, the impression of his bare feet was made in concrete beside that of his former stare, Tatyana Eltale. After retiring to his private apartment at the conclusion of the ceremony, Powar was expected to join you and his other special guests for cocktails before the movie starts, but he's running curiously late...

Characters:

Denise Ann Dayer
Hack Ryder
Hi Voltaje
Ivonde B. Alone
Savoy R. Fayre
Sel U. Lloyd
Tatyana Eltale
Stu Dyron.

name: Carnage at Cassino
description: Folio-style accessory for use with Advanced Squad Leader, depicting the allied efforts to capture Point 593 near the Monte Cassino monastery, held at that time time by elements of the German 1st Parachute Division. Players may recreate the many and varied attacks by Indian, American, New Zealand, Polish and Free French troops as they attempted to dislodge the stubborn and resourceful Fallschirmjaegers. Includes 8 new scenarios and 4 new campaign games and a 22"x32" map to play them on.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: 1881: Das Berliner Strassenbahnspiel
description: 1881 is an 18xx game about the tram companies of Berlin and the arrival in the city of the S-Bahn. It was designed by Michael Mette and published by him under license from Hartland Trefoil. It was later released in a free downloadable version.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Panzer General: Allied Assault – Patton
description: Patton is a free expansion card for Panzer General: Allied Assault. He is an Unique Unit (one per deck) and classified as Armor. His special abilites allow him to move and fire. He may move diagonally as well.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order

name: Pixel Tactics: Game Pundit / Zee Garcia
description:
Pixel Tactics promo card from Dice Tower 2014 campaign.

Card text: As an action, you may place a chip on a Hero or move it to a new Hero. Each chip has a different effect:
Target: Hero takes twice as much damage.
Snail: Attacking or Restructuring Hero takes 2 actions.
Crybaby: Hero cannot declare melee attacks.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Clue: The Walking Dead
description:
The group has been betrayed - someone murdered the guards while you were away from Alexandria! Now you've got one goal: to discover the truth and uncover the killer.

You'll step into the shoes of Rick, Daryl, Glenn, Michonne, Carol, or Negan as you search Alexandria for information. You need to discover WHO the predator is, WHERE the guards were murdered, and WHAT weapon used to slay the guards.

Think you know WHO killed the guards, WHERE it happened, and WHAT weapon was used? Reveal your suspicions and see if you're good enough detective to win CLUE: AMC's The Walking Dead.

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies

name: Sengoku: The Warring States
description:
Sengoku: The Warring States is an 18 card combat game. Players take the role of shoguns attempting to take out a rival with the use of their small army.

Over 3 phases players deploy 6 units to attack their opponents villages with the goal of destroying two villages, or the village containing their opponent's shogun. Doing so wins the player a battle. Soldiers remain facedown until the end of phase 3 or when an opposing soldier is placed down as well.

The first player to win two battles is victorious!

Contents:
18 Poker Cards
Folding Box/Rules

—description from the designer

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Orcs & Goblins
description:
Warhammer: Orcs & Goblins is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Orcs & Goblins faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Battle of the Bards: Card Expansion 1
description: A fixed (non-random) pack that contains additional Veteran Bards, Leads and Audiences, increasing the variety and replayability of your Battle of the Bards games. The pack contains 4 new Lead Bard cards, 4 new Encore cards, 6 new Audience cards, and 1 rules card.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Music
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Uh-Oh
description:
This is Uh-Oh, the 1-card game. Minimalist, fun and addicting party game, Uh-Oh plays for 3 to an unlimited number of players, starting around 6 years old and for games of around 5 minutes (maybe a bit more if you are 25 people around the table playing).

How to play:

Freely define the first player, who places the card on its Yay! side in front of him/her.
Each player makes a secret bet under the table (or behind their back) with the fingers of their hand, from 0 (closed fist) to 5.
Everyone reveals their hand at the same time.
The first player moves the card clockwise by the number of players corresponding to his/her bet. (ie. she advances it 3 players if she bet 3.) The player seated to his/her left then moves the card by the number of players corresponding to his/her bet, even if the card is not in front of him/her, and so on, until all bets have been played, or two Zeroes have been played.


The first Zero activates the bomb without moving it. (flip the card on its Uh-Oh side).
The second zero makes it explode! (the player in front of whom the card is is eliminated).

If the card has been moved by the total number bet by all players without exploding, 2 possibilities:
a. Its Yay! side is showing : Nothing happens. Start a new round.

b. Its Uh-Oh side is showing: The bomb explodes and eliminates the player in front of whom it is.
Flip it back on its Yay! side and start a new round.

When a player is eliminated, place the card in front of the player to their left, and start a new round.

If three rounds end without a single explosion, then the bomb becomes a Supernova and obliterates the entire planet. Everyone loses.
That’ll teach you to play safely.

When there are only two players left, the round begins with the card on its Uh-Oh side, and cannot be deactivated.

The winner is the last one to survive.

—description from the designer

name: Monopoly: Jurassic Park Edition
description: Secure dinosaur paddocks and other areas but beware of the T. Rex; it doesn't follow rules! Build fences to protect paddocks from the attack and earn money by charging rent, but prepare for damaged property. Activate the gate to hear the Jurassic Park movie theme song or a dinosaur roar, which will determine how much money to collect. The last player with money when all others have gone bankrupt wins. The game also ends if the T. Rex damages all properties before they can be protected with fences or repaired. Then everyone loses!
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Trading

name: Escape the Room: Murder in the Mafia
description:
The ﬁrst thing you notice when you enter your ofﬁce is Mickey Malone's dead body. Mickey was the chief enforcer for the local Maﬁa. You've had your run-ins with Mickey and might treat news of his death as welcome news, if it wasn't your gun on the ﬂoor next to him. Man, you hate Mondays.

Explore a complete replica of the crime scene to discover clues, solve puzzles, and ultimately prove your innocence in this immersive murder mystery adventure.

---

Escape the Room: Murder in the Mafia is an intermediate level tabletop escape room, with a playtime of 90-120 minutes.

—description from the publisher

name: Deal with the Devil: The Bureaucrat Promo Inquisitor
description:
Promo card given to anyone whom bought the game directly from CGE at Spiel 2022. It was also part of launch kit that brick and mortar stores could pre-order before the release.

This inquisitor will give you minus 6 VP, but + 1VP for each coin on the bribe track.
categories: City Building, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Deduction, Events, Income, Loans, Trading, Voting

name: Castellans
description:
In Castellans, players will compete to build the most impressive jurisdictions in the city of Kosk with hopes of becoming its next Castellan — but this is no easy task! It requires players to navigate the complexities of construction, to pit short-term gains against long-term goals, and to decide between the assurance of small payoffs now or the possibility of larger payoffs later. As construction continues, the local Magistrate wanders each district of Kosk, casting judgement upon everyone's work at different times. Will you out-smart other players and gain the Magistrate's favor? Will you do enough in the big picture — and at the right times — to pull off the victory?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Secrets in the Sand
description:
The Department of Antiquities has uncovered evidence of a series of lost tombs. They have invited you, the world’s leading archaeologists, to help find the lost tombs and recover their treasures.

Each day the Minister of Antiquities will announce one new dig permit, and the first expedition to find a viable route is allowed to travel and dig. Race against competing archaeological expeditions across desert sands, through jungle oases and across rivers to find the tombs. But beware of scorpions, raiders and sandstorms along the way!

Players roll 2 dice to add their first camp to the board. Pick a Minister card which dictates the route a player must travel this turn. Players race to find a path - avoiding obstacles or using travel cards to overcome them. Once a player finds a path, they yell "Carpe Diem!" and move to their new camp and picking up a Dig card which provides a new item or event. If a player arrives ata tomb, they collect the tomb instead and roll the dice to place a new tomb.

The game ends when all tombs are discovered or an expedition runs out of dig camps - whichever occurs first. Either way, the player with the most points wins the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Race, Worker Placement

name: Les Maréchaux II: Dupont 1808 – Victor 1811 – Suchet 1813
description:
Les Maréchaux (The Marshals) is an operational wargame designated to simulate campaigns led by French marshals and generals of French Revolution and 1st Empire, when Napoleon was not directly acting on the theater of operations.

The game includes three scenarios:
- "Dupont 1808" related to general Dupont's campaign in south of Spain against spanish general Castaños, during summer 1808.
- "Victor 1811" related to marshal Victor's campaign near Cadix against general La Peña trying to relieve the cit'y siege with help of an english division, late winter 1811.
- "Suchet 1813" related to marshal Suchet's campaign against general Murray for the last big battle in Aragona, spring 1813.

Players are moving divisions and brigades on a "point to point" map. They have to deal with supply, forced march and to prepare battles. The leaders of each army have a key role in coordinating actions.

The game includes:
- one A4 map for Dupont's campaign;
- one A4 map for Victor's campaign;
- one A4 map for Suchet's campaign;
- 108 die-cut counters;
- independent rules and scenarios booklet.

Available with French rules, but English rules can be downloaded from Vae Victis or Designer's website.


The first game in the series is Les Maréchaux: Junot 1808 – Soult 1809 with two campaigns in Portugal.

name: Quicksand
description: Quicksand is a deep brain-burning abstract for two players, played on a set of Martian Coasters. On your turn, you can either place a pyramid onto the board, or use a placed pyramid to capture other pyramids by jumping over them. After that, you MUST rotate one of the coasters, creating a volatile board that can radically swing the balance of power. The first player to capture 15 points of opposing pyramids wins.

name: Piece Packing Pirates
description:
Ahoy, me hearties! Thar's booty afloat, and me wants me fair share. The sea, she's a-callin' me, so drink ye grog and woo ye lassies tonight, for on th' morrow it's gangplanks and cutlasses. We weigh anchor at dawn!

Piece Packing Pirates is a solitaire sea adventure full of sailing, booty, fighting, booty, mayhem and more booty! The game is playable with a standard piecepack set.

Winner of the piecepack Solitary Confinement design contest.

name: Ad Liners
description:
Enter the wild and crazy world of advertising.
Players view 1 of 75 photos from a real ads. Each player selects an ad slogan from his hand of five. The dealer places all the selected slogans in view of everyone and then a vote is taken as to which one fits the best. Points are scored for having your slogan selected or voting with the majority.
With 400 slogans in the deck the possibilities are endless. The results are often hilarious, but this game is always fun.
categories: Bluffing, Humor, Industry / Manufacturing, Party Game

name: Tradecraft: Spies for Hire
description:
trade·craft (trād′krăft′) n.
The methods used in clandestine operations such as espionage.

Knives in the dark. Secret plans. Information. Disinformation. What more could a spy ask for?

It's the height of the Cold War and you are a spy. You have a mission to accomplish and you would like to avoid being killed while doing it. And you want your side to win, of course. But who, exactly, is on your side?

Tradecraft is a hidden role card game where 3-6 players take on the roles of either Soviet or American spies during the Cold War era. Rather than using social deduction, players will have to carefully watch to see which cards are drafted and how they are played to decipher friend from foe. Players may never willingly show their role to another player, but may say whatever they want about it, even the truth if necessary. The game is played over the course of several rounds and can usually be finished in less than 30 minutes.

Each round has 3 phases:

1. Deal Cards - Roles and tradecraft cards will be shuffled and dealt randomly.
2. Choose Cards - Players will pass a portion of their cards to the left 3 times to draft the cards they want.
3. Play Cards - Cards are then executed in descending order, information flows, and bullets fly.

Scoring is based on the side winning the round (1 point) and completing a public or secret missions (usually 1 or 2 points).
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Modern Warfare, Murder/Mystery, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Farlight: Mission Critical
description:
Farlight: Mission Critical offers five daring new missions for Farlight that feature a unique countdown die mechanic. If you can succeed the benefits will be substantial, but if you fail the mission or can't complete it by the time the die expires, the losses to your ship and resources could be devastating!

Critical Missions are like no other mission you've undertaken before.

1. When a Critical Mission is revealed, roll a die and place it on the mission. This is now the countdown die. Reduce the die by 1 pip after every round.

2. Place bets to attempt to complete the Critical Mission as you normally would. When attempting to complete a Critical Mission you must roll another die, and add the value of your bets to the die roll. The result must be higher than the countdown die for the mission to succeed. If you are unable to complete the mission, the text below “Attempt Fail” is triggered.

3. If a countdown die reaches zero, the text below “Countdown Fail” is triggered.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Amoeba
description:
Amoeba is an abstract strategy game for 2-6 players. Players take turns placing a pyramid, scoring their turn, and adding another poker chip to the playing area. A pyramid may be placed on any empty poker chip. When adding a new chip to the playing area, it must touch at least two other poker chips.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces

name: Destroyer of Words
description:
THE GAME OF LINGUISTIC ÖBLITERATIÖN

A competitive tile-laying word game that gives players the opportunity to blast their adversaries words clean off the board!

Earn points by destroying your opponent's words while strategically building (and re-building) words that will survive until the end of the game.

A player's turn has 4 phases: Building, Attacking, Destroying, and Redrawing.

On a player's turn they can make as many words as they like from the 9 tiles on their rack. Words can extend into other player's areas, but must have at least one letter in the active player's home area. Next, they may perform an attack using one of the 3 Implements of Destruction that are unlocked by playing tiles. Each letter tile contains Attack Points that determine an attack's direction, and an attack may be made from any tile that is part of an unbroken chain of tiles that is located over any one of the active player's Vortexes. Attack range is determined by word length (tiles shared by 2 or more words can use the range of any word they are a part of).

The player removes any tiles destroyed by the attack, and continues to remove tiles until all letters left on the board form legal words. Where a tile is removed from on the board determines it's point value. Destroyed tiles are placed in the corresponding Scoring Pits on the active player's board (no points are scored for tiles destroyed in your own area.

Play continues until the last tile is drawn. Every player then gets one last turn. Points are tallied from destroyed tiles in your Scoring Pits and those remaining intact in your home area. Highest score wins the game!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Network and Route Building, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Soldateska
description: Soldateska is a trick-taking cardgame themed around Prussian military life. Players attempt to win tricks by playing various dueling cards such as pistols and sabers. The most successful duelist will attain the highest rank; while the inept will become a traitor. Complicating things are a bomb, snuff, and Kokette, who officers cannot help but spend their upon.

name: Dust Tactics: Operation "Achilles"
description:
Description from the publisher:

As the war grows ever deadlier, soldiers have come to rely on the safety that battlefield fortifications can provide. This box contains rules to deploy bunkers, strongpoints, trenches, and barbed wire to anchor your front line.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Pocket Sports Baseball
description:
Pocket Baseball is another game in the Pocket Sports line up of mini simulation dice games.

The game contains custom dice for the Pitcher, Batters, Fielders. It's a light dice rolling game that captures baseball in a pocket sized travel or beer & pretzels game.

There is some light strategy in the form of POWER PLAYS to increase fielders or runners play during an inning.

Each game comes with 1 of 5 unique team counter sets.

name: GoRoGo
description:
Publisher's summary
GoRoGo is new Go variant game for two players played with each 10 ordinary black and white pieces and 5 additional neutral ones. Each player has two of the neutral pieces, and one starts on the game board.

Like Go, the game is played on a grid, but the board has only a 5x5 grid with 25 intersections and 40 paths. The purpose of the game is to obtain more of your opponent's pieces, not to claim an area majority.

Since there are only 25 pieces, the game is over after 24 moves at most. A player cannot pass, nor play a neutral piece last. If they don't have a legal move, they lose.

The neutral pieces are both black and white. That is, on Black's turn, a neutral piece is a black piece. Then on White's turn, it is a white piece. This allows moves that are normally prohibited in Go, such as 'Kou'. A player can attack into an area that in Go would be protected.

GoRoGo is a GO game but not GO. It means that the tactics are GO tactics but the strategy isn't GO.

name: Sixteen
description:
SET UP



Each player takes one shield. Fold the wings of the shield and stand it in front of you.
After putting all the tiles in the pocket, mix them well and split them equally among the players.(22 pieces each for 4 people)
When playing with 3 players, each player takes 29 tiles and leave the remaining 1 tile in the pocket. The tiles taken from the pocket are taken inside the shield. Cover the tiles well and turn them all over so other players can't see them.
If the game is played by 2 players, place all 5 colored “1” tiles in the center of the table and put all remaining tiles in the pocket and mix well. Each person takes 30 tiles from the pocket. Leave the remaining tiles in the pocket and do not use them. Then, hide all the tiles in the shield so that other players can’t see them and turn them all over.
If you put the tiles of the same color together, it will be helpful for you to play the game.


STARTING SETTING



- 4 Players : 22 Tiles
- 3 Players : 29 Tiles
- 4 Players : 30 Tiles


GOAL OF THE GAME



Every tile you own is your negative score. The goal of Sixteen is to put down all the tiles you own first, or leave the fewest number of tiles. Tiles can be placed one color per turn, and must be placed in a higher number (in ascending order) than the number of tiles placed at the very end. You can also create an opportunity to remove remaining tiles by using 16END and 16RESTART tiles and special tiles such as scissors and trash cans. Make strategies by predicting other player’s remaining tiles.


SPECIAL TILES



- 16 RESTART(5 : 1 per color) : You can restart the row by resetting the row of that color to the number '1'. Place a tile and pass the turn to the next player.
- 16 END(5 : 1 per color) : You can finish the row of that color. 16END tiles can be removed with scissors or trash bin tiles, but you cannot place 16RESTART tiles.
- Scissor tile(2) : You can remove one of the last tiles in a row. After removing it, you can place the tile one more time. You can only place the tile on the row that you used scissor tiles, or you can use scissor tiles only. Place the removed tiles and used scissor tiles separately next to the table.
- Trash Bin Tiles(1) : You can discard as many tiles as you like, except for tile '1' in a row. You can place the tile one more time after discarding it. You can only place the tile once more on the line where you used the trash can tile, or you can use the trash can tile only. Put the discarded tiles and the used trash can tiles separately next to the table.


PLAYING THE GAME



If there is a tile with the number '1', place it all in the center of the table. The game is played clockwise starting with the player with the red number '1' tile. In the case of 2 players, a random player will be selected to start the game.
When it's your turn, you can place down a tile once. Only tiles of one color can be placed down at a time. Each color of tiles with a number greater than the number of tiles placed at the end (in ascending order) can be placed. You cannot place a tile with a number smaller than the number of tiles placed at the end.
If the ascending order conditions are satisfied, tiles can be laid down in two ways.
(Default) : Place a larger number of tiles than the one placed at the end
(Group) : Lay down a group of consecutive tiles


END OF THE GAME



There are two ways to end a game. If either of them applies, the game ends immediately.
First, if a player has laid down all of their tiles, the game ends immediately and that player wins.
Second, if all players yell ‘PASS’ in one round, the game ends and the player with the lowest score wins.

[How to calculate points]
All the player remove theirs shield and add the number of tiles they have left.
For any remaining 16 END and 16RESTART tiles, add 16 points. For scissors and trash bin tiles add 20 points each.
Consecutive tiles must be in ascending order. If there is no break in the middle, the number of tiles can be placed down at once without a limit. 16END and 16RESTART can also be put down in groups. However, you can't lay down two 16 tiles at once. (Yes. You cannot put down 16END after 16RESTART in one turn)

After putting down the 16END and 16RESTART tiles, hand over the turn to the next player. After using scissors and trash can tiles, you can place down tiles of the corresponding color one more time, and this action is optional and not required. Scissors and trash can must be used until the game ends. If you don't use them and keep them till the end of the game, you get -20 points.

“Pass” if there are no tiles that can be put down in your turn. When your turn comes back, if there's a tile you can put down, put the tile down again and hand over the turn to the next player. The game continues until all players yell PASS or one player has put down all of the tiles they had.

If the calculation is over, the player with the lowest score wins.

If there is a tie, compare the number of tiles and the one with fewer tiles wins.
Ex) When 2 people are tied for the 1st place (19 points), the number of their tiles is compared. The 1PLAYER has 3 tiles, and the 2PLAYER has 2 tiles. Therefore, the 2PLAYER who has 1 less tile wins.


Contact Publisher



MAGICBEANGAMES(Republic of Korea)
e-mail : magicbean@magicbeangame.com
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Movement, Tile Placement

name: Cricket: The Game
description:
Cricket: The Game is a 2-4 player tabletop game, based on the sport of cricket. The game consists of a game board, playing cards, tokens, and dice.

Each team plays an Innings, both Bowling and Batting. The sequence of play is based on deliveries in an over which commence with the Bowler secretly selecting their bowl to deliver. The batter then marks on the field their attempted stroke, before the bowler reveals the bowl type. A rolling advantage is set based on various outcomes in gameplay, that may favour the batter or bowler. Next an Over Deck card is revealed that can affect the batter or bowler with different advantages or disadvantages.

Both teams then roll dice to determine the strength of the delivery and stroke, which may result in a strike, miss, or block. If struck, the ball enters the field where the batter rolls additional dice to determine the distance and bounce of the ball.
As per the sport, the winning team either finishes with the most runs, or bowls the other team out.

—description from the publisher

name: Scrap Racer: Expansion 1
description:
Two new Racers with unique abilities expand the driver field and allows to play with up to 8 players.

Three new race tracks - each with their own rules - mix up the racers' positions.

The Pit Stop allows players to upgrade their racer with new abilities.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Race

name: Forest Sky: Open Air
description:
Whether it's the intimidating vulture or the imitative mockingbird, most birds still pair off when it's time to build a nest.

A 6-card expansion for Forest Sky, featuring 3 2-card sets that can be added individually or in any combination: Mockingbirds, Vultures, and Nests.


A delightful expansion that can be added in its entirety, or just mixing in some of the pairs and not others with the base game to change up the experience. Vultures are nice, since they score either cards from the discard or from the forest which helps pivot when that card you really wanted for your hand ends up locked down elsewhere. Mockingbirds provide wild abilities to let them count as another bird type or value. And Nests score bonus points if you have exactly two birds of the same type in your chosen forest. These are fun, solid additions to the game and exactly what you want to see from an expansion.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Agricola: The Legen*dairy Forest Deck – Peruvian Inquisition
description:
The Peruvian Inquisition is a special promo card given out at SPIEL 2012 in Essen and expands the Agricola The Legen*dary Forest Deck.

Description of the card:

"Nobody expects the Peruvian Inquisition"

Replace all sheep on your farm with llamas. At the end of the game, llamas are scored for all players, using the same values as for sheep.

name: New World Order Battles: Kiev & Ulan Bator
description:
New World Order Battles is a grand tactical wargame of battles that were, or could possibly be fought, in the era since the fall of the Berlin Wall, and even into the near future. Players control actual and hypothetical combat units using a wide range of technologies and forces to gain objectives. Two scenarios are included: Kiev, covering a hypothetical Russian clash with NATO forces at the Ukrainian capital, and Ulaan Baatar, a hypothetical clash between Russian and Chinese forces at the Mongolian capital.

There are two players in each game, commanding opposing forces. Both games use a system of shared rules, and each also has its own scenario special instructions. The game pieces represent military units, supporting firepower, and Netwar operations.

Modern War #22, Mar-Apr 2016

name: Beneath the Lily Banners Second Edition: Wargame Rules for 1660 - 1721
description: A tabletop wargaming rule system designed to give players a real flavour for the tactics and troops used in Europe during the period 1660-1721. The game play is simple and quick to master. The mechanics are based on simultaneous movement regulated by easy to understand orders. The game can be played in 28mm or 15mm scale. 6-8 units per side will give two or three hours of fun. The rules will easily accommodate 100 units per side for grand battle scenarios. The 2nd edition has many refined mechanisms for orders, shooting, close combat and morale. The book has an updated events section with 52 ‘playing card’ controlled game events to add challenges and entertainment to the game play. The rules contain supplementary chapters for gaming the Great Northern War, Eastern Wars against the Ottoman Empire and King William’s War in North America 1689-1690.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Klingon: I.K.S. B'Moth – Collective OP Blind Booster Pack
description: This ship is one of the ships players purchase as an entrance fee to participate in the Star Trek Attack Wing "The Collective Month 1" tournaments.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Wunderkessel
description: The players gather their sorcerer's apprentices around the magic cauldron. They need to uncover ingredient tiles with the right symbols and colors to brew their magical potions. The first player to brew the right mixture of magic potions wins the game.

name: Kotki
description:
Collect treats and toys on your pillow by drawing cards. Be careful about how many, so the card with the dog won't stop you.

In your turn, you can either prepare treats on your pillow or attract cats by offering those treats. Each cat has different value and like different things. Some might even help you in your next moves with their special skills.

Whoever scores 10 points first or 15 in longer version, wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Race, Set Collection

name: Forlorn Hopes
description:
(from ATO website:)

World War Two history has a pattern in both the European and Pacific Theaters. Constant Axis expansion, followed by steady Axis contraction, as the Allies recapture lost territory. In Europe, it is hard to pinpoint the transition point (a good barroom discussion any time!). In the Pacific, it is a little easier to focus precisely at the campaign where the Japanese tide of conquest began to ebb-- their unsuccessful campaign to take Port Moresby, the "step too far."

What then represents the "high tide" of the Japanese Empire? That would be their successful conquest of the Dutch East Indies, one of their most strategically vital targets for the oil and rubber it could provide. A broad look at the record suggest the Japanese mostly had things their own way against the hasty "ABDA" alliance (American, British, Dutch, Australian), with its varied mix of modern and obsolete weapons and widely differing priorities. But a closer look shows that this was a much closer campaign, stretching the Japanese to complete. With a few breaks, the Allies might have held on.

Can you do better? Find out for yourself.

Forlorn Hopes covers the entire two-month campaign for the region, using a system that fully integrates air/sea/land operations. Derived from the popular titles "Chennault's First Fight" and "Operation Cartwheel" (both published by ATO), this game give both sides difficult choices in facing their different challenges.

The Allies are spread thin and facing multiple routes by which the enemy can attack. They know the maxim that "those who defend everything defend nothing" but deciding what NOT to hold is difficult. You must make the Japanese pay for every gain...

The Japanese face an enemy already in control of much of the battlefield and fighting with their backs to the wall. They have a schedule crunch and must weigh to benefits of using high cost assets to gain objectives. The cost of success at too high a price is long term failure (and who will tell the Emperor?).

BOTH players can choose to increase their available forces, representing greater emphasis in overall planning. But the reinforcements come at a cost in victory points that could tip the scales to the enemy. Both sides are charged with using assets as effectively as possible. This is not an easy win for either side.

Forlorn Hopes, the 2012 Annual, delivers the extra size and contents you expect from ATO. Full color 22" x 34" map. 288 die-cut, full color large 5/8" counters provide players with the air, ground, and naval units which actually fought in the campaign, plus some which could have been there.

Maps - One full color 22"x34" mapsheet
Counters - 288 full color die-cut 5/8" pieces
Rules length - 16 pages
Charts and tables - 4 pages
Complexity - Medium
Solitaire suitability - Average
Playing time - Up to 2 to 3 hours for the smaller scenarios, 12 to 15 hours for the full campaign game

Design - Paul Rohrbaugh
Development - Lembit Tohver
Graphic Design - Mark Mahaffey
categories: Aviation / Flight, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Multiple Maps, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Three Dimensional Movement, Victory Points as a Resource

name: MAYOIGA: The Lost Village
description:
User summary
迷家-マヨイガ - The Lost Village (MAYOIGA - The Lost Village) is a game from a popular Japanese anime series. Mayoiga translates as "Illusion House" and the name comes from Japanese folklore stories which say that those who have visited the mysterious house in a hidden village will gain wealth. In the anime, there is a hidden village but no illusion house.

Form a team of five out of 30 characters, and survive them!

"Mayoiga - The Lost Village" is a survival horror card game which is based on the Japanese TV anime program of the same name. In this game, characters confront the NANAKI, monstrous beings shaped by the characters' own mental traumas.

Reveal a number of character cards equal to the number of players plus one on the table. Players strengthen the characters' mind by playing mind cards of five types on them. Then each player adds one of the characters to that player's team, along with mind cards on that character. However, the NANAKI devour the remaining cards on the table, making themselves hard to be overcome. At the end, the characters must confront the NANAKI which has been grown by the players' intentions!

Publisher's summary
日本のアニメーションを原作にしたカードゲーム！

30人のキャラクターの中から5人のチームを作り、生き延びろ！
トラウマが具現化したバケモノ〈ナナキ〉と対決する
サバイバルホラー・カードゲーム！

公開されたキャラクターカード（プレイヤーの人数+1枚）を、
心の力を象徴する5色のマインドカードで強化し、チームに加えていく。
だが、残ったカードはナナキに吸収され、成長していくのだ。
プレイヤーの思惑を吸収しながら成長するナナキと対決するのだ！！
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery
publishers: Pony Canyon, Inc. (株式会社ポニーキャニオン / Kabushiki kaisha Ponī Kyanion)

name: Not Men But Devils: The Battle of Camerone
description:
Refight the Battle of Camerone, a ten hour fight in the heat and dust near Vera Cruz on April 30th 1863 between the French Foreign Legion and the Mexican army. Regarded as a defining moment in the Foreign Legion's history, after the battle and learning just how few French troops there were, the Mexican commander exclaimed, "These Are Not Men, They Are Devils!"

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Simulation

name: Бэнг! Звёздные Войны
description:
============Russian description============Культовая настольная игра — теперь в мире «Звёздных Войн»!
Знаменитый настольный спагетти-вестерн переносится в Далёкую Галактику, и на смену бандитам, помощникам и шерифу придут повстанцы, штурмовики и сам Дарт Вейдер. Вы станете легендарными героями Оригинальной кинотрилогии и примете участие в перестрелке галактического масштаба. Вооружитесь бластерной винтовкой или световым мечом, догадайтесь, где союзник, а где враг, и выполните секретную цель вашего персонажа.

«Бэнг! Звёздные Войны» предлагает поклонникам оригинальной игры новую игровую механику — «Встреча с судьбой». Теперь, когда персонаж игрока окажется на грани гибели, он сможет разыгрывать усиленные версии обычных карт, чтобы получить возможность на последнем издыхании переломить ход истории.
Сыграйте в знаменитую игру по новым правилам и станьте героем Далёкой Галактики!



============English description============Bang! Star Wars

The world-renowned spaghetti western shoot-out — now in the world of "Star Wars"!

"Bang!", one of the most famous spaghetti western board games, is transferred to Galaxy Far, Far Away, and the Outlaws, the Deputies, and the Sheriff are replaced by Rebels, Stormtroopers, and Darth Vader himself. You will become legendary heroes of the original movie trilogy and will take part in a shootout of a galactic scale. Arm yourself with a blaster rifle or lightsaber, guess where your ally is and who your enemy is, and fulfill the secret goal of your character.

"Bang! Star Wars" features a new game mechanics — "Meeting Fate". Now, when a character is on the verge of death, they will be able to play enhanced versions of their cards to get the opportunity to break the course of history on fumes.

Play your beloved game according to the new rules and become a hero of the Galaxy!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fighting, Party Game, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Kill Steal, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: BLUE
description:
BLUE is a game from the RED, BLUE, GreenGreenerGreenest trilogy.

BLUE is a three-coloured tile-laying game for three players. It is a crossbreed of the games RED and Hong, by the same designer.

The three colours in the game are white, gray, and blue, and each player will be a different colour. The tiles have the same design as in Hong, but combining those 3 colours in a black background. So there are 3 types of tiles in total.
A row is a straight line of one or more aligned segments of the same colour with a semicircle of that colour on each end. A spot is a circle made of 2 semicircles of the same colour with no segments in between.

Players place tiles on the table trying to create as many rows and spots of their colour as possible.

name: Momiji: Morning Dew
description: Morning Dew allows you to play Momiji with up to 5 players. Morning Dew cards can also be added to a 1-4 player game in place of another leaf type. The blue Morning Dew leaf cards can be collected in their own pile in a player’s personal area as usual, or they can be played as Wild cards/Jokers. When played as Wild you can add it to the top of any color of leaf card following the usual rules. You can also play any color of leaf on top of a blue leaf. You cannot have two or more leaf cards of the same color visible on top of your piled at the end of your “play leaf cards” action, and you can never play a blue leaf onto a closed pole showing the Torii symbol. If used as a Wild, immediately take the blue leaf token (-3 victory points at the end of the game).

name: Hanamikoji: Geisha's Road – Kickstarter Goodies 2
description:
Hanamikoji: Kickstarter Goodies 2 are the stretch goals unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign of Hanamikoji: Geisha's Road launched on October 26, 2021.

The goodies include:
3 Special Guests
2 Item Cards
5 Geisha Powers
1 Scoring Sheets
4 Special Postcards
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Force Commitment, Hand Management, I Cut, You Choose, Set Collection, Sudden Death Ending, Tug of War

name: Sherlock Solitaire
description:
Sherlock Solitaire is a solo and/or co-operative card game that puts players in the shoes of Watson and Holmes! Take on some of Sherlock Holmes' most famous mysteries in this smart, quick strategy card game.

With a little luck, you may even be able to thwart the dastardly Professor Moriarty and his agents once and for all! Are you clever enough to survive and solve the case?

Contains 55 game cards and a rules sheet.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Novel-based, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Ordering, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Bottom of the 9th: Scholar
description:
Scholar is a promo card for Bottom of the 9th and was offered by Foam Brain Games at Gen Con 2015 in a vending machine at the Asmadi Games booth for 75 cents.

Scholar, listed on the card as one of the Sentinels of the Ninth, is one of the heroes of the Sentinels of the Multiverse. He is a left-handed control pitcher. He has the Philospher's Pitch in his arsenal. He doesn't receive fatigue due to his pitches, but he also cannot be relieved during cleanup.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Mini Crimes: Family Matters
description:
In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

Mini Crimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyse a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

In Mini Crimes: Questioni di Famiglia ("Mini Crimes: Family matters"), the elderly Mrs Bingley, widow of Lord Crawford, a wine-collecting banker and vintage car collector, is found dead in her study, slumped on her desk like she was sleeping. What's happened?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Speed Rugby
description:
Rugby game with dice.
There are 6 dice in this game and players roll these on their turn. The Different dice have different faces like: Try, Drop, Penalty, Play, and Validation do the actions according to dice.

A game is played over two halves. The Player with the highest score at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Ascension: Rise of Vigil – Mudfin Angler Promo Card
description:
Mudfin Angler was sent out to participating Game Day stores on May 2013.

Text on card:
Mudfin Angler - 6 Powers
Monster
"Reward: Gain 5 Honour Crystals. Choose an opponent and name a card. The chosen opponent reveals their hand and you put any of the named card into your hand."

name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Defender of Vigil Promo Card
description:
Defender of Vigil is the January 2014 promo card for Ascension.

Gain 2 Rune and 2 Power.
Gain 1 Rune for each Apprentice you play or have played this turn.
Gain 1 Power for each Militia you play or have played this turn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Roll Saga Baseball
description:
Roll Saga Baseball is a tabletop fantasy role-playing game that brings the excitement of big league strategic action and the realism of the ballpark to the table.

You'll be acting as Owner, General Manager, and Manager (OGM) and playing your games on a large 28 x 28 inch premium game mat that is not only a replica with precise dimensions, but also convertible: it converts into any one of the 30 major league ballparks in two simple and quick steps. Your game mat rolls up after each use to be stored nicely in its own box and carrying case along with all other game components.

On the field, you'll be using real replica scoreboards and full teams consisting of 40-man rosters. You won't have to refer to a lot of charts, either, as we've printed most of what you need right there on the player tokens themselves.

How Games Are Played - A General Overview:

Games in Roll Saga Baseball are played just like games in true-life baseball. Game players act as Owners, General Managers, and Managers (OGMs) of baseball teams that consist of a full team roster of 40 players.

Each OGM (Owner/General Manager/Manager) selects his team and places all of the individual player tokens (each player token represents one team player) onto the field's dugout - the large white box on each side of the field. Each OGM then performs the necessary pre-game preparations like selecting a batting line-up (batting order) and choosing what starting, relief, and closing pitchers that they want to have in the game.

As each player comes up to bat, his player token is placed into the batter's box at home plate. The next batter in line after that batter would be placed in the on-deck circle.

With a batter in the batter's box, the opposing team's OGM would then control his pitcher on the mound by selecting certain types of pitches to throw, targeting the locations of those pitches (according to each individual pitches movement), and rolling 3 six sided dice to determine the success of failure of the pitching action. Each roll is augmented by that particular pitcher's pitching ability (PIT), like '+3' for example, that would be added to the roll to increase the overall sum of the total. Pitchers, just like all other players, can have special skill-sets (like Pitching Under Pressure, or Endurance, for example) that can further augment plays and increase the pitcher's overall game performance.

The batter (the OGM playing with the team at-bat) decides to swing, let it go (not swing) or bunt. If he decides to swing, 3 six sided dice are rolled to determine the hit success or failure and, if hit, what type of hit (grounder, hot grounder, line drive, hard line drive, or fly ball results). If a hit is made, another roll is enacted using 3 six sided dice to determine the direction and speed (power) of the hit. Just as pitchers have a PIT ability that is added to their pitch roll, batters use their batting ability (BAT) which is expressed as a 'plus' to augment their 'to hit' roll. Additionally, batters have power ratings (POW) that are used to determine how much extra a hit can travel in feet (like, +50', for example). And just as pitchers, and all other player positions, there are many different skill-sets that can be possessed by a batter (like Clutch Hitting or Place Hitting).

As each play is played out, all of the things that are performed in a true-life baseball game are enacted by the opposing OGMs (Owner/General Manager/Manager) like fielding the ball, throwing the ball, running the bases, stealing, playing off base, sliding into base, picking off, etc. Every single action, bar none, of baseball is accurately replicated in Roll Saga Baseball through a precise and fluid game mechanic true to the game of baseball as we know it to be.

As the game continues, the player tokens are moved around the game mat/field just as players in a real baseball game would move in the course of a game: coming to bat, running the bases, running in the outfield to catch hits, and throwing the ball to get the opposing team's runners out.

Scoring and Winning - A General Overview:

Each team scores points just as in baseball - by bringing a base runner into, and across, home plate.

To keep score, authentic replica scoreboards are used. The scoreboards are erasable (marker included) and have places to record runs, hits, errors, balls, strikes, and outs - among other things. The team with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Levels of Play:

Roll Saga has been designed to be very flexible in levels of play in order to ensure that those who don't know a lot about baseball can play at a level that does not require much knowledge. And, conversely, those that are baseball enthusiasts can replicate true baseball strategy and action without error.

It has been designed for 1 (solitaire) or two players.

Additionally, these levels of play can be mixed during any game so that any action or series of actions (like an inning) can be simulated and other actions can be played out. A full game can be played in as little as 30-40 minutes, or as long as it takes for a normal major league baseball game (2-3 hours) depending on what the OGMs decide during the course of game play.

name: The Last Friday: Buby
description:
Buby is a promo character for The Last Friday. At the begining of a chapter, players may decide to play Buby instead of a camper. Buby comes with a set of special rules indicated in the card.

Buby cannot collect/remove tokens or pick up keys. However, Buby can still take refuge in a cabin if it is open and not full yet.
Buby special ability is "Fright". At the end of the turn, if the maniac is adjacent to Buby, the maniac needs to reveal himself and Buby must move one additional white dot.

This promo card was given out at Gen Con 2016 when buying a copy of the game, as a stretch goal given free to everyone who pledged for the 2016 Man vs Meeple Season One Kickstarter campaign, and as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Memory, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Ares Games, Galakta, Heidelberger Spieleverlag, KADABRA, Pendragon Game Studio

name: Ninja All-Stars: Clan Kitsune
description:
Description from the publisher:

Clan Kitsune is a clan expansion for Ninja All-Stars which contains enough miniatures to build a complete Kitsune-themed team. Clan boxes feature dynamic and unique sculpts for players’ favorite teams. They also introduce two powerful new troop types to players’ existing collections: large-sized Oni and a fearsome clan Hero.

Clan Kitsune are the mercurial mystics and and expert herbalists of the hallowed spirit trees of Kagejima. With access to an abundance of herbs and fungi found nowhere else in the world, they create and trade their remedies and poisons for the wares of other clans. Yet, in their cunning, they are keen to keep the most potent and arcane of their creations for themselves. Due to their whimsical and often wayward nature, many of the more stoic clans view the Kitsune as unreliable rogues, but their friends simply see them as wise tricksters.

name: Tar'Aram
description:
Tar'Aram is a tactical game for 2-6 adventurers who try to find the secret access to the treasure chamber of the pyramid. Therefore century old mysteries have to be solved and obstacles must be cleared out of the way. But every adventurer should be faster than his opponents, because only the first will have access to the legendary treasury.

Tar'Aram is a special game with unusual card-based game mechanics. The combination of race, tactical consideration and solving a mystery creates a unique feeling of playing. The playing field consists of several different parts, which is why the game board can be combined individually.

The game is aimed at players aged 10 and over, who have fun in tactics and deduction games. The rules are learned quickly, the game itself is attractive by its many possibilities for both casual and multi-player.

The name is composed of arabic tariq = way and aharam = pyramid, by the way.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Thieves Market
description:
You are a master criminal looking to earn bragging rights at the annual Thieves' Market by bringing the rarest and most valuable wares for your discerning customers. All sales are final, but you may find items you worked hard to obtain being sold in another rogue's display! You'll have to find the right balance between choosing items to add to your own display and sabotaging what your rivals stole fair and square!

Thieves' Market is a drafting microgame for 2 to 4 players. Each player is a world-class thief who will be attending an underground international auction. The sneak who brings the best goods earns bragging rights for the year. First, they'll be choosing their targets and building their collection. Afterwards, the auction provides them the opportunity to ply their trade against one another.

Each player gets a hand of potential targets for them to rob. All players select a card, and at the same time they decide whether to put that card into their Display or their Stash. Cards in the display are face-up on the table and are worth the value in the top right corner. Cards in the Stash can be used for the action on the card later on. After players have allocated their cards, they pass their hands around the table and repeat this process until there are no more cards.

After drafting, everybody has the chance to use the cards in their stash to affect the outcome. Players will go around the table stealing, breaking, or switching out items in an effort to be victorious. Card effects range from very strong to practically useless, but so do their value in your display. Figuring out the best cards and whether they belong in your display or in your stash will determine the outcome.

Once both phases are complete, players will add up the value of their display and any relevant set bonuses. The player with the best display wins the round and is the most lauded at this year's auction.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Bitoku: Promo 2 – Yama Uba & Meijo Promo Cards
description:
Originally available as part of the Man vs. Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter.

Yama Uba is an alternate Yama Uba card to use in place of one of the four already in the deck. Either obtain a dragonfly or crystal. Worth six victory points if removed during Winter.

Meijo is an alternate Meijo card to use in place of the one already in the deck. When you reach this card in your Bitoku path, you are awarded with four victory points and a +3 amulet.

name: Ein Junge und ein Riese
description:
I went on a trip that day in search of ancient giants.
A sudden outbreak of the Black Death robs 15-year-old Theo of his quiet daily life. In order to save his mother life, the boy decides to enter the forbidden "dark forest".

The Giant and the Boy is his card game using 80 cards in two colors. Only players who overcome hardships by using their cards carefully and sometimes boldly will be able to survive. May the giant tree Muurometsu bless you!

name: Blanc-Manger Coco: La Geekerie
description:
The irreverence Blanc-Manger Coco now attacks the world of the fans of the imagination and digital culture. You like the Marvel saga and the hugs with our friend Pedobear, the sequences of "0" and "1" make you think of poetry more than arithmetic: La Geekerie is for you!

Mix the cards or not with the other games in the range: you decide.

Contains 160 reply cards and 40 question cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: War of Civilizations
description:
War of Civilizations is a 4x strategy board game set in the year 2050 on a climate change-affected dystopian earth. Players take on the role of clan leaders and compete to gain mystical powers, acquire resources, and build powerful war fleets to conquer land and defeat rival clans. The game requires players to balance their acquisition of powers and resources with their warfare tactics, while navigating the challenges of a harsh, post-apocalyptic world.

The objective of the game is to achieve dominance in one of two ways: either by controlling the Isle of Myth for three consecutive rounds with the capital ship, or by accumulating the maximum number of magic crystals.

SUPREMACY: Controlling Isle of Myth for 1 full round after paying Ocean crystals for Upkeep.

WARFARE: Win against Capital Ship.
OR
Win against the opponent fleet or *Pirates.

EXPLORE Apex Island.

EXTERMINATE: Eliminate an opponent and gain their magic crystals and resources.

THE END GAME GETS TRIGGERED WHEN ANY PLAYER ENTERS THE ISLE OF MYTH FOR THE FIRST TIME IN THE GAME. WHEN THE END GAME IS TRIGGERED, THE GAME WILL END IN THE FIVE ROUNDS THEREAFTER.
categories: Fantasy, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Network and Route Building, Player Elimination, Turn Order: Progressive, Worker Placement

name: ChamboulDé
description:
The game rules : for 2 players or more, each player rolls the dice once and writes down his score.

1 pair - 1 point, 3 of a kind - 3 points, 4 of a kind - 8 points, 5 of a kind - 20 points, 2 pair - 6 points, 1 pair + 3 of a kind - 10 points

The first player to reach 100 points or more wins the game.

—user summary

name: De Slimste Mens ter Wereld: Het Bordspel – Uitbreidingsset
description: Expansion for the boardgame based on a Belgian TV quiz adding more questions and 2 more players. Every player has a digital display with a timer. You start with 60 seconds and you can earn seconds with correct answers. After 4 rounds, the 2 leading players struggle for victory in the final round. In this round, you have to give correct answers until your opponent`s timer reach 0
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Krayton Expansion Pack
description:
The Krayton was a Ferengi D'Kora-class Marauder in service in the mid-24th century. Under the command of DaiMon Tog, the Krayton abducted Betazoid ambassador Lwaxana Troi, her daughter Deanna, and Commander William T. Riker.

They were tracked down by the USS Enterprise-D and Captain Picard was able to secure the release of the prisoners.

This ship is the competitive prize for Month 1 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Dominion War.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Tron: Assault on MCP Game
description:
FROM THE BACK OF THE BOX: "TRON is a fantastic, futuristic 3-D action chase based game based on Walt Disney Productions' motion picture. Players race to be the first to reach and topple the MCP Tower, an evil computer intelligence with designs on world domination, with "light discs" shot from the bases of their movers. They battle the dangers of the fantastic "Electronic World" along the way, the dangerous Tanks and Recognizers, the deadly Sark's Arena Challenge and contests of shooting skill against the other players for "light disc" weapon supremacy."

A path-race game based on the movie, TRON. Various spaces and situations in the game pit players against one another, Sark, or the Master Control Program by the players' pawns firing "light discs".
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Knight Chase
description:
Knight Chase is an enjoyable and quick-playing abstract strategy game from Alex Randolph, featured in Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games.

Knight Chase is played on a chess board using one black and one white Chess knight and thirty markers. Starting at opposite corners of the board, white attempts to capture black. Each player moves his knight according to standard Chess rules but also places two markers on his previous location as well as on another location of his choice. When all 30 markers have been placed, white has ten more moves in which to capture black. If he is unable to do so successfully, black wins by avoiding capture.

There are two more rules:
1) If either knight is unable to move, the game ends and black wins because he avoided capture.
2) If your opponent's knight only has one remaining place to move, you may not put a marker there.


Re-developed as Pferdeäppel
publishers: Dover Publications, dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Hugendubel Verlag, Hutchinson, Random House, Inc., RBA Libros S.A.

name: Shadowfist: Reloaded
description:
The first fixed Shadowpack for Shadowfist.

From the website:

"The first 50-card expansion set for the new format features a combination of new cards and reprints (plus a few familiar old cards with a new slant!). The set is non-randomized and features seven cards per faction and eight Feng Shui sites."
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Dark Maiden
description:
Dark Maiden is a cooperative adventure games in which the players advance through 4 different sites (village, forest, mountains and finally the Castle of the Dark Maiden) completing the required points in each site, to face the final bosses of each site. The last enemy to defeat is the Dark Maiden.

On their turn, a player can walk 1 field and draw 1 card or run 2 fields and draw 2 cards. Afterwards, all cards of all players are resolved. The cards can contain dangers or opportunities, and also the enemies that need to be defeated. Battle is resolved by dice. Each time a site boss is defeated, players will advance to the next site, but so will the boss of the previous site who will now become a subordinate boss on the new site, therefore increasing the difficulty of each site.

Players win if at least one of them survives and kills the Dark Maiden before all the players' lives are finished. The players can decide on how many lives to start with to adjust the difficulty level.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Codenames: Cartes promo – Personnalités
description:
This is a promo pack of ten additional double-sided cards for Codenames.

Michael Jackson / Laure Manaudou
Zinédine Zidane / Barack Obama
Albert Einstein / Angelina Jolie
Cléopâtre / Michael Jordan
Céline Dion / Chuck Norris
Léonard de Vinci / Édith Piaf
Jacques Chirac / Marie Curie
Steven Spielberg / Nelson Mandela
Jeanne d'Arc / Jamel Debbouze
Shakespeare / Lady Gaga
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Magic: The Gathering – Innistrad: Midnight Hunt
description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering returns to the gothic horror world of Innistrad. Since we last visited Innistrad in Eldritch Moon, Emrakul's lingering presence has been causing the days to become shorter and shorter, and if nothing is done to stop it, an eternal night will soon fall across the land, leaving nothing to stop the werewolves and vampires from overrunning what's left of humanity. At the Harvesttide Festival, a group of witches has gathered all the defenders of the day together at the Celestus for a last-ditch ritual to bring back the sun—but the werewolf leader Tovolar and his Dire Pack are ready to lay siege to the festival to stop them.

Innistrad: Midnight Hunt features the return of the ghosts, zombies, vampires, werewolves, and humans of previous Innistrad sets, but with a special spotlight on werewolves. The set contains more werewolves than any other expansion in Magic history, and all of the werewolves (as well as the witches) have a special alt-art "equinox" showcase version that appears about half as often as the normal version. The flagship mechanic is Day and Night, a revamp of the original werewolf mechanic from Innistrad. Other new mechanics include Disturb, Decayed, and Coven.

The set contains 277 cards (100 commons, 83 uncommons, 64 rares, 20 mythic rares, and 10 full-art "Eternal Night" basic lands) and is sold in draft boosters, set boosters, collector boosters, theme boosters, and bundles. Two tie-in Commander decks were also released alongside the main set: Coven Counters, a green-white deck themed around the Coven mechanic, and Undead Unleashed, a blue-black zombie deck based on the Decayed mechanic.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That
