name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Camping Activity Promo Card
description:
A new activity card.

Add the card to its respective deck and play proceeds as usual.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Income, Open Drafting, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Legions of Middle-Earth
description:
The Legions of Middle-earth expansion book is the definitive guide to playing head-to-head games of The Lord of The Rings Strategy Battle Game. With over 40 army lists to choose from, each with its own flavour and unique options, you can create a themed and balanced force from your collection. In addition, rules for allies allow you to use much of your collection, while still respecting the books and films, allowing greater tactical flexibility and the chance to add some favoured models to your army.
(Publisher Website)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame

name: Mercante: Shipment & Fleeting Promo Cards
description:
Both cards were included inside AEG's version of Patronize

Shipment:
Auction the top card of the shipment deck without looking at it

Fleeting:
Severin & Odette
Each player with an agent assigned to Skulduggery loses two crowns. Remove all ages from Skullduggery and place them in the unassigned agents area
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Florenza: Captains of Fortune
description:
Florenza: Captains of Fortune consists of six cards that represent the "Captains of Fortune", with their correlated tiles for the draw from the bag. This new kind of character allows you to take the field in Renaissance battlefields to gain glory...and some extra resources!

This expansion also includes resource multipliers to make it impossible for players to run short on tokens during the game.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Renaissance

name: The Pollination Game
description:
[from the box]
Give and take in the world of flowers, their friends and foes.
A stimulating card game of educational fun for all ages.

Provides marvelous examples of the mutual interdependence of plants and animals and makes a fascinating and beautiful deck of cards. Insects, birds, and flowers benefit each other in pollination. Get the right pollinators together with the right flowers and score points! Play 5 different games with this beautifully illustrated deck of 72 cards.

name: Beyond Words
description:
Contains six competitive paper-and-pencil word games by Sid Sackson, each named after an author suggested by the style of the game: Tolstoy, Joyce, Dickens, Poe, Carroll, and O. Henry.

Part of a series of five paper-and-pencil game books by Sid Sackson, including Beyond Competition, Beyond Solitaire, Games of Art, Beyond Words, and Calculate!.
publishers: Hugendubel Verlag, Pantheon Books, Penguin Books

name: Urusei Yatsura: Tomobiki-cho Kaigui Wars
description:
Complexity 3 based on Tsukadas 1-6 scale (1=easiest)

The game of Scuffle in Urusei Yatsura

Based off the wacky love/comedy science fiction anime/manga series Urusei Yatura.

Run around the city buying food to keep your strength up as events lower your strength. Uses cards for the events and characters, and a board for running around the city. Characters like/dislike each other to different degrees (which does affect the game), and have special abilities unique to them.

Japanese intensive, in both the rules and the cards.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action/Event, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Stat Check Resolution, Team-Based Game

name: Off Course
description: Players advance around a Monopoly style outer board collecting cards which they use with a die to play an inner 9 hole golf course.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Spells & Spell Casters, Phantasy Realm Expansion #001
description:
This first expansion for the Phantasy Realm fantasy-adventure board game includes 2 new characters (allowing for 6-player Phantasy Realm games), 2 new adventures, a number of new encounters and magic objects and introduces spell casting (63 spell cards) and magical mounts (special Encounter chits).

The addition of spells allows for increased direct interaction between characters, while the spell themselves support the competitive-not-elimination style of play found in the basic game.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Orbit War
description:
"Orbit War is a stylized game of tactical space combat in the 21st century . . . The playing board consists of eight concentric orbits around a central body; this central body represents a star in all games except the invasion scenario, in which it represents a planet."

Players control individual ships orbiting around a planet. The object is to defeat the enemy fleets by destroying their flagships. Written orders for movement and combat are executed simultaneously.

Note that this is an entirely different game than Wallace Wang's Orbit War released by Steve Jackson Games.
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Bias, Events, Grid Movement, Negotiation, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: PDQ
description: Based on the long-running (1965-69) game show, the object is to convey a long word or short phrase to your teammate using as few letters as possible. Ideally, the teams are two teams of two players each, although there are rules to play with as few as three players or as many as six.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Falcon's Maze
description:
A Game of Race, Fortune, and Strategy

The object is to be the first player to move two Scepters from your side of the board to your opponents.

Scepters are clear plastic pawns. The board is 19x19 with a center square called the Falcon's Keep. The center square is where a scepter is placed when it is captured.

Each player has 100 small gemstones to place on the board and which allow their scepter to land on that square. Gemstones in each set are random.

Dice are in a clear plastic shaker.

Players move by making a mandatory move of one of their Scepters in a straight line from one gemstone to another. It is possible to cross over empty spaces

Players then roll the dice and may choose to move their Scepter or place additional gemstones. The Hop move can also be used to capture an opponent's Scepter.

The Scepter moves in a hop move to adjacent gemstones to a max number rolled on one die. (The other die is then used to place a gemstone.)

Placing gemstones depends upon the number rolled on the dice and opponent gemstones can block placement.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Game Auction
description:
From the designer's description on Web-Grognard's (slightly edited):

Game Auction is a satirical look at the wargaming hobby and the games, people, and companies that make up the hobby. With tongue firmly planted in cheek, I have designed a game that simulates all the fun and craziness of a live wargame auction. Based on MODERN ART, the game adds event cards that may be played on yourself or on an opponent during the course of an auction (and includes such cards as "buying frenzy" where your emotions take over and you want to buy anything that has cardboard and dice, or the ever popular "Paranoid" where a player has come to the conclusion that a person is bidding against him not for the game but to out bid him--it has become personal). The game also adds condition cards that are played after a round of auctions is completed. It simulates that moment when you finally open the box that you've just purchased. With condition cards, you can find anything from a designer's autograph to mildew. The game also comes with a complete description of the companies and games that are up for sale. You will run into companies like EGO Games, "considered by many including themselves to produce the ultimate wargames, this company features some of the most famous personalities in the hobby. Renowned for their use (some would say abuse) of color, their games feature everything a wargame should have and a lot that isn't necessary. Their motto is 'If you can't understand our games, we are not surprised.'"

name: Oh Nuts!
description: Object is to be the first player to collect each of five colors and fill your card. Each player chooses an illustrated squirrel-away card and takes a nut catcher. Now place the colored balls in the game tray and turn on the game. The balls will now be whirling around the tray. Each player races to try to catch the whirling balls by coming down directly on top of them with the nut-catcher.

name: Vallée de la mort
description:
from thr MGDG website:

By the beginning of 1954, both French and Viet Minh realized that the war in Indochina was nearing an end. Ho Chi Minh had requested cease-fire negotiations in Geneva, Switzerland, and the French government was looking for a way out that would give them peace with honor. Both sides felt that a "big win" on the battlefield would finally secure at the peace table what they had been unable to obtain in six and a half years of war.

The site of this battle would be near a village called, in Vietnamese, "Seat of the Border County Prefecture" located in a distant valley of north-western Vietnam near the Laotian border. The French high command, under General Henri Navarre, reasoned that such remote location could not be successfully attacked. General Vo Nguyen Giap thought the position was nearly impossible to defend. The siege of Dien Bien Phu would be the result.

Vallée de la mort is a simulation of this epic siege that ended the French colonial presence in Asia and marked the beginning of a 21-year struggle for national unification. The game is designed for 2 players, one taking the role of the French commander of the fortress complex at Dien Bien Phu, the other of General Giap commanding the Viet-Minh forces laying siege. The game and scenarios are small enough to be played solitaire, however.

name: Aboculis
description: A black marble is put in the center square of the board and a cover is placed over it. The two players in turn introduce a marble into the board, pushing the marbles already inside into new positions. The winner is the player who manages to push the black marble out.

name: Rock 'N' Roll...The Music Biz Game
description:
"The first authentic game about all areas of the music biz.

Being a rock star today puts you in SITUATIONS with all types of people-from record companies to agents, lawyers to other artists and more. All of these people have an impact on your career-sometimes good...sometimes bad.

Invented by two music biz pros, ROCK N ROLL...THE MUSIC BIZ GAME will let you experience all the excitement that comes with a career in the music biz and give you real world knowledge of the various types of SITUATIONS that you can run into along the way.

You start off with a little money and ultimately retire with as much as possible by spinning your way through 5 albums and everything that goes along with them:
~Feel the excitement as your hit single works its way up the charts.
~Race against other players to be the first to retire with a big bonus.
~Enjoy unexpected great tours and record sales.
~Experience the disappointment when a band member quits or find that you just missed a great gig because your agent went on vacation.
You will need skill and plenty of luck to hit it big!

The game is self-contained and includes the spinning album and tone arm, hit single spinner, 9 types of situation cards (50 of each), checks, ticket/instruction card and gold record marker pieces to keep track of where you are in your career.

Anyone who has ever been interested in what the music biz is really about will enjoy playing ROCK N ROLL...THE MUSIC BIZ GAME. This fun, fast-moving, true-to-life game will delight you and your friends over and over." (Taken from box).

name: Profit Farming
description: According to Sid Sacksons "A Gamut of Games": Action is primarily determined by landing on spaces and by drawing cards. But players make choices between used or new farm equipment, between paying the bank for services or lesser amount to an opponent, and when to buy or sell land.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gators!
description:
Player 1: Colonel, the friendly island nation of Unnarstan has been engulfed in revolution. The surviving members of the government have asked for American intervention. Your MEU (Marine Expeditionary Unit) is in the area, but there are no other forces available, and speed is of the essence, so the Marines have the ball. Your task is to fight your way into Unnarstan, occupy the capital, and bring the rightful government back there before you run out of supplies, which will happen in 15 days. You have advantages in numbers and quality, and you get to choose where your invasion will go in, but time and terrain are against you. Semper fi!

Player 2: Liberation! At last, our fair nation is free of foreign influences! Generalissimo, you have done well, but the imperialists are sure to react to our coup. Our armed forces are equipped with American weapons, so if they try to intervene, you can give them a taste of their own medicine. You must fight wisely, for we are outnumbered, but we know our own land and can defend it well. All we require is that you delay the invaders until their supplies run out, and then annihilate them at leisure. Death to the invaders!

Gators! is a 2-player wargame depicting a modern US Marines amphibious operation. This is a complete game with counters and maps (you must download my M8 map system separately). All you provide is a six-sided die.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Alquimix
description:
From the box of the game: "In Alquimix, all the fantasy of ancient science become a thrilling challenge!
"Each player has 5 test tubes and color tokens representing chemical substances and cards. Using these cards players transfer one, two or three tokens from one tube to another. Their goal is to make proper combinations of colors, as depicted on the bottle cards."

name: Flames of War: Stars and Stripes – Intelligence Handbook on US Armored and Infantry Forces
description:
Stars and Stripes is a supplement for Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game, the World War II miniatures game. It provides the complete organization and equipment for US infantry and armored forces in North Africa and the Mediterranean. Also included are variants for Ranger Company, Parachute Rifle Company and Armored Recon Company. History of 'Bid Red One' Infantry Division is also provided.

There are new Reconnaissance rules, tactics guide, painting guide, three American Warriors and two new missions for Flames of War.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Pig Out
description:
PIG OUT is a party game in which players take a pig character (including Burnt out Boaris the drunken lout, Lady Gammon Steak a toffee nosed sow ...) and place them at the start which is at the center of a playing board that spirals outwards to the finish.

Players move from start to finish, based on dice rolls attempting to collect a total of six donuts on the way.

Donuts are earned on pink squares through successfully answering a "Squealer" question. Each card provides a subject and a number (5 Bad Habits, 6 Pizza Toppings etc.) which the player must "name". Failure to complete the task earns players a penalty in the form of a Pig Out card.

The other coloured squares - blue, green and yellow involve the initiation of three different types of word games (memory, connections and opposites) that all players participate in until one of the players slips up and is punished by being awarded a Pig Out card.

Whenever a player fails to complete a task then he/she draws a Pig Out card and follows the instructions - which normally result in some kind of forfeit.

The first player to get to the "Home" space with 6 donuts, having survived the hazards arising from the Pig Outs, is the winner.

name: Australian Menagerie: Coral Reef Habitat
description:
This is the Coral Reef Habitat add on for Australian Menagerie. The animal cards included are 4 Coral, 4 Dugong, 4 Loggerhead Turtle and 4 Parrot Fish.

Each animal card is unique, it has *different* information about the animal on each, as with all Australian Menagerie animal cards.

Environmental Threat: Climate Change
Management Strategy: Climate Change

There are also 3 Habitat place mats included with a coral reef illustration.

Expands:

Australian Menagerie
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game

name: Tri-words
description:
Players try to score the most points by making words from randomly drawn Tri-tiles (the 5-sided triangular pieces) consisting of letters and wild cards (designated by stars)

The rules describe play for 2 to 6 players. However the cover states the game is for 1 to 6 players, and it's not difficult to see how a player could play solitaire against the timer.

name: Spooky Stories Game
description:
From the publisher:

Test your creativity by inventing terrifying tales that frighten, bewilder and electrify your fiends… ahem, friends. Your goal is to discard all of your tokens by seamlessly continuing the story using phrases on your Snippet Card. The player ahead of you just described a basement full of severed heads that moan for the return of their bodies. Now it’s your turn. You draw a card that says, “She ran screaming through the night into the woods.” How will you weave that phrase into your tale? Be quick and make sense! Take it to summer camp… take it on family outings… take it anywhere you want to send people scurrying into their sleeping bags! Includes 50 cards, 25 punch-out tokens and instructions. For 2 to 10 players.

Gameplay:

All the picture tokens (axe, noose, ghost, skull, etc.) are passed out and everyone draws a story snippet card. One person reads an intro card, and then players continue the tale incorporating the story snippets on their cards. If they mention an object on a picture token, they get to discard it. Other people can discard more than one token named during the storyteller's turn. If the storyteller doesn't make sense or takes too long, they must take a token from the discard pile. The first player to get rid of all their tokens is the winner.

name: CyborGladiators
description:
Kidnapped from your home world by decadent aliens, you have been transformed into a deadly cyborg warrior battling in star-crossed arenas for survival, glory, and, just perhaps, your freedom. You are one of the CyborGladiators!

This fast, fun, and furious tabletop fighting game includes rules for creating your own cyborgs with more than 30 unique cybernetic implants, earning glory in careers mode, and building an endless variety of arenas filled with dangers such as flamethrowers and pools of boiling acid for exceptional replay value. Featuring a cover by Bart Willard and interior art by Bart Willard and Richard Cox, the game includes a cardstock sheet of foldable color cyborg figures or you can play using your own action figures or miniatures. Ages 13 and up, no game master required

Expanded by:

Invincible

name: Vimeiro
description:
DTP publication on the Anglo-French encounter at Vimeiro in Portugal on 11 August 1808. Uses the La Guerra de la Indepencia system rules (12 pages) which cover leaders, formation, various types of combat, including cavalry charges, and morale. The scenario employs a small number of event cards. The scenario rules are only 2 pages, although the long list of Peninsular battles announced for this series never came to fruition, except for Rolica. The DTP production values are high for the counters, including oblong line-formation units, as well as 7 pages of color Player Aid Charts, although the map is 'functional'.

Game system:
- scale 250 m/hex (140 yrd/hex);
- time = 15 min/GT;
- strength = 100 men/SP (infantry), 50 men/SP (cavalry), 3 guns/SP (artillery)

name: Playing Politics
description:
Playing Politics
Seven games that bring out the politician in all of us.

From the back cover:
"This is a book of games and a book about politics. It is for anyone interested in politics, or who likes playing games - or who thinks the two are synonymous anyway. It is intended also as a useful adjunct for both teachers and students of politics, adding a practical, constructive but enjoyable dimension to their studies.
It is about getting your own way, seizing power, making money, reneging on your promises. Players can be politicians, form parties, fight elections, overthrow governments and make all kinds of deals. From 'Primitive Politics' to 'Rolling Logs' and from 'Elections' to 'Agenda', each game is an attempt to capture the cut and thrust of political double-dealing."

The author hopes that the games in this book will be fun to play and can be enjoyed by people who don't care about politics. However, the games are intended to show some aspect of the political process. Ten fundamental laws of nature that apply to all the games are set out in the first chapter of the book. Each subsequent chapter gives the rules of a new game and includes a discussion on strategy and how the game relates to reality.

The games in this book are:
1) Primitive Politics (number of players 2 to 2,000,000,000)
2) Entrepreneurs
3) Elections
4) Coalitions
5) Coelections
6) Rolling Logs
7) Agenda

The games can be played with a minimum of equipment - pencils, paper, money, playing cards.

The book was originally published be Pelican in 1979. A revised edition was published by OUP in 1997.

name: Iowaopoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Gym Shoe, Graduation Cap, Alarm Clock, #2 Pencil, Bicycle

Board Spaces:
Kinnick Stadium, South Johnson, Herky the Hawk, Iowa Memorial Union

Cards:
You're picking up a pizza from Pagliai's. Collect $25 from each player.

It's 10 degrees below zero in Iowa City, IA. The token of your choice is frozen for two turns.

Recite the fight song or lose one turn!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Les 7 Royaumes Combattants
description:
From the box :

The "7 fighting kingdoms" is a strategy and diplomacy game, taking place in the antique China.
Each player is leading a kingdom; his aim : Unify China, and by all means, war or negotiation, money or betrayal, because in order to be the China master, you must be a great general as well as a fine politician.

Including :
800 counters
1 color map
7 game charts
1 rules booklet
Rules for 2 to 7 players
Complexity : 7/10

name: Viva Fidel
description: Viva Fidel is a Solitaire wargame of the Cuban Revolution - only a pencil and eraser needed. The player commands the guerrilla forces. To win the city of Bayamo must becomes pro-guerrilla.

name: The Thirty Years War
description:
This is a very small, very inexpensive ($1.79) wargame covering the whole of the Thirty Years War. The three players represent Austria, Sweden, and the Palatinate. Production, political influence, and status are all kept on a small record sheet. The map and counters are made of paper. Victory is determined by victory points based on captured cities and aggregate political influence.

Obviously published on a shoestring, there's enough meaty game play here to have warranted a more substantial treatment.

name: History of War: "Fall Gelb" Edition
description:
"Fall Gelb" is an expansion for the base-game History of War which introduces the French forces into the game. The expansion consists of two sets - one with the French forces and one with the German forces. The expansion may not be played stand-alone although there are included new base improvements, territory improvements, upgrades and action cards as well. But the mixture of the cards concentrates on the units of each side.

Expands

History of War
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Paris Paris: Zusatzkarten Expansion
description:
This is an expansion for Paris Paris, published in the Abacus Spiel catalog. Instead of picking a special route tile, players pick a tile with 3 stops on it, and keep it secret until the end of the game. You score points for however many houses you have at those stops, and lose points if you have no houses on them.

Expands:

Paris Paris

name: Piazza degli Affari
description:
The game tries to represent the world of the Stock Exchange in a simplified manner.

Components:
A board
A quote sheet
A block sheet of operations
Money
Share Certificates
Event cards
6 pawns
2 dice

name: Cross'n GO
description:
from the publisher

This game is built on a mobile checker board, which you composed differently at the beginning of each game. The player can only move forward on the road of his color; he has to move the bars of the checker board to proceed by following the points to move the bars. Your stake will be always TO CHOOSE between building your road or putting barriers on the road of your opponent, or even, destroy this road… Your behaviors will have to be well-balanced: “too nice” and you will be blinded and immobilized, “too nasty” and you will have to face the unforeseen obstacles raised by your opponent and also by yourself.

name: Maillot Jaune: Le Jeu de Bernard Hinault
description:
This cycling game is based upon the Tour de France. The box contains 1 board (46x46 cm²), 6 cyclists, 2 dice, cyclist cards and energy indicators. The game consists of 3 different étappes or stages.

Each player controls one cyclist with 3 stars in one specialty, either climbing, descending or riding on a flat terrain. The stars (3, 2 and 1 respectively) determine how fast a cyclist can go on each type of terrain. To speed up, there are two ways to attack, either a risky or normal attack. A risky attack means that the energy of the cyclist will decrease. A cyclist can also follow the slipstream of another player, which will cost the cyclist in front 1 energy point. Winner is the player who gets the best overall result in the 3 stages.

The "Maillot Jaune, Le Jeu de Bernard Hinault" version is based upon Tour de France legend Bernard Hinault, five time winner of the Tour.

name: First Sino-Japanese War
description:
This is a Japanese wargame on the First Sino-Japanese war 1894-1895.

A small game with only 30 counters with monthly turns.
publishers: Banner Of War, Game Journal, Kilovolt Design

name: Bataplouf
description:
This unusual take on Snap or Pairs takes place in the bath
Contents include; 25 waterproof playing cards, with 5 different fish character designs. Cut out models of the 5 fishy characters to float around and catch when a match is made
Also includes a fishing net to dry the cards

Divide the waterproof playing cards between the players and float the 5 fish characters around in the tub. Proceed to play as you would do in 'snap'. When a match is made the first player to grab the matching floating fish (which will be swimming around the players) wins the pack of cards.

Ages 4+
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Nautical, Real-time

name: Les Apprentis de la Manufacture
description:
Les Apprentis de la Manufacture is the first game from producers L'Auberge des Jeux.
Each player take the role of a manufacture, attempting to create Jouy fabrics to gain the rank of Royal Manufacture by Queen Marie-Antoinette. Each turn players can visit the Market, the Auction House or the Artists' House, in order to buy goods, create fabrics or hire artists. The player who creates the most valuable fabrics will win the game.
The game consists of illustrated fabric boards and cards. A supply of 'Ecu' (paper money) is also provided.
The production is richly illustrated and has tonnes of thematic flavor and text information.

name: The Aleutians Campaign: The North America Theatre in WW2
description:
(from the publisher:)

During a war that blazed across most of the world, there was only one place in North America that was invaded and occupied by the Axis. The hard fighting that took place in the freezing fog and the logistical nightmare of getting there in the first place doesn't get the place in the history of the Second World War that it deserves.

This game is a strategic simulation of the fighting in the Aleutians between Japan and the United States from June 1942 to August 1943.

Most game turns represent one month of real time. Winter turns represent two months.
Contents: two 11 x 17-inch game maps, 247 counters that have to be mounted and cut-out, charts and tables, English rules
publishers: Blue Panther, Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社), Schutze Games

name: Warrior Dice
description:
This is a dice game for 2 players.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Players are warriors that fight each other using dice.
Use the tables to see what's the meaning of the die result.
While attacking and defending don't forget to see your Life Points! If they are reduced to 0 then you have lost.

name: Section D'Assaut
description: A 1:1 tactical ww2 miniature game on battlegroup level. many supplental rules and scenarios in VaeVictis magazine.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Price of Glory
description:
From the publisher website:

Introducing our new WWI system, this is a stand alone game, allowing you to game small unit WWI actions. Rules include infantry, cavalry, artillery, vehicles, plus barbed wire, trench crossing, gas, and more. Troop lists are very flexible, allowing you to decide what you need to fight. Players of DH/C7B will be familiar with some mechanics, but you do not need DH/C7B to play.

name: Game Night at Nate's
description:
(This game was a one-of-a-kind gift for Nate (Cavedog_pdx on BGG) designed and assembled by his regular gaming group. He had no idea what 14 of his friends were up to!)

From the English rules:

It’s Game Night at Nate’s! As the regulars trickle in, the haggling begins. What to play?

In this highly realistic simulation, you earn points by having fun. Play lots of games with lots of people. Earn bonus points when you play your favorite games. Better yet, dive for a seat in a game with everyone’s favorite host, Nate. The player who earns the most points by the end of the evening wins.

name: Road Cycling Tour: Travel Edition
description:
Using the same movement rules of standard Road Cycling Tour, this version provides a simplified set of track segments while also applying an advanced rule that is an optional variation in the standard game. This means each player’s cumulative selection for the special movement category (energy bursts for breakaway and sprint actions) must fit within a maximum budget restriction.

Note that the current written version of the rules relies upon a prior understanding of the standard game (most importantly regarding rules of movement). It does not provide a stand-alone description.

Dice are not used, here. Each player controls a deck of 48 cards for all movement, and each card contains information to serve multiple purposes. Players can divide the cards as they wish, selecting some for special movement skills (bidding for breakaway and sprint) while the remainder constitutes a random-draw stack that will be used for basic movement (ordinary counts of zero through 4).
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Racing, Sports

name: Pop Opinion
description: Each player starts with a small popcorn bowl (provided in the game) containing 20 pieces of popcorn (supplied by players). Players take turns answering questions about each other such as "Room in the house where I spend the least time" and "Vegetable most like me". When players are correct, they eat a piece of popcorn. The first player to eat all of his/her popcorn wins.

name: Tannhäuser: Eva Kramer Winter Pack
description:
This official extension has been published in the French magazine "Des jeux sur un plateau" issue 40.

This extension includes John McNeal winter pack (character sheet plus 4 new items), Eva Kramer winter pack (Character sheet plus 3 new items), Ksiaz castel pathfinding resume, Ksiaz crypt pathfinding resume and Tesla base pathfinding resume.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Wargame, World War I, World War II
publishers: Jeux sur un Plateau, Take On You

name: Corvus
description:
A fast play set of rules for fighting naval battles in the Mediterranean sea in the period 320 to 30BC. It aims to avoid book-keeping in favour of simplicity and playability. Each side plays alternately, moving all of their ships to shear off oars, grapple or ram the enemy, whilst the non-moving player can shoot back. Combat resolution is by a comparison of dice throws, with additional tactical factors. It is designed to be played with miniatures but full colour counters are provided as an alternative.

This was a Society of Ancients subscribers' game but is also available separately.

name: Athene
description:
With the unspeakable events of Troy behind them, the Greek Captains steer their ships for home. But Athene will not let these acts go unanswered and marshals the storm clouds as they have never been marshaled before, and nor will they be again. As the storm rises, and the currents take a greater and greater hold of your ship, can you steer your way home, or will you be swept into an inescapable whirlpool, or off the edge of the world?

Athene is a game for 3-6 players. The game is played on a grid of tiles. The tiles start off as calm seas, and players play cards to control the movement of their ship. But as the game progresses, the tiles are turned over to reveal the currents, and the players have less and less control of where their ship goes. The longer a ship stays at sea, the more valour the captain will earn, but ultimately you have to get home before the seas become unsurvivable and your ship is lost.

Due to lack of interest, JKLM have decided not to produce this game.

name: For the Birds
description:
There are 4 game rules included in each deck.

This game was developed for two purposes. It was developed with young children and their parents in mind. All age groups can play the same game and experience challenges appropriate to their age. Secondly, we chose birds because they are important to our ecosystem and have significant habitat overlap with humans. We wanted to create a game where children and adults would learn about the natural world around them. As a result of that learning, we hoped people would go out to explore and protect their natural world.

More games rules are available for free download. Games include basic memory games for children, and more advanced set building and area control games for adults.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Memory, Number
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Trick-taking

name: The Civil War 1861-1865
description:
A game for two players; one being the North(Blue) and the other being the South(Gray). Game is played in alternating Game Turns, each composed of a series of sequential phases.

Part of the One Page War Series
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Lineage
description:
Official Site: http://www.lineageboards.com/

Lineage is a two-player, turn-based, abstract strategy game designed by Ray Li at age 16 for a school project. It is played on a board of intersecting ovals and lines.

The Objective: Capture the four center points.

Game Setup: You start the game with ten of your pieces on or within the starting oval, and the other two on the center points on your right.

Game Mechanics: On each turn, you must either move one of your pieces or force an enemy piece.

--Moving your own pieces: A piece may move to any intersection along the lines it is on, unless another piece is in its way. Also, every line that goes off the board is connected to the other side of itself.

--Forcing an enemy piece: If an enemy piece is surrounded on all sides except one and one of your pieces is behind the enemy piece, you may force the enemy piece through the open intersection (see detailed explanation on the official website).

--Piece elimination: You can eliminate pieces by surrounding them.

Lineage can be purchased directly from the publisher's website: LineageBoards.

name: El Mundo
description:
El Mundo ("The World") is a 4 player game of backgammon from Alphonso the Wise's Book of Games ("Libros del Axedrez, Dados et Tablas") produced in the late 13th century.

El Mundo is a form of backgammon, played on a round board. The board is divided into quarters with each quarter having six spaces. Players start with 12 pieces off the board and roll three six-sided dice to bring them on. The first player to get all of their pieces to the opposite quarter and then bear them off wins.

name: Toro
description:
The game board consists of a bull on a wooden plank. A brick is fastened to its horns by a rubber band, then other bricks are put in between.
The players now stack wooden cubes on top of this construction until it collapses with a bang. The player who caused the collapse is the loser.

name: Awesome Bots
description: Awesome Bots is a short card game in which you draft and then play through your deck of robot cards, battling for the best score. The structure of the game allows you to filter through what you've gotten, and you won't be playing most of what you draft. All but the lowest-valued cards have a cost, requiring you to spend cards you've already played. You must either "scrap" a certain value's worth of robots, sending them out of the game, or "upgrade" them, saving those points for later. Balancing the risky but high-valued scrapping bots and the safer but less rewarding upgrading bots, keeping in mind the values and types in your deck's makeup, is central to the game. The game can be played cutthroat with 2 to 4 players or as a partners game of 2 on 2.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Ausgerechnet Unken
description:
In this re-themed edition of Ausgerechnet Buxtehude, we are now trying to learn the geographical locations of cities and sights in Austria.

Players place cards on the table according to their relative location. Other players may doubt the accuracy of the placement you made. Should the accusations turn out to be true, you would have to give out a scoring marker. The player with the most scoring markers in the end wins.

The game includes 215 location cards with longitude, latitude, elevation and population.

Elevation and population are used for variants simular to Anno Domini.

This game is only sold in Austria.

name: Virulant!
description: Game plays in a large plastic petri dish (150mm). Each of the 2 players has 10 'spores.' Place your spores in the dish according to a couple of simple placement rules. Surrounded opponent spores can be knocked out of the dish. Be the first to place all of your pieces on the board.

name: Bailout! The Game
description:
Everyone starts off with the best intentions but greed has caused you to make risky investments. Before long, you are forced to realize all your bank is left with is worthless paper. Your only option is to undermine, outsmart and devour the competition and make it to Bailout Bank before they do.

This game has the appearance of a classic railroad style game with strategic and competitive game play. Bailout! The Game is anything but an ordinary ride along the tracks. The banks must obtain a continual flow of debt and have greatest unsustainable losses in order to win the game.

Banks bombard each other with sales and acquisitions. The transactions are a vital part of the game; every decision a bank makes can affect every other bank. Banks try desperately to manipulate their stock holdings for their own benefit. If they are not careful there stock may fall into the hands of a rival or vise versa. The continued interaction drastically changes the outcome of the game right up until the end.

Bailout! The Game: Made in America with partially recycled materials. This game has classic American styling. Perfect for family game night or playing with friends.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: StarTaxi
description:
StarTaxi is a cross-over of Memory and Boardgames.

You are a (Star)Taxi Driver and your aim is to make couples, not only twins, because for every race (5 in total) you have their planet, a male, a female, and a baby, every kind of combination is possible! Move through the universe with your Taxi, roll the dice, and find the special cards! Meteors, Star's eclipses, radar and so on!

Releasing at Essen 2009 : Angelo Porazzi Games Stand: Hall 9 - Booth 30
publishers: World oF Twilights Studio and Games

name: Dezign Pak 4
description:
Dezign Pak 4 is a scenario pack for ASL. It contains fifteen scenarios from a variety of theaters. They are somewhat larger than the previous Dezign Pak series.

Scenario list from publisher:

38) CHOKE POINT - Verdal, Norway, April 21, 1940
39) THE GRIND - Goch, Germany, February 16, 1945
40) PATTON'S PRIDE - Agrigento, Sicily, July 16, 1943
41) COMMENCE HOSTILITIES - Mokra, Poland, September 1, 1939
42) BATTLE AT BORODINO - Borodino, Russia, October 14, 1941
43) HUNGARIAN HAMMERHEAD - Korotojak Bridgehead, Russia, August 7, 1940
44) TESTIS MEGALOS - Vovousa, Greece, November 4, 1940
45) BELOW THE BELT - Tongeren, Belgium, May 11, 1940
46) "MAD MIKE'S" FINEST HOUR - Mogaung, Burma, June 6, 1944
47) SHATTERED BONE & BURNING FLESH - Warka Bridgehead, Vistula River, Poland, August 8, 1944
48) PAK NEST - Bulson, France, May 14, 1940
49) SUCKER PUNCHED - Roseiniai, Lithuania, June 25, 1941
50) ATROCITY IS MANDATORY - Tanapag Plain, Saipan, July 6, 1944
51) TOUGH 'OMBRES - Mairy, France, September 8, 1944
52) ENGULFED - Bukrin Bridgehead, Khodorov, Ukraine, Russia, September 29, 1943
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Poor Bloody Infantry
description:
(from Minden Game's website:)

POOR BLOODY INFANTRY is a tactical World War I "experience" game simulating a single platoon (featuring counters representing individual men) going over the top at the Somme on July 1, 1916. The game is played on a standard chess board grid, and includes 128 counters, rules, Reference Card, and four historical scenarios: Red Hand at Thiepval Wood, 10th West Yorks at Fricourt, Advance of the 4th Liverpool Pals, and 16th Middlesex at Beaumont Hamel.

Poor Bloody Infantry is a simple solitaire tactical game that simulates a British platoon going "over the top" during the first hour of the initial British attack at the Somme on July 1, 1916. The object of the game is for the British (the player) to capture the opposing German trench. During play, individual British soldiers will brave German fire (the game system) while moving across No Man's Land towards the enemy.

The game uses a deck of cards, dice and provides pieces which are moved across a standard checkerboard.

Four scenarios are provided.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Role Playing

name: Ombre
description:
"Ombre" is the first game where the trump suit is decided by bidding. It is played with a standard deck of cards without the 8s, 9s and 10s. Each player is dealt 9 cards, and after that they bid how much tricks they can take. The highest bidder plays then against the two other players.

The game represents a battle of the 17 th. with it's officers and troops, so it can be said it is the first card wargame.

It's a game original from Spain known firstly as "Triunfos Hispánicos" later circa 1700 it was known as "Juego del Hombre" or "Mediator". Again circa 1800 changed his name into "Tresillo", and from that time is known as "Rocambor" in the former spanish colonies of latin america where today is still played.

In Spain almost no one plays it any longer, as before was a gentelmen game and became unpopular in the 20 th. century, but it carries to be played in Lima.

Funny enought there are as well clubs in Dennmark were it is known as "L'Hombre". It is my personal opinion that the spanish ocupation army of Dennmark in the age of Napoleon comanded by the Marquis de la Romana have something to do with the expansion of this game in Jutland!!

Tenshō karuta, Unsun karuta and Sunkun karuta are all rooted in Ombre

name: Battleship: Search and Destroy
description: Battleship: Search and Destroy is a free print & play game that combines the Fog of War of classic Battleship with the fleet action of Battleship Express. The players take alternating turns that are further broken down into a scouting and an attacking phase. Players assign ships to scout for the enemy. Each ship assigned allows one guess on the traditional Battleship grid. The results are either a miss, hit or identified (all of the ships squarea have been discovered). Once a ship is identified by the opponent, he/she may assign ships to attack that ship and try to sink it. Play procedes until only 1 player has a ship left afloat.
categories: Deduction, Exploration, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Wars of Empire I: The Seven Weeks War of 1866
description:
A campaign system and battle rules for miniatures, nominally for 10mm figures but applicable to others.

This set of rules forms part of the Real Time Wargames series, in this case covering the Seven Weeks War of the 19th century involving the Austrian, Prussian and minor nations armies.
publishers: Real Time Wargames, Realistic Modelling Services

name: Honk!
description:
Do you drive in traffic on a daily basis? How stressful is it dealing with all those crazy drivers every morning and night? Welcome to HONK! the board game all about driving through traffic.
The object of the game is to navigate your car down the freeway and be the first to make it home. That would be simple, but everyone else is trying to do the same thing. Each player has a handful of cards and a number of actions. A player may use cards to gain special movements, inhibit the movement of other players, or move cars out of way. The other thing players can do is strategically move their car. Either way, making it down the freeway is a hoot with flat tires, stalled cars, accidents, and of course the police. Keep your eyes open as this one will be for sale soon!
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Struggle Against Doom
description:
Issue game of old Game Journal 62.
Designed by Jun Tajima.
Covers the Napoleon's campaign from 1812 to 1814.
The game uses the "Hannibal" engine.
Play is based on card play.
The battle is resolved by combat card matching.
1 map
144 counters
64 strategic cards
48 combat cards
You must prepare 1 dice.

name: Schollenhüpfen
description: Among the ice floats in the Arctic Sea swim the fattest fish. This is also where the polar bears and go hunting. Of course, every polar bear tries to catch the most fish and eagerly jump from float to float. But wind and waves move the ice. The voracity of the other bears also reduces the number of fish rapidly. And sometimes even an Inuit or a cheeky seal steals a fish already caught. Who in this icy environment first collects ten fish is the winner. A memory game for children were the fish are fastened to the ice-floats with magnets.

name: Maziacs the Boardgame
description:
From the rules: In this game you play the part of a hero that goes into a dangerous maze to look for a great treasure. The maze is full of monsters called Maziacs who will try their best to kill the hero. Fortunately they're not very intelligent, but can be deadly if you're caught off guard...

The game uses tiles to build a new random maze each play and mechanics to create a unique path towards the treasure. This path is slowly uncovered by the player by asking prisoners that can be found randomly through the maze. Also, the Maziacs will appear randomly and try to kill the hero, but as long as he has a sword, he'll be safe. There's also a mechanic that will adjust the chance of a new Maziac appearing based on the number of Maziacs already on the board and the distance from the exit.

In the end, it's all about beating the game system, either as a solo or cooperative game, trying to maneuver through the tight corridors fooling Maziacs into dead ends and finding the correct path to the treasure.

The game is based on the great ZX Spectrum game "Maziacs" programmed by Don Priestley. He was kind enough to allow the designer of this game to use the same name.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Eesti Mälumäng (Travel)
description:
From the publisher:
In Eesti mälumäng you have 100 cards with 600 questions from six categories: History, Culture, Nature, Geography, Sport and Miscellaneous. Vast majority of questions concern Estonia only. To win the game, you need to get all 5 categories on one side of the triangle on your score pad.

Content:
100 cards
2 category dice
pencil
block of score pads
rules

name: Game Seeds
description:
Game Seeds is a card game designed to spice up your brainstorm sessions on character and game design.

Theme: Game Design

Goal of the Game: Design a Hero, a Sidekick and a Game

Preparation:
Split the players in 2 groups (maximum of 6 players per group)
Distribute the 7 rule cards to each group
Game Seeds card distribution:
1) Shuffle the cards and give 6 per team.
2) Each group selects one of its given cards to keep
3) Each group then passes the remaining cards to the other group.
Repeat steps 2 and 3 till the cards are over.

Gameplay:
The game is composed by 3 phases:

Phase 1: Design a Hero
Step 1: Define your main Character Attributes (based on the team´s cards)
Step 2: Develop his Personality
Step 3: Pitch your Hero
Step 4: Swap the characters between the 2 teams

Phase 2: Design a Sidekick
Step 1: Create the Sidekick of your opponent Hero
Step 2: Pitch the created character
Step 3: Teams vote for the best character pair

Phase 3: Design a Game
Step 1: Choose one of the team cards and design a game based on your pair of characters
Step 2: Pitch your Game
Step 3: Teams vote for the Best Game Idea

The game was made as a Research & Development project for the Design for Playful Impact research program at the Utrecht School of the Arts.

Game Seeds are wild free-spirited tiny creatures that you can play with, combine, hack and get inspired by to bring new characters and game ideas to life. The goal of the game is to embed the gameplay and the future players actions in the behaviour of the designed characters. Throughout the phases of the game you design a hero, a sidekick and finally… a game!

Improving your skills on character design is all about practicing. The more you play, the better you will eventually become. Using improvisation to foster your creativity.

Game Seeds has been designed for designers, students and creative professionals by the Utrecht School of the Arts, Monobanda and Metagama.The game offers a playful experience and a real playcentric approach to character design and creating innovative games, it can also be used as a workshop-tool.
publishers: (Self-Published), Utrecht School of the Arts (Faculty of Art, Media and Technology)

name: Odin's Rune Chess
description:
From the author's introduction:
"To create the game I used an approach similar to that used by Carl Jung when he philosophized about the I Ching and the concept of synchronicity... To put myself in the right frame of mind for creating the rune game I first concentrated on Odin and Chess. In Nordic mythology Odin is a wise god who brought the runes to mankind, something akin to Prometheus bringing fire to men. I then thoroughly shuffled and mixed a set of rune cards and randomly selected six... I was surprised by the results..."

This 10x10 chess variant takes inspiration from its theme and converts some of the standard chesspieces into their Norse equivalents. All the non-royal pieces retain their moves and capturing abilities. The queen becomes a valkyrie, with the additional power of transporting a king to safety by taking its place on the board. Knights become Forest oxen, with great horns that can kill in a neighboring square. Pawns become minor pieces, giving up their promotion ability to do so. And kings must "consult" before doing anything. The king moves and captures like any friendly piece it starts the turn next to. Each player has 2 of each type of piece, including kings, and 10 pawns. The game is won by capturing both enemy kings.

name: Bowl' Em  Over
description:
Set up the 12 bowling pins and aim to get a strike. This game is fun for everyone and will unleash your competitive side!

Object of the game is to knock all the bowling pins down and score a strike.


Comes with: 1 Bowling Alley, 12 Bowling Pins, 2 side supports
1 Score Sheets
1 Instruction Sheet
2 Bowling Balls
1 Monkey Bowler

name: Triangel
description:
In all four variants (Triangel Solo, Triangel Mini/Maxi and Triangel Tempo) triangular tiles with coloured arcs around the corners must be placed (according to the rules of the variant) in order to create full circles of a single color.

The Solo variant is the puzzle to create as many full circles as possible from a random subset of all tiles, but the multi player games have no predefined best outcome.

While Triangel Mini and Maxi have a slight resemblence to Domino, since players take turns to add tiles from their personal “hand” to a growing structure in the middle so that sides fit, in the Triangel Tempo version, the triangular tiles are dealt equally to the players and the players try to place all of their tiles in one structure, with sides of the triangles matching each other. Once a player manages to fit all his tiles in one structure, the assembly stops and points are scored, with one point for each full circle in a player's structure and negative points for unused tiles.

name: ASL Mannual '98
description:
subtitled: for Obsessed Pathetic Losers

A parody of the ASL Annuals, this magazine was a one shot effort featuring Alfred E. Neuman on the front as a 5+2 leader.

There are various articles and letters to the editors, including a column "Tank Talk" by Clink and Clank, giving their caller Erin Rommel advice on what type of tank he should be driving.

There are three scenarios included:


ASL Scenario On0, ATSA Natsoguda, Italy, February 15, 1944. Elements of a dug in German regiment and a lot of armor counters from Panzerblitz face off against an American force that never enters onto the mapboard.



ASL Scenario K9, Un Chien Boiteux Et Mal Equilibre, June 10 1940. The French border forces are Three Fenchmen and a Poodle. The Italian Forces are: La Groupa Gonna Getcha, You Bet.



ASL Scenario 1954, Gojira!!!, Outside Tokyo, 1954. The Japanese army takes on Gojira (Godzilla).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Railway Rivals Map IN: India
description: This is an expansion map of India for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. The base game involves route building like in crayon rails and the second part of the games involves racing along player routes between cities to win prize money. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.

name: Arena of Heroes
description:
Theme:
Arena of Heroes puts the players against each other in a fighting arena as they battle to the death. The artwork is reminiscent of an arena filled with gladiators being cheered on by thousands of fans.

Game-play:
The game board consists of a 5" by 5" grid, players start in the corners, are given 10 life tokens, and dealt 5 cards each. There are 3 different types of cards in the full deck of 126 cards: black Movement Cards, red Combat Cards, and full color Item Cards. The players draw back up to a full hand of 5 cards at the beginning of each turn, allowing the player to use all their cards on their turn or hold some back to defend against attacks on the other players' turns. Each successful attack causes the defender to lose a life token.

The Center Square:
The center square of the 5" by 5" grid has special properties for both attackers and defenders. If an attacker is occupying the center square and successfully lands an attack on the defender, the defender loses 2 life tokens. If the defender is in the center square and the attacker successfully lands an attack, the attack has the choice of the defender taking the hit (and losing one life token) or knocking the attacker out of the center square and into any available adjacent square. This can setup the attacker for various combinations for dealing additional damage on a second attack on the defender by first occupying the now available center square.

Movement Cards:
Movement Cards allow the players to move their miniature one square either diagonal or orthogonal as denoted by the image on the card.

Combat Cards:
The Combat Cards are used to attack opponents either diagonal or orthogonal as denoted by the image on the card. The strength of the attack is determined by the number in the corner of the card. Combat Cards are also used to defend against attacks and are successful if the defender's card is equal to or greater than the number on the attacker's card. Combat cards can only be played against another player if their miniatures are adjacent, unless using the throwing axe (see Item Cards below).

Item Cards:
The Item Cards include various weapons, armor, and other items to modify the numbers on the Combat Cards. If a player has the two handed axe equipped (+4 to attack) and plays a Combat Card with a 7, the defender must counter the attack with an 11 or higher. If the defender had a shield equipped (+3 to defense), then only an 8 or higher is required to defend the attack. Bonuses to attack and defend do stack, but each player can only have 2 cards equipped and certain cards cannot be equipped at the same time as any others.

Goal:
Be the last player standing.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Masco
description:
Deduction game.
Components: 54 wooden tiles featuring faces with a variety of eyes, noses and smiles, 18 control cards showing 18 face variations, red and white plastic counters.
Game for 2 players, one the informant and one the detective. 54 tiles are placed face up in the lid of the box or on the table. The informant selects one card from the 18 control cards and copies the face onto a piece of paper secretly The card is returned to the pack and the paper hidden from the detective. One of the colours, red, yellow or white is also written on the paper.
The detective then attempts to deduce the features of the face by presenting a tile. The informant places a red infomation counter for each correct feature; eyes, nose, mouth, colour. This continues until the detective knows the selected identity. Twice per round the informant can refuse to give any information and indicates this by placing a white counter. At the end of the round players reverse roles. The winner is the player who, as detective, collected the fewest information counters.

name: Battle Break
description:
Theme:
It's 2111 and aliens have come to earth--to dominate!

Game-play:
On a grid, wage war with your army. There are four factions, but cooperation between them: Gaia (red) and Coeurl (green) versus Empire (yellow) and Alien (blue). Figures are stacked onto chips that reflect their level of power and life. The chips can also be spent to execute special moves--found under the figure bases. The round is basically split into 4 phases, and battles are resolved with a combination of movement (including flight), special moves, and dice rolls.

Packaging:
As of April 2011, four factions have been released in encounter boxes, the red/green Keruberosu Reckless Plan, and the yellow/blue Kuresento (Crescent) Ambition Platoon. Each preconstructed starter includes a team-up of two factions (4 figs), a battle mat, a rulebook, 4 castle coins, 5 gaia coins, 5 kail coins and one battle die. One encouter box has only enough material for 1 player--and the castle coins are required to play. Also available are randomized booster boxes--from which capsule vending machines are also stocked. Larger figures must be assembled, and all boosters come with an additional battle coin. All figures are pre-painted.

Series 2 was released June of 2011.
Series 3 was released August of 2011.
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Kleur Bekennen
description:
Both players make and hide color combinations and try to guess the colors of the opponent at the same time.

Try guess the right color combination of three cylinders behind the fence of your opponent before him.

This is a simplified version of Mastermind Challenge that uses three columns of information instead of five.

name: Babylon 5 Wars: Showdowns-1
description: Another first in the B5 Wars universe, Showdowns-1 presents dozens of new scenarios to play out to the bitter end, as well as new civilian and Raider ships, Narn and Centauri orbital satellites, unique weapons, elite officers and more! Includes: Rules and options for mine warfare, a preview of Raider ships & fighters, enhancements (for ships, fighters, officers, and crew), and a variety of miscellaneous rules (such as cargo holds, C&C recovery, fighter critical hits, etc.) and terrains (asterois, planets, moons, gravity wells, hyperspace whirlpools, and more). Whether your gaming group is looking for some unconquered territory or you've just played one free-for-all too many, the Showdowns series will provide unlimited playability to a trusted game system!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Aquarium: Rainbowfish
description:
Aquarium Rainbowfish is a small expansion for Aquarium which features the special Rainbowfish.

This expansion is a promotional expansion and it is not for sale.

Rules for the Rainbowfish:

The rainbowfish can be just be added to the deck but beware because they are pretty powerfull!

The best way to use the rainbowfish is to give each player one at the start of the game instead of the normal fish of size 1.

The rainbowfish is a fish of size 1 (so it eats only 1 unit of food each feeding time) but it's worth 1 extra star at the end of the game.

The rainbowfish can be used as a fish of size 1 of one of the four colours so it makes it easier to score your bonuspoints at the end of the game (if you keep it alive till then!) or can be used to start an early breeding tank (but then you won't profit from the possible extra stars)

name: Calvinball Unofficial  Mini-Game
description:
Other kids' games are all such a bore!
They've gotta have rules and they gotta keep score!
Calvinball is better by far!
It's never the same! It's always bizarre!
You don't need a team or a referee!
You know that it's great, 'cause it's named after me!
—The Calvinball theme song

Calvinball is a game played by the characters of the classic comic strip Calvin and Hobbes by Bill Watterson.

The goal of Calvinball is to round the circuit of bases in sequence while in the possession of the required Calvinball for each base. One time successful around the bases wins the game. Opponents will attempt to halt other Player’s advancement while simultaneously trying to reach their own sequential base with their Calvinball (it may or may not be the same ball). Scattered around the field are trees, rocks, a stream, sports equipment and other items to hinder and assist players in their efforts to win the game

name: The Other Side
description: The other side is a queue management card game (Guillotine, Parade, etc.) where you try to get your chickens across the road in one piece! If you don't, they're roadkill. There are two decks of card, the action deck full of queue re-arrangers, Chicken killers, bonus points, and more. The chicken deck is full of chickens (imagine that!) Whoever has more of their own chickens safe at the end of the game, wins! The Other Side is full of humor and fun for most ages...

name: Nit de Reis
description:
Nit de Reis is a free web-published game offered by the radio station Catalunya Ràdio for the Epiphany feast of 2012 (the traditional day in Catalonia for giving Christmas presents to children, tha day of the three Magi).

It is a push-your-luck game with just six dice. In the dice there are three kinds of presents (low-valued, mid-valued and high-valued), the Magi and coal (the typical present that the Magi give to naught children). Each player can roll the dice up to five times and after each roll he can keep as many dice as he wants. You only get points for just one kind of present and only if the Magi are present. But beware! The first time coal appears, you lose one die, and the second time, you lose everything! So it's wise not to be too greedy! The three Magi don't like greedy children!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Aussie Footy
description:
A recreation of Australian Rules Football using a Tiddlywink mechanic. Players assume the role of the 18th player and move the football to images of the 17 other players on the board. The player retains possession as long as the football is "kicked" to an image of their player who is deemed to have caught or "marked" the ball. If the football falls on the picture of an opposing player or in an open field, the opponent takes control of the ball. Wooden goalposts at each end signify the goalposts and a player can either secure a goal (6 points) or behind (1 point), depending on the accuracy of their aim.

The football has a red and blue side, and if the ball goes off the board ("out of bounds"), it is flipped and whatever colour lands face-up gains possession. When a football equally sits on a red and blue player, the colour that is face-up determines which player has possession. Flipping is also used to determine who kicks the ball first at the commencement of the game or after a goal is scored.

The winner can be determined by the first to reach a pre-determined number of points, or using an elapsed amount of time.

The game first came out during the late 1960s.

name: Square 4
description:
"The fast-paced aim, launch, and score game!"

This a dexterity game with a motorized revolving game board. Players use catapult-style flippers to launch balls into four different 5x5 grids on the board as it spins. Each grid target matches one of the four ball colors. The object of the game is to be the first player to get four balls of his or her color in a row.

There are three levels of play. For young players scoring is based on the total number of balls that land in his or her matching zone. For adavanced players only balls in the matching zone count when creating the four-in-a-row sequence.

Includes the motorized board with four attached catapults, 40 balls, 4 grids, and the rules.

Designed for 2, 3, or 4 players ages 4 and older.

name: Master & Commander: Close Quarters
description:
From Their Website:
Master & Commander: Close Quarters is a set of rules designed for playing boarding actions between Napoleonic ships. Now you can play in detail such famous actions as ‘Nelson’s Patent Bridge for Boarding First-Rates’ in the battle of Saint Vincent, follow Captain Decatur in a boarding action against Barbary Corsairs, or board the Royal Navy ships with the San Juan Neponucemo at Trafalgar

Fast, innovative and simple playing system. Designed to play with our ship boards, and CAPITAN MINIATURES 18mm crews,all you need to play is downloable for free.

name: Phantoms of the Ice: Tricks
description:
This is a one card mini expansion which was included in the White Wind game Rainbows to promote their games Tricks and Phantoms of the Ice.

The expansion consists of a new goalie named Tricks and a rules card. Tricks has a value of "0" but can foretell the defeat of his team. If he is right, the losing team wins the game, if he is wrong, he must be discarded.

name: Schnack nich... Dat geit!!!
description: Players take turns adding wooden pieces of different shapes to a fragile tower. They also need to get their two playing pieces onto the tower. One piece is lighter the other heavier. Once in a while (the length of this while is determined by a random element), there are scoring breaks. The players then check the positions of their pieces and multiply the number of levels one piece is up with the number of levels the other piece is hanging over the edge of the board. When all pieces have been built, the game ends and the player with most points wins. If a player topples the tower before that, that player is the sole loser.

name: China: Starmania
description: Expansion map for China / Web of Power, released during his year-long campaign to release a new map every month. Available for online play at www.michaelschacht.net.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Colorado Midland: Mayors
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Colorado Midland: Mayors brings stakeholders into play in Colorado Midland.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building

name: Shadows Upon Lassadar: Siege at Nem
description:
The Barons continue their invasion of Lassadar, striking out at the port city of Nem. Raise the call, they attack by sea!

Siege at Nem is a postcard style wargame for 1 or 2 players lasting 25 minutes and is the second game in the 2nd Lassadar game trilogy.

This hex and counter style wargame uses a deck of cards (standard or Tarot) + 1d6 for action point (AP) allotment. Action points may be spent to move units, for combat, for spell casting, bombardment of the city or deploying additional units.

The game last 7 rounds with the Baron player winning if they can occupy the Citadel Hex in the City of Nem with 1 unit until the end of any turn or if they are able to kill all Lassadar units within the city.

The Lassadar player wins if they can sink both of the Baron's Ship units or kill the Baron unit before game end.

Solo rules provided.
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Scribbo
description:
From the box

Scribbo It's Bingo With Words
It's as easy as Bingo. Take turns calling out a letter and a number (for example:"A-23"). Ech player write that letter in that number's space on either of his Scribbo grids. The number on your space are arranged differently than on your opponent's space.

With careful letter placement letters turn into words-horizontally and vertically and along the valuable diagonal. You must write down each letter called. Think ahead! You'll need to be clever to protect the words you're trying to make while also trying to block your opponents. Words can be short as one letter and long as five. Play continues until all grids are filled in. High score wins.

name: Legacy: Gears of Time – Gen Con Indy Promo Card
description:
The Gen Con Indy Promo Card is an exclusive promo card for Legacy: Gears of Time given to people who participated in a demo of the game at Gen Con 2012. This technology card is added to the deck and can be played like any other technology, provided the prerequisites to do so are met:


Logic 2
Printing Press 4
Writing
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Wild Oltrenatura
description:
Wild Oltrenatura leads players into the most uncontaminated habitats on Earth: Kenya's savannah, Namibia's desert, Colombia's jungle, and Alaska's glaciers and forests. Explorers will parachute into regions waiting to be explored. Here, they will have to walk or swim, seeking out the best routes, in order to meet the wildest animals and survive. They will have to face – and collect – scary sharks, huge cats, aggressive pachyderms, the most poisonous snakes, and many more animals they've probably never even heard of, all while carefully monitoring their energy, water and health supplies!

The object of Wild Oltrenatura is to meet as many animals as possible and, of course, to survive in the different extreme environments. During your turn, you have to decide whether to move 1-3 spaces (consuming water and energy) to receive an animal card or special natural resource benefits, feed (discard an animal card to get energy back), or rest (to recover one energy, water or health). Players can challenge opponents to take over their animal cards, and the game ends as soon as one player has explored all four environments.

name: Crown of Underworld
description:
user summary
Players compete as mafia bosses for the most influence in Munshine City.

Each player takes one of 8 different families/organisations, each with special powers.

The game takes 10 turns, divided into phases of which the most important are:

Bribing phase: The players bid blindly on one or more of 6 so called Key Figures, which convey special powers in the following turn.

Planing Phase: The players plan their next moves by adding influence tokens to the board, hiring or assigning gangster cards, so called suspects, to the tasks of attacking, defending or collecting income. Those assignments are secret.

Venality phase: Bribes are revealed and Key Figures' powers used.

Combat phase: Players who planned on attacking use their suspects to attack another player. Results are given by the value of attacking and defending suspects and the number of influence tokens on the attacked area.

Cash In / Cash Out Phase: Planned moves must be payed, otherwise a penalty is taken. Income is collected.

All the while, players can play event cards on each other.

After 10 turns, a winner is determined by the number and position of controlled areas, with some extras for number of suspects or cash.


quoting from the manual
Crown of Underworld is strategic card-driven boardgame! It's hybrid nature merging two different kinds of game engines offers something absolutely new for fans of this kind of entertainment. Players struggle on many levels simultaneously to earn advantage and ultimately - the victory.
The game develops planning skills and ability to use own advantages and see weaknesses of others to dominate competitors. Unlike many games, Crown of Underworld is completely different with each game. On the other hand, non-linear nature of the turn-flow, created by random sequence of events affecting each turn promotes flexible players.
We hope you will enjoy playing Crown of Underworld as much as we had fun when we designed it!

additional information
according to the designers, 150 copies were printed exclusively for Essen 2012
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Throne Wars
description:
Throne Wars is a kingdom battle game for two to four players. Each player starts the game with a Strong Hold card in play, which represents the center of their kingdom. Each player takes turns playing each phase of the game. During each turn players roll dice to represent sending out their peasants to do work for the kingdom. Sometimes these peasants comply and other times they do not. Once the dice are rolled, they are assigned to the corresponding decks. There are 5 decks in all; Fortification (deck 2), Assault (deck 3), Development (deck 4), Devine (deck 5), and Siege (deck 6), there is no deck for 1. If the players have rolled a 1, this peasant decided to slack off and did nothing, so it is assigned to no deck. Players are then able to draw a card for each die they rolled.
Players may draw a card from whatever deck the die was assigned to or any deck below that one in number. For example, if a player rolled a 5, this die is assigned to the 5 deck and the player may choose to draw from the 5 deck or any deck below that one in descending order. In this way, players are able to choose cards from decks strategically.

Once players have drawn their cards, play then moves into the Fortification phase. During this phase, players may play any fortification cards they drew. Fortification cards build up the player’s kingdom; they provide a buffer for the Strong Hold. These cards represent towers, walls, and gatehouses. Once each player has done this, play moves on to the Siege phase. During this phase, players play and fire siege equipment such as ballista and catapults. These cards directly target the fortifications of the opposing player.
Players then move on to the Assault phase of the game. During this phase, players play any Assault cards they drew. These cards make up the troops that will be played to attack an opposing player’s Strong Hold. These cards have Footmen, Archers, etc. These Assault cards then are able to attack an opposing player’s Strong Hold. However, the total power of an assault force is only able to damage a Strong Hold if it is greater than the total amount of Fortification the opposing player possesses.

Throughout all the phases, players are able to build developments and use divine powers (draw from those respective decks) to support their tactics. These cards can be a devastating and tide turning strategy to employ. These cards include; Hand of God, Sapper Bomb, Siege Ladder, Blacksmith, etc. Play continues through these phases until a player’s Strong Hold has been reduced to (0).

This is a fast paced game of strategy and luck. The theme is fantasy medieval combat and focuses on divine catholic inspired societal norms of the day. Throughout the game, players feel as though they are in charge of a kingdom and are working to overtake their opponent’s kingdom through force of arms and smart planning.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Religious
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Ami
description:
Introduction

Become a dog breeder! You have a unique chance to choose one dog from 12 breeds with different requirements. Take care of your pets and do your best. Thanks to it they will grow into beautiful dogs and with a little bit of luck win Best in Show.

The Game

The players in order to prepare their pets to take part in a show must feed, comb and take them for a walk. Of course owners should remember to vaccinate their dog as well. To achieve it they must use their development cards. On each card there are from 1 to 5 different symbols (from 1 to 5) and sometimes there is also a big picture of a dog.

The second stage of the game begins at the point when one of the players is fully prepared with his / her 3 dogs for the show. A cup is given in each of three categories: small dogs , medium, and large. The game is won by the player who has received the most cups.

Breeds available in the game: Dachshund, Poodle, Yorkshire Terrier, Beagle, Irish Setter, Labrador, Rough Collie, Boxer, German Shepherd, Afgan Hound, Great Dane, Saint Bernard.

name: Nutty Balance
description:
