Mr. Squirrel has a problem! He can't move his acorns into his treehouse without some help. See how many acorns you can balance on his back so he can store them for the winter.

Product designed in France. Made in China. Painted with safe water colour paints.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Buccaneers!
description:
Early eighteenth century, the Golden Age of Piracy! Legendary pirates sailing the seas of the Caribbean attacking merchant ships Europeans. Time to go to Tortuga, summon some sailors, and left for the seas of the Caribbean to loot some ships because we Buccaneers!

Buccaneers! is a board game for 2-4 players, developed by Julio Trois, about the Golden Age of Piracy in Caribbean Sea.

Each turn, players must navigate the seas of the Caribbean, attacking other pirates ships or warships Europeans (the battles are defined as the sum of the results of 3 dice), can also loot merchant ships (uses 5 dice. looted treasure depends on the combination of 5 dice, equal to Yatzee). But there is always the danger of sea monsters!

The game has the mechanics, Grid Movement, Dice Rolling, moreover, in each round, players can perform actions similar or different, increasing the strategic difficulties.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Chez Geek: Promokarte Pegasus-Supporter
description:
A German promo card for Chez Geek with the following text:

German original:

Pegasus-Supporter
Person
Slack 3
Der Pegasus-Supporter wird sich immer sofort in den Raum mit den meisten Spielen-Karten [sic!*] begeben (bei Gleichstand in jedem Zug auswürfeln). Hier ist er von vielen Leuten umgeben, die genauso gerne spielen wie er.
"Das Spiel ist ganz einfach. Ich erklär euch mal kurz die Regeln..."


"Spiele-Karten" is what seems to be meant.


English translation:

Pegasus Supporter
Person
Slack 3
The Pegasus Supporter will always immediately go to the room with the most Game cards (roll a die in case of a tie). Here he is surrounded by people who like gaming as much as he does.
"The game is very easy. I'll quickly explain you the rules..."

name: Pompker
description:
Pompker is a "push-up poker". It's a pun in polish language, because it's a combination of words "pompki" (push-ups) and "poker".

The entire gameplay is similar to Texas Hold'em but there are some exceptions. The players do not have any starting amount of "money". Instead of money they bid with push-ups. During the game they can bid how much they want but bidding too much is a risk of losing. After finishing the round there is a winner who does not have to do the push-ups that he bid. All other players have to do the push-up according to how much they bid. The winning player gains as many points as all other players did push-ups in that round.

Each loosing player gains the points too (unless he passes and bids 0). He gains as many points as he did push-ups in that round.

If any player is not able to do the push-ups that he bid, he is out of the game and he scores minus points for the push-ups that he was supposed to do (e.g. if he bid 50 and he does 40, he gets -10 points).

The game end when all players but one are eliminated. The winner is not the last player in the game, but the player who scored the most points.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Cursed
description:
Picture an ancient legend....

The long ago a group of greedy villagers attempted to steal powerful magic and treasures from a long abandon temple. For their crimes, the unnamed God of the temple cursed them to transform, one by one, night after night, into a hideous beast that hunted the other Villagers and devour them. The curse was only ended when a single Villager remained to tell the cautionary tale. (Ancient legends don't have happy endings!)

Cursed is a quick, casual game for 3 to 8 player, ages 5 and up. The game focuses on heavily on Bluffing and features a unique cooperative/competitive gameplay style, in which players take turns becoming the "Monster", well the other players battle against the Monster as a group in an attempt to fend it off for the night. The next night, the next player in line becomes the Monster and the battle begins again. The game ends when the Monster eats the last 2 Villagers and the Curse is broken.

The game revolves around dice rolls and a small amount of card playing. Each "Villager" rolls a single die in the open, for all to see, well the "Monster" rolls an equal number of dice privately. The Monster knows if they can beat the Villagers at a glance, but must decide if he/she want to Bluff the Villagers into fleeing, tempt Villagers into a hopeless and costly battle, or simply flee if the Villagers are clearly too strong.

Add into this mix Ward Cards, magic powers that aid or hinder either side, or even disrupt the battle completely in some strange way, and which can be played be either side to keep the game endlessly unpredictable. These cards are costly though, and beyond the 3 you get at the start of the game, must be paid for WITH YOUR LIFE!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Horror, Mythology
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: FlipFlop
description:
Board & Pieces
FlipFlop is played between two opponents. There are two versions of the game: One is played on 3x3 board and another is on 5x5 square board. Each player has 3 (5 for 5 x 5 boards) pieces, which have two faces: The Bishop and the Rook.
Movements
All pieces start as Rook, arranged at the first row on each end. As in normal chess games, Rooks move in a straight line, horizontally or vertically and Bishops move in a straight diagonal line, as far as they want.

After each move, pieces are 'flipped' and promoted from Rook to Bishop, then from Bishop to Rook.

Pieces cannot be captured, except when they are either in your or opponent's goal square.

Goal
You win when any of your pieces is placed in the middle square in the last row, your goal square for two consecutive turns, or when there is no legitimate moves left for your opponent.

name: Nubia
description:
A board game that uses components of a checkers set. 22 pieces, 11 per player, and an 8x8 board. Layout: two diagonally opposite corners are labeled "Camps;" a player's counters are arranged in a diagonal pattern guarding his or her camp. (Please note: opening set-up of pieces has been revised.)

Movement: pieces move as a rook in chess. If a piece is making a non-capturing move, it can only move forward, toward the enemy Camp.

Capturing: this is done by moving away from an adjacent enemy counter. So, if at the start of your turn, an enemy piece is next to one of yours, you move away from it in a straight line to capture it.

Winning: the person who gets a counter onto the enemy's Camp wins. (In the extremely rare case in which a player has no legal move but does not occupy the enemy's Camp, then the immobile player loses.)

name: To Je Fotbal
description:
To Je Fotbal (This Is Football) is a true simulation of a football match, a strategic board game that brings football action to your table by combining football rules and game strategy.

To Je Fotbal is a game for two football managers. Each team consists of the basic eleven players and five substitutes. The players are marked with a colored base corresponding to their role on the pitch. The forwards, midfielders, defenders, goalkeeper and captain all perform different functions. The basic skills can be enhanced by using special cards according to the manager's chosen strategy. During one turn, the manager can move three players in any direction according to their attributes and kick the ball if it is in possession of the team. Playing time is 2 x 45 turns (and maybe extra time).

The basic rules make it easy to get into the game for those aged 10 and up, and they cover situations such as passing, shooting, goal kick, saves, offside, posts, tacking for ball and position, extra time, substitutions and (of course) goals. The extended rules contain special situations such as corner kick, throw-in, free kicks and penalty kicks, fouls, yellow and red cards and even diving.

The game pieces are miniatures of football players in team jerseys with names, numbers and even sponsors' logos. The atmosphere of a football stadium is completed not only by a full-colored 82x55 cm game board with goals, flags and advertising panels, but also by an imitation of a scoreboard. All components (special cards, scoreboard) are in English, with the printed rules in the box coming in six languages.

The first edition, "10th Czech vs Slovakia derby", is supported by the Czech and Slovak national teams. You will find such football greats as Petr Cech, Tomas Rosicky, Marek Hamsik and Martin Skrtel in the teams.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Hostile Realms Fantasy Battle Rules
description:
Hostile Realms uses Piquet games concepts including the Sequence Deck, impetus, opposed polyhedral die rolls and morale chips to bring a new style of warfare to Fantasy miniature tabletop wargaming. This game stands alone and does not require the Piquet Core Rules to play.

There are special sections or rules on:

- Magic This is important but not dominating. More than 40 different spells in 4 levels of difficulty are included.

- Heroes and Champions (who may also be Wizards). These characters command subsections of the army, and may fight on their own as well. Their varying capabilities determine how they impact the battlefield.

- Relics These magical items alter how units and/or heroes perform.

- Fantastic Creatures The Bestiary covers 25 types, from swarms of bats to Wyverns. Many have special abilities such as poison, regeneration, causing disease, and/or use of magic.

- Flight Some heroes may be mounted on flying steeds, and many creatures and even some units of troops may fly above the fantasy battlefield, raining missiles down upon their land bound foes, and/or swooping down from above to wreak destruction with weapons, teeth, and/or claws.

- Starter Army Lists (18) These include many popular armies from other fantasy miniatures wargames and common fantasy tropes to help novice players get started immediately. The introductory scenario "The Battle of the Black Valley," features an Orc army opposed by a High Elven army.

name: Milne Bay
description:
Game description from the publisher:

"Australian troops had, at Milne Bay in New Guinea, inflicted on the Japanese their first undoubted defeat on land. Some of us may forget that of all the Allies it was the Australian soldiers who first broke the spell of the invincibility of the Japanese Army." —Field Marshall Sir William Slim

Defeated at sea in the battle of the Coral Sea in May and then distracted by the US Marine Corps landings on Guadalcanal, the Japanese High Command was forced to change its plans for New Guinea. After diverting the previously allocated Army regiment to reinforce Guadacanal, it fell to the Navy to gather a scratch force to capture the "lightly defended" airfield on the eastern tip of New Guinea.

Unfortunately for Japanese plans, those months of delays allowed Australia to finish assembling a brigade of Militia at Milne Bay during July, then rush a veteran AIF brigade there shortly before the Japanese landings commenced on August 25th, 1942.

Several scenarios are included in Milne Bay to allow players to explore different Australian and Japanese plans.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Choose One! Promo Pack
description:
The Choose One! Promo Pack is a pack of seven extra cards to add to your Choose One! game. Great for handing out to people to give them an idea of how the game plays, or as a stocking stuffer or small gift for someone who already has the main game.

The Choose One Promo Pack includes the following cards:

Bert or Ernie
Spinach or Broccoli
Born with superpowers or Transformed as an adult
Kirk or Picard
Religion or Politics
Goatee or Sideburns
Nightmare about falling or Nightmare about being chased

name: Rifugio: Rivers & Rafts
description:
This expansion adds a faster way of moving to the game and an extra way to earn victory points too.

Rafts float only on rivers and enable you to take an extra step towards your goal.

If someone else uses your raft you get extra points.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Super Dungeon Explore: King Starfire
description:
With the Heroes of Crystalia's constant incursions into his realm, Starfire has searched for ever more powerful relics for his hoard to increase his strength. With his discovery of the Horn of the Dragon King he has declared himself King of the Dragonback Peaks and Lord of all Dragons.

King Starfire is an all new resin sculpt of the classic Dungeon Boss. This version features an all new profile card with new deadly abilities; a new adventure card featuring the Cult of the Burning Star; and a powerful new magic item: The Dragon's Horn.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Cool Mini Or Not, Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures

name: Hockey
description:
'Hockey' is an ice hockey simulation game played with a standard deck of 52 cards.

Players attempt to match the card played by their opponent to create a "breakaway" (also known as "clearing the ice") and then also matching the opponent's following play to score a "goal."

Each play through the deck is considered a "period." Five cards are dealt to each player at a time, except the last deal of the period when all remaining cards are dealt. Three periods constitute a complete game. The deal switches after each period.

Players take turns playing one card from their hand face up in a common playing area. All cards are played on top of one another so that only the most recently played card is visible.

If a played card matches the rank (number) of the top card of the pile (e.g. a "6" is played on top of another "6") it creates a "breakaway" for that player. Jacks always create breakaways when played, regardless of the previous card in the stack.

Once a breakaway has been created, that player now needs to try to match the rank of the next card played by the opponent. If able to do so, a goal is scored.

The player with the most goals at the end of the game is the winner.

name: San Fermo
description:
The Battle of San Fermo took place the 27 May 1859 at a mountain pass near lake Como in northern Italy. It was an engagement during the Second Italian War of Independence in which the Italian volunteers of Giuseppe Garibaldi's Hunters of the Alps defeated an Austrian force, forcing the Austrians to abandon the town of Como.

San Fermo is the first wargame of the N-SB (Small Battles) series and is also the first one dedicated to the Italian Risorgimento. Players can play both the phases of the battle or the entire battle with optional rules for better Austrian training and troop control.

Based on activation chits and operative orders, the game system is centered on the totally different battleground of Italian theatre that forced both armies to fight battles "hand to mouth" sending in company after company. Counters represent single companies, cavalry squadrons and half batteries.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – House of Talons
description:
Shadowcats prowled those passes, rock slides were common, and the mountain clans were lawless brigands, descending from the heights to rob and kill and melting away like snow whenever the knights rode out from the Vale in search of them. Even Jon Arryn, as great a lord as any the Eyrie had ever known, had always traveled in strength when he crossed the mountains.
–George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

Venture into the Vale of Arryn with House of Talons, the fifth Chapter Pack in the Wardens cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. Among its sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty different cards), you’ll find plenty of cards to support every Great House, including iconic characters like Bronze Yohn Royce, Jhogo, and Robert Arryn.

As you ascend the heights of the Eyrie, House of Talons also continues the major themes of the Wardens cycle, adding options for decks built around high-cost, recognizable characters. In addition, this Chapter Pack enhances decks build around key traits, ranging from Rainbow Guard to Dothraki to Sand Snake. It also introduces characters that can interact with new Castle plots, and presents new “limited response” abilities, making them a more meaningful part of your deck-building.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Lucky Dice
description:
Ready to push your luck? Then reach for the Lucky Dice and try your chances. The game lasts five rounds with each player taking a turn in each round.

To start a turn, a player grabs and rolls two or three dice from the bag. From that point on, the player has a choice of stopping and scoring points, or drawing and rolling three more dice. If a player ever has three of the same number or color showing, that player's turn ends and she scores nothing — unless she also has a die face that shows "Free (number)" or "Free (color)", in which case that number or color can't bust her for the turn. If a player has used all 18 dice in the bag, she must stop.

To determine a score for the round, first remove all of the "Free ____" dice, then sum the digits on the dice that remain. If, however, you've rolled one or both of the lucky dice in the bag, your score might be boosted (or halved). A "1:5" on a lucky die, for example, means that 1s give you five points instead of one. A "1/2" means that your sum is halved, but if you roll both "1/2" symbols, then your score is doubled instead.

The player with the highest score after five rounds wins!

name: Color Huey & The Four Seasons
description: This is two games in one! One side of board matches the color tokens to the color of Huey’s shoes and for more advanced play turn the board over and match the color tokens to the correct color word. If you already have this token on your board you get to pass it onto another player! Be the first player to fill up all of the spaces on your Huey board and win!

name: Warhammer 40,000: Shield of Baal – Deathstorm
description:
A boxed Warhammer 40,000 starter game for the 7th Edition, featuring Blood Angels against Tyrannids. From the publisher's website:

Included is a 40-page campaign supplement containing:

the Fate of Phodia: the story of the desperate and violent battle between the Blood Angels Strike Force Deathstorm and the Tyranid bio-horrors of the Phodian Annihilation Swarm
a set of three themed missions that enable you to re-enact the pivotal engagements of the Deathstorm Campaign
full rules for Captain Karlaen of the Blood Angels 1st Company, the Broodlord known as the Spawn of Cryptus, and all of the units contained in the box
complete lists of all of the Blood Angels wargear and Tyranid weapons and biomorphs needed to play through this campaign
descriptions of the Tyranids special rules and psychic powers used in Deathstorm
a handy reference page that makes it easy to find the rules whilst playing games.


Also includes a small-format paperback copy of Warhammer 40,000: The Rules featuring an exclusive Blood Angels cover.

This box set contains 25 Citadel miniatures, including: 1 Blood Angels Terminator Captain, 1 Furioso Dreadnaught, 5 Death Company Space Marines, 5 Space Marine Terminators, 1 Broodlord, 8 Genestealers, 3 Tyranid Warriors and 1 Carnifex. It also includes a Deathstorm transfer sheet, 1 Dreadnaught Base, 6 x 40mm Round Bases, 5 x 32mm Round Bases, 9 x 25mm Round Bases, 3 x 50mm Round Bases, 1 x 105mm Oval Base and 1 x 75mm Oval Base.

name: Second World War at Sea: Sea of Iron
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

World War II began when the German battleship Schleswig-Holstein opened fire in the early morning hours of 1 September 1939. The war started on the Baltic Sea, and some of its very last actions took place there as well.

Sea of Iron is a complete Second World War at Sea boxed game based on actions on the Baltic Sea between 1939 and 1945. Thirty-six scenarios track the operations and battles that took place or could have taken place between the fleets and air forces of Germany, Poland, Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia, the Soviet Union, Finland and Sweden. In addition to their complete Baltic Sea orders of battle, the Soviets, Swedes and Finns all have additional ships they planned or began to construct but did not complete. And of course the game includes scenarios for their use.

There are 140 “long” ship pieces and 420 standard-sized square ones representing smaller warships, transports, aircraft (many, many aircraft) and a handful of markers. This is a big game, at least in terms of pieces. The map is not so big: the Baltic Sea is pretty small and almost completely land-locked, with ports and airfields in abundance. Aircraft are very potent in this theater, and ships have very little room to hide. The map by Guy Riessen shows the full Baltic on a single 11x17-inch panel.

The scenarios cover all of the action from the Polish “Operation Peking” in which three destroyers escaped to England just before the war began, to the planned Swedish invasion of German-held Denmark in May 1945.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Phoenix Expansion Pack
description:
The U.S.S. Phoenix is a Federation Nebula-class starship. Under the command of Captain Benjamin Maxwell, and without orders, the Phoenix destroyed a number of Cardassian ships and a Cardassian Outpost before it was intercepted by the U.S.S. Enterprise-D and ordered back to Starbase 211.
Star Trek - Attack Wing: U.S.S. Phoenix Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 18 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Phoenix is a Nebula class starship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: The Falklands Ablaze
description:
BACKGROUND: The Falklands Ablaze is a solitaire semi-historical simulation of the Falklands War (May – June 1982). The Game begins shortly after the Argentinians capture the Port City of Stanley after a surprise attack. The British have mustered their Task Forces and have arrived just of the northern coast of the Falkland Islands. The British must now establish a Beach Head and advance their forces towards Port Stanley to defeat the Argentinian Forces and liberate the British Settlers.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of the British Naval and Land Forces, you must gather your forces and naval squadrons to capture Port Stanley, Port Stanley Airfield and 10 other Argentine controlled Settlements before the Campaign Deck is depleted.

GAME FEATURES: The Falklands Ablaze contains many colorful counters including ground forces, ships and aircraft. The Game includes rules for Ground, Sea and Air Combat.

The Falklands Ablaze can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Pocket Sports Gridiron
description:
Pocket Sports Gridiron is a fast dice rolling game that see two teams attempting to drive to the end zone when they have possession of the football.

The objective is to complete a pass or run into the end zone for a touchdown, without your opponent’s defense preventing the play. As the game only uses dice, there is no need to measure yards or mark a line of scrimmage. Think of the game as a highlights package of your team on the offense drive. They either score or your opponent takes over on offense.

The Quarterback die will be the central die. Rolling this will choose the play 'called' by the QB. The subsequent die rolled next will be one of the other passing/running positions.

The WR , TE , & RB all have different plays on each die face with an 'intensity' value that the DEFENSE must match to prevent the play being successful. There are Field Goal options, Flags for penalties, Sacks, Intercepts, Fumbles and an Audible Play option (for PRO MODE)

The game includes 5 team cards to be used for an optional PRO MODE.

Light, compact and portable.

name: Monopoly: Groningen
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Groningen, in the Netherlands.
note:
big part of the profit was donated to charity foundation Beatrix children's hospital.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Heavy Steam: Kickstarter Exclusives
description:
The box of exclusives was included only with the Kickstarter campaign.

It contains the following:
2x New Player Boards
2x Powerfully Exclusive Pilot Cards
3x SteamPunk Themed Promotional Zpocalypse Cards
5x Tactical Terrain Cards
5x Additional Weapons Cards
2x New Minis (Zpocalypse and Fairytale themed)
1x Exclusive Event Card
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Guerra de Letras
description:
Is a game similar to battleship, but you must to discover the oponent words.
You have a card with some words and try to discover the words of your oponent.

By turns, each player says a letter of the alphabet (asks for only one letter in his turn) and the oponent, answer with all the locations of the word in his own card (example: player 1 says the letter "J" then, the player 2 answers "A3, B4, D1, etc").

Win the player that discover all the oponent words.

name: Teblo
description:
Teblo is an abstract strategy game. It is played on a square board (12x12). Each player has a pawn and 25 square pieces.

The board shows 4 colored starting squares. Players start their pawn on their own starting square, diagonally opposite to each other. Their goal is to reach to starting square of the opponent.

On his turn a player can either move his pawn horizontally or vertically or place one of his square pieces on the board.
These pieces can only be placed on the white squares. Pawn can enter the colored squares too.

The square pieces block the opponents route to the goal square, but not your own (you can place your pawn on top of it and pass your own piece in the next turn).

A player may never block the goal square completely.

You win as soon as you reach the goal square with your pawn.

name: Gut Check: The Microbiome Game
description:
Gut Check is a game for 2-4 players where each player attempts to develop a healthy microbiome while interfering with the microbiomes of their opponents. Give your friends the plague, botulism and more! Go to work sick to get rid of a pathogen, take some probiotics, or have some lasagna (if you can digest it). The game takes 30-60 minutes to play, depending on experience and number of players.

Gut Check draws on elements from a number of games including Pandemic, Magic: The Gathering, and Dominion. While the game plays equally well with 2, 3, or 4 players the strategy changes in each case. Optimal play revolves around hand management, card cycling, striking a balance between building your own microbiome or playing cards to interfere with opponents, and timing various events.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Save the President, Save the World
description:
Thanksgiving Day, the unthinkable happened. The earth shook. An earthquake of a 9.6 magnitude on the Richter scale opened a giant inter-dimensional rift around the White House, bridging the free world to some kind of mysterious void.

A massive horde of monsters came out of this dark void. Evil, frightening creatures hell-bent on crushing freedom and the man who represents them — The President of the United States!

They took the whole White House staff by surprise, slaughtering each and every single person. The Secret Service and Marine Guard gave their life heroically to protect the President, but ultimately failed at containing these hideous monstrosities. The President stands tall, undaunted. He has sworn an Oath to lead the free world, and he won't let us fall! Yet the end is near. Our President's life is at risk, and all hope seems lost...

But in the midst of this absolute chaos rises the silhouettes of men and women. Out of the rubble citizens & tourists become Patriots! They are this nation's last hope and together they stand! With one mission: Save the President, save the world!

Save the President, Save the World is a co-op game with offbeat humor & references to Z-movies. The action takes place in the White House and you have to protect POTUS from horde of monsters.

Any resemblance to real and actual names is purely coincidental.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Rhode
description:
Rhode is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board). The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.



DefinitionsA weak pair is a set of two like-colored, diagonally adjacent stones such that there is no like-colored stone adjacent to both.

A crosscut is a 2x2 set of stones consisting of two diagonally adjacent black stones and two diagonally adjacent white stones. A stone can be part of several crosscuts at the same time.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate.

On your turn, if there are any friendly weak pairs on the board, place a stone of your color on an empty point that is adjacent to the two stones in one of those pairs. Otherwise, place a stone of your color on any empty point.

After your placement, remove all friendly stones, except the one just placed, that are part of any crosscuts.

You win by creating a chain of orthogonally connected stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color.

To make the game fair, White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Portia Forthwright's Celebrated Steam Driven Velocipede
description:
Description from the designer:

You are Portia Forthwright, an inventor with a dream—to build the world’s first steam-powered bicycle. Grapple with adversity and time to advance along the technology tree, but if you succumb to despair, your dream will be lost to the scrap heap of time.

This is a solitaire game about invention in a steam-punk universe. The game uses play with a traditional 52-card deck to manipulate four elements (inspiration, willpower, materials, and technology) around clock faces. When two or more of these elements are in-sync, advancement is possible. However, Portia has periods of time when her work always suffers, and work within those hours causes a regression. Regress often enough and despair sets in. Advance to the top of the technology tree, and you have invented Portia Forthwright’s Celebrated Steam Driven Velocipede.

name: OverThrone: A Game of Cards
description:
Description from the designer:

Four noble houses fight for control of a kingdom. Whichever of these powerful families sits on the central Throne is regarded as the ruler of the entire land.

At the start of the game you are a trusted close advisor to the Throne and are instrumental in maintaining a form of peace, through a mixture of negotiation, bribery, threats and promises (playing the cards).

However the time will soon come (each turn represents one year) when you’ll need to choose between honour and duty to the realm and your own personal well being. Anticipation, planning ahead and making the right moves at the right time will be key to your survival.

OverThrone is a solitaire game played with a standard pack of cards. The aim of the game is to get rid of all your cards by playing them, one at a time, according to the rules dictated by the ruler at the time. If you manage to place all the cards then you win the game.

name: Per Seconde Wijzer
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Challenge your friends with this exciting quiz famous from the Dutch television. Try to match the right descriptions with the correct answers before the time runs out! Try to outsmart your friends and use your tokens at the right moment. Are you able to think under a lot of pressure?

Per Seconde Wijzer is a quiz game for up to 4 players older than 12 years old. One of the players reads 6 descriptions and all the other players try to connect the right answers within 60 seconds. For every correct answer the player is allowed to move a step forward. The first one to reach the goal is the winner.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Kung Fu Combo
description:
Description from the publisher:

Kung Fu Combo is a fast action 2 player card game.
Players take turns attacking and defending until one player is reduced to zero(0) life points and is knocked out.

You take on one of the sacred animal masters; Crane, Tiger, Leopard or Snake. Attack with combination flurry's by matching colors, numbers, sequences or both.
You defend by blocking your opponents attacks by matching numbers or forming defensive combo's by adding and subtracting your cards to perform the proper block.

You decide if you want to lean heavily on defense or rely on your attacks, or try and balance the two.

name: See It? Slam-It!
description: See-It? Slam-It! is a fast-paced family card game where players must shout out a word associated with a picture. There are three picture cards showing at all times. A letter card is flipped over and players race to spot something on any one of the cards beginning with that letter. See something!?! Then slam your hand down fast on the card before someone else spots a match. For example, the three picture cards shown are of pears, a cactus, and a shark jumping out of a pail. You flip over the letter card and it's a "P". Now slam your hand quick on one of the picture cards and make a connection to the letter, "P". You could slam the cactus and say, "prickly"! BAM! There you go! You saw it, you slammed it. Now you know how to play See-It? Slam It! Get ready for a fun game of speed and observation! Description from Amazon
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time

name: The Ultimate Trivial Pursuit Question & Answer Book
description:
A book containing more than 2,500 questions and answers in the six standard Trivial Pursuit categories:


Geography
Entertainment
History
Arts & Literature
Science & Nature
Sports & Leisure


The format is similar to the question cards of a standard Trivial Pursuit game, with six questions on one page and the answers on the backside of that page.

It can be used as an expansion for any Trivial Pursuit set or played on its own.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Reise um die Erde
description: Where will your travel take you? With an around-the-world ticket in Reise um die Erde, the players fly to the metropolises of the world and share their experiences through social networks? Who will be the first to visit their eight personal dream goals?

name: Blood, Sweat and Cheers
description:
Blood, Sweat and Cheers is a tactical, two-player, card and dice game, that recreates single combat between gladiators in the arenas of the Roman world from the mid-third century BC to the start of the fifth century AD.

Cards are used to abstractly represent the different options available to a player’s gladiator during the ebb and flow of a gladiatorial bout, while dice are used to resolve interactions. The watching crowd interacts with the gladiators in the arena by rewarding showy attacks and spilt blood with favourable cheering which may in turn be utilised to buoy up a gladiator’s performance.

Almost everything you need to play the game, including a basic area, is inluded in the deck. All players need to do is download the free two-page rule sheet at DriveThruCards and provide their own gladiators, dice, and a few wound tokens or markers.

name: Civitas
description:
Civitas is a fast-paced hand management card game about different government forms. Become the President, General, or even King while you try to be the first to empty your hand of cards. Customize each game by mixing and matching the eight different government types (Monarchy, Military, Democracy, Communism, Theocracy, Plutocracy, Republic, and Anarchy).

Before starting the game, players choose which forms of government they want to use. Each governmental form features its own deck of color-coded number cards, event cards, law cards, wild cards, and government change cards. Combine the decks together and then deal each player 7 cards. The top card of the deck determines the starting government, and then on your turn, you play one card out of your hand that matches the color of the government in play. If it's a number card, play continues. If it's an event card, resolve the action on the card. Law cards have special actions that must be resolved according to the government in play (voting in a democracy or the first player deciding in a monarchy, for example). And government change cards force a shift to a new form of government. If you don't have a card to play, draw a new card and play passes to the next player. The game continues until one player has gotten rid of all his or her cards. You then score according to the number of cards left in your hand modified by the governments you led during the game.

Be sure to chose wisely when changing the governments because each one has special effects that can make it easier for you, or harder for your opponents, to win. Use the power of Communism to slow down the leader as you redistribute cards, or declare a Plutocracy and watch your lead get bigger with every turn. Move cards around in the deck in a Theocracy, and decide events together in a democracy. Build up other players' decks in a Military government, make other players lose turns in a Monarchy, and build coalitions in a Republic. But watch out for descent into Anarchy, where government leaders lose their power, and anything goes as wild cards take over game play.

name: Sailor Moon Crystal: Truth or Bluff
description:
Are you telling the truth or bluffing? Keep your opponents guessing as you pass tiles around the table and try not to get caught being too obvious. Watch out for the Dark Kingdom villains, though, because they can mess with your plans. When one player triggers the end of the game they are defeated and the player with the most number of Success Tokens is the winner!

A hilarious party game of deception and misdirection featuring super-deformed caricatures of your favourite Sailor Moon Crystal guardians!

Game Play Details
Players each attempt to avoid running out of Character Tiles and/or filling the conditions on the selected Ending Tile that triggers the end of the game while simultaneously trying to gain the greatest number of Success Token points. The player that triggers the game’s end has been defeated while the player with the greatest number of Success Token points is the winner.

name: Foodfighters: Problem Picnic Faction
description:
This Foodfighters expansion adds a new faction to the game, with a theme from another Kids Table BG game, Problem Picnic: Attack of the Ants. Like the factions in the base game and other expansions, this one includes the following:

9 Delicious Fighter Tiles
9 Static Cling Thought Bubbles
3 Awesome Power Cards


…and it is packaged in its own tuckbox.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Kitsune Switch
description:
Kitsune Switch, a.k.a. きつねスイッチ, is an UNO-like card game with hidden identity mechanism.

Players are dealt a role card which is human, fox, or the fox spirit, and a battle is fought between humans and the fox spirit. Foxes are fluid; they ally with the fox spirit if it exists, otherwise they ally with humans. The game is played like UNO; players take turns playing a card which has the same color or number as the top card of discard pile. Each time a card is played, its effect is activated. Players could be forced to change their roles or even eliminated from the game.

The game ends when a player gets rid of all cards in their hand, in which case that player wins the game. All of that player's allies win together, but only if there is an opposing side of the winner. The game also ends when the deck runs out, in which case the side with the lower total value in their hands wins the game if there are two sides. Otherwise the player with the lowest total value in their hand wins the game.

Sometimes you are required to co-operate to win as a team, but you win anyway if you go out. It is an effective strategy to focus on winning alone.

•••

基本的にUNO／ウノです。陣営戦要素とカードに特殊効果があります。陣営を示す正体カードは『人間』、『狐』、『九尾の狐』の３種類で、人間陣営と九尾陣営の２つに分かれています。
ウノ同様、手札を出し切れば自分の陣営ごと勝ちますし、その前に山札が切れた場合は、陣営ごとにカードの合計値を比べ合う判定戦になります。
陣営戦なので協力要素がありますが、陣営はゲーム中、流動的に変化し、いっそ一人勝ちを狙いに行くのも有効な戦略です。
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Team-Based Game

name: Brigand Kings
description:
The border counties of Bhargive are unstable and dangerous. In the interests of commerce, neighboring lords send in soldiers to control the bandit problem. The trick is that the bandits are just troops sent from neighboring lords on the other side.

Players are barons with dreams of glory. Each turn, they roll dice in order to muster troops and send them to loot border counties - or to protect border counties. Whichever.

This game uses a Decktet and dice.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Print & Play

name: Monster Misfits:  Battle Pack
description:
Add more strategy to your Monster Misfits Game with this 50 Card Expansion Pack.
Give your Monsters Weapons, Potions, Curses and other Items to make an epic battle!
Battle Pack also comes with all new Chaos Cards and more Monsters.

—description from the publisher

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Land Starter Deck
description:
Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey is a new take on the collectible non-collectible KB line, with Jeffrey Neil Bellinger once again putting the rabbits through the grinder. Six new starter decks Animals, Crops, Elementals, Energy, Land and Technology will be available, and players can construct personalized decks of no less than 60 cards, with the cards from any deck.

Ultimate Odyssey is not collectible or random. Players can now buy starter decks and booster expansions for Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey and then use any combination of those cards to form their own constructed decks to play against opponents. Unlike in Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot, where up to eight players play with the same deck of cards, all sharing the same draw pile, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey has players each draw only from their own constructed deck of 60 cards. There are not any random packs, so players will always know which cards they are purchasing in a deck and they can buy the right products for their planned deck. For Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey six brand new starter decks (red, violet, blue, yellow, green, or orange) allow players to construct a personalized deck with any of the cards of any deck.

The setting for the new game is an ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth. Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Goss' Marauder Card Pack
description:
Goss' Marauder is a Ferengi D'Kora class ship. As a card pack, it comes with all the cards and tokens required for play.

It is a part of card pack wave 2.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: MINOPOLY
description: The player who can “see” the most buildings from his side of the board when the game ends is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck

name: Glyph: Seer Champion
description:
Glyph is a dice-building combat strategy game for 2-6 players. Players are tasked with forming a team of three champions and defeat their opponent. These Champions are broken up into three distinct classes--Strikers, Guardians, and Adherents--with each Champion having his or her own strengths, weaknesses, and unique abilities which you will use by harnessing the power of mystical glyphs. As the game progresses, your Champions will have the opportunity to acquire new items which will enhance their capabilities as well as perhaps give them even more skills to use to defeat your enemy.

Glyph: The Seer further expands the options available to players for customizing their group of Champions with a the Seer, a hero with no combos of her own but the devastating ability to see into the future to better turn the tide of battle for your side.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 1976 The Entebbe Blitz
description:
"1976 The Entebbe Blitz" is a solitaire war game depicting the action performed by Sayeret Matkal, one of the Israeli Special Forces, in the airport of Entebbe, Uganda, where a group of terrorists who had hijacked an Air France Boeing were keeping the crew and the Jewish passengers as prisoners.

A daring operation, far from the home bases 4000 kilometers and 8 flight hours, which was a success with the liberation of the hostages and the elimination of the terrorists, with the loss of just one officer and few hostages but some wounded soldiers.

It includes:

86 counters, a A3 map, updated rules... you just need 2 d6!!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: NLT
description:
In NLT (No Later Than), all players have three Blokus-like tridimensional pieces: a N, a L and a T. Each round, a card is drawn, indicating a top, a front and a side view, as well as two of the three pieces. The object of the game is to use the two pieces indicated in order to build a structure matching the three views. Whoever is the first to build the structure takes the card, which is worth one point.

The game ends as soon as a player has 4 points. They are declared the winner.

name: CRIMINAL'S
description:
User summary
CRIMINAL'S is a card game with a theme of thieving.

You are trying to steal a treasure which is guarded with four security methods. To defeat the security, you form a group of five criminals. There are six types of security, and each criminal has an advantage at one of them and a disadvantage at another one.

At the beginning of the game, place 12 security chips, forming three groups of four chips (A, B, and C). Chips in group A are revealed, meaning they are not guarding the treasure. Chips in Group C are never revealed until end of the game, meaning they are guarding the treasure. Chips in group B are partial information; a player can see two of them during the game. Then players are dealt nine criminal cards each.

During a round, the first player takes a chip. The first two players may look at it, and discards one card from their hand. The other players may not look at that chip but guess it from the discards, and discard one from their hand. Instead of discarding one, you may discard two and take the card the previous player discarded. Play four rounds so that everyone has five criminal cards.

At end of the game, reveal one security chip from group C, each player passes the security if they play one criminal who is advantageous to that security, or any two criminals who are not disadvantageous to it (other conditions apply). Take a treasure if you pass four securities in this way.

After several games, the player with the most treasures is the grand champion.

The third edition in 2016 is in Japanese and English.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは手持ちのメンバーカードを使ってチームを編成し、そのメンバーで宝物を守る4つのセキュリティを解除しに行きます。見事解除出来れば宝物が手に入ります。このラウンドを繰り返し、最終的に集めた宝物の数が一番多い人の勝利となります。
publishers: オトコマエゲームズ (OTOKOMAE GAMES)

name: OrcQuest WarPath: Quests Box – PorkQuest
description:
PorkQuest is a new expansion that will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. Here, the Porks have a mission to come chase your heroes during their adventures. Secret poachers have hired these ignoble beings to track down and kill any orc infiltrating the Kingdom of Istarra. So you can add porks as additional enemies in any chapter of the Main Campaign. You will also have the choice of playing them as heroes, allying with the orcs, and you risk seeing them kill each other at the slightest misunderstanding.

As enemies of orcs, the Porks have a mission to hunt down and kill any green skin they encounter. The Pork Trackers will have their own Patrols instead of the normal Patrols. Except that here, the Porks "feel" the presence of orcs, thanks to their highly developed sense of smell. They will go directly to the heroes to try and exterminate them.

In addition, Pork Trackers are not the only ones who resent greenskins. Three Pork bounty hunters prowl the area and may arrive at any time to do carnage, even if it means slaughtering everyone between them and their target.

The Porks can also be used as heroes alongside the orcs and as a band of adventurers who have sworn to help the greenskins in their quest, provided they leave them the found treasures.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Across A Deadly Field: The War in the East
description:
The War in the East, a supplement for John Hill's Across a Deadly Field, gives players the resources to recreate the battles, great and small, of the Eastern Theater of the Civil War.
Step into the shoes of Robert E. Lee and drive towards Washington with the Army of Northern Virginia, or take command of the Army of the Potomac, and attempt to capture Richmond.
With scenarios, including an optional mini-campaign for the first day of Gettysburg, and special rules that enhance gameplay, this volume offers players, whether Union or Confederate, a versatility that can accommodate their preferences and miniatures collections without sacrificing either playability or historical accuracy.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Tanks: Priest (RHA) – Tank Expansion
description:
The RHA (Royal Horse Artillery) were highly experienced gunners. On the mobile battlefields of World War II they traded in their horse and limbers for American M7 self-propelled 105mm, nicknamed ‘Priest’ in British service. The Priest gave the armoured divisions a mobile artillery piece able to keep up with its tanks during cross-country moves.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Priest (RHA) tank
1x Priest (RHA) tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Squatch the Board Game
description:
Challenge your friends and be the first to catch the Sasquatch. This is a fast paced game where each player races to collect 3 supply cards corresponding with 1 of the 4 locations on the board. On a turn, a player may play as many cards from their hand as they like, then draw back up to 3 cards.

Supply cards, when drawn, are immediately placed face up on the discard pile. The first player to grab the corresponding territory totem wins that supply card.

Once you have collected enough supply cards you must move yourself and Sasquatch onto the correct location in order to catch him and win the game. Watch out, other players will steal your supplies, rotate the board, and other things to mess up your plans.
mechanics: Area Movement, Set Collection, Take That

name: Take a Pic
description:
The photo safari on the game board is open, so keep your eyes open and cameras on!

In Take a Pic, dice indicate which animals can be seen this round and you must be the first one who takes a picture. Don't forget to protect pictures on your flash card because competitors don't slumber!

The game includes two big dice with animals and a photographer (joker) on their faces, and the animals on the round cards represent what you see through your camera lens. Now it's time to find out who is faster. Say cheese!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Tanks: Lend Lease Valentine Tank Expansion
description: Because the Valentine was so well-liked by the Soviets, the British government decided to direct nearly all of Canadian Valentine production to the Soviet Union. Over the war a total of 3,782 Valentines of various marks were sent to the Soviet Union.

name: Small Star Empires: Supermassive Black Hole
description:
Mini-expansion for Small Star Empires.

Explore the secrets of the Supermassive Black Hole with your survey ships and stay clear of its strong gravitational field, as it can pull your ships and destroy them!

Push your luck to score as much points as possible!

—description from the back of the box
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Bakugan Battle Planet: Battle Brawlers
description: The goal of the game is to deal damage to your opponent until they run out of cards. Turns are simultaneous. A round begins with a card draw, then each player may play a card face-down as an energy card. Then, players roll their Bakugan (spheres which transform via a magnet) at the hide matrix, a series of metallic tiles each of which is referred to a Baku-core. Brawls are resolved by comparing BP with ties determined by flipping a card, with the higher cost breaking the tie. The winner will the deal damage to the opponent based on its damage value. Cards may be played at almost anytime.

name: Ancient Terrible Things: Unnatural Mystic Promo Card
description:
Kickstarter exclusive limited edition adventure promo card (from the Ancient Terrible Things: AwakeTen Kickstarter).

An additional adventure card that can be added to the deck of adventure cards in the base game.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Mythology
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Warhammer Armies (Fourth Edition): Chaos
description:
Warhammer Armies: Chaos is an expansion to the 4th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This boxed set contains an 88-page softcover army book, as well as over a hundred various cards (magic spells, magic items, Chaos rewards, and Chaos gifts), that provide all kinds of information required to collect Chaos faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Chronicles of Crime: Game Boy Geek 2019 Promo Card
description:
Available from Game Boy Geek 2019 Kickstarter Campaign.

Adds a new suspect for missions in Chronicles of Crime.
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Sparkle*Kitty: Safe Words Pack
description:
A 40 card expansion set for the Spark*Kitty games.

Introducing Vampire and Werewolf game modes to add more variety to all of your Spark*Kitty need!

Plus a few new spells, enchantments and a wild ream power that we can all get behind.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Libretto
description:
One player plays the yellow letter tiles; the other player plays the blue letter tiles. On his turn, a player creates a word with his tiles and places it on a 16X16 grid. The object of the game for each player is to connect with a series of words the sides of the board that match that player's tile colors and, of course, to block the other player, who is trying to do the same thing with his tiles. The first player to connect his sides of the board is the winner.

—user summary

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Chaos Battletome – Blades of Khorne
description:
Battletome: Blades of Khorne is the updated guide to fielding a Khorne army for Age of Sigmar 2nd Edition.

This hardback book contains a miniatures showcase illustrating colour schemes and painting advice, plus examples of painted models. It also features rules for fielding your Blades of Khorne army in games of Age of Sigmar, as well as rules for building a Khorne warband in Path to Glory.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Battle Ravens: Scottish Army
description:
Battle Ravens army packs offer players three new armies to command in battle: choose from the Normans, the Welsh, or the Scots.

Battle Ravens is a game of Viking Age warfare: a brutal clash of strength, cunning and luck, where subtlety and nuance are neither welcome or commonplace. Army packs offer new artwork and strategies for play.

Each army pack includes 18 Hirdmen, 18 Bondi, 4 Thralls, 20 Ravens, an information sheet including optional rules for Battle Ravens, and 10 Tactics Cards themed to the army.

—description from the publisher

name: I Spy Spooky Mansion
description:
Players make their way through the Spooky Mansion spotting objects among the mysterious contents and collecting keys to the mansion. The first player to collect five keys from different rooms and escape the mansion wins the game.

Literacy: Introduces vocabulary with words and pictures.
Coordination: Use quick thinking to identify matches.
Social Skills: Cooperate with each other and follow rules.

Contents include: 3D Game Board, 20 Picture Cards, 80 Word Cards, 4 Player Pieces, 18 Key Tokens, 4 Mansion Maps, 1 Die, Sand Timer and Instructions.
publishers: Briarpatch, FI Entertainment Co., Ltd., University Games

name: Ultra Quick Baseball
description:
The purpose of this game is to quickly simulate scores and standings for baseball leagues. You can use the game as a companion to a play-by-play baseball game, or as a stand-alone game in which you play out the season and watch the pennant races unfold.
Each team is accurately rated for their hitting, pitching and defense as well as how they perform when playing at home and how they handle pressure situations. The combination of these ratings gives you a very accurate picture of each team. In addition to the team ratings, we also provide you with a quick and simple method for normalizing teams across eras. So, you can effortlessly determine the best team of all time if you choose, without worrying about any biases.

As the name implies, the games play out Ultra Quick! Now you can finally complete that full baseball season on your tabletop with Ultra Quick Baseball.

You'll need an Ultra Quick Season Year Book to play the game.

name: The Era of Traveling Merchant
description:
The Era of Traveling Merchant, a.k.a. 行商の時代, is a pick-up-and-deliver game of merchants peddling their wares.

A peddler who travels through various cities and sells goods was indispensable to running the economy. Players go around each city to buy goods and fulfill their orders. Getting the goods sold by other players will help a player become the best peddler. Become one of the world's richest and prestigious merchants by successfully managing your products in multiple cities.

To set up the game, nine city tiles are arranged in one of the suggested ways, with each tile being divided into colored zones to match the player colors. Six order cards are dealt from a deck, which show various demands from these nine cities.

Players get two actions on a turn from a move action, a cargo action, or a shipping action. Players can move to cities; can pick up cargo from a city and place the goods in their wagon (but not goods they dropped previously); or ship goods to their storehouse in the city with the demand. By fulfilling demands, players collect order cards, gaining victory points. By taking the most prominent order cards, players receive jewel bonuses. By building up sets of order cards, players can increase the capacity of their wagons and build trading houses in cities; trading houses give the player a third action each round, which gives the player an advantage and is one of the endgame conditions.

The game ends either when the decks are exhausted, the special cards (difficult orders) are lost, or when a player has four trading houses.

All players get the same number of turns, then a final score is taken, most points wins. Points come from order cards, jewels, and from getting the last wagon card (marked fin).
mechanics: Contracts, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Perfect Family
description:
What kind of family do you think is a perfect family? Luxury cars in mansions, brilliant living? Or a peaceful family with a smile on their face? Any family can be cast with light. No matter how perfect it may look, there's a secret behind it that you can't imagine. Yes, a perfect family.

Players are all part of the family. We will raise the perfect value of the family as much as possible in seven days to bring it closer to the ideal perfect family that everyone will live in.

On the other hand, players must keep their characters' secret. If a secret is revealed, not only will your family become unhappy, but you will also lose your life experience.

What would you do if this family became "almost" perfect or collapsed? Of course, you have to move as you get!
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Escape Adventures: Von Schmugglern und Entdeckern
description: Family friendly escape game in a Caribbean island setting. The story driven game includes solving puzzles as well as some deductive skills and offers a scoring at the end based on the age of the group and the used hints.

name: Sin Rummy
description:
Sin Rummy is a brand new game - a vicious twist on one of the most popular card games of all time (Gin Rummy).

The game itself is elegantly contained inside a gorgeous deck of the highest-quality playing cards, manufactured by the United States Playing Card Company.

Sin Rummy follows the rules of Rummy, with a simple exception: before each round starts, each player is dealt one 'social sin' card face up on the table. This card changes the rules for only the player that has it, for the entirety of that round. Then play proceeds with whatever variant of Rummy you prefer.

—description from the publisher

name: Pocket Investigations: The Love Lock Agency
description:
Pocket Investigations is a series of "escape boxes", i.e. cooperative investigation board games that are based on escape games, with real items for clues, and playable at home.

In this scenario, you will have to follow a mysterious stranger in the streets of Venice during the Carnival...

name: DunFi Escape
description:
Try to make your way through 59 dungeon areas and have legendary songs sung about your wits, bravery and cunning.... or will you die horribly? Yes, the answer is yes... you will die horribly. Good Luck!

A 9-card, dice rolling 'continuing dungeon' layout in which you are being constantly chase by an unknown 'creature'.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Harry Potter: I'm Going to Hogwarts
description:
I'm going to Hogwarts is a Harry Potter themed card game based on the classic children's memory game "I went to market"..

Players take to turns to recite all the previous items packed for the trip to Hogwarts before drawing a new card and adding it to the list. If someone makes a mistake all other players, in reverse order, take a item from the list to add to their trunk, where they are trying to collect their 4 unique items.

— user description

name: Motyla noga!
description:
Do you like butterflies? Well, so does the kitten. More so, the little kitten needs you and your friends to help catch the little butterfly so that they can play together.

Gather your friends and follow the butterfly path while it flies from place to place, and guess where it last landed. You'll win cards if you pay attention to the butterfly's flight path and when the kitten catches the butterfly you shout out.

name: Chain Mail: A Call to Arms – Adventure Kit
description:
Rumors spread of a missing war horn that calls forth a long lost hero. It's location is known only to three mysterious elders, each with their own demands of those who come looking.

Find the elders, appease them, and bring back the horn.

A Call to Arms is an Adventure Kit for Chain Mail: Adventures of Earthshine.

Goal: Return the Golden Horn to the Noble.

This expansion includes:

Quest: A Call to Arms
Map: Bitterport Bay
Monsters: Fungal Cluster / Wild Mushroom
Treasure: Elixir of Ogre Strength



Released in the May 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Chain Mail: All-Seeing is Believing – Adventure Kit
description:
A well-known collector is asking for help in procuring a very particular eye. In order to find the eye you'll have to search out the right monster, getting close enough to confirm they have it.

Be warned, monsters don't take well to people sneaking about.

All-Seeing is Believing is an Adventure Kit for Chain Mail: Adventures of Earthshine.

Goal: Find and reclaim the All-Seeing Eye.

This expansion includes:

Quest: The All-Seeing Eye
Character: Zoella, Astrologist
Map: The Swamps of Sorrow
Monsters: Giant / Orc Grunt
Treasure: Plate Armor



Released in the August 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Hattin 1187
description:
Battle of Hattn was one the decisive battles of the crusades. Christian army, led by the Raymond Tripoli, Guy of Lusigan and Balian of Ibelin met the muslim army, led by Saladin. In the two days long fights most of the Crusaders was killed or taken prisoner.It was the end of the Kingdom of Jerusalem.

Game uses Medieval system rules, with classic "I go, you go" mechanics. Cavalry is allowed to perform charges that doubles or triples it's strength, but it needs enough terrain to do so. Muslims have quite a number of horse archers that allows them to carry a number of distance attacks on the enemy. Fatigue of the armies pays important role as well.

Game contains two scenarios, showing both days of the battle.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Dr. Biscuits' Radical Road Trip: 60 Fun Games to Play in Your Car
description:
60 Fantastic Games To Play in Your Car!


Survive a License Plate Asteroid Field
Play a new version of H-O-R-S-E using the radio
Spot themed bumper stickers for Points
Spark a dance contest at the next rest stop
Send a postcard to the White House (included!)
Trick your friends into meowing like a cat
Play games like Duck Duck Bruce, Flip Dingus, and Ronjon Chico Bonbon … And that’s just scratching the surface!


Dr. Biscuits' Radical Road Trip is the brainchild of Barry and Jason, the creators of Game Night in a Can. Just as they did with their first successful game, Barry and Jason used their comedic skills and fun-loving competitive spirit to create 60 brand new games to play in the car. There are 6 categories of games to choose from, each one containing 10 games. The Categories are Everlasting Games, Logical Games, Ridiculous Games, Games for Humanity, Creative Games and Games Outside the Car. It's been called "Cranium for the Car" by some and "the most fun I've had in a car since you were conceived" by others

—description from the publisher

name: Black Stories Junior: Animal Stories
description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: animal stories are tricky riddles for animal lovers. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

Black Stories Junior: animal stories includes fifty cards with riddles for you to puzzle out.

name: Delivirus
description:
Players fill Deliveries by collecting sets of Resources from the Market while avoiding Symptoms. If a player takes on too many Symptoms, that player will have to take a Test to see if he/she has contracted a virus! At the end of the game, players tally the points earned from their completed Deliveries and subtract any points from Deliveries still in their hand. The player with the most points wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Second Edition): Codex – Space Wolves
description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


Codex for Space Wolves for Warhammer 40K second edition. 88 pages.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Snotling Team Card Pack
description:
This deck of 44 cards helps you focus on your game and keep track of your stats and special rules. Snotling teams are an all-new team with new positionals and lots of tricks up their sleeves.

Contents:
– 6 Reference cards for Snotlings, Fungus Flingas, Fun-Hoppas, Stilty Runnas, Pump Wagons, and Trolls
– 9 Reference cards for Star Players including Bomber Dribblesnot, Fungus the Loon, Nobbla Blackwart, and Ripper Bolgrot
– A Golden Era Star Player Reference Card for Bob Bifford
– 20 Blank cards that you can use to keep track of your own players
– A team roster card, with a match record on the reverse
– 3 Dirty Tricks cards (can be used by any team)
– 3 Miscellaneous Mayhem cards (can be used by any team)
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

Key Features
Full set of reference cards for Snotling teams
Includes blank cards for all 6 positions
Speed up your games and keep track of your roster, players, and special rules

-description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Small Army: Tank Wars
description:
This game is combination of the construction of historic vehicles from construction blocks with games simulating the armored battles of World War II.

In the set you will find blocks which, when assembled, will create military vehicles, which are faithful replicas of authentic machines. Each of the models is made on a scale compatible with Small Army NANO products — blocks produced by COBI.

Thanks to Small Army Tank Wars you will see that a good game can also be like a history lesson coming to life.

It is at the same time an excellent lesson in strategic thinking for adults and children.

You can easily play it with your family and friends.
We guarantee that with Small Army Tank Wars no one will be bored!

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Command Cards, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Open Drafting, Programmed Movement, Square Grid

name: GRBLD
description:
Each round in GRBLD, players draft letter cards to build words in a given category. Players draft only consonants, with vowels being free! Once the words have been built, players drop the words on their sheet. The first word will still make sense, but then things get GRBLD!

Players score by filling rows, marking off the alphabet, filling a "combo bar" by placing vowels in the correct spaces, and stacking the same consonants on each other. Via the combo bar, players unlock great powers to use, such as the "letterbomb" and the ability to use both letters on a card or even to make two words in a round.

By using various powers, players get to experience satisfying explosive turns in which they rack up both words and points. However, peak too early and risk running out of space for your words; peak too late, and risk not being able to make optimal use of your powers.

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Bob Ross Edition
description:
“Take advantage of whatever happens” in the most peaceful edition of MONOPOLY you’ve ever seen! MONOPOLY: Bob Ross is your bravery test to buy, sell, and trade favorite works of art from The Joy of Painting series. Use collectible tokens to canvas the board as a Squirrel, Pine Tree, Easel, and more as you build up Cabins and Covered Bridges, shake off taxes, and beat the devil out of others’ budgets to be the last one standing with Happy Bucks!

Includes:
Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens
28 Title Deed Cards
16 Happy Little Accidents Cards
16 The Joy of Painting Cards
32 Houses renamed Cabins
12 Hotels renamed Covered Bridges
1 pack of Bob Ross Money
2 dice
Rules

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Marvel HeroClix: Battlegrounds – Avengers vs. Masters of Evil
description:
Get Started with Battlegrounds!
The Avengers are a team of Earth’s Mightiest Heroes – can they defeat the Masters of Evil – a team of Earth’s most menacing villains? Each figure in HeroClix Battlegrounds comes with 2 cards to match their HeroClix dial; one is specifically geared toward learning to play, while the other is good for players who have already played a few games. Featuring fan-favorite heroes and recognizable villains, it will appeal to casual fans and Marvel veterans alike!

The Avengers feature Captain America, Black Widow, Iron Man, Hulk, and Captain Marvel. The Masters of Evil include Mach-X, Baron Zemo, Red Skull, Winter Soldier, and Ultron! Different combinations and teams will face off head-to-head in normal HeroClix combat or scenarios unique to this product!

This boxed-set is a great way for 2 players to learn HeroClix!

HeroClix Battlegrounds contains everything up to 4 people need to play HeroClix (Exact game components subject to change):

10 HeroClix Figures
20 HeroClix Character Cards
18 Object and Terrain Tokens
20 Action Tokens
4 Full-Color Maps
2 Six-Sided dice with the Avengers logo
1 HeroClix Powers & Abilities Card
1 HeroClix Core Rulebook
8 Scenario/Campaign Cards
6 Double-Sided Bystanders (for Scenario/Campaign use only)

-description from publisher's website
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures

name: Trail Blazers
description:
Pack your bags, get ready… we’re going on an adventure! We’ll travel through the dense jungle of Amazonia, the scorching desert of Tenere, the icy mountains of Makalu and the fiery skies of Shangri La to collect mystical treasures. But beware, perils lie everywhere. Anyone can enter but only a few can escape…

Trailblazers is an exciting memory drawing game that your family will not get enough of. The goal is simple: see a map, spot the treasures and obstacles, remember them and then draw your own way out of it using memory and some basic rules. Then, spin away and maximise your points! Sounds simple but is a laughing riot when opponents take a wrong turn.
Enjoy as your kids use principles of geometry, memory and strategy to draw their way through various adventure worlds. See them master basic concepts of lines and angles, decision making and motor skills right before your eyes!

In Trail Blazers, players travel through four different adventures, collecting coins and avoiding obstacles. The goal is to draw your way out of each maze in the adventure region. Everybody starts with a Path Map, and a sketch pen. Place the adventure book in the centre. Choose an adventure region, and start with Maze 1. Cover the maze with the Spin-A-Round spinner. Keep your sand timer ready.
VIEWING ROUND (30 secs) - When the timer begins, all players must visualise and remember a path in the maze from Start to Finish.
During this time, players are not allowed to draw anything. All pens must be down!
At the end of 30 seconds, the maze is covered again with the Spin-A-Round spinner.
DRAWING ROUND (60 secs) - All players draw their paths on their Path Maps from Start to Finish. They must try to score maximum points by collecting coins and avoiding obstacles. All players must enter with a Ray at the Start point and exit with a Ray at the Finish point. You can enter or exit horizontally or vertically but not diagonally. All paths must be individual line segments, connecting the dots on the path maps from Start to Finish. All paths must be horizontal or vertical and not diagonal. At the end of the drawing round, each player counts their score by placing their path map on the maze in the adventure book. Each coin you collect in your path, you get the points mentioned on it. Each obstacle you hit, you lose points as mentioned on the left hand pages. Add all points for the coins collected, subtract all points for the obstacles hit, add 2 points for entering with a ray at the correct Start point and add 2 points for exiting with a ray at the correct Finish point. This is your score for the drawing round.
