SPINNING ROUND - The player with the highest score for this maze, spins the spinner. Now, choose either your entry or exit Ray as the reference Ray. If you get a Parallel, then you count all lines parallel to the reference Ray. If you get a Perpendicular, then you count all lines perpendicular to the reference Ray. Then you multiply the number above by either x1 or x2 as per what they have spun. This is your score for the spinning round.
Add the scores of the Drawing and Spinning round as the final score for maze 1. Repeat the same for Mazes 2 and 3 in the adventure region. The person with the highest total of all three mazes, wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Althingi: One Will Rise
description:
Althingi is a quick set-up, fast-play game of strength and influence for 2-4 players based in Viking-Age Iceland. Each player takes on the role of a powerful Chieftain and tries to take control of the annual gathering known as the Althingi through good old-fashioned bribery, coercion, and intimidation.

The game takes place over a series of days each with three rounds: Morning, Afternoon, and Evening. In the morning Chieftains gather Loot which has value both in bribing Vikings and in equipping them for holmgang (a duel). In the afternoon phase Chieftains strategically bribe the new Vikings that arrive that round to join their camp using their Loot cards while retaining enough resources to defend themselves in the Evening phase. During the Evening, Chieftains can use Vikings in their camp to challenge holmgang (a duel) against Vikings from other camps. The aim of the game is to gain the most influence, which is acquired by having Vikings join your camp and by winning holmgangs (duels). The player with the most influence at the end of the game controls the Althingi and wins!

The aesthetic of this game is gritty and raw, with striking original illustrations by Lada Shustova. Special attention was paid to historical details such as clothing, weapons, and bartering goods, so rest assured that there are no horned helmets in this game! If you’ve visited Iceland, then you’ll recognize the landscape art as the fields of Thingvellir. And Viking history buffs might recognize the meaning of the two runes used in the game, symbols for Strength and for Influence.

-description from designer
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Betting and Bluffing, Bribery, Hand Management

name: Reavers of Midgard: Tablet of Mischief Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of the 2020 GameBoyGeek Season 8 Kickstarter campaign.

Tablet of Mischief:

Any: Discard this artifact to change the faces of up to 2 if your dice to sides of your choice.

name: Sardinia (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description: Ticket to Ride Sardinia is a fan-produced map of Sardinia by Davide Fornasini. The cities on the map are 45 and the map can be played with the original rules of TTR Europe or with the TTR Sardinia's custom rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Trismegistus: Roll & Write
description:
Throughout history alchemists have been tirelessly working on unlocking the most coveted secret of the universe: the Philosopher's Stone. Following the success of Trismegistus: The Ultimate Formula, Trismegistus Roll & Write sends you once again into a race against other alchemists to follow in the footsteps of Hermes Trismegistus and to become the greatest alchemist the world has ever known!

Trismegistus: Roll & Write is played over five rounds. In each round, players take two turns by drafting dice. Additionally, each player may take one reaction per round. With their actions and reactions, players gain elements, transmute them, perform experiments, and prepare for their publications. During the game, players receive and track victory points (VPs) from experiments. At the end of the game, these are added to VPs gained from a player's Philosopher's Stone, their elements, and completed publications.

In addition to the print-and-play materials themselves, you need ten dice from Trismegistus: The Ultimate Formula. If you do not have Trismegistus dice, you can make your own using regular dice and a sticker sheet provided with the print-and-play materials for Trismegistus: Roll & Write.

name: Rapa Nui: Clan Wars
description: Rapa Nui: Clan Wars consists of two new elements for the Rapa Nui base game: "The Sign of the Great Ancestors" introduces a new large obsidian Moaï, and seven Ahu tiles can be used to reinforce the importance of turn order while significantly lengthening the game.

name: Hoodwink
description: A trick taker of shifting alliances, in which partners try to win the same number of tricks as each other, and a soloist tries to sabotage them.

name: Carcassonne: Spiel Doch! Expansion
description:
Issue 2/2018 (autumn/winter 2018) of the German boardgame magazine SPIEL DOCH! published in September 2018 contained a punchboard with 4 tiles: 2 for Carcassonne and 2 for Carcassonne: Safari

This entry is for the 2 Carcassonne tiles using the artwork for the more recent printings.

One tile shows a donkey stable and the other a garden for the Abbott. You can use these tiles to play the variant where the player who manages to place the two new tiles in the correct order immediately receives five extra points.
publishers: Hans im Glück, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Blanc-Manger Coco 3: La petite gâterie
description:
Blanc-manger Coco 3 – La Petite Gâterie, the adult game designed by teenagers, produced by children. Set of 600 cards, including 132 question cards and 468 answer cards.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Rat's Lair
description:
The rat’s lair is the first adventure in a series of mini solitaire card games. Each adventure is a stand-alone game that requires you to collect various items to help you defeat the evil Lord Zadorf in the final adventure.

The rat’s lair is a tile placement game where you must venture into the foul smelling, rat infested sewers in search of five artefacts lost long ago in the great floods.

Explore the vast sewer network by connecting stepping stones and search for the five missing artefacts whilst avoiding the killer rats which infuriatingly block your path.

Find torches to help you progress through the pitch black tunnels, poisons to help you avoid the rats, and collect as many artefacts as you can before making your way back to the sewer entry point – easier said than done!

Just making it out of the sewers with your life could be seen as a success, but you are going to need at least one or two artefacts to help you in your quest against the evil Lord Zadorf. Three or four would be preferable and escaping with all five should be your ultimate goal, but may be a step too far!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Maze, Puzzle
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Gray Eminence: Year of Chaos
description:
The good, the bad, and the ugly of 2020 – the year the hits just kept on coming.

Not since the war years has the world had to work so hard to find succor. As science worked to save us, creativity and ingenuity became our tools of survival during the stresses of lockdown. But for some dark masters, our Annus Horribilis brought new opportunities…

Revisit the secret world of the Gray Eminences, in this expansion to the innovative base game of manipulations and administrations. Become the power behind the thrones that suddenly no-one wished to sit on.

Annus Horribilities turned in to an expansion. No rule changes, but just more of the high-quality content!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Action Queue, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Trading, Voting

name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Succession Wars Cards
description:
Alpha Strike is BattleTech’s fast-playing game of armored combat. Alpha Strike Succession Wars Cards contains the ‘Mech Units that survived centuries of warfare across the Inner Sphere. Fullcolor, poker sized, and laminated for dry-erase use, you just need miniatures and dice and you’ll be battling for control of mankind’s tenuous future.

98 double-sided, dry-erase cards expand players’ available ‘Mech roster.
10 double-sided combat command cards include special rules to play units of renown from BattleTech lore.
Includes all the ‘Mechs from Technical Readout: Succession Wars
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: The Final Light-Year: The Delta Sector
description:
May 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new map, new crew and a new set of enemies, but instead of a new boss, the kit brings a Spaceport postcard that introduces longer form campaign play.

You'll place the spaceport between two sector maps and play two full games, with a little extra trouble in-between. The enemies and boss at the second sector are boosted, but you can use actions in the first sector to weaken them. It's an all new type of balance, looking toward the long game.

This is the first of many spaceports, each twisting the two game campaign in a new way, and even allowing bigger and bigger campaigns as more are released.


Released in the May 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Travel Over
description:
Travel Over is a roll and write game in which the players aim to be the first to travel all over the map. The game includes one map for Japan and another for Tokyo. The player with the most points will win.

On a turn, a player rolls two dice and each player writes in the boxes on their map either numbers or x's. The game will end when one player has written in each box of their map.

Points are earned for being the first to fill in different areas and major cities; reaching certain destination objectives; and filling in the complete map. Players are also given a number of "special powers" to use to aid in their play.

name: Da Vinci Wars 1494-1559
description:
Everything you need to recreate the battles of the Italian Wars, a simple and quick wargame ruleset to simulate one of the most fascinating periods of the art of war, in which sidearms were joined by firearms, while Swiss pikemen were faced in bloody battles by lansquenets and horsemen of arms, the lion of Venice fought indomitable against the armies of the Pope and ...

Sequence of Play

first player will start his turn following the game sequence and the second player will do the same thing, at the end of the turn the next game turn will begin.
First Player attempts to activate his own unit
If successful, First Player activates his unit
First Player tries to activate another of his units and so on, if the player fails the activation the turn passes to the Second Player
Second Player attempts to activate his own unit.
If successful, Second Player activates his unit.
Second Player tries to activate another of his units and so on, if the player fails the activation, the turn returns to the First Player and so on.


The rules are recommended for 15mm to 28mm
Includes army lists for the major protagonists.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Runes of Zun: Arcane Secrets
description:
The Arcane Secrets Expansion will transform how you play Runes of Zun. This expansion is all about advanced knowledge, fortune, and card manipulation.

There are six new action types (good and bad), a new reaction type, and a new and unique modifier type. Mix them into your original game for a total of 78 cards. If you also mix in the original Action Packed Expansion and the Shadow Tactics Expansion, you'll get a total of 114 cards in your deck (or 123 with all the promos!)

New tactics will emerge, and game-changing combos will win out. Are you ready?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Deduction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – New Vegas Rules Expansion
description:
Enter the dangerous world of the Mojave wasteland, Fight over its future at the Hoover Dam, and get some R and R on the lush New Vegas Strip – if you can afford the entry fee!

The Mojave wasteland stretches from New California Territory to the contested Hoover Dam, containing all sorts of treasures for the bold and dangers for the unwary. For those who come out on tip there is glory or territory to be gained; the unlucky join the desert sands of feed the geckos.

The risks are high, but the rewards are great, all within sight of the glowing lights of New Vegas!

This essential rules expansion allows you to add the flora, fauna and characters from New Vegas to your games of Wasteland Warfare. The New Vegas Rules Expansion includes cards for playing with new Fallout: Wasteland Warfare sets, as well as rules and scenarios for playing in the Mojave wasteland.

The accompanying 40-page rulebook includes a guide to building and painting your NCR and Legion models, a miniatures gallery, new rules for storyline events, a five mission campaign allowing you to refight the battle for the Hoover Dam (with the faction of your choice) and mini achievements to try to earn in games.

Faction/model type rules included in the set cover the NCR, Caesar’s Legion and the Super Mutant Nightkin as well as key characters and allies for the Survivors.

Includes 81 Poker and 150 Euro mini pop-out cards.

Units profiles and AI cards included in this set cover:

The Courier
The Burned Man
NCR Veteran Ranger
NCR Trooper MP
NCR Trooper
NCR Patrol Ranger
NCR Civilian Ranger
NCR Heavy Trooper
1st Recon Sharpshooter
Chief Hanlon
General Lee Oliver
Lieutenant Gorobets
Hound Master
Legion Mongrel
Vexillarius
Veteran Decanus
Praetorian Guard
Prime Legionary
Recruit Legionary
Centurion
Legion Explorer
Legionary Scout
Lucius
Vulpes Inculta
Legate Lanius
Nightkin
Marcus
Lily
Tabitha
Raul
Ede-E
Rex
Veronica
Arcade Gannon
Boone
Cass
Securitron MKI
Securitron MKII
The set also includes the following narrative and upgrade cards:
6 x Perk
1 x Unpredictable
28 x Items
12 x Explore
12 x Event
30 x Stranger/Danger/Creature
8 x Quest
53 x Weapon
Requires the Two Player Starter set to play.
categories: Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simulation

name: Pocket-Escape: Schatten der Vergangenheit
description:
Alice discovers her likeness on a wanted poster - an aunt is looking for her! Does this aunt really exist? Or is the profile just a trap? Alice has to use all her courage and ingenuity to face her past...

28 pages full of puzzles, action and difficult decisions.

name: Destroy COVID
description:
Destroy COVID is a cooperative, puzzle-solving board game that players can play in the safety of their homes. Be a member of an international research team and develop a vaccine against COVID to defeat the pandemic. Find the solution fast to keep the number of infected people to a minimum. Communicate effectively and work as a team to save the world.

The boxes contain puzzles similar to ones found in popular escape room games. However, the elements are non destructive, so you can give it to your friends after you finished the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Flip-Pix!
description:
In Flip-Pix!. you start with a number of cards in hand, with one side of each card showing images and the other side showing letters.

Everyone plays at the same time. Pick up your cards, then play one of them image side up, then flip your cards over, find a card with the starting letter for that image, then play that card. Be creative to make matches! For an image of a unicorn, you could play a "U" to match "unicorn", an "A" to match "animal", or an "I" to match "imaginary creature". Flip your cards again to find an image that matches a played letter, and continue playing cards and flipping them.

Whoever first plays all of their cards wins!

name: Fulcrum Leader
description:
Fulcrum Leader is a solitaire tactical game which depicts the conventional Soviet air campaign against NATO in Europe during the Cold War era. The game covers the crucial decades from 1970s to 1990s as opposing forces faced each other down in a game of nuclear brinkmanship, with featured aircraft including the MiG-29 Fulcrum, MiG-23/27 Flogger, MiG-21 Fishbed, MiG-25 Foxbat, Su-27 Flanker, Su-24 Fencer and Su-17 Fitter.

In Fulcrum Leader, you will need to select the right combination of aircraft in your regiment in order to successfully carry out the different missions which your pilots will execute. You will be faced with the same type of decision-making and risk-taking experienced by Soviet air regimental commanders.

This game adds new aspects of Soviet air operations such as enhanced radio-electric combat, ground controlled intercepts (GCI), and the ever-present political officer watching over your shoulders, the Zampolit. You will need to manage the capability of your pilots, weigh the advantages and disadvantages of your aircraft, use your zampolit to manage your superiors, and avoid the ignoble fate of being sent off to a re-education facility in Kamchatka.

The core game contains 336 cards and 704 counters, including:


207 x Aircraft cards
MiG-21bis Fishbed-N
MiG-23ML Flogger-G
MiG-27 Flogger-J
MiG-29 Fulcrum-A (USSR / Bulgaria / Czechoslovakia / DDR / Poland / Romania)
MiG-29 Fulcrum-C
Su-17M Fitter
Su-24 Fencer
Su-27 Flanker

5 x Squadron Asset cards
MiG-25RB/RBV Foxbat-B
MiG-25RBSh Foxbat-D
MiG-25BM Foxbat-F
Su-25 Frogfoot

18 x Support Aircraft cards
Yak-28PP Brewer-E
Tu-126 Moss
A-50 Mainstay

9 x Ground Control Intercept cards
45 x Target cards
36 x Event cards
16 x Zampolit cards


In addition, the core box includes:


11 x Campaign sheets
3 x Player Help sheets
1 x Airbase Squadron Control sheet
1 x Player Log sheet
1 x Tactical Display board
1 x Rulebook


—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 4 – Cambalache
description:
Sucesos Argentinos Vol. 4 is a card game where Argentinian history knowledge is tested. Players must organize a chain of historical events chronologically ordered.

Each game can have from 2 to 4 players and lasts 15 to 20 minutes. It can be combined with other volumes to play up to 6 players.

This game box contains 75 unique double-sided cards depicting notable events in Argentina's history. On the front of each card are the name by which the historical event is known and an image, and on the back a description of the event and the year in which it occurred.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Sucesos Argentinos es un juego de cartas donde se pone a prueba el conocimiento de historia argentina de los jugadores organizando una cadena de sucesos en orden cronológico.

Cada partida puede tener de 2 a 4 jugadores y tiene una duración de 15 a 20 minutos. Puede combinarse con otros volúmenes para permitir hasta 6 jugadores.

La caja del juego contiene 75 cartas únicas de doble cara que representan sucesos notables de la historia argentina. En el frente de cada carta encontramos el nombre por el cual se conoce al hecho histórico y una imagen orientativa, y al dorso una descripción del suceso y el año en que ocurrió.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

name: Raise the Roofs
description:
How high can you build it? Roll different dice combinations to build towers and earn bonus blocks. Create the tallest combined tower to win the game.

In Raise the Roofs, players take turns rolling the dice up to three times to create different combinations. These combinations are then used to build new towers, add blocks to existing towers, or reduce the height of an opponent's tower. Once gameplay ends, each player combines their towers into a single tower, and the player with the tallest tower wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Stacking and Balancing, Take That

name: Hit the Silk!: Extra Cargo Pack expansion
description:
Additional content for Hit the Silk!
- New Open Water expansion with Punchboard and addition rules.
- Deck of 20 Cards
- Altitude Dice
Limited Edition

Altitude Dice - this replaces the automatic 1000ft. drop in altitude after the vote to Hit the Silk! introducing variable outcomes between 500-1500 ft.
New Open Water Scenario including an additional game board (at the larger size).
Deck of 20 Incident Cards - which can be added to any game and additional assets and rules specific to the scenario.

name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield Fusion Strike
description:
The path ahead is riddled with rivals and fierce battles. Fortunately, it also harbors limitless potential as the new Fusion Strike style emerges, capturing the unbound spirit of Pokémon and Trainers alike! Adaptable new Pokémon V like Genesect V, Hoopa V, and Mew VMAX are eager for battle, while Single Strike and Rapid Strike Pokémon loom large as Rillaboom VMAX, Cinderace VMAX, and Inteleon VMAX appear in their Gigantamax forms. Go with the flow and discover powerful new strategies in Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield—Fusion Strike!
—description from the publisher

Adds over 260 new cards to the game.
—user summary
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: LÊN MÂM
description:
Len Mam is a card game for 2-4 players. You will become siblings, and cook the traditional Tet tray together

Summary of games

The game has 3 stages including going to the market, cooking and completing the dish. After the market closes, players will check their trays and score points. The person having the most points will win. There are 4 traditional dishes that will be cooked including bamboo shoot soup, jellied meat, square glutinous rice cake, and pickled onion. Each dish will correspond to 1 color and need 4 different ingredients to cook
To set up, each player has 5 ingredient cards, the remaining cards will be called a market deck. The turn starts with the oldest person called the eldest brother/sister. The player takes 2 cards from the market deck, chooses 1 of the 2 cards to decide what to cook in turn
Stage 1: Go to the market: You draw ingredient cards from the market deck
Stage 2: Cook: You can put 1-3 cards into the pot. You can put cards that are the same color as the dish you are cooking, or different color cards.
When you play a different color card, you will activate that card's function. However, if there are more different color cards than the number of players + 1, the pot will be destroyed and the dish cannot be completed.

Stage 3: Complete the dish: The dish can only be completed when there are 4 ingredients to cook it (not counting the number of cards). The player who plays the last card to complete the dish will take all the cards on the pot to his tray to score points at the end of the game. If there are more different color cards than the number of players + 1, the pot will be destroyed. The last player playing a different color card will not get the ingredients in the pot, the other players take the ingredient cards from the pot.
At the end of phase 3, a new turn will begin, until the deck of afternoon market cards is taken, the game ends.
Special card: Boiling water card: can be played with any color and is scored at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

“Người chơi sẽ trở thành các anh chị em trong gia đình, cùng nhau nấu Mâm cỗ ngày Tết cổ truyền.
Tóm tắt trò chơi
Trò chơi trải qua 3 giai đoạn gồm Đi chợ, Vào bếp và Kiểm nồi. Sau khi chợ đóng cửa, người chơi sẽ kiểm tra mâm cỗ của mình và tính điểm. Người được nhiều điểm nhất sẽ chiến thắng. Có 4 món ăn truyền thống sẽ được nấu gồm canh măng, thịt đông, bánh chưng, dưa hành. Mỗi món sẽ tương ứng với 1 màu và cần 4 nguyên liệu khác nhau để nấu
Mỗi người sẽ có sẵn 5 nguyên liệu khi bắt đầu trò chơi, những thẻ còn lại sẽ gọi là chồng thẻ chợ. Lượt chơi bắt đầu từ người tuổi nhất - chị/anh cả. Người chơi lấy 2 thẻ từ chồng thẻ chợ, chọn 1 trong 2 thẻ để quyết định món sẽ nấu trong lượt
Giai đoạn 1: Đi chợ: người rút thẻ nguyên liệu từ chồng thẻ chợ
Giai đoạn 2: Vào bếp: người chơi được bỏ từ 1-3 thẻ nguyên liệu vào nồi. Bạn có thể bỏ nguyên liệu cùng màu với món đang nấu hoặc bỏ nguyên liệu khác màu.
Khi đánh nguyên liệu khác màu, bạn sẽ được kích hoạt chức năng của thẻ đó. Nhưng nếu nồi có số thẻ nguyên liệu khác màu bằng số người chơi + 1 thì nồi sẽ bị phá hoại và món ăn không thể hoàn thành
Giai đoạn 3: Kiểm nồi: Món ăn chỉ được hoàn thành, khi có đủ 4 nguyên liệu nấu món đó (không tính số lượng thẻ). Người chơi đánh thẻ cuối cùng để hoàn thành món sẽ được Lên Mâm và lấy toàn bộ thẻ trên nồi về Mâm của mình để tính điểm vào cuối game. Nếu xuất hiện số thẻ khác màu hơn số được phép, nồi sẽ bị phá hoại. Người cuối cùng đánh thẻ phá hoại sẽ không được lấy nguyên liệu trong nồi, các người chơi khác lần lượt lấy các thẻ nguyên liệu đã được nấu chín trong nồi.
Kết thúc giai đoạn 3, sẽ bắt đầu lượt chơi mới, đến khi chồng thẻ chợ chiều được lấy hết thì kết thúc trò chơi.
Thẻ đặc biệt: Thẻ nước sôi: có thể đánh cùng bất kỳ màu nào và được tính điểm vào cuối game”

—description from the publisher

name: Turf War: Fantasy Theme Pack
description:
The Fantasy Theme Pack expands the base Turf War with a set of fantasy-themed cards to replace each player's starting cards, as well as 5 new fantasy-themed Neighbor cards that can be shuffled into the Neighbor deck.

The re-themed cards include 2 "Treasure Chest" Piggy Banks, 2 "Dragon's Hoard" Piggy Bank Tracks, 2 "Castle / Adventure" Home / Away cards, 2 "Throne Room" Garages, and a "Dungeon" Trash card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pieces as Map, Race, Square Grid, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Jurassic Park: Bid to Win Trivia
description: Grab your Visitor’s pass and prove how “clever” you are by going head-to-head with other prehistoric adventure lovers with the officially licensed Jurassic Park: Bid to Win Trivia Game! Answer 600 questions that span Jurassic Park, The Lost World, and Jurassic Park 3 trilogy.

name: Guca 5
description:
Be the first to use all your cards to form trios, ladders or logical relationships (greater than/less than, additions/subtractions and equalities). Modify the groups that are already on the table, use some of your cards to create new ones. Even use the joker to make combinations and modifications. Play, think and above all enjoy!
A morea advanced version of Guca 3.

name: Gamestormers
description:
Gamestormers is a creative, tableau-building card game for 3-6 players. In the game, you are a young, up-and-coming gamestormer in the futuristic land of Fjerogard who must impress the Elder Gamestormer with a great new game idea. The object of the game is to design and pitch a great game idea to the rest of the players.

During the game, players fill out their game tableaus using a variety of actions, such as taking Item cards from the market, drafting Storyline and Mechanic cards, designing custom cards using dice with images, or entering the Arena. All of the actions allow the player to acquire new cards for the game they are designing or earn victory points.

There are two ways to win the game - either create a game that is worth the most victory points, or receive the most votes for best overall game from your fellow players. The game you create consists of a Storyline card, two Mechanic cards, and two Items cards, each of which you will use to create a cohesive game narrative. Each card in your game tableau earns you points, as well as other bonuses you can activate by reaching certain objectives.

-description from designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Storytelling, Victory Points as a Resource, Voting

name: Table Battles: Great Battles of Prince Charles Alexander of Lorraine
description:
Great Battles of Prince Charles Alexander of Lorraine is the sixth expansion to Amabel Holland's Table Battles, taking as its subject the not-exactly illustrious career of its namesake. Oh, the six battles in this set are "great" battles, including some of the most famous engagements of the eighteenth century. But they're not famous because of Charles, who is widely regarded as one of the worst commanders in history. They're famous because of guys like Frederick the Great and Maurice de Saxe, who ran circles around our boy Chuck, inflicting one humiliating defeat after another. Of course, the battles didn't have to end the way they did, and perhaps with your skill and a little luck, the outcomes might be very different!

This builds on some of the layers added in the last two expansions, and adds some new wrinkles of its own! Linked formations support one another, and tactical victory conditions allow you to win by attrition when a more decisive outcome is out of your grasp. Cards are demarcated as Infantry or Cavalry formations (with illustrations!), and the new Shift mechanic allows you to move forces of a certain type from one card to another. This not only can shore up places where your lines are weak, but if you concentrate enough force in one area, the resulting Oblique Attack can inflict heavier casualties on the enemy.
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Corruptia: Segunda Vuelta
description:
From the designers of Corruptia, came a new game for 2 players!

Welcome to Corruptia: Second Round, an asymmetrical card game where a business man and a candidate try to obtain the major quantity of personal benefits during the second round of the presidential elections.

As the benefactor, you will try to buy the presidential candidate offering different agendas for your economical convenience in exchange to finance their campaign.

As the candidate, you will try to gain resources for your campaign taken economic agendas that doesn´t affect you too much on your personal reputation with your voters.

After 8 turns of negotiations, the player who obtain the major benefits will win the game.

Any resemblance with reality is only coincidence...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Negotiation, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Turn Order: Role Order, Zone of Control

name: Cosmic Encounter: Demon Promo Alien
description: The Demon promo was a promotional alien and flare given by Fantasy Flight Games to attendees of CosmicCon 2014. It was later included in Fantasy Flight Games' 42nd Anniversary Edition of Cosmic Encounter.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Science Fiction
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Singapore 1889
description:
In Singapore 1889, players are thrown into the lives of Chinese merchants living in Singapore in the 19th Century. Governed by the British East India Company, Singapore flourished as a trading hub in Southeast Asia.

Many Chinese merchants relied on the secret societies’ influence and aid to maintain a lucrative business. You are one of such merchants, trying cash in on trading goods favoured by Ghee Hin Kongsi (義興公司), one of the most influential secret societies in 19th century Singapore. Find the right goods to trade and compel the secret society’s interest to your advantage.

But beware! The British have taken notice of the secret societies’ dominance and might be working to weaken its influence.

The game has players collecting precious commodities which is favored by the Secret Society and the British East Indies Company. Players will try to manipulate the goods favored by the Secret Society so that their own goods will increase in value. The game ends when each player collects 7 goods and the player with the highest value of goods, wins!

—description from the publisher

name: The Hunger: Casey Promo Card
description:
Casey
Speed: 0
VP: 2
Type: Human Villager
Effect: At the end of your turn: Values 2 VP when you are on the railroad.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Race
publishers: Cranio Creations, Pegasus Spiele, Renegade Game Studios

name: Post Mortem London Gothic: The Ghost in the Machine
description:
Prepare to explore Victorian-Era London in this choose-you-own-adventure style murder mystery. You will scour clues, interview suspects, and follow the trail of tragedy and woe that surrounds a deadly cotton mill in the midst of the industrial revolution.

In this murder-mystery game you are the detective. Players will work collaboratively to choose which leads to follow and what paths to take. With a dossier of police reports, coroner inquests, and various pieces of physical evidence players will work to unravel the mystery of the Ghost in the Machine, following prompts in the two penny blood novels included with the game that contain the narrative pieces of the story.

When your investigation comes to a close, check the Case Memorandum for the resolution and see how well you made out playing detective.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Storytelling

name: Von Äh bis Z
description:
Title translates to "From Err to Z"

A crazy and fun explaining and guessing game for everyone. The players try to explain as many words as possible to the other team which has to guess the correct term. The clue: The wanted term can only be explained with the displayed letter. If, for example, one player draws a card with the letter "S" on it, his/her teammates can only use this letter to explain the wanted word until the next letter card is drawn. Assuming the wanted word is "Fish", the players could give hints like "Swims! Scales!" A stop watch with 90 seconds adds extra suspense.

name: Love Letter: 10th Anniversary Edition
description:
Love Letter: 10th anniversary edition combines all the different versions of the classic micro game Love Letter.

It does that by re-theming all the versions to the original Love Letter theme so they fit together. So you're still trying to get a love letter to your beloved princess.

It's still the classic and simple 'have one card in your hand, take a card, play a card' gameplay with the last person or highest card winning. But it adds alternative cards, character cards, score cards, quest cards, alternative win conditions, and more. And it offers 16 different variants to combine the cards.
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Gem Forge
description:
In a distant corner of the world stands a mountain that is shrouded in myth and mystery. As legend has it, the mine that descends deep below the mountain has magical properties: no matter how many sacks of precious gemstones you procure from its tunnels, the mine will always be full to the brim with treasures. The best jewellers in the land decided to take advantage of this wondrous source to craft the most amazing jewelry pieces. They compete against each other to prove that they are worthy of the highest reward possible, the magic anvil.

Gem Forge is a versatile family game with a unique 3D pop-up game board and magical illustrations. Procure rare gemstones from the magical mine and store them in your gem box. Then, set exquisite jewelry pieces with the collected gem stones. Finally, receive victory points for finished pieces and jewelry sets!

Playing the game

Before the start, set everything up according the rules: players will have the magic mountain with the gems in random, player pawns and the reminder cards of the same color, player boards or minecarts, 3 jewelry cards, special cards. Set up the market of jewelries with 4 cards to choose. Special cards deck should be placed face down.

The first player can be chosen randomly. At their turn, players have to perform 2 of 5 possible actions:

Take a gemstone from the mountain. The new gem must be placed to the player's minecarts. There are 3 spaces for gems.
Set a gemstone to jewelry.
Discard a gemstone from your minecart. Players may free the space for the new gems.
Draw a special card.
Play a special card. The special cards which should be played during other players turn do not spend your actions.


Players get points for the jewelries they make. The number of points is shown at the bottom of jewelry cards.
There are gold (ordinary) and blue (for collections/sets) jewerly cards. Sometimes players may create a collection of jewerlies with the gemstones of the same color and get even more points.
After a jewelry has all the required gems, it is ready.
Return the gems to the mountain, discard the card, and take a new one from the market. Move the pawn on the scoring track.

When a player gets to the highlighted spaces of 5,10,15,20 scores, all the players having less points get a special card.
Special cards have various effects affecting either you or other players. A player should not have more than 4 special cards. If a player has 4 cards and is required to take the new one, they discard one at their choice and then take he new card.
The player who gets to the final spot on the scoring track first wins the game.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Compaya.hu: Gamer Café Kft., GP Games, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, One Moment Games, Red Cat Games

name: Taco Time
description:
Taco Party is a dice-rolling, push-your-luck game by Ridley's Games for 2-6 players aged 8+. Players roll dice to collect food and drink cards by matching the correct ingredients to the dishes they want to make. The more correct ingredients they roll, the harder it will be for other players to challenge them. However, rolling too many wrong ingredients can cause players to lose their card. Each food card collected earns points, with bonus points for completing a whole meal. The winner is the player with the highest-scoring cards in their pile. Taco Party is suitable for friends, families, and anyone who loves tacos. It comes with 32 food cards, 12 drink cards, 8 ingredient dice, and instructions, and has an average gameplay time of 30 minutes. Printed using FSC paper and with soy inks.

—description from the publisher

name: Ma-Riot
description:
Ma-Riot is a blindfolded board game themed on the magical sport of "Ma-Riot" from another world. This is Wonderland, a land in another world. This year, the popular Ma-Riot League begins again. This is the gateway to success for young mages. Players become up-and-coming mages and form teams called "clans" with stuffed animal "puppets" to compete in the Ma-Riot League.
The game takes place on a 5 by 5 grid, every player has their own copy of the board on which they place their puppets so the other players can't see them. You command them to guess the positions of the invisible opposing player's Puppets and attack them by unleashing spells. Sometimes, Mags' trump card, the Clan Spell, is used to change the course of the game. Players earn points by hitting other player's puppets, first player to earn the desired amount of points wins.
mechanics: Action Queue, Deduction, Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Hunt A Killer: R.I.P. at the Rodeo
description:
Picture this: the latest Hawk Springs Rodeo is in town, and the excitement is palpable. But when Patches the Rodeo Clown is found murdered, the fun comes to a screeching halt. With everyone close to Patches a suspect, it's up to you to crack the case and catch the killer.

As Rosario, Patches' ex-wife, reaches out to you for help, you'll need to put your detective skills to the test. Investigate items found in Patches' trailer, analyze witness statements, and piece together a timeline to solve the mystery.

But be warned: this isn't your average murder mystery game. With a cast of colorful characters, including an upcoming rodeo star, a greedy promoter, an angry judge, a beautiful rodeo queen, a fellow clown, and a suspicious veterinarian, you'll have to stay on your toes to unravel the clues and catch the culprit.

Players will need to investigate items found in Patches' trailer, analyze the witness statements, and piece together a timeline to determine who had the means, motive, and opportunity to kill the beloved rodeo clown.

Difficulty: 2/5

—description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: 1940: Swallows of Death – Moroccan Troops in the Battle of France
description:
In August 1939, France’s Armée d’Afrique mobilized ten Moroccan infantry regiments; all of them would fight in the coming campaign in France, three of them forming the elite 1st Moroccan Infantry Division. The “Swallows of Death” already carried a fearsome fighting reputation from the trenches of the First World War, and they would only add to their black swallow insignia’s legend in the Second.

1940: Swallows of Death is an expansion book for our Panzer Grenadier: 1940 The Fall of France, focused on the exploits of Moroccan troops in the 1940 campaign. You get 30 new scenarios for 1940: The Fall of France, plus 88 new die-cut, silky smooth pieces showing the Moroccans in their own special color scheme plus elite French recon troops, horsed machine-gun units and the unusual WT15 tank destroyer. The crack horsed cavalry of the Spahis Marocains get their own pieces and scenarios, too.

Scenario design is by Philippe Léonard, with the book organized into six chapters with battle games for each to link them together. And as you expect in an Avalanche Press book, plenty of historical background. You’ll need 1940 The Fall of France and Road to Dunkirk to play the scenarios.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Deus Ex Machina: The Card Game
description:
Deus ex Machina is competitive card game for 2 to 4 players with an innovative hero placement mechanism in which each player takes the role of an legendary Hero such us Hercules Perseus etc trying to achieve supremacy over the other legendary heroes. Their ultimate goal is to accumulate the most Glory Points by having heroes complete quests. The winner of the game is the player who has completed his secret objective!

—description from the designer

name: 7 Deadly Dice
description: 7 Deadly Dice is a 2-6 player game for the worst of us. Collect dice and complete hidden sinful objectives in order to be crowned the Most Awful. With a rapid play style and sneaky player-vs-player mechanics, this game of skill, luck and complete lack of moral fibre will reveal the greediest, the laziest and the most envious of all!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Matching, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Suricates
description:
Suricates ("Meerkats") is a co-operative game in which all players have to make precise combinations by moving their character to dig a tunnel so that their meerkat friends can escape.

—description from the publisher

name: Enquêtes Express: On a Volé La Machine A Remonter Le Temps
description:
On a Volé La Machine A Remonter Le Temps is a mini stand alone investigation card deck for Enquêtes Express.
It was available from Plato magazine 152 as a promotional freebie.

Enquêtes Express is a cooperative investigation game that is accessible, fast and fun! During an investigation, each player is only allowed to consult a part of the clues. It is only by sharing and cross-checking their information that the players can unravel the case together.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Enquêtes Express est un jeu d'investigation coopératif à la fois accessible, rapide et fun ! Lors d'une enquête, chaque joueur n’est autorisé à consulter qu’une partie des indices. C’est donc uniquement en partageant et en recoupant toutes leurs infos que les joueurs peuvent ensemble démêler l’intrigue.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Keepers of the Crystal River
description:
As a volunteer conservationist, it is your job to hike to the Crystal River, keep track of the health of the river and the animals, fish and insects that reside at the Crystal River. With notebook in hand, you will spend time recording what wildlife you spot around the river. This can be a little tricky, since the water moves very quickly, and you have to jump around on floating logs. You have to watch out for floating debris, and you don’t want to get swept away down river. But you love your job and the danger associated with it. Can you find all of the animals, fish and insects without getting swept down river?

Keeper of the Crystal River is a solo, tile moving game where your goal is to mark off the animals, fish and insects in your journal that you have observed at the river. Each turn you will move your keeper, after which, you will shift all of the river sticks down one. As you jump on a log with animal, fish or insect icon, you will move a cube on your player to the right to indicate another one has been spotted. Beware of floating debris, it can be quite a challenge for the most seasoned observer. If you find everything in your journal and cross the river, you win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pieces as Map, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Anno 1800: Die Erweiterung
description:
The expansion for Anno 1800 - The Board Game advances industrialization and offers new possibilities and combo moves. Innovation cards and gears increase efficiency, airships promote trade, expansion and influence, patents protect your own industries, and new contract cards open up entirely new strategies. The expansion includes a solo mode and is only playable with the base game. Discover Martin Wallace's Anno 1800 game now with even more possibilities and intense fun.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Race, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Set-up

name: Tape Jam
description:
You look through your old cassettes and, oh no! All the tape of your favorite cassettes are all chewed up. Its time to get ahead of this tangle and tidy it all up!

In Tape Jam you reveal and choose cards from a common pool to get triplets of same number or consecutive numbers in your display to score the highest score in the End. Each card holds two numbers, though. Tape Jam is a tiny numbers puzzle to get your head around with some competitive elements.

All the components are made so that you can transport your game perfectly in a cassette box, of course!

—description from the designer

name: Trash Dice
description: Designed for 2 players and suitable for ages 4 and up, Trash Dice is a captivating and easy-to-learn game that promises hours of entertainment. In Trash Dice, each player races to be the first to complete a set of six different dice numbers. But there's a twist! Roll a duplicate number, and that die is "trashed," adding an element of surprise and strategy to every turn. This game isn't just about luck; it's about smart decisions and anticipating your opponent's moves. The set comes complete with a uniquely designed trash can, which not only stores all components but also serves as an innovative dice tray. The 40 colorful dice are durable and eye-catching, appealing to kids and adults alike. The included rulebook lays out the simple yet engaging gameplay, ensuring that players of all ages can jump right in. Whether you're looking for a quick game to liven up a party, a compact travel companion for road trips and vacations, or an educational game that teaches basic counting and probability, Trash Dice is your go-to choice.

name: The Dead Keep
description:
Legends speak of the Dead Keep. Travelers and locals alike spin tales of this accursed locale 'round hearths every evenings. Public houses are always filled with whispers and rumours about what lies within. And yet, you'll probably never meet a single soul who has seen the Keep and returned. The many faded names carved into the table you are at is the only reminder of those who dared venture into the Keep. But you? You might be different.

Embark on an adventure with The Dead Keep, a cooperative dungeon diving campaign game designed for 1-6 players. Immerse yourself in the fantastical artwork, crafted from the original designs of renowned artist Paul Bonner. As fearless adventurers, you'll plunge into the depths of The Dead Keep, driven by the promise of untold riches from the enigmatic Patron. Will you unravel the secrets lurking within, or will the mist claim you?
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Asmodee, CMON Global Limited, Guillotine Games, Portal Games

name: Politrickers
description:
In the muddy waters of politics, there are some surprisingly simple rules. First, follow the policy of your own party unconditionally. Second, oppose the policy of the opposing party. But today's friends can be tomorrow's enemies, and it's always more fun to betray than to be betrayed. So remember, you have nothing to rely on but your own political power.

Politrickers differs from the usual trick-taking game in that it's a mix of must-follow and must-not-follow. There are two political parties in the game. You must follow the suit of your own party, and must not follow that of the opposing party. You earn points for contributing to your party's victory without upsetting the political balance symbolized by the Libra.

Wield your limited political power skillfully to extend your influence, sometimes switching parties out of patriotic determination, sometimes declaring innovations that will turn the political world upside down. The path you walk is one of commitment and trust, or one of betrayal and intrigue. Either way, result says everything.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Negotiation, Trick-taking

name: Awaken Realms Vault: Story Dice – AR Board Game Dice Bundle Box
description: Contains all 5 AR Board Game dice sets.

name: Happy Home
description:
Welcome to Happy Home, the exciting strategy game of home decoration!

Move around the shop board to collect polyomino furniture tiles and place them into your house. Fulfill objectives and complete sets of furniture in each room to score points. Moving ahead on the shop board to collect that perfect piece of furniture might seem like a good idea, but be careful, moving too far will give other players more turns to collect furniture!

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins the title of the most creative home decorator! Let's get started and make our homes happy!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: BANG! Bloody Mary
description:
Bloody Mary, a promotional character card for BANG! included with Spielbox #6 of 2016, has this unique ability: Each time your BANG! card is Missed!, draw one card from the deck.

This card is also contained in the expansion BANG! Armed & Dangerous, although with a different artwork.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Abu Simbel
description:
The great Abu Simbel temple hides a thousand-year-old secret. Its chambers patiently wait for someone brave enough to explore them. However, as every amazing adventure, the path is filled with dangers. The walls of the temple hide deadly traps that range from sharp blades to floors that collapse under your feet... And even poisonous scorpions and undead mummies! Do you dare explore the ancient secrets of Abu Simbel?

Abu Simbel is a board game you play on your feet, recreating the movements indicated by the cards to avoid the numerous traps hidden in the temple. If you decide to enter the chambers of the Abu Simbel temple, you will have to crawl, jump, squeeze through tight cracks, cross over dark pits... and defeat the mummies that protect the temple! You will have to do it literally—moving your arms, hands, and legs.

The goal of Abu Simbel is to get past the traps in the different chambers in order to reach the great treasure vault, grab some treasures, and leave the temple through the same traps again, but in reverse and in total darkness!

At the end of the game, the winner is the player who scores the most points from the treasures gained and their remaining charm cards.

name: Pantery w akcji (Kaniów 1943)
description:
Pantery w akcji (Kaniów 1943) (Panthers in action - Kanev 1943) presents the situation in late 1943.

After the fall at Kursk, the German army was withdrawing to the West. The major obstacle for the Red Army was the Dniepr river, especially since south of Kiev only one bridge was left - the railway one near Kanev.
Expecting an attack of Kiev, the German forces were unprepared for a Soviet attack aimed at siezing the bridge. Combined Armoured Corps and airborne units soon threatened to have the German forces cut off from the Western bank of the river. The situation was to be rescued by reinforcements of 19th and 7th Panzer Divisions but they come to late - the Dniepr was taken by Red Army.

The game uses rules of the B35 (Battles of World War II 1943-1945) system designed for dealing with medium battles of World War II. Counters represent battalions (Germans) or regiments (Russians), one hex represents 1500m, one turn represents 12 hours.

name: History & Legends: SICILY
description:
SICILY is the first game of the collection History & Legends, set between the centuries V B.C. and the IIIrd A.D.. Strategy, diplomacy and economy are combined in it, allowing to recreate the wars between Carthaginians, Greeks and Romans to get the control of the mentioned island.

It is a boardgame where can take part up to 4 players. It is structured in years, each one with its four seasons: spring, summer, autumn and winter. The game mechanics are very elaborated and allows to apply great variety of strategies. Nevertheless, learn to play is so easy and, in a few minutes, raw players can defend alone. The actions in every phase are very rapid, so games can last from 1 to 5 hours according to the select scene and it decided that the players are.

SICILY contains a great carton board and tokens, color rules, plastic miniatures, events and secret aims cards, etc... In these moments, it is only available in the language of Cervantes (spanish), but it also will be published the corresponding version in the language of Shakespeare (english).


SICILIA es el primer juego de la colección Historia y Leyendas, ambientado entre los siglos V antes de Cristo y el III después de Cristo. En él se combinan estrategia, diplomacia y economía, permitiendo recrear las guerras entre cartagineses, griegos y romanos para hacerse con el control de dicha isla.

Se trata de un juego de tablero en el que pueden participar hasta 4 jugadores por partida. Se estructura en años, cada uno con sus cuatro temporadas: primavera, verano, otoño e invierno. La mecánica de juego está muy elaborada y permite aplicar gran variedad de estrategias. Sin embargo, aprender a jugar es sencillo y en pocos minutos los jugadores novatos pueden defenderse solos. Las acciones en cada fase son muy rápidas, por lo que las partidas pueden durar de 1 a 5 horas según el escenario escogido y lo decididos que sean los participantes.

SICILIA contiene un gran tablero de cartón, un reglamento a todo color, miniaturas de plástico, fichas de cartón, cartas de sucesos y de objetivos secretos. En estos momentos solamente está disponible en el idioma de Cervantes (castellano), pero dentro de poco también publicaremos la versión correspondiente en el idioma de Shakespeare (inglés).
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Economic, Political
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The Agents: Sites
description:
Sites are shuffled with the Safe-Houses to a “sites deck”, before setting up the game. Each player (beginning with the first player) draws one site from the sites deck and chooses which direction to place it in towards the player to their left. That site marks the shared Faction between the player who placed it and the player to their left.

Note that a site provides a special ability to the player towards whom they are facing (i.e. their text is facing). These abilities apply as long as the text is facing that player. If the site is turned (e.g. by the Engineer), then the ability is then granted to the opposite player of that Faction.


This expansion was not included in the 1st Kickstarter, but was sent to those who had issues with the delivery of the game, as a free bonus.
In the 2nd Kickstarter, this deck was bundled in the new "Break the Rules" expansion, together with Break-The-Rules and Commanders decks.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Kartenspiel – Sonderkarte 2003 – Guido, der große Diplomat
description:
This is a promo card for the Siedler von Catan card game distributed in special fairs usually by Mr. Klaus Teuber itself.
The card name is "Guido, der große Diplomat", which means "Guido, the great diplomat".
The card text says: "If your opponent has more victory points than you and you play this card at the very beginning of your turn (before your roll), you receive the topmost Attack-Action Card from your opponent's discard pile. Guido is immune to the 'Spy'."

The card was reimplemented with a different picture and slightly improved effect (removing the requirement to play it before rolling the dice) in the expansion Artisans & Benefactors.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Four Tribes: Library Edition
description:
A bloody war between two mighty kingdoms has reached an impasse. Each ruler now turns to the northern tribes in an attempt to form an alliance, and turn the tides. Will you be able to capture the favor of the Four Tribes?

In Four Tribes, you and one other player will be placing cards, according to the rules, to either side of a row of six village cards. Most of these cards you are placing represent provisions that each village is lacking. Your goal is to appease the elder of each village more than your opponent by giving them higher ranked goods.

In addition to provisions, there are a host of special cards that you may employ that might be defensive in nature, or be a devastating blow to your opponent. Hand-management and timing is the key!

Four Tribes is a game of strategy and tactics that is balanced with a bit of luck. Each player draws from their own deck of cards, but each player has the same deck, so while you may draw on the weak-side early on, you will know that powerful cards are coming up that you can capitalize on.

Four Tribes can be setup, played, and put away in about 30 minutes, making it a great lunchtime or filler game. I specifically designed this game to be a game that I can play with my wife and since then have heard from dozens of couples who play Four Tribes regularly.

This newest edition takes everything that was loved about the original version, that was very successful on KickStarter, and boils it down and redevelops it into something that feels much like the original, but is new at the same time.

Contents

28 Card Orange Army Deck 28 Card Purple Army Deck 6 Double-sided Standard Village Cards 6 Double-sided Winter Village Cards 6 Fire Expansion Cards 6 Flood Expansion Cards 3 Longhouse Cards 1 Blizzard Token 12 Village Elder Pawns 42 Wooden Houses (10 each of Blue, Green, Red, & Yellow, and 2 Black) 1 drawstring bag Instruction Booklet

name: Rolling Ranch: Hay there!
description:
‘Hay there!’ is a mini-expansion that can be added to Rolling Ranch base game to allow you to play with a third die that adds different new options to the gameplay.

The hay will add an interesting majority mechanism that will reward one new choice number during the game and 10 victory points at the end.

The royal rooster will elevate your chicken strategy, giving one extra victory point to surrounding chickens.

The dog and the raccoon will interact with the collected Hay during the game. One will guard it, the other will try to steal it!

—Description from publisher website
categories: Animals, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Lençóis
description:
A chest was buried in one of the dunes of Lençóis, Brazil, and a key sank in one of its pools. Can you find them before the wind changes everything?

Inspired by the biomes of the Brazilian states of Maranhão and Piauí, Lençóis is a light and fast game, but with many layers of strategy. The game is for 2-6 players and has 18 cards: nine dune cards and nine lagoon cards, with different text on each of them. Among the dune cards is a chest and among the lagoon cards a key, and whoever has both cards simultaneously wins — but if you have the key and a thunderstorm in hand, you lose and leave the game.

To play, six cards are placed face down on the table, and each player starts with two cards in hand. On your turn, take two actions — draw a card and play a card — in the order you wish. When playing a card, carry out the effect printed on it. At the end of each turn, the wind blows and all the cards on the board revolve around the center.

Lençóis is a game of strategy and memory, but with a good dose of about faces and attacks!

name: Dracula
description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards including two jokers. Both players are dealt four cards and a card is put face up on the table players put their cards so they form at the end of the round a 3x3 grid. Then one player scores for the vertical, the other for the horizontal lines. The score depends on the cards in the row, but cards with the same color or suit increases the value of a line.

More information, including a 3 and a 4-player variant can be found at http://parlettgames.uk/oricards/dracula.html

name: 800 Metres
description: Sports simulation game covering the 800 meters (metres) event.

name: Kłuszyn 1610
description:
Kłuszyn 1610 covers the battle between Polish and Russo-Swedish forces during the Polish-Russian war 1609-1618. It was one of the most glorious victories of polish heavy cavalry Husaria, where 5600 polish Husars defeated 30 000 soldiers of Sweden and Russia.

This is a typical hex and counter wargame and first of the planned series of wargames taking place in XVI-XVII century.

name: Los caminos de Alicia
description:
Inspired on Lewis Carrol's 'Alice in Wonderland'.

Players have to build roads using hexagonal tiles, move their figures across them and interact with the scenes and characters from the book in order to complete their goals.

name: Stew: Crows and Corn
description:
The crows are out, and they are pecking at everything in sight! Keep them occupiedor you can say goodbye to your stew. They'll snatch that corn right off the top. They say the corn is best at the bottom anyway...

A 2-card expansion for Stew that behave in neat new ways.

Crows are a new vermin that will pick the top item of the stew, if left unfed.

Corn is an ingredient that scores 4 points, and lowers its value for each card on top of it, even possibly scoring negative points.


Released in the November 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

name: Pantacle
description:
Each player must gather enough resources (Influence (cubes), Adepts (meeples), Powers (tokens)) to light the flames of the PANTACLE one by one. These resources can only be obtained by requesting favors from the Keepers of the PANTACLE. There are 7 types of favors that provide either resources or powers whose effects will make your progress easier. Beware though! If another player has the right set of cards in hand, they can counter your request and bribe the favor away from you.

To light a flame on the PANTACLE, players regularly need to sacrifice accumulated resources. The further players progress, the harder the PANTACLE resists and the more complex the game becomes. Indeed, a player who lights a flame receives a reward (resource, power) but also a curse, despite the sacrifice of resources. The Keepers can suspend a Curse for a time, but will the other players let them?

—description from the publisher

name: ウボンゴ ポケモン (Ubongo Pokémon)
description:
Despite the fact that the publisher's own website claims this is the same as Ubongo Mini, it isn't.

Yes, this is a small form factor variant of the original Ubongo. Players race against each other over eight rounds to solve little tile-placement problems. In every round, the first person to solve their puzzle yells "Ubongo!" then counts to some mutually-agreed number of seconds (the rules suggest 20 or 30; but allow that other variations are possible). All players that complete their puzzle before time runs out keep the puzzle tile (a Pokémon ball!) as a scoring reminder, and those that fail give their tile to the first solver.

So far, that sounds a lot like Ubongo Mini. (That has a "Don't bother counting; first to solve keeps their tile, and everyone else just stops." alternate rule, too; and while that rule could easily be used in this version, it's not mentioned.)

But: the puzzles in ウボンゴ ポケモン are notably harder. Each puzzle tile has two sides: one that can be completed with three pieces, and one that requires four. More, the puzzles don't disclose which pieces are required! Players have eight possible tiles, and need to figure out which subset works. (In contrast, Ubongo Mini's puzzles are two or three pre-specified pieces.)

Additionally, the rules specify that it's possible to complete all puzzles without the simplest (1x3 rectangle) piece. And that using that piece or not could be an additional scaling factor.

name: Operation Roundup: The Allies Invade France in 1943
description:
Operation Roundup was the code name for a plan prepared by Allied forces to invade Northern France in 1943 in the Pas de Calais area. This game explores the first month of this never-run plan, set in September 1943 (instead of the historical landings at Salerno in Italy). Allied forces are not the mighty invasion armada of 1944 lacking both the armored "funnies" and Mulberries that worked so well in Normandy. For the Germans at this time their "Atlantic Wall" and panzer arm are more promises of what is to come than actual impenetrable defenses.

Yet the game remains highly re-playable time after time as, at start, neither player knows Hitler’s reaction to the invasion until it is rolled for during the first turn of the game. Will he give orders to: (1) Strip the East of as many divisions as possible transferring them to this new front so as to attempt to annihilate the landing, or merely try to contain it as a “self-sustaining POW camp”? OR (2) Redeploy the as-yet-unbroken Reich Air Defense fighter force to temporarily give up the war against the Allied strategic bombing campaign and switch to combat air support over the battlefield? OR (3) Mobilize the II Parachute Corps (standing by at air bases in southern France) to drop directly into the Allied beachhead? Depending on how many of them survive, they might prove decisive in upsetting the whole Allied plan. Or trigger powerful Allied countermeasures?

The map area covers the French coast from around Dunkirk south to the mouth of the Somme and inland to Lille and Arras. Operation Roundup uses a standard 34" x 22" large-hex (19mm) map and 216 medium (16mm) counters. The game is scaled at 2 miles (3.25 km) per hex, with 10 three-day game turns, and uses regiments and brigades (and a few battalions) as units of maneuver. The game system is an evolution of the classic old-SPI Cobra, simple enough to allow for a game to be completed in one sitting, and can also easily be adapted for solitaire play.

Operation Roundup is published in the Against The Odds (ATO) Annual 2021.

Contents and Information

Maps - One full color 22" x 34" hex mapsheet
Counters - 216 full color 9/16" die-cut counters
Rules length - 12 pages
Charts and tables - 2 pages
Complexity - Medium
Playing time - Up to 3 to 4 hours
How challenging is it solitaire? - Average.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Omen: A Reign of War – Echoes of Myth
description:
The fires of war have begun to smolder, and it's clear that an end to the Reign of War is in sight.

Echoes of Myth, the final planned expansion for Omen: A Reign of War, introduces twelve brand new units, including an all new unit type: Spirits. When a Spirit enters a City, it has two different abilities, and you choose which one you will use. However, you have the option of paying the Spirit's cost, plus a little extra, and discarding it from your hand to use both abilities.

name: Zombie Princess and the Enchanted Maze
description:
Build and navigate a treacherous hedge maze by placing and rotating maze tiles, retrieve your key, and escape before the Zombie Princes catches and turns you!

Once upon a time, she was looking for love...

Now she’s looking for lunch!

As a knight, you are bound by chivalry to rescue the trapped princess. However, this princess is a zombie! And she is roaming free in an enchanted maze. Get to the other side to grab a key and race to the castle — before becoming a zombie yourself!

A competitive game of tile placement, as you build out the maze by playing tiles and changing the paths within the maze by rotating tiles. Your goal is to get to your key on the other side of the maze while avoiding the Zombie Princess – or even any Zombie Knights. Of course, you may have helped create those Zombie Knights by arranging a convenient path for the princess to get that knight.

A lighthearted game of undeath awaits you in Zombie Princess and the Enchanted Maze!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pieces as Map, Tile Placement

name: Lord of the Fries: Las Cabezas Mexican Restaurant Deck
description:
This restaurant deck plays the same as the original Lord of the Fries, but with ingredients and menu themed as a Mexican restaurant. Ingredients in this deck include Rice, Tortillas, Beans, 'Red Stuff', 'Green Stuff', Cheese, Bird, Cow and Pig.

Special Rule: You may substitute any type of meat for the correct meat, but played for zero points (play the card face down).

Besides being an expansion to Lord of the Fries, this can be played as a stand alone.
—user summary

Zombies Making Food.
That's the idea behind Lord of the Fries.
You and your friends are a crew of not-so-smart Zombies, racing to assemble meals from hands of random ingredients.
It's a simple, fast, and funny card game for you and all your no-so-smart friends.
This deck can be played by itself or mixed with others.
You need a 6-sided die to play this game.
—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Andantino
description:
In Andantino, a game from the inventor of Trax, two players take turns placing hexagonal tiles in their own color. To start, one tile of each color are placed together on the table. Each tile placed must touch at least two pieces already in play. (Although a variant allows the second player to place one tile next to only one other tile to balance a first-player advantage.) A player wins by surrounding at least one of the opponent's tiles with tiles of his own color or by creating a line of five tiles of his own color.

Since the tiles placed are never moved, this game can alternatively be played on hexagonal paper with the players using pens of two colors.

name: 6: Siege – Sand and Dust
description:
These two new environments will provide you with exciting games!

"Coastline" represents a trendy club where operators will move through a series of brightly lit lounges and bars to neutralize the enemy threat. To achieve their goals, operators must stay mobile and adapt their defenses to this subdued environment, a paradise tainted by the chaos of combat.

Featuring a checkpoint composed of old and new buildings, "Border" is a very open environment that encourages clashes on the outer edges of the building. Operators must make their way through the offices of this secure complex, converging on a central room that will inevitably be the scene of gunfire.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Real-time, Video Game Theme

name: The Chameleon: Picture Edition
description:
QUICK TO LEARN EASY TO PLAY
Look at the picture, use one word to describe it, then find the Chameleon. Board games for families should all be this easy and fun!

KEEP IT SECRET!
All the complicated code cards and dice from our original family game have been replaced with exciting secret reveal envelopes.

NEVER GETS OLD
Thanks to changing identities and 480 pictures to guess at, this is a family game for kids and adults that has loads of replay-value.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Targeted Clues, Team-Based Game

name: MiniMonFa Espansione Rigor Mortis
description:
This expansion for MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy) brings in the game the fantastic world of Rigor Mortis, the dark overlord of Kragmortha, from the comic strip created by Riccardo Crosa. Finally you'll play with all the friends of genius of Evil, from Romolus the barbarian to Kira the werecat and Arkham-Oz the construct. You'll be able to use some of the more unusual magic items of Rigor Mortis like kyuss the talking sword. Everything is rounded up by a score of creatures and traps from the comic.

Rules for more than two players included.

Expands:

MiniMonFa (MiniMonsterFantasy)


Other Expansions:

MiniMonFa: Fairy Expansion
MiniMonFa: Undead Expansion
MiniMonFa Espansione Mondo Sotterraneo
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Iago
description:
The perfidious game of confrontation in which two players steal words and time from each other.

The Game In Brief:
The letter-tiles are blue on one side and red on the other. One player enters words with the blue side up, the other with the red side up. At each move the object is to take the lead and end up with at least one more tile on the board then one’s opponent. But words entered on the board are by no means permanent-they may be stolen-which is indeed the main point of the game. Whenever a player is able to change both the form and the meaning of an opponent’s word, by substituting one or more letters in the word and/or by adding letters to either end, that player may steal it by turning over all its letters, so a previously blue word becomes a red one, or vice-versa.

The game ends when a player is unable to take the lead on his turn and over-steps the time-limit.
publishers: Chieftain Products, Editrice Giochi, Spear's Games

name: Battleships at War: Atlantic
description: Battleships at War: Atlantic is a stand-alone game covering WW2 tactical level ship-to-ship combat in the Atlantic, Med, and Baltic theaters. Includes sixty ships from five nations (Britain, Germany, France, Italy, USSR), rulebook, a dozen scenarios, Reference Card, and a Convoy module, in ziplock packaging. In the old-style Minden tradition, counters must be cut out prior to play. But, components are in COLOR, and game is fully compatible with The Mighty Hood game appearing in Panzerschreck #14. If you liked Graf Spee in Pzsk #13, my guess is you'll love both The Mighty Hood and Battleships at War: Atlantic.

name: Down in Flames: WWI
description:
Down In Flames - WWI depicts the fun and flavor of World War I aerial dogfighting. You get to fly the
colorful and agile aircraft of WWI as you make history in the world’s first use of aircraft in a military role.

This Down in Flames game opens up the whole new era of WWI combat. For those of you who have played
the WWII version of the game series you will find that you catch on to the game, and its new systems very
easily. For people who are new to the game, welcome aboard!

Components include:

81 Action Cards
15 Western Aircraft types (each with 1 Leader card and 2 Wingmen cards)
15 Central Aircraft types (each with 1 Leader card and 2 Wingmen cards)
171 total cards
Rulebook
Counters for Hits, Turn Order, Altitude


The game is published in both PDF and Vassel versions.
A "Print On Demand" option will also be available.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: One Bad Apple
description:
In this children's dexterity game, you must pick an apple from the barrel on your turn. You can either try for the big red one that's worth the most points, or try a smaller one that may be easier to pick.

Reach for the stem and lift the apple up, but be careful! If you pick it without disturbing any other apples, you get to keep it and score points. But if the apple you pick makes the wormy apple pop up it goes back into the barrel and you lose points on that turn. Then reset the game for continued play.

name: K.O !
description:
K.O ! is a wacky action / dexterity game. Two gadgets are set in a groove in a heavy duty plastic board. Each gadget has a handle, a hammer (which can be operated through a button on the handle) and a tube filled with 5 discs. The tube has two horizontal slits at the bottom. By sliding your gadget along the groove you try to strike with your hammer through one slit, thereby hitting a disc of your opponent and send it flying. When you lose your last disc you're knocked out.

It's a matter of speed and reaction. Even when sliding your gadget all the way forward, your hammer may not reach the tube of your opponent. So you've got to feint, lure your opponent forward, strike fast and be quick to retreat.

name: Tchu Tchu Train
description:
The railroad era of Korean history, the epic project to connect 8 provinces is begun. Many railroad companies are competing with each other to construct more trains and stations. Which company will be crowned the railway king!

[Goal]
Each player – the railroad company – should place his own trains as many as possible, construct stations properly, and connect the stations with the trains to get more points than other players.

[Game Play]

This game use 2 decks of common playing cards and a hex game board of South Korea map.


In one’s turn, do one action of two as follow.
1.Place trains: play cards from 1 to 7 pieces and place trains on the board corresponding to the cards. (The cards should be corresponded to adjacent areas on the board.)
